0.text: BULBASAUR can be seen napping in bright sunlight. There is a seed on its back. By soaking up the sun’s rays, the seed grows progressively larger.
0.name: bulbasaur

1.text: The seed on its back is filled with nutrients. The seed grows steadily larger as its body grows.
1.name: bulbasaur

2.text: It carries a seed on its back right from birth. As it grows older, the seed also grows larger.
2.name: bulbasaur

3.text: A strange seed was planted on its back at birth. The plant sprouts and grows with this Pokémon.
3.name: bulbasaur

4.text: For some time after its birth, it grows by gaining nourishment from the seed on its back.
4.name: bulbasaur

5.text: Bulbasaur can be seen napping in bright sunlight. There is a seed on its back. By soaking up the sun’s rays, the seed grows progressively larger.
5.name: bulbasaur

6.text: It can go for days without eating a single morsel. In the bulb on its back, it stores energy.
6.name: bulbasaur

7.text: There is a plant seed on its back right from the day this Pokémon is born. The seed slowly grows larger.
7.name: bulbasaur

8.text: While it is young, it uses the nutrients that are stored in the seed on its back in order to grow.
8.name: bulbasaur

9.text: The bulb on its back grows by drawing energy. It gives off an aroma when it is ready to bloom.
9.name: ivysaur

10.text: The bulb on its back grows as it absorbs nutrients. The bulb gives off a pleasant aroma when it blooms.
10.name: ivysaur

11.text: To support its bulb, IVYSAUR’s legs grow sturdy. If it spends more time lying in the sunlight, the bud will soon bloom into a large flower.
11.name: ivysaur

12.text: If the bud on its back starts to smell sweet, it is evidence that the large flower will soon bloom.
12.name: ivysaur

13.text: There is a plant bulb on its back. When it absorbs nutrients, the bulb is said to blossom into a large flower.
13.name: ivysaur

14.text: When the bud on its back starts swelling, a sweet aroma wafts to indicate the flower’s coming bloom.
14.name: ivysaur

15.text: There is a bud on this Pokémon’s back. To support its weight, Ivysaur’s legs and trunk grow thick and strong. If it starts spending more time lying in the sunlight, it’s a sign that the bud will bloom into a large flower soon.
15.name: ivysaur

16.text: The bud on its back grows by drawing energy. It gives off an aroma when it is ready to bloom.
16.name: ivysaur

17.text: When the bulb on its back grows large, it appears to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.
17.name: ivysaur

18.text: Exposure to sunlight adds to its strength. Sunlight also makes the bud on its back grow larger.
18.name: ivysaur

19.text: As it warms it­ self and absorbs the sunlight, its flower petals release a pleasant fragrance.
19.name: venusaur

20.text: VENUSAUR’s flower is said to take on vivid colors if it gets plenty of nutrition and sunlight. The flower’s aroma soothes the emotions of people.
20.name: venusaur

21.text: It is able to convert sunlight into energy. As a result, it is more powerful in the summertime.
21.name: venusaur

22.text: By spreading the broad petals of its flower and catching the sun’s rays, it fills its body with power.
22.name: venusaur

23.text: After a rainy day, the flower on its back smells stronger. The scent attracts other Pokémon.
23.name: venusaur

24.text: There is a large flower on Venusaur’s back. The flower is said to take on vivid colors if it gets plenty of nutrition and sunlight. The flower’s aroma soothes the emotions of people.
24.name: venusaur

25.text: The flower on its back catches the sun’s rays. The sunlight is then absorbed and used for energy.
25.name: venusaur

26.text: Its plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.
26.name: venusaur

27.text: A bewitching aroma wafts from its flower. The fragrance becalms those engaged in a battle.
27.name: venusaur

28.text: If it's healthy, the flame on the tip of its tail will burn vigor­ ously, even if it gets a bit wet.
28.name: charmander

29.text: The flame that burns at the tip of its tail is an indication of its emotions. The flame wavers when CHARMANDER is happy, and blazes when it is enraged.
29.name: charmander

30.text: The flame on its tail shows the strength of its life force. If it is weak, the flame also burns weakly.
30.name: charmander

31.text: The fire on the tip of its tail is a measure of its life. If healthy, its tail burns intensely.
31.name: charmander

32.text: The flame on its tail indicates Charmander’s life force. If it is healthy, the flame burns brightly.
32.name: charmander

33.text: The flame that burns at the tip of its tail is an indication of its emotions. The flame wavers when Charmander is enjoying itself. If the Pokémon becomes enraged, the flame burns fiercely.
33.name: charmander

34.text: The flame at the tip of its tail makes a sound as it burns. You can only hear it in quiet places.
34.name: charmander

35.text: It has a preference for hot things. When it rains, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.
35.name: charmander

36.text: From the time it is born, a flame burns at the tip of its tail. Its life would end if the flame were to go out.
36.name: charmander

37.text: Without pity, its sharp claws destroy foes. If it encounters a strong enemy, it becomes agitated, and the flame on its tail flares with a bluish white color.
37.name: charmeleon

38.text: It is very hotheaded by nature, so it constantly seeks opponents. It calms down only when it wins.
38.name: charmeleon

39.text: In the rocky mountains where Charmeleon live, their fiery tails shine at night like stars.
39.name: charmeleon

40.text: It lashes about with its tail to knock down its foe. It then tears up the fallen opponent with sharp claws.
40.name: charmeleon

41.text: When it swings its burning tail, it elevates the air temperature to unbearably high levels.
41.name: charmeleon

42.text: Charmeleon mercilessly destroys its foes using its sharp claws. If it encounters a strong foe, it turns aggressive. In this excited state, the flame at the tip of its tail flares with a bluish white color.
42.name: charmeleon

43.text: Tough fights could excite this Pokémon. When excited, it may breathe out bluish-white flames.
43.name: charmeleon

44.text: It has a barbaric nature. In battle, it whips its fiery tail around and slashes away with sharp claws.
44.name: charmeleon

45.text: If it becomes agitated during battle, it spouts intense flames, incinerating its surroundings.
45.name: charmeleon

46.text: Spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. Known to cause forest fires unintentionally.
46.name: charizard

47.text: It uses its wings to fly high. The temperature of its fire increases as it gains exper­ ience in battle.
47.name: charizard

48.text: CHARIZARD flies around the sky in search of powerful opponents. It breathes fire of such great heat that it melts anything. However, it never turns its fiery breath on any opponent weaker than itself.
48.name: charizard

49.text: A CHARIZARD flies about in search of strong opponents. It breathes intense flames that can melt any material. However, it will never torch a weaker foe.
49.name: charizard

50.text: It is said that CHARIZARD’s fire burns hotter if it has experienced harsh battles.
50.name: charizard

51.text: If CHARIZARD becomes furious, the flame at the tip of its tail flares up in a light blue shade.
51.name: charizard

52.text: Breathing intense, hot flames, it can melt almost anything. Its breath inflicts terrible pain on enemies.
52.name: charizard

53.text: It is said that Charizard’s fire burns hotter if it has experienced harsh battles.
53.name: charizard

54.text: When expelling a blast of superhot fire, the red flame at the tip of its tail burns more intensely.
54.name: charizard

55.text: Charizard flies around the sky in search of powerful opponents. It breathes fire of such great heat that it melts anything. However, it never turns its fiery breath on any opponent weaker than itself.
55.name: charizard

56.text: When this Pokémon expels a blast of superhot fire, the red flame at the tip of its tail burns more intensely.
56.name: charizard

57.text: It spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. It may cause forest fires by blowing flames.
57.name: charizard

58.text: Its wings can carry this Pokémon close to an altitude of 4,600 feet. It blows out fire at very high temperatures.
58.name: charizard

59.text: Its shell is not just for protection. Its rounded shape and the grooves on its surface minimize resistance in water, enabling SQUIRTLE to swim at high speeds.
59.name: squirtle

60.text: After birth, its back swells and hardens into a shell. It powerfully sprays foam  from its mouth.
60.name: squirtle

61.text: The shell is soft when it is born. It soon becomes so resilient, prodding fingers will bounce off it.
61.name: squirtle

62.text: The shell, which hardens soon after it is born, is resilient. If you poke it, it will bounce back out.
62.name: squirtle

63.text: It shelters itself in its shell, then strikes back with spouts of water at every opportunity.
63.name: squirtle

64.text: Squirtle’s shell is not merely used for protection. The shell’s rounded shape and the grooves on its surface help minimize resistance in water, enabling this Pokémon to swim at high speeds.
64.name: squirtle

65.text: Shoots water at prey while in the water. Withdraws into its shell when in danger.
65.name: squirtle

66.text: When it retracts its long neck into its shell, it squirts out water with vigorous force.
66.name: squirtle

67.text: When it feels threatened, it draws its limbs inside its shell and sprays water from its mouth.
67.name: squirtle

68.text: Its long, furry tail is a symbol of longevity, making it quite popular among older people.
68.name: wartortle

69.text: Its large tail is covered with rich, thick fur that deepens in color with age. The scratches on its shell are evidence of this POKéMON’s toughness in battle.
69.name: wartortle

70.text: This POKéMON is very popular as a pet. Its fur-covered tail is a symbol of its longevity.
70.name: wartortle

71.text: It often hides in water to stalk unwary prey. For fast swimming, it moves its ears to maintain balance.
71.name: wartortle

72.text: It is said to live 10,000 years. Its furry tail is popular as a symbol of longevity.
72.name: wartortle

73.text: Its tail is large and covered with a rich, thick fur. The tail becomes increasingly deeper in color as Wartortle ages. The scratches on its shell are evidence of this Pokémon’s toughness as a battler.
73.name: wartortle

74.text: When tapped on its head, this Pokémon will pull it in, but its tail will still stick out a little bit.
74.name: wartortle

75.text: It is recognized as a symbol of longevity. If its shell has algae on it, that Wartortle is very old.
75.name: wartortle

76.text: It cleverly controls its furry ears and tail to maintain its balance while swimming.
76.name: wartortle

77.text: A brutal POKéMON with pressurized water jets on its shell. They are used for high speed tackles.
77.name: blastoise

78.text: It firmly plants its feet on the ground before shooting water from the jets on its back.
78.name: blastoise

79.text: BLASTOISE has water spouts that protrude from its shell. The water spouts are very accurate. They can shoot bullets of water with enough accuracy to strike empty cans from a distance of over 160 feet.
79.name: blastoise

80.text: The waterspouts that protrude from its shell are highly accurate. Their bullets of water can precisely nail tin cans from a distance of over 160 feet.
80.name: blastoise

81.text: It deliberately makes itself heavy so it can withstand the recoil of the water jets it fires.
81.name: blastoise

82.text: The pressurized water jets on this brutal Pokémon’s shell are used for high-speed tackles.
82.name: blastoise

83.text: Blastoise has water spouts that protrude from its shell. The water spouts are very accurate. They can shoot bullets of water with enough accuracy to strike empty cans from a distance of over 160 feet.
83.name: blastoise

84.text: Once it takes aim at its enemy, it blasts out water with even more force than a fire hose.
84.name: blastoise

85.text: It crushes its foe under its heavy body to cause fainting. In a pinch, it will withdraw inside its shell.
85.name: blastoise

86.text: The rocket cannons on its shell fire jets of water capable of punching holes through thick steel.
86.name: blastoise

87.text: It crawls into foliage where it camouflages itself among leaves that are the same color as its body.
87.name: caterpie

88.text: CATERPIE has a voracious appetite. It can devour leaves bigger than its body right before your eyes. From its antenna, this POKéMON releases a terrifically strong odor.
88.name: caterpie

89.text: Its voracious appetite compels it to devour leaves bigger than itself without hesitation. It releases a terribly strong odor from its antennae.
89.name: caterpie

90.text: It is covered with a green skin. When it grows, it sheds the skin, covers itself with silk, and becomes a cocoon.
90.name: caterpie

91.text: It releases a stench from its red antenna to repel enemies. It grows by molting repeatedly.
91.name: caterpie

92.text: Its feet have suction cups designed to stick to any surface. It tenaciously climbs trees to forage.
92.name: caterpie

93.text: Caterpie has a voracious appetite. It can devour leaves bigger than its body right before your eyes. From its antenna, this Pokémon releases a terrifically strong odor.
93.name: caterpie

94.text: When attacked by bird Pokémon, it resists by releasing a terrifically strong odor from its antennae, but it often becomes their prey.
94.name: caterpie

95.text: It’s easy to catch, and it grows quickly, making it one of the top recommendations for novice Pokémon Trainers.
95.name: caterpie

96.text: Perhaps because it would like to grow up quickly, it has a voracious appetite, eating a hundred leaves a day.
96.name: caterpie

97.text: Its body is soft and weak. In nature, its perpetual fate is to be seen by others as food.
97.name: caterpie

98.text: If you touch the feeler on top of its head, it will release a horrible stink to protect itself.
98.name: caterpie

99.text: For protection, it releases a horrible stench from the antenna on its head to drive away enemies.
99.name: caterpie

100.text: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.
100.name: caterpie

101.text: This is its pre- evolved form. At this stage, it can only harden, so it remains motionless to avoid attack.
101.name: metapod

102.text: The shell covering this POKéMON’s body is as hard as an iron slab. METAPOD does not move very much. It stays still because it is preparing its soft innards for evolution inside the hard shell.
102.name: metapod

103.text: Its shell is as hard as an iron slab. A METAPOD does not move very much because it is preparing its soft innards for evolution inside the shell.
103.name: metapod

104.text: Inside the shell, it is soft and weak as it prepares to evolve. It stays motionless in the shell.
104.name: metapod

105.text: It prepares for evolution by hardening its shell as much as possible to protect its soft body.
105.name: metapod

106.text: A steel-hard shell protects its tender body. It quietly endures hardships while awaiting evolution.
106.name: metapod

107.text: This Pokémon is vulnerable to attack while its shell is soft, exposing its weak and tender body.
107.name: metapod

108.text: The shell covering this Pokémon’s body is as hard as an iron slab. Metapod does not move very much. It stays still because it is preparing its soft innards for evolution inside the hard shell.
108.name: metapod

109.text: Its shell is filled with its soft innards. It doesn’t move much because of the risk it might carelessly spill its innards out.
109.name: metapod

110.text: Its shell is hard, but it’s still just a bug shell. It’s been known to break, so intense battles with it should be avoided.
110.name: metapod

111.text: Its shell is filled with a thick liquid. All of the cells throughout its body are being rebuilt in preparation for evolution.
111.name: metapod

112.text: Its hard shell doesn’t crack a bit even if Pikipek pecks at it, but it will tip over, spilling out its insides.
112.name: metapod

113.text: Hardens its shell to protect itself. However, a large impact may cause it to pop out of its shell.
113.name: metapod

114.text: It is waiting for the moment to evolve. At this stage, it can only harden, so it remains motionless to avoid attack.
114.name: metapod

115.text: Even though it is encased in a sturdy shell, the body inside is tender. It can’t withstand a harsh attack.
115.name: metapod

116.text: It flits from flower to flower, collecting honey. It can even identify distant flowers in bloom.
116.name: butterfree

117.text: It has a superior ability to search for delicious honey from flowers. It can seek, extract, and carry honey from flowers blooming over six miles away.
117.name: butterfree

118.text: Water-repellent powder on its wings enables it to collect honey, even in the heaviest of rains.
118.name: butterfree

119.text: It loves the honey of flowers and can locate flower patches that have even tiny amounts of pollen.
119.name: butterfree

120.text: The wings are protected by rain-repellent dust. As a result, this Pokémon can fly about even in rain.
120.name: butterfree

121.text: Butterfree has a superior ability to search for delicious honey from flowers. It can even search out, extract, and carry honey from flowers that are blooming over six miles from its nest.
121.name: butterfree

122.text: Close examination of its large eyes reveals that each eye is composed of a myriad of tiny eyes.
122.name: butterfree

123.text: When attacked by other Pokémon, it defends itself by scattering its poisonous scales and fluttering its wings.
123.name: butterfree

124.text: Its wings are covered in toxic scales. If it finds bird Pokémon going after Caterpie, Butterfree sprinkles its scales on them to drive them off.
124.name: butterfree

125.text: Nectar from pretty flowers is its favorite food. In fields of flowers, it has heated battles with Cutiefly for territory.
125.name: butterfree

126.text: Its wings, covered with poisonous powder, repel water. This allows it to fly in the rain.
126.name: butterfree

127.text: In battle, it flaps its wings at great speed to release highly toxic dust into the air.
127.name: butterfree

128.text: It collects honey every day. It rubs honey onto the hairs on its legs to carry it back to its nest.
128.name: butterfree

129.text: The barb on top of its head secretes a strong poison. It uses this toxic barb to protect itself.
129.name: weedle

130.text: Often found in forests, eating leaves. It has a sharp stinger on its head that injects poison.
130.name: weedle

131.text: It attacks using a two-inch poison barb on its head. It can usually be found under the leaves it eats.
131.name: weedle

132.text: It eats its weight in leaves every day. It fends off attackers with the needle on its head.
132.name: weedle

133.text: Often found in forests and grasslands. It has a sharp, toxic barb of around two inches on top of its head.
133.name: weedle

134.text: Its poison stinger is very powerful. Its bright-colored body is intended to warn off its enemies.
134.name: weedle

135.text: Weedle has an extremely acute sense of smell. It is capable of distinguishing its favorite kinds of leaves from those it dislikes just by sniffing with its big red proboscis (nose).
135.name: weedle

136.text: Beware of the sharp stinger on its head. It hides in grass and bushes where it eats leaves.
136.name: weedle

137.text: Nearly incapable of movement, it leans against stout trees while waiting for its evolution.
137.name: kakuna

138.text: KAKUNA remains virtually immobile as it clings to a tree. However, on the inside, it is extremely busy as it prepares for its coming evolution. This is evident from how hot the shell becomes to the touch.
138.name: kakuna

139.text: It remains virtually immobile while it clings to a tree. However, on the inside, it busily prepares for evolution. This is evident from how hot its shell becomes.
139.name: kakuna

140.text: This POKéMON is in a temporary stage while making its body. It is almost completely unable to move on its own.
140.name: kakuna

141.text: Although it is a cocoon, it can move a little. It can extend its poison barb if it is attacked.
141.name: kakuna

142.text: From this form, it will grow into an adult. As its body becomes softer, the external shell hardens.
142.name: kakuna

143.text: Almost incapable of moving, this Pokémon can only harden its shell to protect itself when it is in danger.
143.name: kakuna

144.text: While awaiting evolution, it hides from predators under leaves and in nooks of branches.
144.name: kakuna

145.text: Kakuna remains virtually immobile as it clings to a tree. However, on the inside, it is extremely busy as it prepares for its coming evolution. This is evident from how hot the shell becomes to the touch.
145.name: kakuna

146.text: Able to move only slightly. When endangered, it may stick out its stinger and poison its enemy.
146.name: kakuna

147.text: It uses sharp, poisonous stings to defeat prey, then takes the victim back to its nest for food.
147.name: beedrill

148.text: It flies at high speed and attacks using  the large venomous stingers on its forelegs and tail.
148.name: beedrill

149.text: It can take down any opponent with its powerful poison stingers. It sometimes attacks in swarms.
149.name: beedrill

150.text: It has three poison barbs. The barb on its tail secretes the most powerful poison.
150.name: beedrill

151.text: Its best attack involves flying around at high speed, striking with poison needles, then flying off.
151.name: beedrill

152.text: May appear in a swarm. Flies at violent speeds, all the while stabbing with the toxic stinger on its rear.
152.name: beedrill

153.text: Beedrill is extremely territorial. No one should ever approach its nest—this is for their own safety. If angered, they will attack in a furious swarm.
153.name: beedrill

154.text: It has three poisonous stingers on its forelegs and its tail. They are used to jab its enemy repeatedly.
154.name: beedrill

155.text: It rapidly flaps its wings in the grass, stirring up a dust cloud that drives insect prey out into the open.
155.name: pidgey

156.text: PIDGEY has an extremely sharp sense of direction. It is capable of unerringly returning home to its nest, however far it may be removed from its familiar surroundings.
156.name: pidgey

157.text: It has an extremely sharp sense of direction. It can unerringly return home to its nest, however far it may be removed from its familiar surroundings.
157.name: pidgey

158.text: Does not like to fight. It hides in tall grass and so on, foraging for food such as small bugs.
158.name: pidgey

159.text: It usually hides in tall grass. Because it dislikes fighting, it protects itself by kicking up sand.
159.name: pidgey

160.text: Common in grassy areas and forests, it is very docile and will chase off enemies by flapping up sand.
160.name: pidgey

161.text: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.
161.name: pidgey

162.text: It is docile and prefers to avoid conflict. If disturbed, however, it can ferociously strike back.
162.name: pidgey

163.text: Pidgey has an extremely sharp sense of direction. It is capable of unerringly returning home to its nest, however far it may be removed from its familiar surroundings.
163.name: pidgey

164.text: Very docile. If attacked, it will often kick up sand to protect itself rather than fight back.
164.name: pidgey

165.text: It slowly flies in a circular pat­ tern, all the while keeping a sharp lookout for prey.
165.name: pidgeotto

166.text: PIDGEOTTO claims a large area as its own territory. This POKéMON flies around, patrolling its living space. If its territory is violated, it shows no mercy in thoroughly punishing the foe with its sharp claws.
166.name: pidgeotto

167.text: This POKéMON flies around, patrolling its large territory. If its living space is violated, it shows no mercy in thoroughly punishing the foe with its sharp claws.
167.name: pidgeotto

168.text: It has outstanding vision. However high it flies, it is able to distinguish the movements of its prey.
168.name: pidgeotto

169.text: It renders its prey immobile using  well-developed claws, then carries the prey more than 60 miles to its nest.
169.name: pidgeotto

170.text: It flies over its wide territory in search of prey, downing it with its highly developed claws.
170.name: pidgeotto

171.text: The claws on its feet are well developed. It can carry prey such as an Exeggcute to its nest over 60 miles away.
171.name: pidgeotto

172.text: Very protective of its sprawling territorial area, this Pokémon will fiercely peck at any intruder.
172.name: pidgeotto

173.text: Pidgeotto claims a large area as its own territory. This Pokémon flies around, patrolling its living space. If its territory is violated, it shows no mercy in thoroughly punishing the foe with its sharp claws.
173.name: pidgeotto

174.text: This Pokémon is full of vitality. It constantly flies around its large territory in search of prey.
174.name: pidgeotto

175.text: Its outstanding vision allows it to spot splashing MAGIKARP, even while flying at 3300 feet.
175.name: pidgeot

176.text: This POKéMON has gorgeous, glossy feathers. Many TRAINERS are so captivated by the beautiful feathers on its head that they choose PIDGEOT as their POKéMON.
176.name: pidgeot

177.text: By flapping its wings with all its might, PIDGEOT can make a gust of wind capable of bending tall trees.
177.name: pidgeot

178.text: Its well-developed chest muscles make it strong enough to whip up a gusty windstorm with just a few flaps.
178.name: pidgeot

179.text: By flapping its wings with all its might, Pidgeot can make a gust of wind capable of bending tall trees.
179.name: pidgeot

180.text: When hunting, it skims the surface of water at high speed to pick off unwary prey such as Magikarp.
180.name: pidgeot

181.text: It spreads its gorgeous wings widely to intimidate enemies. It races through the skies at Mach-2 speed.
181.name: pidgeot

182.text: This Pokémon has a dazzling plumage of beautifully glossy feathers. Many Trainers are captivated by the striking beauty of the feathers on its head, compelling them to choose Pidgeot as their Pokémon.
182.name: pidgeot

183.text: This Pokémon flies at Mach 2 speed, seeking prey. Its large talons are feared as wicked weapons.
183.name: pidgeot

184.text: This POKéMON's impressive vital­ ity allows it to live anywhere. It also multiplies very quickly.
184.name: rattata

185.text: Bites anything when it attacks. Small and very quick, it is a common sight in many places.
185.name: rattata

186.text: It eats anything. Wherever food is available, it will settle down and produce offspring continuously.
186.name: rattata

187.text: Cautious in the extreme, its hardy vitality lets it live in any kind of environment.
187.name: rattata

188.text: It searches for food all day. It gnaws on hard objects to wear down its fangs, which grow constantly during its lifetime.
188.name: rattata

189.text: Living wherever there is food available, it ceaselessly scavenges for edibles the entire day.
189.name: rattata

190.text: Its fangs are long and very sharp. They grow continuously, so it gnaws on hard things to whittle them down.
190.name: rattata

191.text: Rattata is cautious in the extreme. Even while it is asleep, it constantly listens by moving its ears around. It is not picky about where it lives—it will make its nest anywhere.
191.name: rattata

192.text: Its incisors continue growing until its death. If its Trainer doesn’t offer it a file to gnaw on, it will gnaw on door frames, table legs, and so on.
192.name: rattata

193.text: With their strong capacity for survival, they can live in dirty places without concern. Left unchecked, their numbers multiply rapidly.
193.name: rattata

194.text: Its incisors grow continuously throughout its life. If its incisors get too long, this Pokémon becomes unable to eat, and it starves to death.
194.name: rattata

195.text: This Pokémon is common but hazardous. Its sharp incisors can easily cut right through hard wood.
195.name: rattata

196.text: Will chew on anything with its fangs. If you see one, you can be certain that 40 more live in the area.
196.name: rattata

197.text: It uses its whis­ kers to maintain its balance. It apparently slows down if they are cut off.
197.name: raticate

198.text: Its rear feet have three toes each. They are webbed, enabling it to swim across rivers.
198.name: raticate

199.text: It uses its whiskers to maintain its balance. It apparently slows down if they are cut off.
199.name: raticate

200.text: Gnaws on anything with its tough fangs. It can even topple concrete buildings by gnawing on them.
200.name: raticate

201.text: Its whiskers help it to maintain balance. Its fangs never stop growing, so it gnaws to pare them down.
201.name: raticate

202.text: With its long fangs, this surprisingly violent Pokémon can gnaw away even thick concrete with ease.
202.name: raticate

203.text: It whittles its constantly growing fangs by gnawing on hard things. It can chew apart cinder walls.
203.name: raticate

204.text: The webs on its hind legs enable it to cross rivers. It searches wide areas for food.
204.name: raticate

205.text: Raticate’s sturdy fangs grow steadily. To keep them ground down, it gnaws on rocks and logs. It may even chew on the walls of houses.
205.name: raticate

206.text: Its hind feet are webbed, so it’s a strong swimmer. It can cross rivers and sometimes even oceans.
206.name: raticate

207.text: Its disposition is far more violent than its looks would suggest. Don’t let your hand get too close to its face, as it could bite your hand clean off.
207.name: raticate

208.text: People say that it fled from its enemies by using its small webbed hind feet to swim from island to island in Alola.
208.name: raticate

209.text: Its whiskers are essential for maintaining its balance. No matter how friendly you are, it will get angry and bite you if you touch its whiskers.
209.name: raticate

210.text: Its hind feet are webbed. They act as flippers, so it can swim in rivers and hunt for prey.
210.name: raticate

211.text: To protect its territory, it flies around ceaselessly, making high- pitched cries.
211.name: spearow

212.text: Its loud cry can be heard over half a mile away. If its high, keening cry is heard echoing all around, it is a sign that they are warning each other of danger.
212.name: spearow

213.text: It busily flits around here and there. Even if it is frail, it can be a tough foe that uses MIRROR MOVE.
213.name: spearow

214.text: It flaps its short wings to flush out insects from tall grass. It then plucks them with its stubby beak.
214.name: spearow

215.text: It flaps its small wings busily to fly. Using its beak, it searches in grass for prey.
215.name: spearow

216.text: Very protective of its territory, it flaps its short wings busily to dart around at high speed.
216.name: spearow

217.text: Eats bugs in grassy areas. It has to flap its short wings at high speed to stay airborne.
217.name: spearow

218.text: Spearow has a very loud cry that can be heard over half a mile away. If its high, keening cry is heard echoing all around, it is a sign that they are warning each other of danger.
218.name: spearow

219.text: Its short wings make it inept at flying. It moves about hurriedly and pecks at Bug-type Pokémon in the tall grass.
219.name: spearow

220.text: Farmers whose fields are troubled by bug Pokémon appreciate Spearow for its vigorous appetite and look after it.
220.name: spearow

221.text: Its reckless nature leads it to stand up to others—even large Pokémon—if it has to protect its territory.
221.name: spearow

222.text: Due to its short wings, it can’t fly long distances. It wanders about restlessly and pecks at bug Pokémon.
222.name: spearow

223.text: Inept at flying high. However, it can fly around very fast to protect its territory.
223.name: spearow

224.text: It uses its long beak to attack. It has a surprisingly long reach, so it must be treated with caution.
224.name: fearow

225.text: FEAROW is recognized by its long neck and elongated beak. They are conveniently shaped for catching prey in soil or water. It deftly moves its long and skinny beak to pluck prey.
225.name: fearow

226.text: Its long neck and elongated beak are ideal for catching prey in soil or water. It deftly moves this extended and skinny beak to pluck prey.
226.name: fearow

227.text: Its huge and magnificent wings can keep it aloft in the sky. It can remain flying a whole day without landing.
227.name: fearow

228.text: It shoots itself suddenly high into the sky, then plummets down in one fell swoop to strike its prey.
228.name: fearow

229.text: It cleverly uses its thin, long beak to pluck and eat small insects that hide under the ground.
229.name: fearow

230.text: With its huge and magnificent wings, it can keep aloft without ever having to land for rest.
230.name: fearow

231.text: It has the stamina to fly all day on its broad wings. It fights by using its sharp beak.
231.name: fearow

232.text: Fearow is recognized by its long neck and elongated beak. They are conveniently shaped for catching prey in soil or water. It deftly moves its long and skinny beak to pluck prey.
232.name: fearow

233.text: It’s tough and has excellent stamina. It has no problem flying continuously for a whole day carrying a heavy load.
233.name: fearow

234.text: Drawings of a Pokémon resembling Fearow can be seen in murals from deep in ancient history.
234.name: fearow

235.text: Carrying food through Fearow’s territory is dangerous. It will snatch the food away from you in a flash!
235.name: fearow

236.text: In Alola, fish Pokémon are its prey. It can be seen circling above the ocean searching for food.
236.name: fearow

237.text: A Pokémon that dates back many years. If it senses danger, it flies high and away, instantly.
237.name: fearow

238.text: Moves silently and stealthily. Eats the eggs of birds, such as PIDGEY and SPEAROW, whole.
238.name: ekans

239.text: It flutters the tip of its tongue to seek out the scent of prey, then swallows the prey whole.
239.name: ekans

240.text: An EKANS curls itself up in a spiral while it rests. This position allows it to quickly respond to an enemy from any direction with a threat from its upraised head.
240.name: ekans

241.text: A very common sight in grassland, etc. It flicks its tongue in and out to sense danger in its surroundings.
241.name: ekans

242.text: It can freely detach its jaw to swallow large prey whole. It can become too heavy to move, however.
242.name: ekans

243.text: It always hides in grass. When first born, it has no poison, so its bite is painful, but harmless.
243.name: ekans

244.text: It sneaks through grass without making a sound and strikes unsuspecting prey from behind.
244.name: ekans

245.text: Moving silently and stealthily, it eats the eggs of birds, such as Pidgey and Spearow, whole.
245.name: ekans

246.text: Ekans curls itself up in a spiral while it rests. Assuming this position allows it to quickly respond to a threat from any direction with a glare from its upraised head.
246.name: ekans

247.text: By dislocating its jaw, it can swallow prey larger than itself. After a meal, it curls up and rests.
247.name: ekans

248.text: The eggs of bird Pokémon are its favorite food. It swallows eggs whole, so sometimes an egg gets stuck, and Ekans faints.
248.name: ekans

249.text: The older it gets, the longer it grows. At night, it wraps its long body around tree branches to rest.
249.name: ekans

250.text: This POKéMON has a terrifically strong constricting power. It can even flatten steel oil drums. Once it wraps its body around its foe, escaping is impossible.
250.name: arbok

251.text: It is rumored that the ferocious warning markings on its belly differ from area to area.
251.name: arbok

252.text: Transfixing prey with the face-like pattern on its belly, it binds and poisons the frightened victim.
252.name: arbok

253.text: With a very vengeful nature, it won’t give up the chase, no matter how far, once it targets its prey.
253.name: arbok

254.text: The pattern on its belly is for intimidation. It constricts foes while they are frozen in fear.
254.name: arbok

255.text: The pattern on its belly appears to be a frightening face. Weak foes will flee just at the sight of the pattern.
255.name: arbok

256.text: To intimidate foes, it spreads its chest wide and makes eerie sounds by expelling air from its mouth.
256.name: arbok

257.text: This Pokémon is terrifically strong in order to constrict things with its body. It can even flatten steel oil drums. Once Arbok wraps its body around its foe, escaping its crunching embrace is impossible.
257.name: arbok

258.text: The latest research has determined that there are over 20 possible arrangements of the patterns on its stomach.
258.name: arbok

259.text: After stunning its opponents with the pattern on its stomach, it quickly wraps them up in its body and waits for them to stop moving.
259.name: arbok

260.text: The frightening patterns on its belly have been studied. Six variations have been confirmed.
260.name: arbok

261.text: It keeps its tail raised to monitor its surroundings. If you yank its tail, it will try to bite you.
261.name: pikachu

262.text: When it is anger­ ed, it immediately discharges the energy stored in the pouches in its cheeks.
262.name: pikachu

263.text: It stores electricity in the electric sacs on its cheeks. When it releases pent-up energy in a burst, the electric power is equal to a lightning bolt.
263.name: pikachu

264.text: When several of these POKéMON gather, their electricity can build and cause lightning storms.
264.name: pikachu

265.text: It lives in forests with others. It stores electricity in the pouches on its cheeks.
265.name: pikachu

266.text: If it looses crackling power from the electric pouches on its cheeks, it is being wary.
266.name: pikachu

267.text: This intelligent Pokémon roasts hard berries with electricity to make them tender enough to eat.
267.name: pikachu

268.text: It occasionally uses an electric shock to recharge a fellow Pikachu that is in a weakened state.
268.name: pikachu

269.text: It raises its tail to check its surroundings. The tail is sometimes struck by lightning in this pose.
269.name: pikachu

270.text: It has small electric sacs on both its cheeks. If threatened, it looses electric charges from the sacs.
270.name: pikachu

271.text: Whenever Pikachu comes across something new, it blasts it with a jolt of electricity. If you come across a blackened berry, it’s evidence that this Pokémon mistook the intensity of its charge.
271.name: pikachu

272.text: This Pokémon has electricity-storing pouches on its cheeks. These appear to become electrically charged during the night while Pikachu sleeps. It occasionally discharges electricity when it is dozy after waking up.
272.name: pikachu

273.text: A plan was recently announced to gather many Pikachu and make an electric power plant.
273.name: pikachu

274.text: It’s in its nature to store electricity. It feels stressed now and then if it’s unable to fully discharge the electricity.
274.name: pikachu

275.text: Its nature is to store up electricity. Forests where nests of Pikachu live are dangerous, since the trees are so often struck by lightning.
275.name: pikachu

276.text: While sleeping, it generates electricity in the sacs in its cheeks. If it’s not getting enough sleep, it will be able to use only weak electricity.
276.name: pikachu

277.text: This forest-dwelling Pokémon stores electricity in its cheeks, so you’ll feel a tingly shock if you touch it.
277.name: pikachu

278.text: Pikachu that can generate powerful electricity have cheek sacs that are extra soft and super stretchy.
278.name: pikachu

279.text: When Pikachu meet, they’ll touch their tails together and exchange electricity through them as a form of greeting.
279.name: pikachu

280.text: Possesses cheek sacs in which it stores electricity. This clever forest-dweller roasts tough berries with an electric shock before consuming them.
280.name: pikachu

281.text: When its electric­ ity builds, its muscles are stimu­ lated, and it be­ comes more aggres­ sive than usual.
281.name: raichu

282.text: If it stores too much electricity, its behavior turns aggressive. To avoid this, it occasionally discharges excess energy and calms itself down.
282.name: raichu

283.text: Its electric charges can reach even 100,000 volts. Careless contact can cause even an Indian elephant to faint.
283.name: raichu

284.text: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high-voltage power.
284.name: raichu

285.text: It turns aggressive if it has too much electricity in its body. It discharges power through its tail.
285.name: raichu

286.text: If the electric pouches in its cheeks become fully charged, both ears will stand straight up.
286.name: raichu

287.text: Its tail discharges electricity into the ground, protecting it from getting shocked.
287.name: raichu

288.text: When its electricity builds, its muscles are stimulated, and it becomes more aggressive than usual.
288.name: raichu

289.text: It can loose 100,000-volt bursts of electricity, instantly downing foes several times its size.
289.name: raichu

290.text: If the electrical sacs become excessively charged, Raichu plants its tail in the ground and discharges. Scorched patches of ground will be found near this Pokémon’s nest.
290.name: raichu

291.text: This Pokémon exudes a weak electrical charge from all over its body that makes it take on a slight glow in darkness. Raichu plants its tail in the ground to discharge electricity.
291.name: raichu

292.text: It unleashes electric shocks that can reach 100,000 volts. When agitated, it can knock out even an Indian elephant.
292.name: raichu

293.text: It becomes aggressive when it has electricity stored up. At such times, even its Trainer has to take care to avoid being attacked.
293.name: raichu

294.text: As electricity builds up inside its body, it becomes more aggressive. One theory is that the electricity buildup is actually causing stress.
294.name: raichu

295.text: Because so many Trainers like the way Pikachu looks, you don’t see this Pokémon very often.
295.name: raichu

296.text: When electricity builds up inside its body, it becomes feisty. It also glows in the dark.
296.name: raichu

297.text: If its electric pouches run empty, it raises its tail to gather electricity from the atmosphere.
297.name: raichu

298.text: It can discharge bursts of electricity exceeding 100,000 volts— a single strike with that amount of power would incapacitate one of the Copperajah of my homeland.
298.name: raichu

299.text: It prefers dry, sandy places because it uses the sand to protect itself when threatened.
299.name: sandshrew

300.text: When it curls up in a ball, it can make any attack bounce off harmlessly. Its hide has turned tough and solid as a result of living in the desert.
300.name: sandshrew

301.text: Burrows deep underground in arid locations far from water. It only emerges to hunt for prey.
301.name: sandshrew

302.text: If it fell from a great height, this Pokémon could save itself by rolling into a ball and bouncing.
302.name: sandshrew

303.text: To protect itself from attackers, it curls up into a ball. It lives in arid regions with minimal rainfall.
303.name: sandshrew

304.text: It digs deep burrows to live in. When in danger, it rolls up its body to withstand attacks.
304.name: sandshrew

305.text: It burrows and lives underground. If threatened, it curls itself up into a ball for protection.
305.name: sandshrew

306.text: Disliking water, it lives in deep burrows in arid areas. It can roll itself instantly into a ball.
306.name: sandshrew

307.text: Sandshrew’s body is configured to absorb water without waste, enabling it to survive in an arid desert. This Pokémon curls up to protect itself from its enemies.
307.name: sandshrew

308.text: Sandshrew has a very dry hide that is extremely tough. The Pokémon can roll into a ball that repels any attack. At night, it burrows into the desert sand to sleep.
308.name: sandshrew

309.text: It can roll its body into a ball. It moves through the desert by rolling at high speeds.
309.name: sandshrew

310.text: It usually makes its home in deserts and arid zones, where rain does not fall. It digs holes to catch Bug-type Pokémon.
310.name: sandshrew

311.text: It lives in areas of limited rainfall. When danger approaches, it curls up into a ball to protect its soft stomach.
311.name: sandshrew

312.text: When its skin gets wrinkled from moisture, it heads for a volcano. It lies flat on a spot with a lot of geothermal heat and dries itself out.
312.name: sandshrew

313.text: Its body is dry. When it gets cold at night, its hide is said to become coated with a fine dew.
313.name: sandshrew

314.text: It loves to bathe in the grit of dry, sandy areas. By sand bathing, the Pokémon rids itself of dirt and moisture clinging to its body.
314.name: sandshrew

315.text: It burrows into the ground to create its nest. If hard stones impede its tunneling, it uses its sharp claws to shatter them and then carries on digging.
315.name: sandshrew

316.text: Adept at climbing trees, it rolls into a spiny ball, then attacks its enemies from above.
316.name: sandslash

317.text: It curls up in a ball to protect itself from enemy attacks. It also curls up to prevent heatstroke during the daytime when temperatures rise sharply.
317.name: sandslash

318.text: It is adept at attacking with the spines on its back and its sharp claws while quickly scurrying about.
318.name: sandslash

319.text: In an attempt to hide itself, it will run around at top speed to kick up a blinding dust storm.
319.name: sandslash

320.text: It curls up, then rolls into foes with its back. Its sharp spines inflict severe damage.
320.name: sandslash

321.text: The spikes on its body are made up of its hardened hide. It rolls up and attacks foes with its spikes.
321.name: sandslash

322.text: If it digs at an incredible pace, it may snap off its spikes and claws. They grow back in a day.
322.name: sandslash

323.text: Curls up into a spiny ball when threatened. It can roll while curled up to attack or escape.
323.name: sandslash

324.text: Sandslash’s body is covered by tough spikes, which are hardened sections of its hide. Once a year, the old spikes fall out, to be replaced with new spikes that grow out from beneath the old ones.
324.name: sandslash

325.text: Sandslash can roll up its body as if it were a ball covered with large spikes. In battle, this Pokémon will try to make the foe flinch by jabbing it with its spines. It then leaps at the stunned foe to tear wildly with its sharp claws.
325.name: sandslash

326.text: Although they are sharp, its claws and spikes often break off. They grow back the next day, so it is not bothered by the temporary loss.
326.name: sandslash

327.text: It uses its claws to climb trees and then curls its body into a spiny ball, ready to drop onto any prey that appears.
327.name: sandslash

328.text: Its claws and horns often break off. The broken claws and horns can be used to carve plows for tilling farm fields.
328.name: sandslash

329.text: Thanks to its thick claws, it’s good at climbing trees. There are plenty of Sandslash that park themselves in trees and go right to sleep.
329.name: sandslash

330.text: It is skilled at slashing enemies with its claws. If broken, they start to grow back in a day.
330.name: sandslash

331.text: The drier the area Sandslash lives in, the harder and smoother the Pokémon’s spikes will feel when touched.
331.name: sandslash

332.text: It climbs trees by hooking on with its sharp claws. Sandslash shares the berries it gathers, dropping them down to Sandshrew waiting below the tree.
332.name: sandslash

333.text: NIDORAN has barbs that secrete a powerful poison. They are thought to have developed as protection for this small-bodied POKéMON. When enraged, it releases a horrible toxin from its horn.
333.name: nidoran-f

334.text: Its highly toxic barbs are thought to have developed as protection for this small- bodied POKéMON. When enraged, it releases a horrible toxin from its horn.
334.name: nidoran-f

335.text: Though small, it must be treated with caution because of its powerfully toxic barbs. The female has smaller horns.
335.name: nidoran-f

336.text: The poison hidden in its small horn is extremely potent. Even a tiny scratch can have fatal results.
336.name: nidoran-f

337.text: Although not very combative, it will torment its foes with poison spikes if it is threatened in any way.
337.name: nidoran-f

338.text: While it does not prefer to fight, even one drop of the poison it secretes from barbs can be fatal.
338.name: nidoran-f

339.text: Although small, its venomous barbs render this Pokémon dangerous. The female has smaller horns.
339.name: nidoran-f

340.text: Small and very docile, it protects itself with its small, poisonous horn when attacked.
340.name: nidoran-f

341.text: Nidoran♀ has barbs that secrete a powerful poison. They are thought to have developed as protection for this small-bodied Pokémon. When enraged, it releases a horrible toxin from its horn.
341.name: nidoran-f

342.text: A mild-mannered Pokémon that does not like to fight. Beware—its small horn secretes venom.
342.name: nidoran-f

343.text: Females are more sensitive to smells than males. While foraging, they’ll use their whiskers to check wind direction and stay downwind of predators.
343.name: nidoran-f

344.text: It uses its hard incisor teeth to crush and eat berries. The tip of a female Nidoran’s horn is a bit more rounded than the tip of a male’s horn.
344.name: nidoran-f

345.text: When resting deep in its burrow, its thorns always retract. This is proof that it is relaxed.
345.name: nidorina

346.text: It has a docile nature. If it is threatened with attack, it raises the barbs that are all over its body.
346.name: nidorina

347.text: When NIDORINA are with their friends or family, they keep their barbs tucked away to prevent hurting each other. This POKéMON appears to become nervous if separated from the others.
347.name: nidorina

348.text: When it is with its friends or family, its barbs are tucked away to prevent injury. It appears to become nervous if separated from the others.
348.name: nidorina

349.text: The female’s horns develop slowly. Prefers physical attacks such as clawing and biting.
349.name: nidorina

350.text: It has a calm and caring nature. Because its horn grows slowly, it prefers not to fight.
350.name: nidorina

351.text: When it senses danger, it raises all the barbs on its body. These barbs grow slower than Nidorino’s.
351.name: nidorina

352.text: The female has a gentle temperament. It emits ultrasonic cries that have the power to befuddle foes.
352.name: nidorina

353.text: When feeding its young, it first chews the food into a paste, then spits it out for the offspring.
353.name: nidorina

354.text: When Nidorina are with their friends or family, they keep their barbs tucked away to prevent hurting each other. This Pokémon appears to become nervous if separated from the others.
354.name: nidorina

355.text: When resting deep in its burrow, its barbs always retract. This is proof that it is relaxed.
355.name: nidorina

356.text: The horn on its head has atrophied. It’s thought that this happens so Nidorina’s children won’t get poked while their mother is feeding them.
356.name: nidorina

357.text: If the group is threatened, these Pokémon will band together to assault enemies with a chorus of ultrasonic waves.
357.name: nidorina

358.text: The hard scales that cover its strong body serve as excellent protection from any attack.
358.name: nidoqueen

359.text: NIDOQUEEN’s body is encased in extremely hard scales. It is adept at sending foes flying with harsh tackles. This POKéMON is at its strongest when it is defending its young.
359.name: nidoqueen

360.text: It is adept at sending foes flying with harsh tackles using its tough, scaly body. This POKéMON is at its strongest when it is defending its young.
360.name: nidoqueen

361.text: Its hard scales provide strong protection. It uses its hefty bulk to execute powerful moves.
361.name: nidoqueen

362.text: Its body is covered with needle-like scales. It never shows signs of shrinking from any attack.
362.name: nidoqueen

363.text: Its entire body is armored with hard scales. It will protect the young in its burrow with its life.
363.name: nidoqueen

364.text: It uses its scaly, rugged body to seal the entrance of its nest and protect its young from predators.
364.name: nidoqueen

365.text: The body is covered by stiff, needlelike scales. If it becomes excited, the needles bristle outwards.
365.name: nidoqueen

366.text: Nidoqueen’s body is encased in extremely hard scales. It is adept at sending foes flying with harsh tackles. This Pokémon is at its strongest when it is defending its young.
366.name: nidoqueen

367.text: Tough scales cover the sturdy body of this Pokémon. It appears that the scales grow in cycles.
367.name: nidoqueen

368.text: Nidoqueen is better at defense than offense. With scales like armor, this Pokémon will shield its children from any kind of attack.
368.name: nidoqueen

369.text: It pacifies offspring by placing them in the gaps between the spines on its back. The spines will never secrete poison while young are present.
369.name: nidoqueen

370.text: It constantly moves its large ears in many directions in order to detect danger right away.
370.name: nidoran-m

371.text: The male NIDORAN has developed muscles that freely move its ears in any direction. Even the slightest sound does not escape this POKéMON’s notice.
371.name: nidoran-m

372.text: It stiffens its ears to sense danger. The larger its horns, the more  powerful its secreted venom.
372.name: nidoran-m

373.text: It is small, but its horn is filled with poison. It charges then stabs with the horn to inject poison.
373.name: nidoran-m

374.text: It raises its big ears to check its surroundings. It will strike first if it senses any danger.
374.name: nidoran-m

375.text: It scans its surroundings by raising its ears out of the grass. Its toxic horn is for protection.
375.name: nidoran-m

376.text: Its large ears are flapped like wings when it is listening to distant sounds. It extends toxic barbs when angered.
376.name: nidoran-m

377.text: Nidoran♂ has developed muscles for moving its ears. Thanks to them, the ears can be freely moved in any direction. Even the slightest sound does not escape this Pokémon’s notice.
377.name: nidoran-m

378.text: Its large ears are always kept upright. If it senses danger, it will attack with a poisonous sting.
378.name: nidoran-m

379.text: The horn on a male Nidoran’s forehead contains a powerful poison. This is a very cautious Pokémon, always straining its large ears.
379.name: nidoran-m

380.text: Small but brave, this Pokémon will hold its ground and even risk its life in battle to protect the female it’s friendly with.
380.name: nidoran-m

381.text: It is easily agitated and uses its horn for offense as soon as it notices an attacker.
381.name: nidorino

382.text: Its horn is harder than a diamond. If it senses a hostile presence, all the barbs on its back bristle up at once, and it challenges the foe with all its might.
382.name: nidorino

383.text: It is easily angered. By swinging its well- developed horn wildly, it can even punch through diamond.
383.name: nidorino

384.text: Quick to anger, it stabs enemies with its horn to inject a powerful poison when it becomes agitated.
384.name: nidorino

385.text: It has a violent disposition and stabs foes with its horn, which oozes poison upon impact.
385.name: nidorino

386.text: It raises its big ears to check its surroundings. If it senses anything, it attacks immediately.
386.name: nidorino

387.text: An aggressive Pokémon that is quick to attack. The horn on its head secretes a powerful venom.
387.name: nidorino

388.text: Nidorino has a horn that is harder than a diamond. If it senses a hostile presence, all the barbs on its back bristle up at once, and it challenges the foe with all its might.
388.name: nidorino

389.text: Its horn contains venom. If it stabs an enemy with the horn, the impact makes the poison leak out.
389.name: nidorino

390.text: With a horn that’s harder than diamond, this Pokémon goes around shattering boulders as it searches for a moon stone.
390.name: nidorino

391.text: It’s nervous and quick to act aggressively. The potency of its poison increases along with the level of adrenaline present in its body.
391.name: nidorino

392.text: It uses its thick arms, legs and tail to attack forcefully. Melee combat is its specialty.
392.name: nidoking

393.text: A NIDOKING’s thick tail packs enormously destructive power capable of toppling a metal transmission tower. Once it goes on a rampage, there is no stopping it.
393.name: nidoking

394.text: It uses its powerful tail in battle to smash, constrict, then break the prey’s bones.
394.name: nidoking

395.text: It swings its big tail around during battle. If its foe flinches, it will charge with its sturdy body.
395.name: nidoking

396.text: Its tail is thick and powerful. If it binds an enemy, it can render the victim helpless quite easily.
396.name: nidoking

397.text: It is recognized by its rock-hard hide and its extended horn. Be careful with the horn, as it contains venom.
397.name: nidoking

398.text: One swing of its mighty tail can snap a telephone pole as if it were a matchstick.
398.name: nidoking

399.text: Nidoking’s thick tail packs enormously destructive power. With one swing, it can topple a metal transmission tower. Once this Pokémon goes on a rampage, there is no stopping it.
399.name: nidoking

400.text: Its steel-like hide adds to its powerful tackle. Its horns are so hard, they can pierce a diamond.
400.name: nidoking

401.text: When it goes on a rampage, it’s impossible to control. But in the presence of a Nidoqueen it’s lived with for a long time, Nidoking calms down.
401.name: nidoking

402.text: Nidoking prides itself on its strength. It’s forceful and spirited in battle, making use of its thick tail and diamond-crushing horn.
402.name: nidoking

403.text: Though rarely seen, it becomes easier to spot, for some reason, on the night of a  full moon.
403.name: clefairy

404.text: On every night of a full moon, they come out to play. When dawn arrives, the tired CLEFAIRY go to sleep nestled up against each other in deep and quiet mountains.
404.name: clefairy

405.text: Its adorable appearance makes it popular as a pet. However, it is rare and difficult to find.
405.name: clefairy

406.text: With its magical and cute appeal, it has  many admirers. It is rare and found only in certain areas.
406.name: clefairy

407.text: Thought to live with others on quiet mountains, it is popular for its adorable nature.
407.name: clefairy

408.text: It flies using the wings on its back to collect moonlight. This Pokémon is difficult to find.
408.name: clefairy

409.text: On nights with a full moon, Clefairy gather from all over and dance. Bathing in moonlight makes them float.
409.name: clefairy

410.text: The moonlight that it stores in the wings on its back apparently gives it the ability to float in midair.
410.name: clefairy

411.text: On every night of a full moon, groups of this Pokémon come out to play. When dawn arrives, the tired Clefairy return to their quiet mountain retreats and go to sleep nestled up against each other.
411.name: clefairy

412.text: Its adorable behavior and appearance make it popular with men and women, young and old. Its numbers are few, however.
412.name: clefairy

413.text: On nights with a full moon, they gather together and dance. The surrounding area is enveloped in an abnormal magnetic field.
413.name: clefairy

414.text: They’re popular, but they’re rare. Trainers who show them off recklessly may be targeted by thieves.
414.name: clefairy

415.text: Its adorable behavior and cry make it highly popular. However, this cute Pokémon is rarely found.
415.name: clefairy

416.text: Bathed in moonlight, its wings glow faintly. Without even flapping, Clefairy rises into the air, where it dances around.
416.name: clefairy

417.text: Adored for their cute looks and playfulness. They are thought to be rare, as they do not appear often.
417.name: clefairy

418.text: It is said that happiness will come to those who see a gathering of Clefairy dancing under a full moon.
418.name: clefairy

419.text: It can be found in quiet mountain areas on a full moon's night. Its dancing and its tiny, faintly glowing wings confer upon it a lovely fairylike quality.
419.name: clefairy

420.text: Said to live in quiet, remote mountains, this type of fairy has a strong aversion to being seen.
420.name: clefable

421.text: It has an acute sense of hearing. It can easily hear a pin being dropped nearly 1,100 yards away.
421.name: clefable

422.text: Rarely seen by people, it is said to be drawn by the full moon to play at deserted lakes.
422.name: clefable

423.text: With its acute hearing, it can pick up sounds from far away. It usually hides in quiet places.
423.name: clefable

424.text: Its very sensitive ears let it distinguish distant sounds. As a result, it prefers quiet places.
424.name: clefable

425.text: It is very wary and rarely shows itself to people. Its ears can hear a pin drop over half a mile away.
425.name: clefable

426.text: Its hearing is so acute it can hear a pin drop over half a mile away. It lives on quiet mountains.
426.name: clefable

427.text: Clefable moves by skipping lightly as if it were flying using its wings. Its bouncy step lets it even walk on water. It is known to take strolls on lakes on quiet, moonlit nights.
427.name: clefable

428.text: They don’t like to reveal themselves in front of people. They live quietly in packs deep in the mountains.
428.name: clefable

429.text: According to tradition, people who see a pair of Clefable skipping by can look forward to a happy marriage.
429.name: clefable

430.text: It can’t help but hear a pin drop from over half a mile away, so it lives deep in the mountains where there aren’t many people or Pokémon.
430.name: clefable

431.text: Some scientists believe that it gazes intently at the sky on nights with a full moon because it’s homesick.
431.name: clefable

432.text: They appear to be very protective of their own world. It is a kind of fairy, rarely seen by people.
432.name: clefable

433.text: A timid fairy Pokémon that is rarely seen, it will run and hide the moment it senses people.
433.name: clefable

434.text: Their ears are sensitive enough to hear a pin drop from over a mile away, so they’re usually found in quiet places.
434.name: clefable

435.text: Legend says that on clear, quiet nights, it listens for the voices of its kin living on the moon. I, too, often think of my homeland, so far away.
435.name: clefable

436.text: At the time of birth, it has just one tail. The tail splits from its tip as it grows older.
436.name: vulpix

437.text: As its body grows larger, its six warm tails become more beautiful, with a more luxur­ ious coat of fur.
437.name: vulpix

438.text: At the time of its birth, VULPIX has one white tail. The tail separates into six if this POKéMON receives plenty of love from its TRAINER. The six tails become magnificently curled.
438.name: vulpix

439.text: It can freely control fire, making fiery orbs fly like will-o’-the-wisps. Just before evolution, its six tails grow hot  as if on fire.
439.name: vulpix

440.text: As it develops, its single white tail gains color and splits into six. It is quite warm and cuddly.
440.name: vulpix

441.text: If it is attacked by an enemy that is stronger than itself, it feigns injury to fool the enemy and escapes.
441.name: vulpix

442.text: It controls balls of fire. As it grows, its six tails split from their tips to make more tails.
442.name: vulpix

443.text: When it is born, it has just one snow-white tail. The tail splits from its tip as it grows older.
443.name: vulpix

444.text: At the time of its birth, Vulpix has one white tail. The tail separates into six if this Pokémon receives plenty of love from its Trainer. The six tails become magnificently curled.
444.name: vulpix

445.text: Inside Vulpix’s body burns a flame that never goes out. During the daytime, when the temperatures rise, this Pokémon releases flames from its mouth to prevent its body from growing too hot.
445.name: vulpix

446.text: Its beautiful fur and tails have made it very popular. As it grows, its tails split to form more tails.
446.name: vulpix

447.text: From its mouth spew flames that seem to resemble the spirits of the deceased. Some people mistakenly think this fire is a ghost.
447.name: vulpix

448.text: Its beautiful tails have made it very popular. However, if it’s not brushed diligently, it will be a mass of tangles before you know it.
448.name: vulpix

449.text: It manipulates balls of fire to catch its prey. If you raise one from when it’s young, it will grow close to you like a puppy Pokémon.
449.name: vulpix

450.text: Both its fur and its tails are beautiful. As it grows, the tails split and form more tails.
450.name: vulpix

451.text: While young, it has six gorgeous tails. When it grows, several new tails are sprouted.
451.name: vulpix

452.text: As each tail grows, its fur becomes more lustrous. When held, it feels slightly warm.
452.name: vulpix

453.text: In its belly burns a fire, which Vulpix spits out in the form of fireballs. When young, this Pokémon has but one white tail. As the Pokémon matures, this single tail splits into six.
453.name: vulpix

454.text: It has long been said that each of the nine tails embody an enchanted power. A long-lived NINETALES will have fur that shines like gold.
454.name: ninetales

455.text: Some legends claim that each of its nine tails has its own unique type of special mystical power.
455.name: ninetales

456.text: Its nine beautiful tails are filled with a wondrous energy that could keep it alive for 1,000 years.
456.name: ninetales

457.text: Each of its nine tails is imbued with supernatural power, and it can live for a thousand years.
457.name: ninetales

458.text: It has nine long tails and fur that gleams gold. It is said to live for 1,000 years.
458.name: ninetales

459.text: Ninetales casts a sinister light from its bright red eyes to gain total control over its foe’s mind. This Pokémon is said to live for a thousand years.
459.name: ninetales

460.text: Legend has it that Ninetales came into being when nine wizards possessing sacred powers merged into one. This Pokémon is highly intelligent—it can understand human speech.
460.name: ninetales

461.text: Legend has it that this mystical Pokémon was formed when nine saints coalesced into one.
461.name: ninetales

462.text: Said to live for a thousand years, this Pokémon uses its supernatural abilities to manipulate fire. It can burn its prey to a crisp as it pleases.
462.name: ninetales

463.text: It is vindictive and relentless by nature. Those who cross it even once will be cursed for a thousand years, along with their descendants.
463.name: ninetales

464.text: The flickering flames it spews from its mouth leave its opponents hypnotized. Then, this extremely intelligent Pokémon attacks.
464.name: ninetales

465.text: According to an enduring legend, nine noble saints were united and reincarnated as this Pokémon.
465.name: ninetales

466.text: It is said to live 1,000 years, and each of its tails is loaded with supernatural powers.
466.name: ninetales

467.text: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1,000-year curse.
467.name: ninetales

468.text: The coat of gleaming golden fur is quite magnificent. This species is said to store sacred power in its nine long tails and to live for a millennium.
468.name: ninetales

469.text: It rolls its cute eyes as it sings a soothing lullaby. Its gentle song puts anyone who hears it to sleep.
469.name: jigglypuff

470.text: Nothing can avoid falling asleep hearing a JIGGLYPUFF’s song. The sound waves of its singing voice match the brain waves of someone in a deep sleep.
470.name: jigglypuff

471.text: When its huge eyes waver, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep.
471.name: jigglypuff

472.text: Looking into its cute, round eyes causes it to sing a relaxing melody, inducing its enemies to sleep.
472.name: jigglypuff

473.text: When it wavers its big, round eyes, it begins singing a lullaby that makes everyone drowsy.
473.name: jigglypuff

474.text: Looking into its cute, round eyes makes it start singing a song so pleasant listeners can’t help but fall asleep.
474.name: jigglypuff

475.text: It captivates foes with its huge, round eyes, then lulls them to sleep by singing a soothing melody.
475.name: jigglypuff

476.text: If it inflates to sing a lullaby, it can perform longer and cause sure drowsiness in its audience.
476.name: jigglypuff

477.text: Jigglypuff’s vocal cords can freely adjust the wavelength of its voice. This Pokémon uses this ability to sing at precisely the right wavelength to make its foes most drowsy.
477.name: jigglypuff

478.text: When this Pokémon sings, it never pauses to breathe. If it is in a battle against an opponent that does not easily fall asleep, Jigglypuff cannot breathe, endangering its life.
478.name: jigglypuff

479.text: It hugely inflates its stomach and sings a mysterious melody. If you hear this melody, you’ll become sleepy right away.
479.name: jigglypuff

480.text: Jigglypuff possess a vocal range that exceeds 12 octaves, but each individual’s singing skill depends on its own effort.
480.name: jigglypuff

481.text: Recordings of Jigglypuff’s strange lullabies can be purchased from department stores. These CDs can be found near the bedding area.
481.name: jigglypuff

482.text: The songs they sing are totally different depending on the region they live in. Some even sound like they’re shouting!
482.name: jigglypuff

483.text: Uses its cute round eyes to enrapture its foe. It then sings a pleasing melody that lulls the foe to sleep.
483.name: jigglypuff

484.text: Jigglypuff has top-notch lung capacity, even by comparison to other Pokémon. It won’t stop singing its lullabies until its foes fall asleep.
484.name: jigglypuff

485.text: By freely changing the wavelength of its voice, Jigglypuff sings a mysterious melody sure to make any listener sleepy.
485.name: jigglypuff

486.text: The rich, fluffy fur that covers its body feels so good that anyone who feels it can't stop touching it.
486.name: wigglytuff

487.text: WIGGLYTUFF has large, saucerlike eyes. The surfaces of its eyes are always covered with a thin layer of tears. If any dust gets in this POKéMON’s eyes, it is quickly washed away.
487.name: wigglytuff

488.text: WIGGLYTUFF’s body is very flexible. By inhaling deeply, this POKéMON can inflate itself seemingly without end. Once inflated, WIGGLYTUFF bounces along lightly like a balloon.
488.name: wigglytuff

489.text: Its fur is the ultimate in luxuriousness. Sleeping alongside a WIGGLYTUFF is simply divine. Its body expands seemingly without end when it inhales.
489.name: wigglytuff

490.text: Its fur is extremely fine, dense, and supple. The exquisitely pleasant fur conveys an image of luxury.
490.name: wigglytuff

491.text: It has a very fine fur. Take care not to make it angry, or it may inflate steadily and hit with a body slam.
491.name: wigglytuff

492.text: Its fine fur feels sublime to the touch. It can expand its body by inhaling air.
492.name: wigglytuff

493.text: Its fine fur feels so pleasant, those who accidentally touch it cannot take their hands away.
493.name: wigglytuff

494.text: Their fur feels so good that if two of them snuggle together, they won’t want to be separated.
494.name: wigglytuff

495.text: The body is soft and rubbery. When angered, it will suck in air and inflate itself to an enormous size.
495.name: wigglytuff

496.text: Wigglytuff has large, saucerlike eyes. The surfaces of its eyes are always covered with a thin layer of tears. If any dust gets in this Pokémon’s eyes, it is quickly washed away.
496.name: wigglytuff

497.text: Wigglytuff’s body is very flexible. By inhaling deeply, this Pokémon can inflate itself seemingly without end. Once inflated, Wigglytuff bounces along lightly like a balloon.
497.name: wigglytuff

498.text: It sheds its fine fur when the seasons change. The fur is gathered and spun into a luxurious yarn.
498.name: wigglytuff

499.text: As it inhales, it expands...and expands...and expands. Wigglytuff compete to see which one can inflate itself the most.
499.name: wigglytuff

500.text: Thanks to its bouncy body and fine fur, this Pokémon is sought after. Holding one in your arms while you sleep feels great.
500.name: wigglytuff

501.text: When it gets angry, it inhales with all its might, and its body gradually inflates. Sometimes they can grow 20 times larger!
501.name: wigglytuff

502.text: Its body is very elastic. By inhaling deeply, it can continue to inflate itself without limit.
502.name: wigglytuff

503.text: The more air it takes in, the more it inflates. If opponents catch it in a bad mood, it will inflate itself to an enormous size to intimidate them.
503.name: wigglytuff

504.text: It’s proud of its fur, which is fine and delicate. In particular, the curl on its forehead has a texture that’s perfectly heavenly.
504.name: wigglytuff

505.text: During the day, it gathers with others and hangs from the ceilings of old buildings and caves.
505.name: zubat

506.text: While living in pitch-black caverns, their eyes gradually grew shut and deprived them of vision. They use ultrasonic waves to detect obstacles.
506.name: zubat

507.text: It forms colonies in perpetually dark  places and uses ultrasonic waves to   identify and approach targets.
507.name: zubat

508.text: Disliking sunlight, it sleeps deep in forests and caves until sundown.
508.name: zubat

509.text: While flying, it constantly emits ultrasonic waves from its mouth to check its surroundings.
509.name: zubat

510.text: Capable of flying safely in dark places, it emits ultrasonic cries to check for any obstacles.
510.name: zubat

511.text: It checks its surroundings and location using reflections of the ultrasonic waves from its mouth.
511.name: zubat

512.text: It does not need eyes, because it emits ultrasonic waves to check its surroundings while it flies.
512.name: zubat

513.text: Even though it has no eyes, it can sense obstacles using ultrasonic waves it emits from its mouth.
513.name: zubat

514.text: It has no eyes. Instead, it relies on its ultrasonic cries for echolocation to flit about in darkness.
514.name: zubat

515.text: Zubat remains quietly unmoving in a dark spot during the bright daylight hours. It does so because prolonged exposure to the sun causes its body to become slightly burned.
515.name: zubat

516.text: Zubat avoids sunlight because exposure causes it to become unhealthy. During the daytime, it stays in caves or under the eaves of old houses, sleeping while hanging upside down.
516.name: zubat

517.text: It sleeps in caves during the day. It has no eyes, so to check its surroundings while flying, it emits ultrasonic waves.
517.name: zubat

518.text: When exposed to sunlight, they suffer burns. The frequency of their ultrasonic waves can differ slightly from colony to colony.
518.name: zubat

519.text: It has no eyeballs, so it can’t see. It checks its surroundings via the ultrasonic waves it emits from its mouth.
519.name: zubat

520.text: Their skin is so thin that they’ll be burned if sunlight hits them. When it gets cold out, they gather together to warm one another’s bodies.
520.name: zubat

521.text: Emits ultrasonic cries while it flies. They act as a sonar used to check for objects in its way.
521.name: zubat

522.text: It emits ultrasonic waves from its mouth to check its surroundings. Even in tight caves, Zubat flies around with skill.
522.name: zubat

523.text: Zubat live in caves, down where the sun’s light won’t reach. In the morning, they gather together to keep each other warm as they sleep.
523.name: zubat

524.text: Makes its home in gloomy caves. Atrophied eyes have left this Pokémon blind, so it scans its surroundings via sound waves that it emits from its mouth as it flies.
524.name: zubat

525.text: When it plunges its fangs into its prey, it instantly draws and gulps down more than ten ounces of blood.
525.name: golbat

526.text: Its fangs easily puncture even thick animal hide. It loves to feast on the blood of people and POKéMON. It flits about in darkness and strikes from behind.
526.name: golbat

527.text: It clamps down on its prey with needle- sharp fangs and drains over 10 ounces of blood in one gulp.
527.name: golbat

528.text: It loves the blood of humans and Pokémon. It flies around at night in search of neck veins.
528.name: golbat

529.text: However hard its victim’s hide may be, it punctures with sharp fangs and gorges itself with blood.
529.name: golbat

530.text: It can drink more than 10 ounces of blood at once. If it has too much, it gets heavy and flies clumsily.
530.name: golbat

531.text: Its sharp fangs puncture the toughest of hides and have small holes for greedily sucking blood.
531.name: golbat

532.text: Flitting around in the dead of night, it sinks its fangs into its prey and drains a nearly fatal amount of blood.
532.name: golbat

533.text: Once it bites, it will not stop draining energy from the victim even if it gets too heavy to fly.
533.name: golbat

534.text: Once it starts sucking blood, it does not stop until it is full. It flies at night in search of prey.
534.name: golbat

535.text: Golbat loves to drink the blood of living things. It is particularly active in the pitch black of night. This Pokémon flits around in the night skies, seeking fresh blood.
535.name: golbat

536.text: Golbat bites down on prey with its four fangs and drinks the victim’s blood. It becomes active on inky dark moonless nights, flying around to attack people and Pokémon.
536.name: golbat

537.text: Its thick fangs are hollow like straws, making them unexpectedly fragile. These fangs are specialized for sucking blood.
537.name: golbat

538.text: Sometimes they drink so much blood, they can’t fly anymore. Then they fall to the ground and become food for other Pokémon.
538.name: golbat

539.text: Every once in a while, you’ll see a Golbat that’s missing some fangs. This happens when hunger drives it to try biting a Steel-type Pokémon.
539.name: golbat

540.text: They can suck down over 10 ounces of blood in one go. They have been known to drink so much blood that they can no longer fly.
540.name: golbat

541.text: It attacks in a stealthy manner, without warning. Its sharp fangs are used to bite and to suck blood.
541.name: golbat

542.text: It loves to drink other creatures’ blood. It’s said that if it finds others of its kind going hungry, it sometimes shares the blood it’s gathered.
542.name: golbat

543.text: Its feet are tiny, but this Pokémon walks skillfully. It sneaks up on sleeping prey before sinking in its fangs and slurping up blood.
