543.name: golbat

544.text: It sinks its sharp fangs into other creatures and slurps up their blood. A closer look at the fangs reveals that they are hollow and akin to straws.
544.name: golbat

545.text: During the daytime, ODDISH buries itself in soil to absorb nutrients from  the ground using its entire body. The more fertile the soil, the glossier its leaves become.
545.name: oddish

546.text: ODDISH searches for fertile, nutrient- rich soil, then plants itself. During the daytime, while it is planted, this POKéMON’s feet are thought to change shape and become similar to the roots of trees.
546.name: oddish

547.text: This POKéMON grows by absorbing moonlight. During the daytime, it buries itself in the ground, leaving only its leaves exposed to avoid detection by its enemies.
547.name: oddish

548.text: During the day, it keeps its face buried in the ground. At night, it wanders around sowing its seeds.
548.name: oddish

549.text: Awakened by moonlight, it roams actively at night. In the day, it stays quietly underground.
549.name: oddish

550.text: It often plants its root feet in the ground during the day and sows seeds as it walks about at night.
550.name: oddish

551.text: Its scientific name is “Oddium Wanderus.” At night, it is said to walk nearly 1,000 feet on its two roots.
551.name: oddish

552.text: During the daytime, Oddish buries itself in soil to absorb nutrients from the ground using its entire body. The more fertile the soil, the glossier its leaves become.
552.name: oddish

553.text: Oddish searches for fertile, nutrient-rich soil, then plants itself. During the daytime, while it is planted, this Pokémon’s feet are thought to change shape and become similar to the roots of trees.
553.name: oddish

554.text: It may be mistaken for a clump of weeds. If you try to yank it out of the ground, it shrieks horribly.
554.name: oddish

555.text: If exposed to moonlight, it starts to move. It roams far and wide at night to scatter its seeds.
555.name: oddish

556.text: During the day, it stays in the cold underground to avoid the sun. It grows by bathing in moonlight.
556.name: oddish

557.text: The smell from its drool-like syrup and the pollen on its petals is so bad, it may make opponents faint.
557.name: gloom

558.text: A horribly noxious honey drools from its mouth. One whiff of the honey can result in memory loss. Some fans are said to enjoy this overwhelming stink, however.
558.name: gloom

559.text: The fluid that oozes from its mouth isn’t drool. It is a nectar that is used to attract prey.
559.name: gloom

560.text: It secretes a sticky, drool-like honey. Although sweet, it smells too repulsive to get very close.
560.name: gloom

561.text: The honey it drools from its mouth smells so atrocious, it can curl noses more than a mile away.
561.name: gloom

562.text: Gloom releases a foul fragrance from the pistil of its flower. When faced with danger, the stench worsens. If this Pokémon is feeling calm and secure, it does not release its usual stinky aroma.
562.name: gloom

563.text: From its mouth Gloom drips honey that smells absolutely horrible. Apparently, it loves the horrid stench. It sniffs the noxious fumes and then drools even more of its honey.
563.name: gloom

564.text: Smells incredibly foul! However, around one out of a thousand people enjoy sniffing its nose-bending stink.
564.name: gloom

565.text: Its pistils exude an incredibly foul odor. The horrid stench can cause fainting at a distance of 1.25 miles.
565.name: gloom

566.text: What appears to be drool is actually sweet honey. It is very sticky and clings stubbornly if touched.
566.name: gloom

567.text: By shaking its big petals, it scat­ ters toxic pollen into the air, turning the air yellow.
567.name: vileplume

568.text: In seasons when it produces more pollen, the air around a VILEPLUME turns yellow with the powder as it walks. The pollen is highly toxic and causes paralysis.
568.name: vileplume

569.text: The bud bursts into bloom with a bang. It then starts scattering allergenic, poisonous pollen.
569.name: vileplume

570.text: Its petals are the largest in the world. As it walks, it scatters extremely allergenic pollen.
570.name: vileplume

571.text: It has the world’s largest petals. With every step, the petals shake out heavy clouds of toxic pollen.
571.name: vileplume

572.text: Vileplume’s toxic pollen triggers atrocious allergy attacks. That’s why it is advisable never to approach any attractive flowers in a jungle, however pretty they may be.
572.name: vileplume

573.text: Vileplume has the world’s largest petals. They are used to attract prey that are then doused with toxic spores. Once the prey are immobilized, this Pokémon catches and devours them.
573.name: vileplume

574.text: Flaps its broad flower petals to scatter its poisonous pollen. The flapping sound is very loud.
574.name: vileplume

575.text: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.
575.name: vileplume

576.text: The tochukaso growing on this POKéMON's back orders it to extract juice from tree trunks.
576.name: paras

577.text: A PARAS has parasitic tochukaso mushrooms growing on its back. They grow by drawing nutrients from the host. They are valued as a medicine for long life.
577.name: paras

578.text: Burrows to suck tree roots. The mushrooms on its back grow by drawing nutrients from the bug host.
578.name: paras

579.text: It is doused with mushroom spores when it is born. As its body grows, mushrooms sprout from its back.
579.name: paras

580.text: As its body grows, large mushrooms named tochukaso start sprouting out of its back.
580.name: paras

581.text: Mushrooms named tochukaso grow on its back. They grow along with the host Paras.
581.name: paras

582.text: Growing out of the bug’s back are mushrooms called tochukaso. The mushrooms grow with the bug host.
582.name: paras

583.text: Paras has parasitic mushrooms growing on its back called tochukaso. They grow large by drawing nutrients from this Bug Pokémon host. They are highly valued as a medicine for extending life.
583.name: paras

584.text: No matter how much it eats, the mushrooms growing on its back steal away most of the nutrients it consumes.
584.name: paras

585.text: Mushrooms called tochukaso sprout from its back. They can be dried and powdered to make a medicine used to extend life.
585.name: paras

586.text: Whether it’s due to a lack of moisture or a lack of nutrients, in Alola the mushrooms on Paras don’t grow up quite right.
586.name: paras

587.text: The mushrooms, known as tochukaso, are controlling the bug. Even if the bug bugs the mushrooms, they tell it to bug off.
587.name: paras

588.text: Burrows under the ground to gnaw on tree roots. The mushrooms on its back absorb most of the nutrition.
588.name: paras

589.text: Sometimes seen at the foot of trees in humid forests. The mushrooms on its back—called tochukaso—are not present on infant specimens and instead emerge as Paras matures.
589.name: paras

590.text: When nothing's left to extract from the bug, the mushrooms on its back leave spores on the bug's egg.
590.name: parasect

591.text: PARASECT are known to infest the roots of large trees en masse and drain nutrients. When an infested tree dies, they move onto another tree all at once.
591.name: parasect

592.text: It scatters toxic spores from the mushroom cap. In China, the spores are used as herbal medicine.
592.name: parasect

593.text: A host-parasite pair in which the parasite mushroom has taken over the host bug. Prefers damp places.
593.name: parasect

594.text: It is controlled by a mushroom grown larger than the bug body. It is said to prefer damp places.
594.name: parasect

595.text: It stays mostly in dark, damp places, the preference not of the bug, but of the big mushroom on its back.
595.name: parasect

596.text: A mushroom grown larger than the host’s body controls Parasect. It scatters poisonous spores.
596.name: parasect

597.text: The larger the mushroom on its back grows, the stronger the mushroom spores it scatters.
597.name: parasect

598.text: Parasect is known to infest large trees en masse and drain nutrients from the lower trunk and roots. When an infested tree dies, they move onto another tree all at once.
598.name: parasect

599.text: The large mushroom on its back controls it. It often fights over territory with Shiinotic.
599.name: parasect

600.text: It scatters toxic spores from its mushroom cap. Once harvested, these spores can be steeped and boiled down to prepare herbal medicines.
600.name: parasect

601.text: The bug is mostly dead, with the mushroom on its back having become the main body. If the mushroom comes off, the bug stops moving.
601.name: parasect

602.text: Its poisonous spores are also used in traditional medicine. Apparently, spores produced in Alola are not of very good quality.
602.name: parasect

603.text: The bug host is drained of energy by the mushroom on its back. The mushroom appears to do all the thinking.
603.name: parasect

604.text: Mushroom-lacking specimens of this Pokémon lie unmoving in the forest, lending credence to the hypothesis that the large mushroom is in control of Parasect's actions.
604.name: parasect

605.text: The small bugs it eats appear only at night, so it sleeps in a hole in a tree until night falls.
605.name: venonat

606.text: Its coat of thin, stiff hair that covers its entire body is said to have evolved for protection. Its large eyes never fail to spot even miniscule prey.
606.name: venonat

607.text: Its eyes act as radar, enabling it to be active in darkness. The eyes can also shoot powerful beams.
607.name: venonat

608.text: Its eyes also function as radar units. It catches and eats small bugs that hide in darkness.
608.name: venonat

609.text: Poison oozes from all over its body. It catches and eats small bugs at night that are attracted by light.
609.name: venonat

610.text: Its big eyes are actually clusters of tiny eyes. At night, its kind is drawn by light.
610.name: venonat

611.text: Lives in the shadows of tall trees where it eats bugs. It is attracted by light at night.
611.name: venonat

612.text: Venonat is said to have evolved with a coat of thin, stiff hair that covers its entire body for protection. It possesses large eyes that never fail to spot even minuscule prey.
612.name: venonat

613.text: Its large eyes act as radar. In a bright place, you can see that they are clusters of many tiny eyes.
613.name: venonat

614.text: The dust-like scales covering its wings are color coded to indicate the kinds of poison it has.
614.name: venomoth

615.text: VENOMOTH are nocturnal--they only are active at night. Their favorite prey are insects that gather around streetlights, attracted by the light in the darkness.
615.name: venomoth

616.text: When it attacks, it flaps its large wings violently to scatter its poisonous powder all around.
616.name: venomoth

617.text: The powder on its wings is poisonous if it is dark in hue. If it is light in hue, it causes paralysis.
617.name: venomoth

618.text: It flutters its wings to scatter dustlike scales. The scales leach toxins if they contact skin.
618.name: venomoth

619.text: The scales it scatters will paralyze anyone who touches them, making that person unable to stand.
619.name: venomoth

620.text: The wings are covered with dustlike scales. Every time it flaps its wings, it looses highly toxic dust.
620.name: venomoth

621.text: Venomoth is nocturnal—it is a Pokémon that only becomes active at night. Its favorite prey are small insects that gather around streetlights, attracted by the light in the darkness.
621.name: venomoth

622.text: The powdery scales on its wings are hard to remove from skin. They also contain poison that leaks out on contact.
622.name: venomoth

623.text: It digs under­ ground and chews on tree roots, sticking its head out only when the sun isn't bright.
623.name: diglett

624.text: DIGLETT are raised in most farms. The reason is simple - wherever this POKéMON burrows, the soil is left perfectly tilled for planting crops. This soil is made ideal for growing delicious vegetables.
624.name: diglett

625.text: DIGLETT are raised in most farms. The reason is simple--wherever they burrow, the soil is left perfectly tilled for growing delicious crops.
625.name: diglett

626.text: If a DIGLETT digs through a field, it leaves the soil perfectly tilled and ideal for planting crops.
626.name: diglett

627.text: A Pokémon that lives underground. Because of its dark habitat, it is repelled by bright sunlight.
627.name: diglett

628.text: Lives about one yard underground where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears aboveground.
628.name: diglett

629.text: Its skin is very thin. If it is exposed to light, its blood heats up, causing it to grow weak.
629.name: diglett

630.text: Diglett are raised in most farms. The reason is simple— wherever this Pokémon burrows, the soil is left perfectly tilled for planting crops. This soil is made ideal for growing delicious vegetables.
630.name: diglett

631.text: It chews on plant roots underground. Farmers whose vegetables are vulnerable find it can be quite a pest.
631.name: diglett

632.text: Many farmers cherish and nurture Diglett because its droppings enrich the soil it lives in.
632.name: diglett

633.text: It travels through tunnels that it digs underground. It hates sunlight, so it comes out only after the sun goes down.
633.name: diglett

634.text: Around their crops, farmers plant the kind of tree that Diglett like to eat as a way of getting Diglett to plow the fields for them.
634.name: diglett

635.text: It prefers dark places. It spends most of its time underground, though it may pop up in caves.
635.name: diglett

636.text: If a Diglett digs through a field, it leaves the soil perfectly tilled and ideal for planting crops.
636.name: diglett

637.text: It burrows through the ground at a shallow depth. It leaves raised earth in its wake, making it easy to spot.
637.name: diglett

638.text: A team of triplets that can burrow over 60 MPH. Due to this, some people think it's an earthquake.
638.name: dugtrio

639.text: Because the triplets originally split from one body, they think exactly alike. They work cooperatively to burrow endlessly through the ground.
639.name: dugtrio

640.text: A team of DIGLETT triplets. It triggers huge earthquakes by burrowing 60 miles underground.
640.name: dugtrio

641.text: Its three heads bob separately up and down to loosen the soil nearby, making it easier for it to burrow.
641.name: dugtrio

642.text: Its three heads move alternately, driving it through tough soil to depths of over 60 miles.
642.name: dugtrio

643.text: In battle, it digs through the ground and strikes the unsuspecting foe from an unexpected direction.
643.name: dugtrio

644.text: Extremely powerful, they can dig through even the hardest ground to a depth of over 60 miles.
644.name: dugtrio

645.text: Dugtrio are actually triplets that emerged from one body. As a result, each triplet thinks exactly like the other two triplets. They work cooperatively to burrow endlessly.
645.name: dugtrio

646.text: This set of triplets moves cooperatively. It’s the power of teamwork that enables this Pokémon to dig to a depth of 60 miles.
646.name: dugtrio

647.text: Despite the closeness between this Pokémon and farmers and other people, no one has ever seen the parts of it concealed underground.
647.name: dugtrio

648.text: While the three of them normally get along splendidly, on rare occasions a huge fight will break out over which head gets to eat first.
648.name: dugtrio

649.text: Dugtrio’s heads are sleek and smooth and incredibly hard. It can dig through any soil with its headbutts.
649.name: dugtrio

650.text: A team of triplets that can burrow to a depth of 60 miles. It’s reported that this triggers an earthquake.
650.name: dugtrio

651.text: A team of Diglett triplets. It triggers huge earthquakes by burrowing 60 miles underground.
651.name: dugtrio

652.text: These Diglett triplets dig over 60 miles below sea level. No one knows what it’s like underground.
652.name: dugtrio

653.text: It washes its face regularly to keep the coin on its forehead spotless. It doesn’t get along with Galarian Meowth.
653.name: meowth

654.text: It loves things that sparkle. When it sees a shiny object, the gold coin on its head shines too.
654.name: meowth

655.text: All it does is sleep during the daytime. At night, it patrols its territory with its eyes aglow.
655.name: meowth

656.text: It is fascinated by round objects. It can’t stop playing with them until it tires and falls asleep.
656.name: meowth

657.text: It loves anything that shines. It especially adores coins that it picks up and secretly hoards.
657.name: meowth

658.text: It is nocturnal in nature. If it spots something shiny, its eyes glitter brightly.
658.name: meowth

659.text: Adores round objects. It wanders the streets on a nightly basis to look for dropped loose change.
659.name: meowth

660.text: Meowth withdraws its sharp claws into its paws to slinkily sneak about without making any incriminating footsteps. For some reason, this Pokémon loves shiny coins that glitter with light.
660.name: meowth

661.text: It lies around all day, becoming active near dusk. At night, it wanders the city in search of loose change.
661.name: meowth

662.text: It loves shiny things. It often fights with Murkrow over prey they’re both trying to catch.
662.name: meowth

663.text: When visiting a junkyard, you may catch sight of it having an intense fight with Murkrow over shiny objects.
663.name: meowth

664.text: It loves coins, so if you give it one, you can make friends with Meowth easily. But it’s fickle, so you can’t count on that friendship lasting.
664.name: meowth

665.text: Appears to be more active at night. It loves round and shiny things. It can’t stop itself from picking them up.
665.name: meowth

666.text: It loves to collect shiny things. If it’s in a good mood, it might even let its Trainer have a look at its hoard of treasures.
666.name: meowth

667.text: Behind its lithe, elegant appearance lies a barbaric side. It will tear apart its prey on a mere whim.
667.name: persian

668.text: A PERSIAN’s six bold whiskers sense air movements to determine what is in its vicinity. It becomes docile if grabbed by the whiskers.
668.name: persian

669.text: Has a vicious temperament. Beware if it raises its tail straight up. It is a signal that it is about to pounce and bite.
669.name: persian

670.text: Many adore it for its sophisticated air. However, it will lash out and scratch for little reason.
670.name: persian

671.text: A very haughty Pokémon. Among fans, the size of the jewel in its forehead is a topic of much talk.
671.name: persian

672.text: Although its fur has many admirers, it is tough to raise as a pet because of its fickle meanness.
672.name: persian

673.text: Its lithe muscles allow it to walk without making a sound. It attacks in an instant.
673.name: persian

674.text: Persian has six bold whiskers that give it a look of toughness. The whiskers sense air movements to determine what is in the Pokémon’s surrounding vicinity. It becomes docile if grabbed by the whiskers.
674.name: persian

675.text: It has a violent temperament. It will attack anything that looks it in the eye. Its sharp claws inflict deep wounds.
675.name: persian

676.text: It has a high opinion of itself, although not to the same extent as the Alolan Persian. It’s quite difficult to make friends with this Pokémon.
676.name: persian

677.text: Although the jewel on its forehead appears to be a different color than those of Alolan Persian, it’s mostly made of the same material.
677.name: persian

678.text: This Pokémon is popular with rich people. It’s also targeted by hunters who are after the jewel in its forehead.
678.name: persian

679.text: The gem in its forehead glows on its own! It walks with all the grace and elegance of a proud queen.
679.name: persian

680.text: Getting this prideful Pokémon to warm up to you takes a lot of effort, and it will claw at you the moment it gets annoyed.
680.name: persian

681.text: Its elegant and refined behavior clashes with that of the barbaric Perrserker. The relationship between the two is one of mutual disdain.
681.name: persian

682.text: The only time it can use its psy­ chic power is when its sleeping brain cells happen to wake.
682.name: psyduck

683.text: When its headache intensifies, it starts using strange powers. However, it has no recollection of its powers, so it always looks befuddled and bewildered.
683.name: psyduck

684.text: While lulling its enemies with its vacant look, this wily POKéMON will use psychokinetic powers.
684.name: psyduck

685.text: If its usual headache worsens, it starts exhibiting odd powers. It can’t remember doing so, however.
685.name: psyduck

686.text: It never remembers using its odd powers, so it always tilts its head in puzzlement.
686.name: psyduck

687.text: If its chronic headache peaks, it may exhibit odd powers. It seems unable to recall such an episode.
687.name: psyduck

688.text: Overwhelmed by enigmatic abilities, it suffers a constant headache. It sometimes uses mysterious powers.
688.name: psyduck

689.text: When headaches stimulate its brain cells, which are usually inactive, it can use a mysterious power.
689.name: psyduck

690.text: It is constantly wracked by a headache. When the headache turns intense, it begins using mysterious powers.
690.name: psyduck

691.text: It has mystical powers but doesn’t recall that it has used them. That is why it always looks puzzled.
691.name: psyduck

692.text: Psyduck uses a mysterious power. When it does so, this Pokémon generates brain waves that are supposedly only seen in sleepers. This discovery spurred controversy among scholars.
692.name: psyduck

693.text: If it uses its mysterious power, Psyduck can’t remember having done so. It apparently can’t form a memory of such an event because it goes into an altered state that is much like deep sleep.
693.name: psyduck

694.text: As a result of headaches so fierce they cause it to cry, it sometimes uses psychokinesis without meaning to.
694.name: psyduck

695.text: This Pokémon is troubled by constant headaches. The more pain it’s in, the more powerful its psychokinesis becomes.
695.name: psyduck

696.text: Using psychokinesis gives it a headache, so it normally passes the time spacing out and doing as little as possible.
696.name: psyduck

697.text: It has been found that its brain cells are 10 times more active when Psyduck is experiencing a headache.
697.name: psyduck

698.text: Always tormented by headaches. It uses psychic powers, but whether it intends to do so is not known.
698.name: psyduck

699.text: Psyduck is constantly beset by headaches. If the Pokémon lets its strange power erupt, apparently the pain subsides for a while.
699.name: psyduck

700.text: As Psyduck gets stressed out, its headache gets progressively worse. It uses intense psychic energy to overwhelm those around it.
700.name: psyduck

701.text: Suffers perpetual headaches. If the agony grows too great, Psyduck's latent power erupts, contrary to Psyduck's intent. Ergo, I am exploring ways to ease the pain.
701.name: psyduck

702.text: It swims grace­ fully along on the quiet, slow-moving rivers and lakes of which it is so fond.
702.name: golduck

703.text: GOLDUCK is the fastest swimmer among all POKéMON. It swims effortlessly, even in a rough, stormy sea. It sometimes rescues people from wrecked ships floundering in high seas.
703.name: golduck

704.text: A GOLDUCK is an adept swimmer. It sometimes joins competitive swimmers in training. It uses psychic powers when its forehead shimmers with light.
704.name: golduck

705.text: Often seen swimming elegantly by lakeshores. It is often mistaken for the Japanese monster Kappa.
705.name: golduck

706.text: A Pokémon that lives in lakes. It swims faster than any human swimming champion.
706.name: golduck

707.text: The flippers of its well-developed limbs give it shocking speed. It is the best swimmer among Pokémon.
707.name: golduck

708.text: When it swims at full speed using its long, webbed limbs, its forehead somehow begins to glow.
708.name: golduck

709.text: It is seen swimming dynamically and elegantly using its well-developed limbs and flippers.
709.name: golduck

710.text: When its forehead shines mysteriously, Golduck can use the full extent of its power.
710.name: golduck

711.text: It appears by waterways at dusk. It may use telekinetic powers if its forehead glows mysteriously.
711.name: golduck

712.text: The forelegs are webbed, helping to make it an adept swimmer. It can be seen swimming elegantly in lakes, etc.
712.name: golduck

713.text: The webbed flippers on its forelegs and hind legs and the streamlined body of Golduck give it frightening speed. This Pokémon is definitely much faster than even the most athletic swimmer.
713.name: golduck

714.text: Golduck is the fastest swimmer among all Pokémon. It swims effortlessly, even in a rough, stormy sea. It sometimes rescues people from wrecked ships floundering in high seas.
714.name: golduck

715.text: It is said that the red part of its forehead grants supernatural powers to those who possess one, so it was over-hunted in the past.
715.name: golduck

716.text: It swims along the banks of lakes and catches fish Pokémon. It takes them to the shore and quietly eats them up.
716.name: golduck

717.text: Even fast-swimming fish Pokémon can be disabled by Golduck. It brings them to a standstill and seizes them.
717.name: golduck

718.text: A professional swimmer, it can continue swimming for two days straight by waving its long tail skillfully.
718.name: golduck

719.text: Its long, slim limbs end in broad flippers. They are used for swimming gracefully in lakes.
719.name: golduck

720.text: This Pokémon lives in gently flowing rivers. It paddles through the water with its long limbs, putting its graceful swimming skills on display.
720.name: golduck

721.text: Old tales tell of Golduck punishing those that defiled its river. The guilty were dragged into the water and taken away.
721.name: golduck

722.text: Its body is strong, and it has webbing on its hands and feet. Golduck can swim easily through rough seas, clawing its way through the high waves.
722.name: golduck

723.text: It lives in groups in the treetops. If it loses sight of its group, it becomes infuriated by its loneliness.
723.name: mankey

724.text: When it starts shaking and its nasal breathing turns rough, it’s a sure sign of anger. However, since this happens instantly, there is no time to flee.
724.name: mankey

725.text: Light and agile on its feet, and ferocious in temperament. When angered, it flies into an uncontrollable frenzy.
725.name: mankey

726.text: Extremely quick to anger. It could be docile one moment, then thrashing away  the next instant.
726.name: mankey

727.text: It is extremely ill-tempered. Groups of them will attack any handy target for no reason.
727.name: mankey

728.text: It’s unsafe to approach if it gets violently enraged for no reason and can’t distinguish friends from foes.
728.name: mankey

729.text: It lives in treetop colonies. If one becomes enraged, the whole colony rampages for no reason.
729.name: mankey

730.text: When Mankey starts shaking and its nasal breathing turns rough, it’s a sure sign that it is becoming angry. However, because it goes into a towering rage almost instantly, it is impossible for anyone to flee its wrath.
730.name: mankey

731.text: It can spontaneously become enraged. Everyone near it clears out as it rampages, and the resulting loneliness makes it angrier still.
731.name: mankey

732.text: Its raging tires it out and causes it to fall asleep, but the anger resonating in its dreams causes it to wake up—which infuriates it all over again.
732.name: mankey

733.text: The smallest of things could cause it to lose its temper. Because it doesn’t hold in its stress, this Pokémon can live a long time.
733.name: mankey

734.text: If one gets angry, all the others around it will get angry, so silence is a rare visitor in a troop of Mankey.
734.name: mankey

735.text: An agile Pokémon that lives in trees. It angers easily and will not hesitate to attack anything.
735.name: mankey

736.text: It will beat up anyone who makes it mad, even if it has to chase them until the end of the world.
736.name: primeape

737.text: When it becomes furious, its blood circulation becomes more robust, and its muscles are made stronger. But it also becomes much less intelligent.
737.name: primeape

738.text: Always furious and tenacious to boot. It will not abandon chasing its quarry until it catches up.
738.name: primeape

739.text: If approached while asleep, it may awaken and angrily give chase in a groggy state of semi-sleep.
739.name: primeape

740.text: It becomes wildly furious if it even senses someone looking at it. It chases anyone that meets its glare.
740.name: primeape

741.text: It grows angry if you see its eyes and gets angrier if you run. If you beat it, it gets even madder.
741.name: primeape

742.text: It is always outrageously furious. If it gives chase, it will tenaciously track the target no matter how far.
742.name: primeape

743.text: When Primeape becomes furious, its blood circulation is boosted. In turn, its muscles are made even stronger. However, it also becomes much less intelligent at the same time.
743.name: primeape

744.text: It has been known to become so angry that it dies as a result. Its face looks peaceful in death, however.
744.name: primeape

745.text: Some researchers theorize that Primeape remains angry even when inside a Poké Ball.
745.name: primeape

746.text: It will never forgive opponents who have angered it. Even after it has beaten them down until they can’t move, it never ever forgives.
746.name: primeape

747.text: The blood vessels in its brain are sturdier than those of other Pokémon, so it can stay healthy despite its constant raging.
747.name: primeape

748.text: It stops being angry only when nobody else is around. To view this moment is very difficult.
748.name: primeape

749.text: It controls a big territory. If it detects an unknown smell, it roars loudly to force out the intruder.
749.name: growlithe

750.text: GROWLITHE has a superb sense of smell. Once it smells anything, this POKéMON won’t forget the scent, no matter what. It uses its advanced olfactory sense to determine the emotions of other living things.
750.name: growlithe

751.text: Its superb sense of smell ensures that this POKéMON won’t forget any scent, no matter what. It uses its sense of smell to detect the emotions of others.
751.name: growlithe

752.text: It is very protective of its territory. It will bark and bite to repel intruders from its space.
752.name: growlithe

753.text: A Pokémon with a loyal nature. It will remain motionless until it is given an order by its Trainer.
753.name: growlithe

754.text: Extremely loyal to its Trainer, it will bark at those who approach the Trainer unexpectedly and run them out of town.
754.name: growlithe

755.text: Very friendly and faithful to people. It will try to repel enemies by barking and biting.
755.name: growlithe

756.text: Growlithe has a superb sense of smell. Once it smells anything, this Pokémon won’t forget the scent, no matter what. It uses its advanced olfactory sense to determine the emotions of other living things.
756.name: growlithe

757.text: It’s both clever and loyal, but if a stranger tries to invade its territory, it barks threateningly.
757.name: growlithe

758.text: It looks cute, but when you approach another Trainer’s Growlithe, it will bark at you and bite.
758.name: growlithe

759.text: While it’s quite friendly toward humans once it’s grown used to them, in the wild it must be quite fierce to defend its territory from Rockruff.
759.name: growlithe

760.text: It has lived alongside humans since ages ago. Its bones have been found in excavations of ruins from the Stone Age.
760.name: growlithe

761.text: A Pokémon with a friendly nature. However, it will bark fiercely at anything invading its territory.
761.name: growlithe

762.text: It has a brave and trustworthy nature. It fearlessly stands up to bigger and stronger foes.
762.name: growlithe

763.text: Extremely loyal, it will fearlessly bark at any opponent to protect its own Trainer from harm.
763.name: growlithe

764.text: They patrol their territory in pairs. I believe the igneous rock components in the fur of this species are the result of volcanic activity in its habitat.
764.name: growlithe

765.text: A legendary POKé­ MON in China. Many people are charmed by its grace and beauty while running.
765.name: arcanine

766.text: An ancient picture scroll shows that people were attracted to its movement as it ran through prairies.
766.name: arcanine

767.text: ARCANINE is known for its high speed. It is said to be capable of running over 6,200 miles in a single day and night. The fire that blazes wildly within this POKéMON’s body is its source of power.
767.name: arcanine

768.text: This fleet-footed POKéMON is said to run over 6,200 miles in a single day and night. The fire that blazes wildly within its body is its source of power.
768.name: arcanine

769.text: A POKéMON that is described in Chinese legends. It is said to race at an unbelievable speed.
769.name: arcanine

770.text: This legendary Chinese Pokémon is considered magnificent. Many people are enchanted by its grand mane.
770.name: arcanine

771.text: Its proud and regal appearance has captured the hearts of people since long ago.
771.name: arcanine

772.text: Its magnificent bark conveys a sense of majesty. Anyone hearing it can’t help but grovel before it.
772.name: arcanine

773.text: Arcanine is known for its high speed. It is said to be capable of running over 6,200 miles in a single day and night. The fire that blazes wildly within this Pokémon’s body is its source of power.
773.name: arcanine

774.text: Overflowing with beauty and majesty, this strong Pokémon appears in ancient Eastern folklore.
774.name: arcanine

775.text: The fire burning inside its body serves as the energy to fuel it as it runs great distances. It appears in many legends.
775.name: arcanine

776.text: Legends tell of its fighting alongside a general and conquering a whole country.
776.name: arcanine

777.text: There are so many old tales about them that they’re called legendary Pokémon, but there are way more of them around than you’d expect.
777.name: arcanine

778.text: A legendary Pokémon in the East. Many people are charmed by the grace and beauty of its running.
778.name: arcanine

779.text: The sight of it running over 6,200 miles in a single day and night has captivated many people.
779.name: arcanine

780.text: A Pokémon that has long been admired for its beauty. It runs agilely as if on wings.
780.name: arcanine

781.text: Snaps at its foes with fangs cloaked in blazing flame. Despite its bulk, it deftly feints every which way, leading opponents on a deceptively merry chase as it all but dances around them.
781.name: arcanine

782.text: The swirl on its belly is its insides showing through the skin. It looks clearer after it eats.
782.name: poliwag

783.text: It is possible to see this POKéMON’s spiral innards right through its thin skin. However, the skin is also very flexible. Even sharp fangs bounce right off it.
783.name: poliwag

784.text: Its newly grown legs prevent it from walking well. It appears to prefer swimming over walking.
784.name: poliwag

785.text: Because it is inept at walking on its newly grown legs, it always  swims around in water.
785.name: poliwag

786.text: The direction of its belly spiral differs by area. The equator is thought to have an effect on this.
786.name: poliwag

787.text: Its skin is so thin, its internal organs are visible. It has trouble walking on its newly grown feet.
787.name: poliwag

788.text: Its slick black skin is thin and damp. A part of its internal organs can be seen through the skin as a spiral pattern.
788.name: poliwag

789.text: Poliwag has a very thin skin. It is possible to see the Pokémon’s spiral innards right through the skin. Despite its thinness, however, the skin is also very flexible. Even sharp fangs bounce right off it.
789.name: poliwag

790.text: The swirl on its belly is its internal organs showing through. If the swirl is tinged white, that means it’s affected by some disease.
790.name: poliwag

791.text: It’s still not very good at walking. Its Trainers should train this Pokémon to walk every day.
791.name: poliwag

792.text: Despite the danger, it wants to come up on land. So it does its best to waddle along, but when an enemy finds it, it rushes back to the water.
792.name: poliwag

793.text: The direction of the swirl on their stomachs differs depending on where they live. Poliwag aficionados can tell them apart at a glance.
793.name: poliwag

794.text: The direction of the spiral on the belly differs by area. It is more adept at swimming than walking.
794.name: poliwag

795.text: For Poliwag, swimming is easier than walking. The swirl pattern on its belly is actually part of the Pokémon’s innards showing through the skin.
795.name: poliwag

796.text: In rivers with fast-flowing water, this Pokémon will cling to a rock by using its thick lips, which act like a suction cup.
796.name: poliwag

797.text: Capable of living in or out of water. When out of water, it sweats to keep its body slimy.
797.name: poliwhirl

798.text: Though it is skilled at walk­ ing, it prefers to live underwater where there is less danger.
798.name: poliwhirl

799.text: Its body surface is always wet and slick with an oily fluid. Because of this greasy covering, it can easily slip and slide out of the clutches of any enemy in battle.
799.name: poliwhirl

800.text: The swirl on its belly subtly undulates. Staring at it may gradually cause drowsiness.
800.name: poliwhirl

801.text: The skin on most of its body is moist. However, the skin on its belly spiral feels smooth.
801.name: poliwhirl

802.text: The spiral pattern on its belly subtly undulates. Staring at it gradually causes drowsiness.
802.name: poliwhirl

803.text: It can live in or out of water. When out of water, it constantly sweats to keep its body slimy.
803.name: poliwhirl

804.text: Its two legs are well developed. Even though it can live on the ground, it prefers living in water.
804.name: poliwhirl

805.text: The surface of Poliwhirl’s body is always wet and slick with a slimy fluid. Because of this slippery covering, it can easily slip and slide out of the clutches of any enemy in battle.
805.name: poliwhirl

806.text: Although it can live on land, it prefers to stay in the water, where it has fewer natural enemies.
806.name: poliwhirl

807.text: It marches over the land in search of bug Pokémon to eat. Then it takes them underwater so it can dine on them where it’s safe.
807.name: poliwhirl

808.text: Although it has become capable of living on land, it spends its time in the water, where its prey, fish Pokémon, are plentiful.
808.name: poliwhirl

809.text: Its health suffers when its skin dries out, so be sure to moisturize it diligently.
809.name: poliwhirl

810.text: Under attack, it uses its belly spiral to put the foe to sleep. It then makes its escape.
810.name: poliwhirl

811.text: Staring at the swirl on its belly causes drowsiness. This trait of Poliwhirl’s has been used in place of lullabies to get children to go to sleep.
811.name: poliwhirl

812.text: This Pokémon’s sweat is a slimy mucus. When captured, Poliwhirl can slither from its enemies’ grasp and escape.
812.name: poliwhirl

813.text: It can use its well-developed arms and legs to run on the surface of the water for a split second.
813.name: poliwrath

814.text: POLIWRATH’s highly developed, brawny muscles never grow fatigued, however much it exercises. It is so tirelessly strong, this POKéMON can swim back and forth across the Pacific Ocean without effort.
814.name: poliwrath

815.text: Its highly developed muscles never grow fatigued, however much it exercises. This POKéMON can swim back and forth across the Pacific Ocean without effort.
815.name: poliwrath

816.text: An adept swimmer, it knows the front crawl, butterfly, and more. It is faster than the best human swimmers.
816.name: poliwrath

817.text: This strong and skilled swimmer is even capable of crossing the Pacific Ocean just by kicking.
817.name: poliwrath

818.text: Although an energetic, skilled swimmer that uses all of its muscles, it lives on dry land.
818.name: poliwrath

819.text: With its extremely tough muscles, it can keep swimming in the Pacific Ocean without resting.
819.name: poliwrath

820.text: A swimmer adept at both the front crawl and breaststroke. Easily overtakes the best human swimmers.
820.name: poliwrath

821.text: Poliwrath’s highly developed, brawny muscles never grow fatigued, however much it exercises. It is so tirelessly strong, this Pokémon can swim back and forth across the ocean without effort.
821.name: poliwrath

822.text: Poliwrath in the Alola region are strong swimmers that use the breaststroke. Many children learn to swim by imitating Poliwrath.
822.name: poliwrath

823.text: Its percentage of body fat is nearly zero. Its body is entirely muscle, which makes it heavy and forces its swimming prowess to develop.
823.name: poliwrath

824.text: It’s quite a gifted swimmer, even among Water-type Pokémon, but it normally spends its time on land.
824.name: poliwrath

825.text: The muscles it has developed through swimming are thick and powerful. When it lands a square punch, it can turn huge boulders to dust.
825.name: poliwrath

826.text: Swims powerfully using all the muscles in its body. It can even overtake world-class swimmers.
826.name: poliwrath

827.text: Its body is solid muscle. When swimming through cold seas, Poliwrath uses its impressive arms to smash through drift ice and plow forward.
827.name: poliwrath

828.text: Poliwrath is skilled at both swimming and martial arts. It uses its well-trained arms to dish out powerful punches.
828.name: poliwrath

829.text: It hypnotizes itself so that it can teleport away when it senses danger, even if it is asleep.
829.name: abra

830.text: ABRA sleeps for eighteen hours a day. However, it can sense the presence of foes even while it is sleeping. In such a situation, this POKéMON immediately teleports to safety.
830.name: abra

831.text: A POKéMON that sleeps 18 hours a day. Observation revealed that it uses TELEPORT to change its location once every hour.
831.name: abra

832.text: Using its ability to read minds, it will sense impending danger and TELEPORT to safety.
832.name: abra

833.text: It sleeps for 18 hours a day. Even when awake, it teleports itself while remaining seated.
833.name: abra

834.text: Even while asleep, it maintains a telepathic radar. It teleports when it is threatened.
834.name: abra

835.text: If it decides to teleport randomly, it evokes the illusion that it has created copies of itself.
835.name: abra

836.text: Using its psychic power is such a strain on its brain that it needs to sleep for 18 hours a day.
836.name: abra

837.text: It sleeps for 18 hours a day. It uses a variety of extrasensory powers even while asleep.
837.name: abra

838.text: It senses impending attacks and teleports away to safety before the actual attacks can strike.
838.name: abra

839.text: Abra sleeps for eighteen hours a day. However, it can sense the presence of foes even while it is sleeping. In such a situation, this Pokémon immediately teleports to safety.
839.name: abra

840.text: Abra needs to sleep for eighteen hours a day. If it doesn’t, this Pokémon loses its ability to use telekinetic powers. If it is attacked, Abra escapes using Teleport while it is still sleeping.
840.name: abra

841.text: It sleeps 18 hours a day. Even while sleeping, it will teleport itself to treetops and pick and eat berries there.
841.name: abra

842.text: It can teleport itself to safety while it’s asleep, but when it wakes, it doesn’t know where it is, so it panics.
842.name: abra

843.text: It uses various psychic powers even while it’s sleeping, so you can’t tell whether or not it’s awake.
843.name: abra

844.text: It can read others’ minds and will teleport away when danger approaches. You must clear your mind if you want to catch it.
844.name: abra

845.text: Sleeps 18 hours a day. If it senses danger, it will teleport itself to safety even as it sleeps.
845.name: abra

846.text: This Pokémon uses its psychic powers while it sleeps. The contents of Abra’s dreams affect the powers that the Pokémon wields.
846.name: abra

847.text: Abra can teleport in its sleep. Apparently the more deeply Abra sleeps, the farther its teleportations go.
847.name: abra

848.text: Spends 18 hours of the day sleeping. Even while asleep, Abra can control its psychic powers—should danger approach, the Pokémon will simply teleport away.
848.name: abra

849.text: When it closes its eyes, twice as many alpha parti­ cles come out of the surface of its body.
849.name: kadabra

850.text: KADABRA emits a peculiar alpha wave if it develops a headache. Only those people with a particularly strong psyche can hope to become a TRAINER of this POKéMON.
850.name: kadabra

851.text: It is rumored that a boy with psychic abilities suddenly transformed into KADABRA while he was assisting research into extrasensory powers.
851.name: kadabra

852.text: It happened one morning - a boy with extrasensory powers awoke in bed transformed into KADABRA.
852.name: kadabra

853.text: It emits special alpha waves from its body that induce headaches just by being close.
853.name: kadabra

854.text: If one is nearby, an eerie shadow appears on TV screens. Seeing the shadow is said to bring bad luck.
854.name: kadabra

855.text: It possesses strong spiritual power. The more danger it faces, the stronger its psychic power.
855.name: kadabra

856.text: It stares at its silver spoon to focus its mind. It emits more alpha waves while doing so.
856.name: kadabra

857.text: When it uses its psychic power, it emits strong alpha waves that can ruin precision devices.
857.name: kadabra

858.text: If it uses its abilities, it emits special alpha waves that cause machines to malfunction.
858.name: kadabra

859.text: Kadabra emits a peculiar alpha wave if it develops a headache. Only those people with a particularly strong psyche can hope to become a Trainer of this Pokémon.
859.name: kadabra

860.text: Kadabra holds a silver spoon in its hand. The spoon is used to amplify the alpha waves in its brain. Without the spoon, the Pokémon is said to be limited to half the usual amount of its telekinetic powers.
860.name: kadabra

861.text: A theory exists that this Pokémon was a young boy who couldn’t control his psychic powers and ended up transformed into this Pokémon.
861.name: kadabra

862.text: Kadabra’s presence infests televisions and monitors with creepy shadows that bring bad luck.
862.name: kadabra

863.text: It stares at a silver spoon to amplify its psychic powers before it lets loose. Apparently, gold spoons are no good.
863.name: kadabra

864.text: It possesses strong mental capabilities, but its psychic powers are halved when it’s not holding a silver spoon.
864.name: kadabra

865.text: Many odd things happen if this Pokémon is close by. For example, it makes clocks run backward.
865.name: kadabra

866.text: Using its psychic power, Kadabra levitates as it sleeps. It uses its springy tail as a pillow.
866.name: kadabra

867.text: This Pokémon’s telekinesis is immensely powerful. To prepare for evolution, Kadabra stores up psychic energy in the star on its forehead.
867.name: kadabra

868.text: There are rumors that a child with mystical powers became a Kadabra; however, this remains unverified. I suspect that the spoon Kadabra holds enhances its brain waves.
868.name: kadabra

869.text: It has an IQ of 5000. It calcu­ lates many things in order to gain the edge in every battle.
869.name: alakazam

870.text: While it has strong psychic abilities and high intelligence, an ALAKAZAM’s muscles are very weak. It uses psychic power to move its body.
870.name: alakazam

871.text: It does not like physical attacks very  much. Instead, it freely uses extra­ sensory powers to defeat foes.
871.name: alakazam

872.text: Its superb memory lets it recall everything it has experienced from birth. Its IQ exceeds 5,000.
872.name: alakazam

873.text: Its highly developed brain is on par with a supercomputer. It can use all forms of psychic abilities.
873.name: alakazam

874.text: Closing both its eyes heightens all its other senses. This enables it to use its abilities to their extremes.
874.name: alakazam

875.text: The spoons clutched in its hands are said to have been created by its psychic powers.
875.name: alakazam

876.text: Its brain cells multiply continually until it dies. As a result, it remembers everything.
876.name: alakazam

877.text: Its brain can outperform a supercomputer. Its IQ (intelligence quotient) is said to be around 5,000.
877.name: alakazam

878.text: Alakazam’s brain continually grows, making its head far too heavy to support with its neck. This Pokémon holds its head up using its psychokinetic power instead.
878.name: alakazam

879.text: Alakazam’s brain continually grows, infinitely multiplying brain cells. This amazing brain gives this Pokémon an astoundingly high IQ of 5,000. It has a thorough memory of everything that has occurred in the world.
879.name: alakazam

880.text: It is said to have an IQ of approximately 5,000. Its overflowing psychokinetic powers cause headaches to anyone nearby.
880.name: alakazam

881.text: Its brain cells continue to increase in number until its death. The older the Alakazam, the larger its head.
881.name: alakazam

882.text: Alakazam uses its psychic powers to make the spoons it carries. Each spoon is an original that there’s only one of in the whole world.
882.name: alakazam

883.text: If it trusts someone deeply, it will let them have one of its spoons. Anything you eat with that spoon is apparently delicious.
883.name: alakazam

884.text: A Pokémon that can memorize anything. It never forgets what it learns—that’s why this Pokémon is smart.
884.name: alakazam

885.text: It has an incredibly high level of intelligence. Some say that Alakazam remembers everything that ever happens to it, from birth till death.
885.name: alakazam

886.text: Alakazam wields potent psychic powers. It’s said that this Pokémon used these powers to create the spoons it holds.
886.name: alakazam

887.text: The longer Alakazam lives, the larger and heavier its head becomes. Our tests have shown that the strength of its psychic powers correlates positively to the weight of its head.
887.name: alakazam

888.text: It trains by lifting rocks in the mountains. It can even pick up a GRAVELER with ease.
888.name: machop

889.text: MACHOP exercises by hefting around a GRAVELER as if it were a barbell. There are some MACHOP that travel the world in a quest to master all kinds of martial arts.
889.name: machop

890.text: It continually undertakes strenuous training to master all forms of martial arts. Its strength lets it easily hoist a sumo wrestler onto its shoulders.
890.name: machop

891.text: Loves to build its muscles. It trains in all styles of martial arts to become even stronger.
891.name: machop

892.text: Its muscles never cramp however much it trains. It lives in the mountains away from humans.
892.name: machop

893.text: Though small in stature, it is powerful enough to easily heft and throw a number of GEODUDE at once.
893.name: machop

894.text: It loves to work out and build its muscles. It is never satisfied, even if it trains hard all day long.
894.name: machop

895.text: Though small in stature, it is powerful enough to easily heft and throw a number of Geodude at once.
895.name: machop

896.text: It hefts a Graveler repeatedly to strengthen its entire body. It uses every type of martial arts.
896.name: machop

897.text: Machop’s muscles are special—they never get sore no matter how much they are used in exercise. This Pokémon has sufficient power to hurl a hundred adult humans.
897.name: machop

898.text: Machop exercises by hefting around a Graveler as if it were a barbell. There are some Machop that travel the world in a quest to master all kinds of martial arts.
898.name: machop

899.text: It loves working out. As it gazes at its muscles, which continue to swell day by day, it becomes more and more dedicated to its training.
899.name: machop

900.text: With its superhuman strength, it’s able to throw a hundred people all at the same time. Its strength comes from lifting Graveler every day.
900.name: machop

901.text: Once this Pokémon has gained enough confidence and muscle from training with its friends, it challenges Makuhita to a battle.
901.name: machop

902.text: It likes food that’s highly nutritious because its instincts drive it to build muscle efficiently.
902.name: machop

903.text: Very powerful in spite of its small size. Its mastery of many types of martial arts makes it very tough.
903.name: machop

904.text: Its whole body is composed of muscles. Even though it’s the size of a human child, it can hurl 100 grown-ups.
904.name: machop

905.text: Always brimming with power, it passes time by lifting boulders. Doing so makes it even stronger.
905.name: machop

906.text: Though as small as a child, it has strength enough to easily throw a well-built adult. Striving to become ever stronger, Machop trains by carrying a Graveler on its shoulders.
906.name: machop

907.text: This tough POKéMON always stays in the zone. Its muscles become thicker after every battle.
907.name: machoke

908.text: A belt is worn by a MACHOKE to keep its overwhelming power under control. Because it is so dangerous, no one has ever removed the belt.
908.name: machoke

909.text: MACHOKE’s boundless power is very dangerous, so it wears a belt that suppresses its energy.
909.name: machoke

910.text: It always goes at its full power, but this very tough and durable Pokémon never gets tired.
910.name: machoke

911.text: The muscles covering its body teem with power. Even when still, it exudes an amazing sense of strength.
911.name: machoke

912.text: It happily carries heavy cargo to toughen up. It willingly does hard work for people.
912.name: machoke

913.text: It can lift a dump truck with one hand. Using that power, it helps people with heavy jobs.
913.name: machoke

914.text: Machoke’s thoroughly toned muscles possess the hardness of steel. This Pokémon has so much strength, it can easily hold aloft a sumo wrestler on just one finger.
914.name: machoke

915.text: Machoke undertakes bodybuilding every day even as it helps people with tough, physically demanding labor. On its days off, this Pokémon heads to the fields and mountains to exercise and train.
915.name: machoke

916.text: As a result of its continual workouts, it has developed tremendous power. It uses that power to help people with their work.
916.name: machoke

917.text: It willingly assists with hard labor because it knows the work is good training for its muscles.
917.name: machoke

918.text: When it encounters an enemy that’s truly mighty, this Pokémon removes the power-save belt from its waist and unleashes its full power.
918.name: machoke

919.text: A popular motif for sculptures, its incredibly well-developed muscles have captured the imagination of many an artist.
919.name: machoke

920.text: The belt around its waist holds back its energy. Without it, this Pokémon would be unstoppable.
920.name: machoke

921.text: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power-save belt to be able to regulate its motions.
921.name: machoke

922.text: Its formidable body never gets tired. It helps people by doing work such as the moving of heavy goods.
922.name: machoke

923.text: A sturdy creature boasting a robust physique and boundless stamina. Loves training above all else and voluntarily assists with tasks such as construction and clearing land.
923.name: machoke

924.text: Using its heavy muscles, it throws powerful punches that can send the victim clear over the horizon.
924.name: machamp

925.text: It is impossible to defend against punches and chops doled out by its four arms. Its fighting spirit flares up when it faces a tough opponent.
925.name: machamp

926.text: Its superpowerful punches are said to knock the victim flying clear over the horizon.
926.name: machamp

927.text: It punches with its four arms at blinding speed. It can launch 1,000 punches in two seconds.
927.name: machamp

928.text: It can knock a train flying with a punch. However, it is terrible at delicate work using its fingers.
928.name: machamp

929.text: Its four muscled arms slam foes with powerful punches and chops at blinding speed.
929.name: machamp

930.text: Its four ruggedly developed arms can launch a flurry of 1,000 punches in just two seconds.
930.name: machamp

931.text: It uses its four powerful arms to pin the limbs of its foe, then throws the victim over the horizon.
931.name: machamp

932.text: Machamp has the power to hurl anything aside. However, trying to do any work requiring care and dexterity causes its arms to get tangled. This Pokémon tends to leap into action before it thinks.
932.name: machamp

933.text: Machamp is known as the Pokémon that has mastered every kind of martial arts. If it grabs hold of the foe with its four arms, the battle is all but over. The hapless foe is thrown far over the horizon.
933.name: machamp

934.text: It unleashes megaton-level punches that send opponents flying clear over the horizon.
934.name: machamp

935.text: It can lift heavy loads with the greatest of ease. It can even heft dump trucks. But its clumsy fingers prevent it from doing any precision work.
935.name: machamp

936.text: It grasps its opponents with its four arms and twists them up in an intricate hold. People call it “the Machamp special.”
936.name: machamp

937.text: With four arms, it can attack and defend simultaneously. It’s said to have mastered every martial art in the world.
937.name: machamp

938.text: One arm alone can move mountains. Using all four arms, this Pokémon fires off awesome punches.
938.name: machamp

939.text: It quickly swings its four arms to rock its opponents with ceaseless punches and chops from all angles.
939.name: machamp

940.text: With four arms that react more quickly than it can think, it can execute many punches at once.
940.name: machamp

941.text: In close combat, its four arms afford it offensive and defensive supremacy. In but a blink, this valiant Pokémon can overwhelm its foes with more than 1,000 blows from its fists.
941.name: machamp

942.text: If it notices anything that moves, it immediately flings its vine at the object.
942.name: bellsprout

943.text: BELLSPROUT’s thin and flexible body lets it bend and sway to avoid any attack, however strong it may be. From its mouth, this POKéMON spits a corrosive fluid that melts even iron.
943.name: bellsprout

944.text: A BELLSPROUT’s thin and flexible body lets it bend and sway to avoid any attack, however strong it may be. From its mouth, it leaks a fluid that melts even iron.
944.name: bellsprout

945.text: A carnivorous POKéMON that traps and eats bugs. It appears to use its root feet to replenish moisture.
945.name: bellsprout

946.text: It plants its feet deep underground to replenish water. It can’t escape its enemy while it’s rooted.
946.name: bellsprout

947.text: It prefers hot and humid environments. It is quick at capturing prey with its vines.
947.name: bellsprout

948.text: Even though its body is extremely skinny, it is blindingly fast when catching its prey.
948.name: bellsprout

949.text: Its bud looks like a human face. Because of the bud, it is rumored to be a type of legendary mandrake plant.
949.name: bellsprout

950.text: Bellsprout’s thin and flexible body lets it bend and sway to avoid any attack, however strong it may be. From its mouth, this Pokémon spits a corrosive fluid that melts even iron.
950.name: bellsprout

951.text: Prefers hot and humid places. It ensnares tiny bugs with its vines and devours them.
951.name: bellsprout

952.text: Even though it is filled with ACID, it does not melt because it also oozes a neutral­ izing fluid.
952.name: weepinbell

953.text: When it's hungry, it swings its razor-sharp leaves, slicing up any unlucky object nearby for food.
953.name: weepinbell

954.text: WEEPINBELL has a large hook on its rear end. At night, the POKéMON hooks on to a tree branch and goes to sleep. If it moves around in its sleep, it may wake up to find itself on the ground.
954.name: weepinbell

955.text: At night, a WEEPINBELL hangs on to a tree branch with its hooked rear and sleeps. If it moves around in its sleep, it may wake up to find itself on the ground.
955.name: weepinbell

956.text: Even though it is filled with acid, it does not melt because it also oozes a protective fluid.
956.name: weepinbell

957.text: If its prey is bigger than its mouth, it slices up the victim with sharp leaves, then eats every morsel.
957.name: weepinbell

958.text: A Pokémon that appears to be a plant. It captures unwary prey by dousing them with a toxic powder.
958.name: weepinbell

959.text: The leafy parts act as cutters for slashing foes. It spits a fluid that dissolves everything.
959.name: weepinbell

960.text: It spits out Poison Powder to immobilize the enemy and then finishes it with a spray of Acid.
960.name: weepinbell

961.text: Weepinbell has a large hook on its rear end. At night, the Pokémon hooks on to a tree branch and goes to sleep. If it moves around in its sleep, it may wake up to find itself on the ground.
961.name: weepinbell

962.text: When hungry, it swallows anything that moves. Its hapless prey is dissolved by strong acids.
962.name: weepinbell

963.text: The long vine extending from its head is waved about as if it were a living thing to attract prey. When an unsuspecting victim approaches, it is swallowed whole.
963.name: victreebel

964.text: Lures prey into its mouth with a honeylike aroma. The helpless prey is melted with a dissolving fluid.
964.name: victreebel

965.text: Acid that has dissolved many prey becomes sweeter, making it even more effective at attracting prey.
965.name: victreebel

966.text: This horrifying plant Pokémon attracts prey with aromatic honey, then melts them in its mouth.
966.name: victreebel

967.text: It pools in its mouth a fluid with a honey-like scent, which is really an acid that dissolves anything.
967.name: victreebel

968.text: Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles, although no one has ever returned from there.
968.name: victreebel

969.text: Once ingested into this Pokémon’s body, even the hardest object will melt into nothing.
969.name: victreebel

970.text: Victreebel has a long vine that extends from its head. This vine is waved and flicked about as if it were an animal to attract prey. When an unsuspecting prey draws near, this Pokémon swallows it whole.
970.name: victreebel

971.text: Lures prey with the sweet aroma of honey. Swallowed whole, the prey is dissolved in a day, bones and all.
971.name: victreebel

972.text: As it floats along on the waves, it uses its toxic feelers to stab anything it touches.
972.name: tentacool

973.text: TENTACOOL absorbs sunlight and refracts it using water inside its body to convert it into beam energy. This POKéMON shoots beams from its crystal-like eyes.
973.name: tentacool

974.text: Its body is almost entirely composed of water. It ensnares its foe with its two long tentacles, then stabs with the poison stingers at their tips.
974.name: tentacool

975.text: Its eyes are as transparent as crystals. From them, it shoots mysterious beams of light.
975.name: tentacool

976.text: It drifts in sea currents. Countless fishermen are hurt by its poison stingers.
976.name: tentacool

977.text: When the tide goes out, dehydrated TENTACOOL remains can be found washed up on the shore.
977.name: tentacool

978.text: It drifts aimlessly in waves. Very difficult to see in water, it may not be noticed until it stings.
978.name: tentacool

979.text: Because its body is almost entirely composed of water, it shrivels up if it is washed ashore.
979.name: tentacool

980.text: Its body is virtually composed of water. It shoots strange beams from its crystal-like eyes.
980.name: tentacool

981.text: Drifts in shallow seas. Anglers who hook them by accident are often punished by their stingers.
981.name: tentacool

982.text: Tentacool’s body is largely composed of water. If it is removed from the sea, it dries up like parchment. If this Pokémon happens to become dehydrated, put it back into the sea.
982.name: tentacool

983.text: Tentacool absorbs sunlight and refracts it using water inside its body to convert it into beam energy. This Pokémon shoots beams from the small round organ above its eyes.
983.name: tentacool

984.text: They can be found lying dehydrated on beaches, but they are often still alive. When soaked in water, they will revive.
984.name: tentacool

985.text: It drifts in shallow seas, such as the areas near beaches. If you get bitten or stabbed by its toxic tentacles, rush to the hospital.
985.name: tentacool

986.text: It drifts through the sea searching for prey. Its poisonous tentacles break off sometimes, but after a while, they grow back.
986.name: tentacool

987.text: Its body is 99% water. The remaining 1% contains the organ that makes its poison.
987.name: tentacool

988.text: It can sometimes be found all dry and shriveled up on a beach. Toss it back into the sea to revive it.
988.name: tentacool

989.text: Tentacool is not a particularly strong swimmer. It drifts across the surface of shallow seas as it searches for prey.
989.name: tentacool

990.text: This Pokémon is mostly made of water. A Tentacool out in the ocean is very hard to spot, because its body blends in with the sea.
990.name: tentacool

991.text: They fire beams from the glassy, magenta orbs that resemble eyes atop their heads, and they drift in shallow seas. During low tide, they can sometimes be found on beaches, desiccated.
991.name: tentacool

992.text: When its 80 feel­ ers absorb water, it stretches to become like a net to entangle its prey.
992.name: tentacruel

993.text: It lives in complex rock formations on the ocean floor and traps prey using its 80 tentacles. Its red orbs glow when it grows excited or agitated.
993.name: tentacruel

994.text: With 80 tentacles for ensnaring victims, it prevents escape until the prey is weakened by poison.
994.name: tentacruel

995.text: It alerts others to danger by stridently flashing the red orbs on its head.
995.name: tentacruel

996.text: Its 80 tentacles absorb water and stretch almost endlessly to constrict its prey and enemies.
996.name: tentacruel

997.text: In battle, it extends all 80 of its tentacles to entrap its opponent inside a poisonous net.
997.name: tentacruel

998.text: It extends its 80 tentacles to form an encircling poisonous net that is difficult to escape.
998.name: tentacruel

999.text: The tentacles are normally kept short. On hunts, they are extended to ensnare and immobilize prey.
999.name: tentacruel

1000.text: It has 80 tentacles that move about freely. They can sting, causing poisoning and sharp, stabbing pain.
1000.name: tentacruel

1001.text: Tentacruel has large red orbs on its head. The orbs glow before lashing the vicinity with a harsh ultrasonic blast. This Pokémon’s outburst creates rough waves around it.
1001.name: tentacruel

1002.text: Tentacruel has tentacles that can be freely elongated and shortened at will. It ensnares prey with its tentacles and weakens the prey by dosing it with a harsh toxin. It can catch up to 80 prey at the same time.
1002.name: tentacruel

1003.text: Normally, it has 80 poisonous tentacles. The longer one has been alive, the fewer tentacles it will have.
1003.name: tentacruel

1004.text: Although these Pokémon are rare, when a large outbreak of them occurs, all fish Pokémon disappear from the surrounding sea.
1004.name: tentacruel

1005.text: It fires off ultrasonic waves from its red orbs to weaken its prey, and then it wraps them up in its 80 tentacles.
1005.name: tentacruel

1006.text: It communicates with others of its kind by lighting up the red orbs on its head. When the orbs are blinking, it’s a warning sign.
1006.name: tentacruel

1007.text: Its 80 tentacles can stretch and contract freely. They wrap around prey and weaken it with poison.
1007.name: tentacruel

1008.text: When the red orbs on Tentacruel’s head glow brightly, watch out. The Pokémon is about to fire off a burst of ultrasonic waves.
1008.name: tentacruel

1009.text: Its 80 tentacles can stretch and shrink freely. Tentacruel ensnares prey in a net of spread-out tentacles, delivering venomous stings to its catch.
1009.name: tentacruel

1010.text: It has 80 tentacles, each with a venomous tip. These tentacles are also extendible, lengthening when Tentacruel attempts to catch prey. Use caution.
1010.name: tentacruel

1011.text: Proud of their sturdy bodies, they bash against each other in a contest to prove whose is harder.
1011.name: geodude

1012.text: The longer a GEODUDE lives, the more its edges are chipped and worn away, making it more rounded in appearance. However, this POKéMON’s heart will remain hard, craggy, and rough always.
1012.name: geodude

1013.text: When GEODUDE sleeps deeply, it buries itself halfway into the ground. It will not awaken even if hikers step on it unwittingly. In the morning, this POKéMON rolls downhill in search of food.
1013.name: geodude

1014.text: It climbs mountain paths using only the power of its arms. Because they look just like boulders lining paths, hikers may step on them without noticing.
1014.name: geodude

1015.text: Its round form makes it easy to pick up. Some people have used them to hurl at each other in a snowball fight.
1015.name: geodude

1016.text: Many live on mountain trails and remain half buried while keeping an eye on climbers.
1016.name: geodude

1017.text: Most people may not notice, but a closer look should reveal that there are many GEODUDE around.
1017.name: geodude

1018.text: It uses its arms to steadily climb steep mountain paths. It swings its fists around if angered.
1018.name: geodude

1019.text: At rest, it looks just like a rock. Carelessly stepping on it will make it swing its fists angrily.
1019.name: geodude

1020.text: Found in fields and mountains. Mistaking them for boulders, people often step or trip on them.
1020.name: geodude

1021.text: It is impossible to distinguish from rocks. It slams against others in contests of hardness.
1021.name: geodude

1022.text: The longer a Geodude lives, the more its edges are chipped and worn away, making it more rounded in appearance. However, this Pokémon’s heart will remain hard, craggy, and rough always.
1022.name: geodude

1023.text: When Geodude sleeps deeply, it buries itself halfway into the ground. It will not awaken even if hikers step on it unwittingly. In the morning, this Pokémon rolls downhill in search of food.
1023.name: geodude

1024.text: Its round body makes it easy to pick up, but it is hard and heavy. It’s dangerous to play with them as if they were snowballs.
1024.name: geodude

1025.text: There are plenty of them to be found along any road. A scholar with too much free time once counted a hundred of them along a single route.
1025.name: geodude

1026.text: Geodude that have lived a long life have had all their edges smoothed out until they’re totally round. They also have a calm, quiet disposition.
1026.name: geodude

1027.text: It uses both hands to climb precipitous cliffs. People who see it in action have been known to take up bouldering.
1027.name: geodude

1028.text: Commonly found near mountain trails and the like. If you step on one by accident, it gets angry.
1028.name: geodude

1029.text: Makes its home in mountainous regions, using its arms to climb along harsh mountain roads. Can be troublesome—carelessly kicking one will cause it to fly into a rage and chase after you.
1029.name: geodude

1030.text: It travels by rol­ ling on mountain paths. If it gains too much speed, it stops by running into huge rocks.
1030.name: graveler

1031.text: They descend from mountains by tumbling down steep slopes. They are so brutal, they smash aside obstructing trees and massive boulders with thunderous tackles.
1031.name: graveler

1032.text: Be careful while hiking on mountain trails. GRAVELER may come rolling down the path without slowing.
1032.name: graveler

1033.text: GRAVELER make their homes on sheer cliff faces by gouging out numerous horizontal holes.
1033.name: graveler

1034.text: It tumbles down slopes, heedless of any body parts chipping off. It eats a ton of rocks daily.
1034.name: graveler

1035.text: A slow walker, it rolls to move. It pays no attention to any object that happens to be in its path.
1035.name: graveler

1036.text: It rolls on mountain paths to move. Once it builds momentum, no Pokémon can stop it without difficulty.
1036.name: graveler

1037.text: With a free and uncaring nature, it doesn’t mind if pieces break off while it rolls down mountains.
1037.name: graveler

1038.text: Rolls down slopes to move. It rolls over any obstacle without slowing or changing its direction.
1038.name: graveler

1039.text: Graveler grows by feeding on rocks. Apparently, it prefers to eat rocks that are covered in moss. This Pokémon eats its way through a ton of rocks on a daily basis.
1039.name: graveler

1040.text: Rocks are Graveler’s favorite food. This Pokémon will climb a mountain from the base to the summit, crunchingly feasting on rocks all the while. Upon reaching the peak, it rolls back down to the bottom.
1040.name: graveler

1041.text: Mossy rocks are its favorite food. It can devour a ton a day while crunching loudly.
1041.name: graveler

1042.text: This slow-footed Pokémon moves by curling up and rolling instead of walking. With enough momentum, its speed can exceed 60 mph.
1042.name: graveler

1043.text: It climbs up cliffs as it heads toward the peak of a mountain. As soon as it reaches the summit, it rolls back down the way it came.
1043.name: graveler

1044.text: It travels by rolling down cliffs. If it falls into a river, it will explode with its last gasp.
1044.name: graveler

1045.text: Often seen rolling down mountain trails. Obstacles are just things to roll straight over, not avoid.
1045.name: graveler

1046.text: Dwells in holes dug into sheer walls of stone. It enjoys rolling down slopes as though it were a boulder during a rockfall, so keep an eye upward while traversing mountain roads.
1046.name: graveler

1047.text: Its rock-like body is so durable, even high-powered dynamite blasts fail to scratch its rugged hide.
1047.name: golem

1048.text: GOLEM live up on mountains. If there is a large earthquake, these POKéMON will come rolling down off the mountains en masse to the foothills below.
1048.name: golem

1049.text: GOLEM is known for rolling down from mountains. To prevent them from rolling into the homes of people downhill, grooves have been dug into the sides of mountains to serve as guideways for diverting this POKéMON’s course.
1049.name: golem

1050.text: It is said to live in volcanic craters on mountain peaks. Once a year, it sheds its hide and grows larger. The shed hide crumbles and returns to the soil.
1050.name: golem

1051.text: It is enclosed in a hard shell that is as rugged as slabs of rock. It sheds skin once a year to grow larger.
1051.name: golem

1052.text: Its boulder-like body is extremely hard. It can easily withstand dynamite blasts without taking damage.
1052.name: golem

1053.text: It sheds its skin once a year. The discarded shell immediately hardens and crumbles away.
1053.name: golem

1054.text: It is capable of blowing itself up. It uses this explosive force to jump from mountain to mountain.
1054.name: golem

1055.text: It tumbles down mountains, leaving grooves from peak to base. Stay clear of these grooves.
1055.name: golem

1056.text: Even dynamite can’t harm its hard, boulder-like body. It sheds its hide just once a year.
1056.name: golem

1057.text: Golem live up on mountains. If there is a large earthquake, these Pokémon will come rolling down off the mountains en masse to the foothills below.
1057.name: golem

1058.text: Golem is known for rolling down from mountains. To prevent them from rolling into the homes of people downhill, grooves have been dug into the sides of mountains to serve as guideways for diverting this Pokémon’s course.
1058.name: golem

1059.text: Its body can survive dynamite blasts without a single scratch, but it hates rain and humidity.
1059.name: golem

1060.text: Once a year, this Pokémon molts, and its shed shell returns to the soil. This process creates enriched soil, so farmers collect the shells.
1060.name: golem

1061.text: When Golem grow old, they stop shedding their shells. Those that have lived a long, long time have shells green with moss.
1061.name: golem

1062.text: It detonates its own body. The power from that explosion can propel it up steep mountain paths with amazing speed.
1062.name: golem

1063.text: Once it sheds its skin, its body turns tender and whitish. Its hide hardens when it’s exposed to air.
1063.name: golem

1064.text: The rocklike shell is shed each year. The cast-off shell then crumbles, reverting to a mass of soil, which can be spread across fields to promote crop growth.
1064.name: golem

1065.text: Training by jumping over grass that grows longer every day has made it a world-class jumper.
1065.name: ponyta

1066.text: Its body is light, and its legs are incredibly powerful. It can clear Ayers Rock in one leap.
1066.name: ponyta

1067.text: Its hooves are ten times harder than diamond. It can trample anything completely flat in little time.
1067.name: ponyta

1068.text: About an hour after birth, its fiery mane and tail grow out, giving it an impressive appearance.
1068.name: ponyta

1069.text: It is a weak runner immediately after birth. It gradually becomes faster by chasing after its parents.
1069.name: ponyta

1070.text: Its hind legs, which have hooves that are harder than diamond, kick back at any presence it senses behind it.
1070.name: ponyta

1071.text: As a newborn, it can barely stand. However, through galloping, its legs are made tougher and faster.
1071.name: ponyta

1072.text: Its legs grow strong while it chases after its parent. It runs in fields and mountains all day.
1072.name: ponyta

1073.text: Ponyta is very weak at birth. It can barely stand up. This Pokémon becomes stronger by stumbling and falling to keep up with its parent.
1073.name: ponyta

1074.text: Capable of jumping incredibly high. Its hooves and sturdy legs absorb the impact of a hard landing.
1074.name: ponyta

1075.text: It can’t run properly when it’s newly born. As it races around with others of its kind, its legs grow stronger.
1075.name: ponyta

1076.text: If you’ve been accepted by Ponyta, its burning mane is mysteriously no longer hot to the touch.
1076.name: ponyta

1077.text: These Pokémon live in herds out in the grassland. Newborn foals lack their fiery manes, which will develop about an hour after birth.
1077.name: ponyta

1078.text: It just loves to gallop. The faster it goes, the long­ er the swaying flames of its mane will become.
1078.name: rapidash
