1079.text: It usually canters casually in the fields and plains. But once a RAPIDASH turns serious, its fiery manes flare and blaze as it gallops its way up to 150 mph.
1079.name: rapidash

1080.text: It can gallop at a top speed of 150 miles per hour. It can race as fast as a bullet train while ablaze.
1080.name: rapidash

1081.text: It has astounding acceleration. From a standstill, it can reach top speed within 10 steps.
1081.name: rapidash

1082.text: At full gallop, its four hooves barely touch the ground because it moves so incredibly fast.
1082.name: rapidash

1083.text: With incredible acceleration, it reaches its top speed of 150 mph after running just 10 steps.
1083.name: rapidash

1084.text: When at an all-out gallop, its blazing mane sparkles, enhancing its beautiful appearance.
1084.name: rapidash

1085.text: Very competitive, this Pokémon will chase anything that moves fast in the hopes of racing it.
1085.name: rapidash

1086.text: It gallops at nearly 150 mph. With its mane blazing ferociously, it races as if it were an arrow.
1086.name: rapidash

1087.text: Rapidash usually can be seen casually cantering in the fields and plains. However, when this Pokémon turns serious, its fiery manes flare and blaze as it gallops its way up to 150 mph.
1087.name: rapidash

1088.text: Just loves to run. If it sees something faster than itself, it will give chase at top speed.
1088.name: rapidash

1089.text: This Pokémon can be seen galloping through fields at speeds of up to 150 mph, its fiery mane fluttering in the wind.
1089.name: rapidash

1090.text: The fastest runner becomes the leader, and it decides the herd’s pace and direction of travel.
1090.name: rapidash

1091.text: Fiery mane aglow, Rapidash darts like an arrow across the land. This prodigiously swift creature can traverse the vast region of Hisui in a day and a half.
1091.name: rapidash

1092.text: It is always so absent-minded that it won't react, even if its flavorful tail is bitten.
1092.name: slowpoke

1093.text: SLOWPOKE uses its tail to catch prey by dipping it in water at the side of a river. However, this POKéMON often forgets what it’s doing and often spends entire days just loafing at water’s edge.
1093.name: slowpoke

1094.text: It catches prey by dipping its tail in water at the side of a river. But it often forgets what it is doing and spends entire days just loafing at water’s edge.
1094.name: slowpoke

1095.text: Incredibly slow and dopey. It takes five seconds for it to feel pain when under attack.
1095.name: slowpoke

1096.text: A sweet sap leaks from its tail’s tip. Although not nutritious, the tail is pleasant to chew on.
1096.name: slowpoke

1097.text: Although slow, it is skilled at fishing with its tail. It does not feel pain if its tail is bitten.
1097.name: slowpoke

1098.text: It is always vacantly lost in thought, but no one knows what it is thinking about. It is good at fishing with its tail.
1098.name: slowpoke

1099.text: It lazes vacantly near water. If something bites its tail, it won’t even notice for a whole day.
1099.name: slowpoke

1100.text: Slowpoke uses its tail to catch prey by dipping it in water at the side of a river. However, this Pokémon often forgets what it’s doing and often spends entire days just loafing at water’s edge.
1100.name: slowpoke

1101.text: Its long tail often breaks off. It doesn’t really feel any pain, though, and the tail grows back, so Slowpoke isn’t particularly bothered.
1101.name: slowpoke

1102.text: Alolan home cooking involves drying Slowpoke tails and then simmering them into a salty stew.
1102.name: slowpoke

1103.text: There are some places where Slowpoke is worshiped because of a long-standing belief that whenever Slowpoke yawns, it rains.
1103.name: slowpoke

1104.text: Although their tails, which fall off naturally, can easily be found lying around, they’re a precious ingredient for cooking.
1104.name: slowpoke

1105.text: Incredibly slow and sluggish. It is quite content to loll about without worrying about the time.
1105.name: slowpoke

1106.text: Slow-witted and oblivious, this Pokémon won’t feel any pain if its tail gets eaten. It won’t notice when its tail grows back, either.
1106.name: slowpoke

1107.text: When this Pokémon’s tail is soaked in water, sweetness seeps from it. Slowpoke uses this trait to lure in and fish up other Pokémon.
1107.name: slowpoke

1108.text: Lives lazily by the sea. If the SHELLDER on its tail comes off, it becomes a SLOWPOKE again.
1108.name: slowbro

1109.text: An attached SHELLDER won't let go because of the tasty flavor that oozes out of its tail.
1109.name: slowbro

1110.text: SLOWBRO’s tail has a SHELLDER firmly attached with a bite. As a result, the tail can’t be used for fishing anymore. This causes SLOWBRO to grudgingly swim and catch prey instead.
1110.name: slowbro

1111.text: Its tail has a SHELLDER firmly attached with a bite. As a result, the tail can’t be used for fishing anymore. This forces it to reluctantly swim and catch prey.
1111.name: slowbro

1112.text: When a SLOWPOKE went hunting in the sea, its tail was bitten by a SHELLDER. That made it evolve into SLOWBRO.
1112.name: slowbro

1113.text: The SHELLDER that latches onto SLOWPOKE’s tail is said to feed on the host’s leftover scraps.
1113.name: slowbro

1114.text: Though usually dim witted, it seems to become inspired if the SHELLDER on its tail bites down.
1114.name: slowbro

1115.text: If the tail-biting SHELLDER is thrown off in a harsh battle, it reverts to being an ordinary SLOWPOKE.
1115.name: slowbro

1116.text: Naturally dull to begin with, it lost its ability to feel pain due to SHELLDER’s seeping poison.
1116.name: slowbro

1117.text: Though usually dim witted, it seems to become inspired if the Shellder on its tail bites down.
1117.name: slowbro

1118.text: An attached Shellder won’t let go because of the tasty flavor that oozes out of its tail.
1118.name: slowbro

1119.text: When a Slowpoke went hunting in the sea, its tail was bitten by a Shellder. That made it evolve into Slowbro.
1119.name: slowbro

1120.text: Slowbro’s tail has a Shellder firmly attached with a bite. As a result, the tail can’t be used for fishing anymore. This causes Slowbro to grudgingly swim and catch prey instead.
1120.name: slowbro

1121.text: It spaces out while gazing at the sea. With Shellder’s poison flowing through its body, it becomes even spacier.
1121.name: slowbro

1122.text: Whenever Shellder bites down hard on its tail, it gives Slowbro a flash of inspiration...which it forgets a moment later.
1122.name: slowbro

1123.text: Spacing out is basically all it does. It turns back into Slowpoke if its tail, along with Shellder, breaks off.
1123.name: slowbro

1124.text: Shellder, in its greed to suck out more and more sweetness from Slowbro’s tail, has metamorphosed into a spiral-shaped shell.
1124.name: slowbro

1125.text: Lives lazily by the sea. If the Shellder on its tail comes off, it becomes a Slowpoke again.
1125.name: slowbro

1126.text: Slowpoke became Slowbro when a Shellder bit on to its tail. Sweet flavors seeping from the tail make the Shellder feel as if its life is a dream.
1126.name: slowbro

1127.text: Being bitten by a Shellder shocked this Pokémon into standing on two legs. If the Shellder lets go, it seems Slowbro will turn back into a Slowpoke.
1127.name: slowbro

1128.text: It is born with the ability to defy gravity. It floats in air on powerful electro­ magnetic waves.
1128.name: magnemite

1129.text: The electricity emitted by the units on each side of its body cause it to become a strong magnet.
1129.name: magnemite

1130.text: MAGNEMITE attaches itself to power lines to feed on electricity. If your house has a power outage, check your circuit breakers. You may find a large number of this POKéMON clinging to the breaker box.
1130.name: magnemite

1131.text: MAGNEMITE floats in the air by emitting electromagnetic waves from the units at its sides. These waves block gravity. This POKéMON becomes incapable of flight if its internal electrical supply is depleted.
1131.name: magnemite

1132.text: The units at its sides are extremely powerful magnets. They generate enough magnetism to draw in iron objects from over 300 feet away.
1132.name: magnemite

1133.text: Uses antigravity to stay suspended. Appears without warning and uses THUNDER WAVE and similar moves.
1133.name: magnemite

1134.text: The units at its sides generate electromagnetic waves that keep it airborne. It feeds on electricity.
1134.name: magnemite

1135.text: It is attracted by electromagnetic waves. It may approach Trainers if they are using their Pokégear.
1135.name: magnemite

1136.text: The faster the units at its sides rotate, the greater the magnetic force they generate.
1136.name: magnemite

1137.text: The electromagnetic waves emitted by the units at the sides of its head expel antigravity, which allows it to float.
1137.name: magnemite

1138.text: The units at the sides of its body generate antigravity energy to keep it aloft in the air.
1138.name: magnemite

1139.text: It moves while constantly hovering. It discharges Thunder Wave and so on from the units at its sides.
1139.name: magnemite

1140.text: It’s frequently the cause of power outages, which is why some power plants send out electrical signals that it can’t stand.
1140.name: magnemite

1141.text: Magnemite attaches itself to power lines to feed on electricity. If your house has a power outage, check your circuit breakers. You may find a large number of this Pokémon clinging to the breaker box.
1141.name: magnemite

1142.text: Magnemite floats in the air by emitting electromagnetic waves from the units at its sides. These waves block gravity. This Pokémon becomes incapable of flight if its internal electrical supply is depleted.
1142.name: magnemite

1143.text: They gather in places where electricity is available. They can be found clinging to the steel towers used to support power lines.
1143.name: magnemite

1144.text: It sends out electromagnetic waves, which let it float through the air. Touching it while it’s eating electricity will give you a full-body shock.
1144.name: magnemite

1145.text: Perhaps because electrical lines are often buried these days, the number of Magnemite attacks on power plants has increased.
1145.name: magnemite

1146.text: It is hatched with the ability to defy gravity. It floats while emitting powerful electromagnetic waves.
1146.name: magnemite

1147.text: At times, Magnemite runs out of electricity and ends up on the ground. If you give batteries to a grounded Magnemite, it’ll start moving again.
1147.name: magnemite

1148.text: It subsists on electricity. As Magnemite flies, it emits electromagnetic waves from the units on each side of its body.
1148.name: magnemite

1149.text: A bizarre Pokémon with but a single eye embedded in an iron sphere. I suspect this creature levitates due to the magnetism it emits from its arms, which resemble horseshoe-shaped magnets.
1149.name: magnemite

1150.text: When many MAGNETON gather together, the resulting magnetic storm disrupts radio waves.
1150.name: magneton

1151.text: MAGNETON emits a powerful magnetic force that is fatal to mechanical devices. As a result, large cities sound sirens to warn citizens of large-scale outbreaks of this POKéMON.
1151.name: magneton

1152.text: It is actually three MAGNEMITE linked by magnetism. It generates powerful radio waves that raise temperatures by 3.6 degrees F within a 3,300-foot radius.
1152.name: magneton

1153.text: Formed by several MAGNEMITE linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.
1153.name: magneton

1154.text: It is actually three MAGNEMITE linked by magnetism. A group can set off a magnetic storm.
1154.name: magneton

1155.text: Three MAGNEMITE are linked by a strong magnetic force. Earaches will occur if you get too close.
1155.name: magneton

1156.text: The MAGNEMITE are united by a magnetism so powerful, it dries all moisture in its vicinity.
1156.name: magneton

1157.text: Many mysteriously appear when more sunspots dot the sun. They stop TV sets from displaying properly.
1157.name: magneton

1158.text: The stronger electromagnetic waves from the three linked Magnemite are enough to dry out surrounding moisture.
1158.name: magneton

1159.text: A linked cluster formed of several Magnemite. It discharges powerful magnetic waves at high voltage.
1159.name: magneton

1160.text: Magneton emits a powerful magnetic force that is fatal to mechanical devices. As a result, large cities sound sirens to warn citizens of large-scale outbreaks of this Pokémon.
1160.name: magneton

1161.text: Magneton emits a powerful magnetic force that is fatal to electronics and precision instruments. Because of this, it is said that some towns warn people to keep this Pokémon inside a Poké Ball.
1161.name: magneton

1162.text: When three Magnemite link together, their brains also become one. They do not become three times more intelligent.
1162.name: magneton

1163.text: It has about three times the electrical power of Magnemite. For some reason, outbreaks of this Pokémon happen when lots of sunspots appear.
1163.name: magneton

1164.text: Delicate equipment can malfunction in areas inhabited by Magneton, which send out mysterious electrical signals.
1164.name: magneton

1165.text: When rain clouds form, many Magneton gather in high places to wait for lightning to strike.
1165.name: magneton

1166.text: Generates strange radio signals. It raises the temperature by 3.6 degrees Fahrenheit within 3,300 feet.
1166.name: magneton

1167.text: This Pokémon is three Magnemite that have linked together. Magneton sends out powerful radio waves to study its surroundings.
1167.name: magneton

1168.text: This Pokémon is constantly putting out a powerful magnetic force. Most computers go haywire when a Magneton approaches.
1168.name: magneton

1169.text: Three Magnemite gathered to evolve into this Pokémon. The source of much vexation on my part, as its powerful magnetism destroys my research equipment.
1169.name: magneton

1170.text: The sprig of green onions it holds is its weapon. It is used much like a metal sword.
1170.name: farfetchd

1171.text: Lives where reedy plants grow. They are rarely seen, so it's thought their numbers are decreasing.
1171.name: farfetchd

1172.text: If it eats the plant stick it carries as emer­ gency rations, it runs off in search of a new stick.
1172.name: farfetchd

1173.text: In order to pre­ vent their extinction, more people have made an effort to breed these POKéMON.
1173.name: farfetchd

1174.text: FARFETCH’D is always seen with a stick from a plant of some sort. Apparently, there are good sticks and bad sticks. This POKéMON has been known to fight with others over sticks.
1174.name: farfetchd

1175.text: It is always seen with a stick from a plant. Apparently, there are good sticks and bad sticks. This POKéMON occasionally fights with others over choice sticks.
1175.name: farfetchd

1176.text: If anyone tries to disturb where the essential plant stalks grow, it uses its own stalk to thwart them.
1176.name: farfetchd

1177.text: If it eats the plant stalk it carries as emergency rations, it runs off in search of a new stalk.
1177.name: farfetchd

1178.text: It can’t live without the stalk it holds. That’s why it defends the stalk from attackers with its life.
1178.name: farfetchd

1179.text: The plant stalk it holds is its weapon. The stalk is used like a sword to cut all sorts of things.
1179.name: farfetchd

1180.text: It always walks about with a plant stalk clamped in its beak. The stalk is used for building its nest.
1180.name: farfetchd

1181.text: Farfetch’d is always seen with a stalk from a plant of some sort. Apparently, there are good stalks and bad stalks. This Pokémon has been known to fight with others over stalks.
1181.name: farfetchd

1182.text: They live where reedy plants grow. Farfetch’d are rarely seen, so it’s thought their numbers are decreasing.
1182.name: farfetchd

1183.text: The stalk this Pokémon carries in its wings serves as a sword to cut down opponents. In a dire situation, the stalk can also serve as food.
1183.name: farfetchd

1184.text: They use a plant stalk as a weapon, but not all of them use it in the same way. Several distinct styles of stalk fighting have been observed.
1184.name: farfetchd

1185.text: It lives on a grassy plain where it can see a long way. If it sees an enemy, it runs away at 60 mph.
1185.name: doduo

1186.text: DODUO’s two heads never sleep at the same time. Its two heads take turns sleeping, so one head can always keep watch for enemies while the other one sleeps.
1186.name: doduo

1187.text: DODUO’s two heads contain completely identical brains. A scientific study reported that on rare occasions, there will be examples of this POKéMON possessing different sets of brains.
1187.name: doduo

1188.text: Even while eating or sleeping, one of the heads remains always vigilant for any sign of danger. When threatened, it flees at over 60 miles per hour.
1188.name: doduo

1189.text: A bird that makes up for its poor flying with its fast foot speed. Leaves giant footprints.
1189.name: doduo

1190.text: By alternately raising and lowering its two heads, it balances itself to be more stable while running.
1190.name: doduo

1191.text: It races through grassy plains with powerful strides, leaving footprints up to four inches deep.
1191.name: doduo

1192.text: A two-headed Pokémon that was discovered as a sudden mutation. It runs at a pace of over 60 miles per hour.
1192.name: doduo

1193.text: The brains in its two heads appear to communicate emotions to each other with a telepathic power.
1193.name: doduo

1194.text: Doduo’s two heads never sleep at the same time. Its two heads take turns sleeping, so one head can always keep watch for enemies while the other one sleeps.
1194.name: doduo

1195.text: Doduo’s two heads contain completely identical brains. A scientific study reported that on rare occasions, there will be examples of this Pokémon possessing different sets of brains.
1195.name: doduo

1196.text: Its short wings make flying difficult. Instead, this Pokémon runs at high speed on developed legs.
1196.name: doduo

1197.text: One of DODUO's 2 heads splits to form a unique species. It runs close to 40 MPH in prairies.
1197.name: dodrio

1198.text: Watch out if DODRIO’s three heads are looking in three separate directions. It’s a sure sign that it is on its guard. Don’t go near this POKéMON if it’s being wary - it may decide to peck you.
1198.name: dodrio

1199.text: Apparently, the heads aren’t the only parts of the body that DODRIO has three of. It has three sets of hearts and lungs as well, so it is capable of running long distances without rest.
1199.name: dodrio

1200.text: A peculiar POKéMON species with three heads. It vigorously races across grassy plains even in arid seasons with little rainfall.
1200.name: dodrio

1201.text: Uses its three brains to execute complex plans. While two heads sleep, one head is said to stay awake.
1201.name: dodrio

1202.text: When DODUO evolves into this odd breed, one of its heads splits into two. It runs at nearly 40 mph.
1202.name: dodrio

1203.text: It collects data and plans three times as wisely, but it may think too much and fall into a state of immobility.
1203.name: dodrio

1204.text: If one of the heads gets to eat, the others will be satisfied, too, and they will stop squabbling.
1204.name: dodrio

1205.text: When Doduo evolves into this odd breed, one of its heads splits into two. It runs at nearly 40 mph.
1205.name: dodrio

1206.text: An enemy that takes its eyes off any of the three heads--even for a second--will get pecked severely.
1206.name: dodrio

1207.text: An odd species that is rarely found. The three heads respectively represent joy, sadness, and anger.
1207.name: dodrio

1208.text: Watch out if Dodrio’s three heads are looking in three separate directions. It’s a sure sign that it is on its guard. Don’t go near this Pokémon if it’s being wary—it may decide to peck you.
1208.name: dodrio

1209.text: Apparently, the heads aren’t the only parts of the body that Dodrio has three of. It has three sets of hearts and lungs as well, so it is capable of running long distances without rest.
1209.name: dodrio

1210.text: One of Doduo’s two heads splits to form a unique species. It runs close to 40 mph in prairies.
1210.name: dodrio

1211.text: The light blue fur that covers it keeps it protected against the cold. It loves iceberg- filled oceans.
1211.name: seel

1212.text: The protruding horn on its head is very hard. It is used for bashing through thick icebergs.
1212.name: seel

1213.text: Although it can’t walk well on land, it is a graceful swimmer. It especially loves being in frigid seas.
1213.name: seel

1214.text: In daytime, it is often found asleep on the seabed in shallow waters. Its nostrils close while it swims.
1214.name: seel

1215.text: The colder it gets, the better it feels. It joyfully swims around oceans so cold that they are filled with floating ice.
1215.name: seel

1216.text: A Pokémon that lives on icebergs. It swims in the sea using the point on its head to break up ice.
1216.name: seel

1217.text: Covered with light blue fur, its hide is thick and tough. It is active in bitter cold of -40 degrees Fahrenheit.
1217.name: seel

1218.text: Seel hunts for prey in the frigid sea underneath sheets of ice. When it needs to breathe, it punches a hole through the ice with the sharply protruding section of its head.
1218.name: seel

1219.text: It has always been supposed that Seel live only in cold seas. Their having shown up in Alola is a mystery.
1219.name: seel

1220.text: Thanks to its thick fat, cold seas don’t bother it at all, but it gets tired pretty easily in warm waters.
1220.name: seel

1221.text: Loves freezing-cold conditions. Relishes swimming in a frigid climate of around 14 degrees Fahrenheit.
1221.name: seel

1222.text: It sleeps under shallow ocean waters during the day, then looks for food at night when it's cold.
1222.name: dewgong

1223.text: DEWGONG loves to snooze on bitterly cold ice. The sight of this POKéMON sleeping on a glacier was mistakenly thought to be a mermaid by a mariner long ago.
1223.name: dewgong

1224.text: It loves to snooze on bitterly cold ice. The sight of this POKéMON sleeping on a glacier was mistakenly thought to be a mermaid by a mariner long ago.
1224.name: dewgong

1225.text: It stores thermal energy in the body. It swims at a steady eight knots even in intensely cold waters.
1225.name: dewgong

1226.text: It loves frigid seas with ice floes. It uses its long tail to change swimming direction quickly.
1226.name: dewgong

1227.text: In snow, the pure white coat covering its body obscures it from predators.
1227.name: dewgong

1228.text: Its streamlined body has low resistance, and it swims around cold oceans at a speed of eight knots.
1228.name: dewgong

1229.text: Its body is covered with a pure white fur. The colder the weather, the more active it becomes.
1229.name: dewgong

1230.text: Its streamlined body has little drag in water. The colder the temperature, the friskier it gets.
1230.name: dewgong

1231.text: Dewgong loves to snooze on bitterly cold ice. The sight of this Pokémon sleeping on a glacier was mistakenly thought to be a mermaid by a mariner long ago.
1231.name: dewgong

1232.text: It swims through the ocean at a speed of eight knots, searching for Pokémon that will become its prey. It’s especially fond of Wishiwashi.
1232.name: dewgong

1233.text: It sunbathes on the beach after meals. The rise in its body temperature helps its digestion.
1233.name: dewgong

1234.text: Its entire body is a snowy white. Unharmed by even intense cold, it swims powerfully in icy waters.
1234.name: dewgong

1235.text: When two of these POKéMON's bodies are combined together, new poisons are created.
1235.name: grimer

1236.text: Born from polluted sludge in the sea, GRIMER’s favorite food is anything filthy. They feed on wastewater pumped out from factories.
1236.name: grimer

1237.text: As it moves, it loses bits of its body, from which new GRIMER emerge. This worsens the stench around it.
1237.name: grimer

1238.text: Wherever GRIMER has passed, so many germs are left behind that no plants will ever grow again.
1238.name: grimer

1239.text: It was born when sludge in a dirty stream was exposed to the moon’s X-rays. It appears among filth.
1239.name: grimer

1240.text: Born from sludge, these Pokémon now gather in polluted places and increase the bacteria in their bodies.
1240.name: grimer

1241.text: Sludge exposed to X-rays from the moon transformed into Grimer. It loves feeding on filthy things.
1241.name: grimer

1242.text: Appears in filthy areas. It thrives by sucking up polluted sludge that is pumped out of factories.
1242.name: grimer

1243.text: Grimer’s sludgy and rubbery body can be forced through any opening, however small it may be. This Pokémon enters sewer pipes to drink filthy wastewater.
1243.name: grimer

1244.text: Grimer emerged from the sludge that settled on a polluted seabed. This Pokémon loves anything filthy. It constantly leaks a horribly germ-infested fluid from all over its body.
1244.name: grimer

1245.text: Its main source of food is the slimy industrial waste of factories. This Pokémon’s numbers have been decreasing in recent years.
1245.name: grimer

1246.text: It was born from sludge transformed by exposure to X-rays from the moon. When its internal load of germs decreases, it dies.
1246.name: grimer

1247.text: It was born from sludge on the ocean floor. In a sterile environment, the germs within its body can’t multiply, and it dies.
1247.name: grimer

1248.text: The wastewater coming from factories is clean these days, so Grimer have nothing to eat. They’re said to be on the verge of extinction.
1248.name: grimer

1249.text: Made of congealed sludge. It smells too putrid to touch. Even weeds won’t grow in its path.
1249.name: grimer

1250.text: As it moves, a very strong poison leaks from it, making the ground there barren for three years.
1250.name: muk

1251.text: It prefers warm and humid habitats. In the summertime, the toxic substances in its body intensify, making MUK reek like putrid kitchen garbage.
1251.name: muk

1252.text: It is usually undetectable because it blends in with the ground. Touching it can cause terrible poisoning.
1252.name: muk

1253.text: Thickly covered with a filthy, vile sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints contain poison.
1253.name: muk

1254.text: Its body is made of a powerful poison. Touching it accidentally will cause a fever that requires bed rest.
1254.name: muk

1255.text: It’s so stinky! Muk’s body contains toxic elements, and any plant will wilt when it passes by.
1255.name: muk

1256.text: They love to gather in smelly areas where sludge accumulates, making the stench around them worse.
1256.name: muk

1257.text: A toxic fluid seeps from its body. The fluid instantly kills plants and trees on contact.
1257.name: muk

1258.text: From Muk’s body seeps a foul fluid that gives off a nose-bendingly horrible stench. Just one drop of this Pokémon’s body fluid can turn a pool stagnant and rancid.
1258.name: muk

1259.text: This Pokémon’s favorite food is anything that is repugnantly filthy. In dirty towns where people think nothing of throwing away litter on the streets, Muk are certain to gather.
1259.name: muk

1260.text: The stench it gives off will make your nose scrunch up. Still, there are Muk fans who think that’s a good thing.
1260.name: muk

1261.text: After recent environmental improvements, this Pokémon is now hardly seen at all. People speculate that it may go extinct at some point.
1261.name: muk

1262.text: Their food sources have decreased, and their numbers have declined sharply. Sludge ponds are being built to prevent their extinction.
1262.name: muk

1263.text: Because they scatter germs everywhere, they’ve long been targeted for extermination, leading to a steep decline in their population.
1263.name: muk

1264.text: Smells so awful, it can cause fainting. Through degeneration of its nose, it lost its sense of smell.
1264.name: muk

1265.text: At night, it burrows a hole in the seafloor with its broad tongue to make a place to sleep. While asleep, it closes its shell, but leaves its tongue hanging out.
1265.name: shellder

1266.text: It is encased in a shell that is harder than diamond. Inside, however, it is surprisingly tender.
1266.name: shellder

1267.text: Grains of sand trapped in its shells mix with its body fluids to form beautiful pearls.
1267.name: shellder

1268.text: It swims backward by opening and closing its two shells. Its large tongue is always kept hanging out.
1268.name: shellder

1269.text: Clamping on to an opponent reveals its vulnerable parts, so it uses this move only as a last resort.
1269.name: shellder

1270.text: At night, this Pokémon uses its broad tongue to burrow a hole in the seafloor sand and then sleep in it. While it is sleeping, Shellder closes its shell, but leaves its tongue hanging out.
1270.name: shellder

1271.text: The hardness of its shell surpasses the hardness of a diamond. In days gone by, people used the shells to make shields.
1271.name: shellder

1272.text: This Pokémon’s tongue is always hanging out. It uses its tongue with great dexterity to dig up sand from the seabed in its search for food.
1272.name: shellder

1273.text: The sand that accumulates inside its shell eventually becomes a pearl. But the pearl gets in the way, so it spits it out and discards it.
1273.name: shellder

1274.text: Even when its shell is closed, its tongue still hangs out. If you give its tongue a good yank, the shock will cause Shellder to open its shell.
1274.name: shellder

1275.text: The shell can withstand any attack. However, when it is open, the tender body is exposed.
1275.name: shellder

1276.text: It swims facing backward by opening and closing its two-piece shell. It is surprisingly fast.
1276.name: shellder

1277.text: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.
1277.name: shellder

1278.text: Even a missile can't break the spikes it uses to stab opponents. They're even hard­ er than its shell.
1278.name: cloyster

1279.text: CLOYSTER is capable of swimming in the sea. It does so by swallowing water, then jetting it out toward the rear. This POKéMON shoots spikes from its shell using the same system.
1279.name: cloyster

1280.text: It swims in the sea by swallowing water, then jetting it out toward the rear. The CLOYSTER shoots spikes from its shell using the same system.
1280.name: cloyster

1281.text: When attacked, it launches its horns in quick volleys. Its innards have never been seen.
1281.name: cloyster

1282.text: CLOYSTER that live in seas with harsh tidal currents grow large, sharp spikes on their shells.
1282.name: cloyster

1283.text: It fights by keeping its shell tightly shut for protection and by shooting spikes to repel foes.
1283.name: cloyster

1284.text: Cloyster that live in seas with harsh tidal currents grow large, sharp spikes on their shells.
1284.name: cloyster

1285.text: Cloyster is capable of swimming in the sea. It does so by swallowing water, then jetting it out toward the rear. This Pokémon shoots spikes from its shell using the same system.
1285.name: cloyster

1286.text: Its hard shell cannot be shattered—not even by a bomb. The contents of the shell remain unknown.
1286.name: cloyster

1287.text: Excavation of the tombs of ancient hunting tribes has turned up many spears tipped with spikes that had fallen off this Pokémon’s shell.
1287.name: cloyster

1288.text: If areas of Cloyster’s very hard shell get damaged, those areas swell, gradually growing into large sharp spikes.
1288.name: cloyster

1289.text: Slowpoke tails are its favorite food. It has even been known to come up on land to look for Slowpoke from time to time.
1289.name: cloyster

1290.text: For protection, it uses its harder-than-diamond shell. It also shoots spikes from the shell.
1290.name: cloyster

1291.text: Its shell is extremely hard. It cannot be shattered, even with a bomb. The shell opens only when it is attacking.
1291.name: cloyster

1292.text: Once it slams its shell shut, it is impossible to open, even by those with superior strength.
1292.name: cloyster

1293.text: It wraps its op­ ponent in its gas- like body, slowly weakening its prey by poisoning it through the skin.
1293.name: gastly

1294.text: When exposed to a strong wind, a GASTLY’s gaseous body quickly dwindles away. They cluster under the eaves of houses to escape the ravages of wind.
1294.name: gastly

1295.text: A being that exists as a thin gas. It can topple an Indian elephant by enveloping the prey in two seconds.
1295.name: gastly

1296.text: Almost invisible, this gaseous POKéMON cloaks the target and puts it to sleep without notice.
1296.name: gastly

1297.text: This Pokémon’s body is 95% made up of gases, which are blown away by strong gusts of wind.
1297.name: gastly

1298.text: A Pokémon born from poison gases. It defeats even the largest foes by enveloping them in gas.
1298.name: gastly

1299.text: Its body is made of gas. Despite lacking substance, it can envelop an opponent of any size and cause suffocation.
1299.name: gastly

1300.text: Gastly is largely composed of gaseous matter. When exposed to a strong wind, the gaseous body quickly dwindles away. Groups of this Pokémon cluster under the eaves of houses to escape the ravages of wind.
1300.name: gastly

1301.text: Should a strange light be seen flickering in an abandoned building, Gastly is lurking there.
1301.name: gastly

1302.text: Although Gastly is barely visible, when it’s near, a faint sweet smell lingers.
1302.name: gastly

1303.text: It’s said that gas emanating from a graveyard was possessed by the grievances of the deceased and thus became a Pokémon.
1303.name: gastly

1304.text: Poisonous gas comprises 95% of its body. It’s said that the remaining 5% is made up of the souls of those who died from the gas.
1304.name: gastly

1305.text: Said to appear in decrepit, deserted buildings. It has no real shape, as it appears to be made of a gas.
1305.name: gastly

1306.text: Born from gases, anyone would faint if engulfed by its gaseous body, which contains poison.
1306.name: gastly

1307.text: With its gas-like body, it can sneak into any place it desires. However, it can be blown away by wind.
1307.name: gastly

1308.text: Gaseous and completely impalpable. Also highly dangerous— inhaling part of its poisonous body will cause one to faint instantly.
1308.name: gastly

1309.text: It hides in the dark, planning to take the life of the next living thing that wanders close by.
1309.name: haunter

1310.text: HAUNTER is a dangerous POKéMON. If one beckons you while floating in darkness, you must never approach it. This POKéMON will try to lick you with its tongue and steal your life away.
1310.name: haunter

1311.text: If a HAUNTER beckons you while it is floating in darkness, don’t approach it. This POKéMON will try to lick you with its tongue and steal your life away.
1311.name: haunter

1312.text: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from another dimension.
1312.name: haunter

1313.text: It can slip through any obstacle. It lurks inside walls to keep an eye on its foes.
1313.name: haunter

1314.text: In total darkness, where nothing is visible, HAUNTER lurks, silently stalking its next victim.
1314.name: haunter

1315.text: It likes to lurk in the dark and tap shoulders with a gaseous hand. Its touch causes endless shuddering.
1315.name: haunter

1316.text: It licks with its gaseous tongue to steal the victim’s life force. It lurks in darkness for prey.
1316.name: haunter

1317.text: Haunter is a dangerous Pokémon. If one beckons you while floating in darkness, you must never approach it. This Pokémon will try to lick you with its tongue and steal your life away.
1317.name: haunter

1318.text: It strikes at humans from total darkness. Those licked by its cold tongue grow weaker with each passing day until they die.
1318.name: haunter

1319.text: It fears the light and revels in the dark. It may be on the verge of extinction in cities that stay brightly lit at night.
1319.name: haunter

1320.text: On moonless nights, Haunter searches for someone to curse, so it’s best not to go out walking around.
1320.name: haunter

1321.text: It’s dangerous to go outside alone on nights when you’re feeling sad. Haunter will catch you, and you won’t be able to go back home.
1321.name: haunter

1322.text: By licking, it saps the victim’s life. It causes shaking that won’t stop until the victim’s demise.
1322.name: haunter

1323.text: Its tongue is made of gas. If licked, its victim starts shaking constantly until death eventually comes.
1323.name: haunter

1324.text: If you get the feeling of being watched in darkness when nobody is around, Haunter is there.
1324.name: haunter

1325.text: This frightful, malevolent spirit can glide through walls, appearing wherever it likes. According to rumor, victims of a Haunter's lick will wither to death day by day.
1325.name: haunter

1326.text: Under a full moon, this POKéMON likes to mimic the shadows of people and laugh at their fright.
1326.name: gengar

1327.text: Lurking in the shadowy corners of rooms, it awaits chances to steal its prey’s life force.
1327.name: gengar

1328.text: It steals heat from its surroundings. If you feel a sudden chill, it is certain that a GENGAR appeared.
1328.name: gengar

1329.text: To steal the life of its target, it slips into the prey’s shadow and silently waits for an opportunity.
1329.name: gengar

1330.text: The leer that floats in darkness belongs to a Gengar delighting in casting curses on people.
1330.name: gengar

1331.text: It hides in shadows. It is said that if Gengar is hiding, it cools the area by nearly 10 degrees Fahrenheit.
1331.name: gengar

1332.text: Hiding in people’s shadows at night, it absorbs their heat. The chill it causes makes the victims shake.
1332.name: gengar

1333.text: Sometimes, on a dark night, your shadow thrown by a streetlight will suddenly and startlingly overtake you. It is actually a Gengar running past you, pretending to be your shadow.
1333.name: gengar

1334.text: Should you feel yourself attacked by a sudden chill, it is evidence of an approaching Gengar. There is no escaping it. Give up.
1334.name: gengar

1335.text: It apparently wishes for a traveling companion. Since it was once human itself, it tries to create one by taking the lives of other humans.
1335.name: gengar

1336.text: You can hear tales told all over the world about how Gengar will pay a visit to children who are naughty.
1336.name: gengar

1337.text: Even your home isn’t safe. Gengar will lurk in whatever dark corner of a room it can find and wait for its chance to catch its prey.
1337.name: gengar

1338.text: A Gengar is close by if you feel a sudden chill. It may be trying to lay a curse on you.
1338.name: gengar

1339.text: On the night of a full moon, if shadows move on their own and laugh, it must be Gengar’s doing.
1339.name: gengar

1340.text: It is said to emerge from darkness to steal the lives of those who become lost in mountains.
1340.name: gengar

1341.text: Possesses potential victims' shadows in an effort to steal away the victims' lives. If your shadow begins to laugh, you must take hold of a protective charm posthaste!
1341.name: gengar

1342.text: Burrows at high speed in search of food. The tunnels it leaves are used as homes by DIGLETTs.
1342.name: onix

1343.text: ONIX has a magnet in its brain. It acts as a compass so that this POKéMON does not lose direction while it is tunneling. As it grows older, its body becomes increasingly rounder and smoother.
1343.name: onix

1344.text: There is a magnet in its brain that prevents an ONIX from losing direction while tunneling. As it grows older, its body becomes steadily rounder and smoother.
1344.name: onix

1345.text: As it grows, the stone portions of its body harden to become similar to black-colored diamonds.
1345.name: onix

1346.text: When it travels underground, it causes rumbling and tremors. It can move at 50 mph.
1346.name: onix

1347.text: It squirms through the ground using its long and rugged body. It always eats while burrowing.
1347.name: onix

1348.text: It twists and squirms through the ground. The thunderous roar of its tunneling echoes a long way.
1348.name: onix

1349.text: It burrows through the ground at a speed of 50 mph while feeding on large boulders.
1349.name: onix

1350.text: Opening its large mouth, it ingests massive amounts of soil and creates long tunnels.
1350.name: onix

1351.text: It usually lives underground. It searches for food while boring its way through the ground at 50 miles per hour.
1351.name: onix

1352.text: Onix has a magnet in its brain. It acts as a compass so that this Pokémon does not lose direction while it is tunneling. As it grows older, its body becomes increasingly rounder and smoother.
1352.name: onix

1353.text: Burrows at high speed in search of food. The tunnels it leaves are used as homes by Diglett.
1353.name: onix

1354.text: As it digs through the ground, it absorbs many hard objects. This is what makes its body so solid.
1354.name: onix

1355.text: It rapidly bores through the ground at 50 mph by squirming and twisting its massive, rugged body.
1355.name: onix

1356.text: This chain of immense stones resembles a giant serpent. Tremors shake the earth above as it burrows deep beneath the ground, feeding on boulders as it goes.
1356.name: onix

1357.text: If you think that you had a good dream, but you can't remember it, a DROWZEE has probably eaten it.
1357.name: drowzee

1358.text: When it twitches its nose, it can tell where someone is sleeping and what that person is dreaming about.
1358.name: drowzee

1359.text: If your nose becomes itchy while you are sleeping, it’s a sure sign that a DROWZEE is standing above your pillow and trying to eat your dream through your nostrils.
1359.name: drowzee

1360.text: A descendent of the legendary animal baku, which is said to eat dreams. It is skilled at hypnotism.
1360.name: drowzee

1361.text: It remembers every dream it eats. It rarely eats the dreams of adults because children’s are much tastier.
1361.name: drowzee

1362.text: It can tell what people are dreaming by sniffing with its big nose. It loves fun dreams.
1362.name: drowzee

1363.text: Puts enemies to sleep, then eats their dreams. Occasionally gets sick from eating only bad dreams.
1363.name: drowzee

1364.text: If you think that you had a good dream but you can’t remember it, a Drowzee has probably eaten it.
1364.name: drowzee

1365.text: If your nose becomes itchy while you are sleeping, it’s a sure sign that one of these Pokémon is standing above your pillow and trying to eat your dream through your nostrils.
1365.name: drowzee

1366.text: A Pokémon that nourishes itself by eating dreams, it is thought to share common ancestry with Munna and Musharna.
1366.name: drowzee

1367.text: It finds really fun dreams tasty. When it makes friends with people, it may show them the most delicious dreams it’s ever eaten.
1367.name: drowzee

1368.text: It can be spotted near recreational facilities, intending to eat the pleasant dreams of children who enjoyed themselves there that day.
1368.name: drowzee

1369.text: It puts its prey to sleep and devours their dreams. It seems that bad dreams taste sour, so Drowzee doesn’t particularly like eating them.
1369.name: drowzee

1370.text: If you sleep by it all the time, it will sometimes show you dreams it had eaten in the past.
1370.name: drowzee

1371.text: The longer it swings its pendulum, the longer the effects of its hypnosis last.
1371.name: hypno

1372.text: The arcing movement and glitter of the pendulum in a HYPNO’s hand lull the foe into deep hypnosis. While searching for prey, it polishes the pendulum.
1372.name: hypno

1373.text: When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use a mix of PSI moves such as HYPNOSIS and CONFUSION.
1373.name: hypno

1374.text: When it is very hungry, it puts humans it meets to sleep, then it feasts on their dreams.
1374.name: hypno

1375.text: Always holding a pendulum that it swings at a steady rhythm, it causes drowsiness in anyone nearby.
1375.name: hypno

1376.text: It carries a pendulum-like device. There once was an incident in which it took away a child it hypnotized.
1376.name: hypno

1377.text: Seeing its swinging pendulum can induce sleep in three seconds, even in someone who just woke up.
1377.name: hypno

1378.text: Hypno holds a pendulum in its hand. The arcing movement and glitter of the pendulum lull the foe into a deep state of hypnosis. While this Pokémon searches for prey, it polishes the pendulum.
1378.name: hypno

1379.text: While it is an extremely dangerous Pokémon, people who are in need of a good, sound sleep call it their savior.
1379.name: hypno

1380.text: As a matter of course, it makes anyone it meets fall asleep and has a taste of their dreams. Anyone having a good dream, it carries off.
1380.name: hypno

1381.text: In Alola, Komala is Hypno’s main target. It rarely harms people.
1381.name: hypno

1382.text: There are some Hypno that assist doctors with patients who can’t sleep at night in hospitals.
1382.name: hypno

1383.text: Avoid eye contact if you come across one. It will try to put you to sleep by using its pendulum.
1383.name: hypno

1384.text: If it is unable to find food, it will absorb nutrients by swallowing a mouthful of sand.
1384.name: krabby

1385.text: KRABBY live in holes dug into beaches. On sandy shores with little in the way of food, they can be seen squabbling with each other over territory.
1385.name: krabby

1386.text: Its pincers are not only powerful weapons, they are used for balance when walking sideways.
1386.name: krabby

1387.text: The pincers break off easily. If it loses a pincer, it somehow becomes incapable of walking sideways.
1387.name: krabby

1388.text: It lives in burrows dug on sandy beaches. Its pincers fully grow back if they are broken in battle.
1388.name: krabby

1389.text: Krabby live on beaches, burrowed inside holes dug into the sand. On sandy beaches with little in the way of food, these Pokémon can be seen squabbling with each other over territory.
1389.name: krabby

1390.text: Its pincers are superb weapons. They sometimes break off during battle, but they grow back fast.
1390.name: krabby

1391.text: It can be found near the sea. The large pincers grow back if they are torn out of their sockets.
1391.name: krabby

1392.text: If it senses danger approaching, it cloaks itself with bubbles from its mouth so it will look bigger.
1392.name: krabby

1393.text: It waves its huge, oversized claw in the air to communicate with others. But since the claw is so heavy, this POKéMON quickly tires.
1393.name: kingler

1394.text: The large pincer has 10,000-horsepower crushing force. However, its huge size makes it unwieldy to use.
1394.name: kingler

1395.text: It can hardly lift its massive, overgrown pincer. The pincer’s size makes it difficult to aim properly.
1395.name: kingler

1396.text: The larger pincer has 10,000- horsepower strength. However, it is so heavy, it is difficult to aim.
1396.name: kingler

1397.text: Its pincers grow peculiarly large. If it lifts the pincers too fast, it loses its balance and staggers.
1397.name: kingler

1398.text: Kingler has an enormous, oversized claw. It waves this huge claw in the air to communicate with others. However, because the claw is so heavy, the Pokémon quickly tires.
1398.name: kingler

1399.text: One claw grew massively and is as hard as steel. It has 10,000-horsepower strength. However, it is too heavy.
1399.name: kingler

1400.text: Its large and hard pincer has 10,000-horsepower strength. However, being so big, it is unwieldy to move.
1400.name: kingler

1401.text: Its oversized claw is very powerful, but when it’s not in battle, the claw just gets in the way.
1401.name: kingler

1402.text: During the study of this POKéMON, it was discovered that its compo­ nents are not found in nature.
1402.name: voltorb

1403.text: VOLTORB was first sighted at a company that manufactures POKé BALLS. The link between that sighting and the fact that this POKéMON looks very similar to a POKé BALL remains a mystery.
1403.name: voltorb

1404.text: It bears an uncanny and unexplained resemblance to a POKé BALL. Because it explodes at the slightest shock, even veteran TRAINERS treat it with caution.
1404.name: voltorb

1405.text: A life-form whose identity is unknown. It is said to SCREECH or suddenly SELFDESTRUCT.
1405.name: voltorb

1406.text: It rolls to move. If the ground is uneven, a sudden jolt from hitting a bump can cause it to explode.
1406.name: voltorb

1407.text: It looks just like a Poké Ball. It is dangerous because it may electrocute or explode on contact.
1407.name: voltorb

1408.text: It was discovered when Poké Balls were introduced. It is said that there is some connection.
1408.name: voltorb

1409.text: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a Poké Ball, it has zapped many people.
1409.name: voltorb

1410.text: Voltorb was first sighted at a company that manufactures Poké Balls. The link between that sighting and the fact that this Pokémon looks very similar to a Poké Ball remains a mystery.
1410.name: voltorb

1411.text: Voltorb is extremely sensitive—it explodes at the slightest of shocks. It is rumored that it was first created when a Poké Ball was exposed to a powerful pulse of energy.
1411.name: voltorb

1412.text: It is said to camouflage itself as a Poké Ball. It will self-destruct with very little stimulus.
1412.name: voltorb

1413.text: An enigmatic Pokémon that happens to bear a resemblance to a Poké Ball. When excited, it discharges the electric current it has stored in its belly, then lets out a great, uproarious laugh.
1413.name: voltorb

1414.text: The more energy it charges up, the faster it gets. But this also makes it more likely to explode.
1414.name: electrode

1415.text: They appear in great numbers at electric power plants. Because they feed on electricity, they cause massive and chaotic blackouts in nearby cities.
1415.name: electrode

1416.text: It stores electric energy under very high pressure. It often explodes with little or no provocation.
1416.name: electrode

1417.text: It is dangerous. If it has too much electricity and has nothing to do, it amuses itself by exploding.
1417.name: electrode

1418.text: It is known to drift on winds if it is bloated to bursting with stored electricity.
1418.name: electrode

1419.text: It explodes in response to even minor stimuli. It is feared, with the nickname of “The Bomb Ball.”
1419.name: electrode

1420.text: It stores an overflowing amount of electric energy inside its body. Even a small shock makes it explode.
1420.name: electrode

1421.text: Electrode eats electricity in the atmosphere. On days when lightning strikes, you can see this Pokémon exploding all over the place from eating too much electricity.
1421.name: electrode

1422.text: One of Electrode’s characteristics is its attraction to electricity. It is a problematical Pokémon that congregates mostly at electrical power plants to feed on electricity that has just been generated.
1422.name: electrode

1423.text: Stores electrical energy inside its body. Even the slightest shock could trigger a huge explosion.
1423.name: electrode

1424.text: The tissue on the surface of its body is curiously similar in composition to an Apricorn. When irritated, this Pokémon lets loose an electric current equal to 20 lightning bolts.
1424.name: electrode

1425.text: The shell is very durable. Even if it cracks, it can survive without spilling the contents.
1425.name: exeggcute

1426.text: If even one is separated from the group, the energy bond between the six will make them rejoin instantly.
1426.name: exeggcute

1427.text: It consists of six eggs that care for each other. The eggs attract each other and spin around. When cracks increasingly appear, it is close to evolution.
1427.name: exeggcute

1428.text: It is often mistaken for eggs. When disturbed, they quickly gather and attack in swarms.
1428.name: exeggcute

1429.text: Their shells are very durable. Even if they crack, they can survive without spilling their contents.
1429.name: exeggcute

1430.text: Using telepathy only they can employ, they always form a cluster of six EXEGGCUTE.
1430.name: exeggcute

1431.text: Its six eggs converse using telepathy. They can quickly gather if they become separated.
1431.name: exeggcute

1432.text: Even though it appears to be eggs of some sort, it was discovered to be a life-form more like plant seeds.
1432.name: exeggcute

1433.text: This Pokémon consists of six eggs that form a closely knit cluster. The six eggs attract each other and spin around. When cracks increasingly appear on the eggs, Exeggcute is close to evolution.
1433.name: exeggcute

1434.text: Its six eggs use telepathy to communicate among themselves. It is believed to carry plant genes and the genes of other species.
1434.name: exeggcute

1435.text: Six of them together form a full-fledged Pokémon. It’s often hunted by Crabrawler, but uses psychokinesis to drive it off.
1435.name: exeggcute

1436.text: Six of them form a single Pokémon. Should one of the six be lost, the next morning there will once more be six.
1436.name: exeggcute

1437.text: Although they are the same size as other Exeggcute, the ones produced in Alola are quite heavy. Their shells are packed full.
1437.name: exeggcute

1438.text: The heads attract each other and spin around. There must be six heads for it to maintain balance.
1438.name: exeggcute

1439.text: Though it may look like it’s just a bunch of eggs, it’s a proper Pokémon. Exeggcute communicates with others of its kind via telepathy, apparently.
1439.name: exeggcute

1440.text: These Pokémon get nervous when they’re not in a group of six. The minute even one member of the group goes missing, Exeggcute become cowardly.
1440.name: exeggcute

1441.text: Living in a good environment makes it grow lots of heads. A head that drops off becomes an EXEGGCUTE.
1441.name: exeggutor

1442.text: Originally from the tropics, EXEGGUTOR’s heads grow larger from exposure to strong sunlight. It is said that when the heads fall, they group to form an EXEGGCUTE.
1442.name: exeggutor

1443.text: It is called “The Walking Tropical Rainforest.” Each of the nuts has a face and a will of its own.
1443.name: exeggutor

1444.text: It is said that on rare occasions, one of its heads will drop off and continue on as an EXEGGCUTE.
1444.name: exeggutor

1445.text: If a head drops off, it emits a telepathic call in search of others to form an EXEGGCUTE cluster.
1445.name: exeggutor

1446.text: Its three heads think independently. However, they are friendly and never appear to squabble.
1446.name: exeggutor

1447.text: It is called “The Walking Jungle.” If a head grows too big, it falls off and becomes an Exeggcute.
1447.name: exeggutor

1448.text: Exeggutor originally came from the tropics. Its heads steadily grow larger from exposure to strong sunlight. It is said that when the heads fall off, they group together to form Exeggcute.
1448.name: exeggutor

1449.text: Each of its heads has its own will. They use telepathy to discuss their plans before coming to a joint decision.
1449.name: exeggutor

1450.text: When the time comes, one of its three heads falls off. Before long, the fallen head grows into an Exeggcute.
1450.name: exeggutor

1451.text: It engages its enemies using psychic powers. Each of its three heads fires off psychokinetic energy, tripling its power.
1451.name: exeggutor

1452.text: Each of its three heads has its own thoughts. When they want to go in different directions, Exeggutor becomes unable to move.
1452.name: exeggutor

1453.text: Its cries are very noisy. This is because each of the three heads thinks about whatever it likes.
1453.name: exeggutor

1454.text: Each of Exeggutor’s three heads is thinking different thoughts. The three don’t seem to be very interested in one another.
1454.name: exeggutor

1455.text: When they work together, Exeggutor’s three heads can put out powerful psychic energy. Cloudy days make this Pokémon sluggish.
1455.name: exeggutor

1456.text: It lost its mother after its birth. It wears its mother's skull, never revealing its true face.
1456.name: cubone

1457.text: It pines for the mother it will never see again. Seeing a likeness of its mother in the full moon, it cries. The stains on the skull it wears are from its tears.
1457.name: cubone

1458.text: Because it never removes its skull helmet, no one has ever seen this POKéMON’s real face.
1458.name: cubone

1459.text: If it is sad or lonely, the skull it wears shakes and emits a plaintive and mournful sound.
1459.name: cubone

1460.text: When it thinks of its dead mother, it cries. Its crying makes the skull it wears rattle hollowly.
1460.name: cubone

1461.text: It wears the skull of its dead mother on its head. When it becomes lonesome, it is said to cry loudly.
1461.name: cubone

1462.text: It always wears the skull of its dead mother, so no one has any idea what its hidden face looks like.
1462.name: cubone

1463.text: Cubone pines for the mother it will never see again. Seeing a likeness of its mother in the full moon, it cries. The stains on the skull the Pokémon wears are made by the tears it sheds.
1463.name: cubone

1464.text: When it thinks of its deceased mother, it weeps loudly. Mandibuzz that hear its cries will attack it from the air.
1464.name: cubone

1465.text: The skull it wears on its head is that of its dead mother. According to some, it will evolve when it comes to terms with the pain of her death.
1465.name: cubone

1466.text: At night, it weeps loudly for its dead mother, but those cries only attract its natural enemy—Mandibuzz.
1466.name: cubone

1467.text: It wears its mother’s skull on its head, so no one knows what its bare face looks like. However, it’s clear that it’s always crying.
1467.name: cubone

1468.text: Wears the skull of its deceased mother. Its cries echo inside the skull and come out as a sad melody.
1468.name: cubone

1469.text: When the memory of its departed mother brings it to tears, its cries echo mournfully within the skull it wears on its head.
1469.name: cubone

1470.text: This Pokémon wears the skull of its deceased mother. Sometimes Cubone’s dreams make it cry, but each tear Cubone sheds makes it stronger.
1470.name: cubone

1471.text: Somewhere in the world is a ceme­ tery just for MAROWAK. It gets its bones from those graves.
1471.name: marowak

1472.text: It has been seen pounding boulders with the bone it carries in order to tap out messages to others.
1472.name: marowak

1473.text: It collects bones from an unknown place. Some whisper that a MAROWAK graveyard exists somewhere in the world.
1473.name: marowak

1474.text: From its birth, this savage Pokémon constantly holds bones. It is skilled in using them as weapons.
1474.name: marowak

1475.text: It is small and was originally very weak. Its temperament turned ferocious when it began using bones.
1475.name: marowak

1476.text: The bone it holds is its key weapon. It throws the bone skillfully like a boomerang to KO targets.
1476.name: marowak

1477.text: Marowak is the evolved form of a Cubone that has overcome its sadness at the loss of its mother and grown tough. This Pokémon’s tempered and hardened spirit is not easily broken.
1477.name: marowak

1478.text: Originally, it was weak and timid. After evolution, its temperament becomes violent, and it begins to wield bones as weapons.
1478.name: marowak

1479.text: This Pokémon is out for vengeance on its natural enemy, Mandibuzz. It throws bones like boomerangs to try to take it down.
1479.name: marowak

1480.text: It throws bones at Mandibuzz to knock it down. It’s thought that Marowak is trying to avenge its parent.
1480.name: marowak

1481.text: They thump their bones rhythmically to communicate among themselves. There are nearly 50 different rhythmic patterns.
1481.name: marowak

1482.text: Small and weak, this Pokémon is adept with its bone club. It has grown more vicious over the ages.
1482.name: marowak

1483.text: This Pokémon overcame its sorrow to evolve a sturdy new body. Marowak faces its opponents bravely, using a bone as a weapon.
1483.name: marowak

1484.text: When this Pokémon evolved, the skull of its mother fused to it. Marowak’s temperament also turned vicious at the same time.
1484.name: marowak

1485.text: It is also called the Kick Master. It uses its elastic legs to execute every known kick.
1485.name: hitmonlee

1486.text: Its legs freely stretch and contract. Using these springlike limbs, it bowls over foes with devastating kicks. After battle, it rubs down its tired legs.
1486.name: hitmonlee

1487.text: When in a hurry, its legs lengthen progressively. It runs smoothly with extra-long, loping strides.
1487.name: hitmonlee

1488.text: Its legs can stretch double. First-time foes are startled by its extensible reach.
1488.name: hitmonlee

1489.text: If it starts kicking repeatedly, both legs will stretch even longer to strike a fleeing foe.
1489.name: hitmonlee

1490.text: Hitmonlee’s legs freely contract and stretch. Using these springlike legs, it bowls over foes with devastating kicks. After battle, it rubs down its legs and loosens the muscles to overcome fatigue.
1490.name: hitmonlee

1491.text: When kicking, the sole of its foot turns as hard as a diamond on impact and destroys its enemy.
1491.name: hitmonlee

1492.text: This amazing Pokémon has an awesome sense of balance. It can kick in succession from any position.
1492.name: hitmonlee

1493.text: The legs freely contract and stretch. The stretchy legs allow it to hit a distant foe with a rising kick.
1493.name: hitmonlee

1494.text: To increase the strength of all its punch moves, it spins its arms just before making contact.
1494.name: hitmonchan

1495.text: A HITMONCHAN is said to possess the spirit of a boxer who aimed to become the world champion. Having an indomitable spirit means that it will never give up.
1495.name: hitmonchan

1496.text: While apparently doing nothing, it fires punches in lightning-fast volleys that are impossible to see.
1496.name: hitmonchan

1497.text: The arm-twisting punches it throws pulverize even concrete. It rests after three minutes of fighting.
1497.name: hitmonchan

1498.text: The spirit of a pro boxer has infused this Pokémon. It throws punches that are faster than a bullet train.
1498.name: hitmonchan

1499.text: Hitmonchan is said to possess the spirit of a boxer who had been working toward a world championship. This Pokémon has an indomitable spirit and will never give up in the face of adversity.
1499.name: hitmonchan

1500.text: Punches in corkscrew fashion. It can punch its way through a concrete wall like a drill.
1500.name: hitmonchan

1501.text: Its punches slice the air. They are launched at such high speed, even a slight graze could cause a burn.
1501.name: hitmonchan

1502.text: Its punches slice the air. However, it seems to need a short break after fighting for three minutes.
1502.name: hitmonchan

1503.text: It has a tongue that is over 6’6’’ long. It uses this long tongue to lick its body clean.
1503.name: lickitung

1504.text: Whenever it sees something unfamiliar, it always licks the object because it memorizes things by texture and taste. It is somewhat put off by sour things.
1504.name: lickitung

1505.text: Its tongue can be extended like a chameleon’s. It leaves a tingling sensation when it licks enemies.
1505.name: lickitung

1506.text: Instead of hands, it uses its tongue, which is twice its height. Its sticky saliva grips anything.
1506.name: lickitung

1507.text: Its tongue has well-developed nerves that run to the very tip, so it can be deftly manipulated.
1507.name: lickitung

1508.text: When it extends its over-six-foot- long tongue, its tail quivers. There is a possibility they are connected.
1508.name: lickitung

1509.text: Being licked by its long, saliva-covered tongue leaves a tingling sensation. Extending its tongue retracts its tail.
1509.name: lickitung

1510.text: Its long tongue, slathered with a gooey saliva, sticks to anything, so it is very useful.
1510.name: lickitung

1511.text: Its tongue is twice the length of its body. It can be moved like an arm for grabbing food and attacking.
1511.name: lickitung

1512.text: Whenever Lickitung comes across something new, it will unfailingly give it a lick. It does so because it memorizes things by texture and by taste. It is somewhat put off by sour things.
1512.name: lickitung

1513.text: It checks out whatever’s around it by licking everything. If you don’t clean off a spot where it’s licked you, you’ll break out in a rash!
1513.name: lickitung

1514.text: It licks filth clean with its tongue. Whatever it licks always stinks afterward, so whether it’s really clean is...questionable.
1514.name: lickitung

1515.text: Its tongue spans almost seven feet and moves more freely than its forelegs. Its licks can cause paralysis.
1515.name: lickitung

1516.text: If this Pokémon’s sticky saliva gets on you and you don’t clean it off, an intense itch will set in. The itch won’t go away, either.
1516.name: lickitung

1517.text: Bug Pokémon are Lickitung’s main food source. This Pokémon paralyzes its prey with a lick from its long tongue, then swallows the prey whole.
1517.name: lickitung

1518.text: Wields its long tongue deftly, as though it were an arm. The Pokémon's viscous saliva, once it has been collected and boiled down, yields a strong and highly useful adhesive.
1518.name: lickitung

1519.text: If one gets close enough to it when it expels poison­ ous gas, the gas swirling inside it can be seen.
1519.name: koffing

1520.text: Getting up close to a KOFFING will give you a chance to observe, through its thin skin, the toxic gases swirling inside. It blows up at the slightest stimulation.
1520.name: koffing

1521.text: Because it stores several kinds of toxic gases in its body, it is prone to exploding without warning.
1521.name: koffing

1522.text: Its thin, filmy body is filled with gases that cause constant sniffles, coughs and teary eyes.
1522.name: koffing

1523.text: The poisonous gases it contains are a little bit lighter than air, keeping it slightly airborne.
1523.name: koffing

1524.text: Toxic gas is held within its thin, balloon-shaped body, so it can cause massive explosions.
1524.name: koffing

1525.text: Its thin, balloon-like body is inflated by horribly toxic gases. It reeks when it is nearby.
1525.name: koffing

1526.text: Lighter-than-air gases in its body keep it aloft. The gases not only smell, they are also explosive.
1526.name: koffing

1527.text: If Koffing becomes agitated, it raises the toxicity of its internal gases and jets them out from all over its body. This Pokémon may also overinflate its round body, then explode.
1527.name: koffing

1528.text: Koffing embodies toxic substances. It mixes the toxins with raw garbage to set off a chemical reaction that results in a terribly powerful poison gas. The higher the temperature, the more gas is concocted by this Pokémon.
1528.name: koffing

1529.text: In hot places, its internal gases could expand and explode without any warning. Be very careful!
1529.name: koffing

1530.text: Its body is full of poisonous gas. It floats into garbage dumps, seeking out the fumes of raw, rotting trash.
1530.name: koffing

1531.text: It adores polluted air. Some claim that Koffing used to be more plentiful in the Galar region than they are now.
1531.name: koffing

1532.text: It lives and grows by absorbing dust, germs and poison gases that are contained in toxic waste and garbage.
1532.name: weezing

1533.text: When it inhales poisonous gases from garbage, its body expands, and its insides smell much worse.
1533.name: weezing

1534.text: By diluting its toxic gases with a special process, the highest grade of perfume can be extracted. To WEEZING, gases emanating from garbage are the ultimate feast.
1534.name: weezing

1535.text: Where two kinds of poison gases meet, two KOFFING can fuse into a WEEZING over many years.
1535.name: weezing

1536.text: Top-grade perfume is made using its internal poison gases by diluting them to the highest level.
1536.name: weezing

1537.text: It grows by feeding on gases released by garbage. Though very rare, triplets have been found.
1537.name: weezing

1538.text: Inhaling toxic fumes from trash and mixing them inside its body lets it spread an even fouler stench.
1538.name: weezing

1539.text: If one of the twin Koffing inflates, the other one deflates. It constantly mixes its poisonous gases.
1539.name: weezing

1540.text: Very rarely, a sudden mutation can result in two small Koffing twins becoming conjoined as a Weezing.
1540.name: weezing

1541.text: Weezing loves the gases given off by rotted kitchen garbage. This Pokémon will find a dirty, unkempt house and make it its home. At night, when the people in the house are asleep, it will go through the trash.
1541.name: weezing

1542.text: Weezing alternately shrinks and inflates its twin bodies to mix together toxic gases inside. The more the gases are mixed, the more powerful the toxins become. The Pokémon also becomes more putrid.
1542.name: weezing

1543.text: This Pokémon lives and grows by absorbing poison gas, dust, and germs that exist inside garbage.
1543.name: weezing

1544.text: It mixes gases between its two bodies. It’s said that these Pokémon were seen all over the Galar region back in the day.
1544.name: weezing

1545.text: It can’t suck in air quite as well as a Galarian Weezing, but the toxins it creates are more potent than those of its counterpart.
1545.name: weezing

1546.text: Its massive bones are 1000 times harder than human bones. It can easily knock a trailer flying.
1546.name: rhyhorn

1547.text: RHYHORN runs in a straight line, smashing everything in its path. It is not bothered even if it rushes headlong into a block of steel. This POKéMON may feel some pain from the collision the next day, however.
1547.name: rhyhorn

1548.text: RHYHORN’s brain is very small. It is so dense, while on a run it forgets why it started running in the first place. It apparently remembers sometimes if it demolishes something.
1548.name: rhyhorn

1549.text: Once it starts running, it doesn’t stop. Its tiny brain makes it so stupid that it can’t remember why it started running in the first place.
1549.name: rhyhorn

1550.text: Its massive bones are 1,000 times harder than human bones. Its TACKLE can knock a semitrailer flying.
1550.name: rhyhorn

1551.text: Its body is clad in a thick hide, and its tackles topple buildings. Unfortunately, it is not smart.
1551.name: rhyhorn

1552.text: It doesn’t care if there is anything in its way. It just charges and destroys all obstacles.
1552.name: rhyhorn

1553.text: Its powerful tackles can destroy anything. However, it is too slow witted to help people work.
1553.name: rhyhorn

1554.text: It is inept at turning because of its four short legs. It can only charge and run in one direction.
1554.name: rhyhorn

1555.text: Rhyhorn runs in a straight line, smashing everything in its path. It is not bothered even if it rushes headlong into a block of steel. This Pokémon may feel some pain from the collision the next day, however.
1555.name: rhyhorn

1556.text: Rhyhorn’s brain is very small. It is so dense, while on a run it forgets why it started running in the first place. It apparently remembers sometimes if it demolishes something.
1556.name: rhyhorn

1557.text: A Pokémon with a one-track mind. Once it charges, it won’t stop running until it falls asleep.
1557.name: rhyhorn

1558.text: Strong, but not too bright, this Pokémon can shatter even a skyscraper with its charging tackles.
1558.name: rhyhorn

1559.text: It can remember only one thing at a time. Once it starts rushing, it forgets why it started.
1559.name: rhyhorn

1560.text: Ludicrously strong—when it butts heads with a mountain, it is the mountain that shatters. But its short legs struggle with turns, and it is incapable of stopping unless it collides with something.
1560.name: rhyhorn

1561.text: Walks on its hind legs. Shows signs of intelligence. Its armor-like hide even repels molten lava.
1561.name: rhydon

1562.text: By lightly spin­ ning its drill- like horn, it can easily shatter even a diamond in the rough.
1562.name: rhydon

1563.text: Its horn, which rotates like a drill, destroys tall buildings with one strike. It stands on its hind legs, and its brain is well developed.
1563.name: rhydon

1564.text: Its brain developed after it stood up on its hind legs. Its drill horn bores tunnels through solid rock.
1564.name: rhydon

1565.text: Its rugged hide protects it from even the heat of lava. However, the hide also makes it insensitive.
1565.name: rhydon

1566.text: Its brain developed when it began walking on hind legs. Its thick hide protects it even in magma.
1566.name: rhydon

1567.text: Standing on its hind legs freed its forelegs and made it smarter. It is very forgetful, however.
1567.name: rhydon

1568.text: Rhydon’s horn can crush even uncut diamonds. One sweeping blow of its tail can topple a building. This Pokémon’s hide is extremely tough. Even direct cannon hits don’t leave a scratch.
1568.name: rhydon

1569.text: Rhydon has a horn that serves as a drill. It is used for destroying rocks and boulders. This Pokémon occasionally rams into streams of magma, but the armor-like hide prevents it from feeling the heat.
1569.name: rhydon

1570.text: Its brain developed when it began walking on its hind legs. Its armor-like hide even repels molten lava.
1570.name: rhydon

1571.text: It begins walking on its hind legs after evolution. It can punch holes through boulders with its horn.
1571.name: rhydon

1572.text: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.
1572.name: rhydon

1573.text: Rapidly rotates its horn to bore through bedrock. It swaggers around volcanic regions, protected from the lava's heat by its tough, armorlike hide.
1573.name: rhydon

1574.text: Few in number and difficult to cap­ ture, it is said to bring happiness to the trainer who catches it.
1574.name: chansey

1575.text: People try to catch it for its extremely nutritious eggs, but it rarely can be found.
1575.name: chansey

1576.text: CHANSEY lay nutritionally excellent eggs every day. The eggs are so delicious, they are eagerly devoured by even those people who have lost their appetite.
1576.name: chansey

1577.text: A rare and elusive POKéMON that is said to bring happiness to those who manage to catch one.
1577.name: chansey

1578.text: It lays several eggs a day and won’t share them with those who have evil in their hearts.
1578.name: chansey

1579.text: It walks carefully to prevent its egg from breaking. However, it is extremely fast at running away.
1579.name: chansey

1580.text: Being few in number and difficult to capture, it is said to bring happiness to the Trainer who catches it.
1580.name: chansey

1581.text: A kindly Pokémon that lays highly nutritious eggs and shares them with injured Pokémon or people.
1581.name: chansey

1582.text: It is said to deliver happiness. Being compassionate, it shares its eggs with injured people.
1582.name: chansey

1583.text: It lays several eggs a day. The eggs are apparently rich in nutrients and extremely delicious.
1583.name: chansey

1584.text: Chansey lays nutritionally excellent eggs on an everyday basis. The eggs are so delicious, they are easily and eagerly devoured by even those people who have lost their appetite.
1584.name: chansey

1585.text: The eggs laid by Chansey are rich in nutrients and a favorite food of many Pokémon.
1585.name: chansey

1586.text: Not only are these Pokémon fast runners, they’re also few in number, so anyone who finds one must be lucky indeed.
1586.name: chansey

1587.text: It seems that other Pokémon’s efforts to take its delicious, nutritious egg away from it caused Chansey to get faster at fleeing.
1587.name: chansey

1588.text: Because the eggs on their bellies have been overharvested by people in the past, the Chansey population remains very small.
1588.name: chansey

1589.text: A gentle and kindhearted Pokémon that shares its nutritious eggs if it sees an injured Pokémon.
1589.name: chansey

1590.text: The egg Chansey carries is not only delicious but also packed with nutrition. It’s used as a high-class cooking ingredient.
1590.name: chansey

1591.text: This species was once very slow. To protect their eggs from other creatures, these Pokémon became able to flee quickly.
1591.name: chansey

1592.text: This purehearted Pokémon shares its eggs with the injured.
1592.name: chansey

1593.text: During battle, it constantly moves the vines that cover its body in order to annoy its opponent.
1593.name: tangela

1594.text: Its vines snap off easily and painlessly if they are grabbed, allowing it to make a quick getaway. The lost vines are replaced by new growth the very next day.
1594.name: tangela

1595.text: Blue plant vines cloak the POKéMON’s identity in a tangled mass. It entangles anything that gets close.
1595.name: tangela

1596.text: The whole body is swathed with wide vines that are similar to seaweed. The vines sway as it walks.
1596.name: tangela

1597.text: It is shrouded by blue vines. No one has seen the face hidden behind this growth of vines.
1597.name: tangela

1598.text: The vines that cloak its entire body are always jiggling. They effectively unnerve its foes.
1598.name: tangela

1599.text: The blue vines shrouding its body are covered in a growth of fine hair. It is known to be ticklish.
1599.name: tangela

1600.text: Many writhing vines cover it, so its true identity remains unknown. The blue vines grow its whole life long.
1600.name: tangela

1601.text: It tangles any moving thing with its vines. Their subtle shaking is ticklish if you get ensnared.
1601.name: tangela

1602.text: Tangela’s vines snap off easily if they are grabbed. This happens without pain, allowing it to make a quick getaway. The lost vines are replaced by newly grown vines the very next day.
1602.name: tangela

1603.text: Its identity is obscured by masses of thick blue vines. The vines are said to never stop growing.
1603.name: tangela

1604.text: Hidden beneath a tangle of vines that grows nonstop even if the vines are torn off, this Pokémon’s true appearance remains a mystery.
1604.name: tangela

1605.text: The vines of a Tangela have a distinct scent. In some parts of Galar, Tangela vines are used as herbs.
1605.name: tangela

1606.text: It is cloaked entirely in blue vines, preventing any glimpse of its true identity. The vines impart a refreshing sensation when chewed—they're useful as a spice.
1606.name: tangela

1607.text: To avoid crushing the baby it carries in its pouch, it always sleeps standing up.
1607.name: kangaskhan

1608.text: If you come across a young KANGASKHAN playing by itself, never try to catch it. The baby’s parent is sure to be in the area, and it will become violently enraged.
1608.name: kangaskhan

1609.text: The female raises its offspring in a pouch on its belly. It is skilled at attacking using COMET PUNCH.
1609.name: kangaskhan

1610.text: The infant rarely ventures out of its mother’s protective pouch until it is three years old.
1610.name: kangaskhan

1611.text: To protect its young, it will never give up during battle, no matter how badly wounded it is.
