1611.name: kangaskhan

1612.text: It raises its offspring in its belly pouch. It lets the baby out to play only when it feels safe.
1612.name: kangaskhan

1613.text: If it is safe, the young gets out of the belly pouch to play. The adult keeps a close eye on the youngster.
1613.name: kangaskhan

1614.text: If you come across a young Kangaskhan playing by itself, you must never disturb it or attempt to catch it. The baby Pokémon’s parent is sure to be in the area, and it will become violently enraged at you.
1614.name: kangaskhan

1615.text: Kangaskhan’s maternal love is so deep that it will brave death to protect its offspring.
1615.name: kangaskhan

1616.text: The child in its pouch leaves home after roughly three years. That is the only time the mother is heard to cry wildly.
1616.name: kangaskhan

1617.text: Kangaskhan protects its child by keeping it in its pouch. It has zero forgiveness for those who harm its child and will beat them down.
1617.name: kangaskhan

1618.text: You shouldn’t get close to the child when it’s playing outside its mother’s pouch. Its mother is always nearby watching over it.
1618.name: kangaskhan

1619.text: Raises its young in its belly pouch. Won’t run from any fight to keep its young protected.
1619.name: kangaskhan

1620.text: Although it’s carrying its baby in a pouch on its belly, Kangaskhan is swift on its feet. It intimidates its opponents with quick jabs.
1620.name: kangaskhan

1621.text: There are records of a lost human child being raised by a childless Kangaskhan.
1621.name: kangaskhan

1622.text: When they're in a safe location, they can be seen playfully tangling their tails together.
1622.name: horsea

1623.text: HORSEA eats small insects and moss off of rocks. If the ocean current turns fast, this POKéMON anchors itself by wrapping its tail around rocks or coral to prevent being washed away.
1623.name: horsea

1624.text: If HORSEA senses danger, it will reflexively spray a dense black ink from its mouth and try to escape. This POKéMON swims by cleverly flapping the fins on its back.
1624.name: horsea

1625.text: By cleverly flicking the fins on its back side to side, it moves in any direction while facing forward. It spits ink to escape if it senses danger.
1625.name: horsea

1626.text: It maintains balance using its tail, which is wound up like a coil. It may spray ink from its mouth.
1626.name: horsea

1627.text: If attacked by a larger enemy, it quickly swims to safety by adeptly controlling its well-developed dorsal fin.
1627.name: horsea

1628.text: Its big, developed fins move rapidly, allowing it to swim backward while still facing forward.
1628.name: horsea

1629.text: Known to shoot down flying bugs with precision blasts of ink from the surface of the water.
1629.name: horsea

1630.text: It makes its nest in the shade of corals. If it senses danger, it spits murky ink and flees.
1630.name: horsea

1631.text: Horsea eats small insects and moss off of rocks. If the ocean current turns fast, this Pokémon anchors itself by wrapping its tail around rocks or coral to prevent being washed away.
1631.name: horsea

1632.text: If Horsea senses danger, it will reflexively spray a dense black ink from its mouth and try to escape. This Pokémon swims by cleverly flapping the fin on its back.
1632.name: horsea

1633.text: If it senses any danger, it will vigorously spray water or a special type of ink from its mouth.
1633.name: horsea

1634.text: Horsea makes its home in oceans with gentle currents. If this Pokémon is under attack, it spits out pitch-black ink and escapes.
1634.name: horsea

1635.text: They swim with dance-like motions and cause whirlpools to form. Horsea compete to see which of them can generate the biggest whirlpool.
1635.name: horsea

1636.text: The male raises the young. If it is approached, it uses its toxic spikes to fend off the intruder.
1636.name: seadra

1637.text: SEADRA sleeps after wriggling itself between the branches of coral. Those trying to harvest coral are occasionally stung by this POKéMON’s poison barbs if they fail to notice it.
1637.name: seadra

1638.text: SEADRA generates whirlpools by spinning its body. The whirlpools are strong enough to swallow even fishing boats. This POKéMON weakens prey with these currents, then swallows it whole.
1638.name: seadra

1639.text: The poisonous barbs all over its body are highly valued as ingredients for making traditional herbal medicine. It shows no mercy to anything approaching its nest.
1639.name: seadra

1640.text: An examination of its cells revealed the presence of a gene not found in HORSEA. It became a hot topic.
1640.name: seadra

1641.text: Its fin-tips leak poison. Its fins and bones are highly valued as ingredients in herbal medicine.
1641.name: seadra

1642.text: Its spines provide protection. Its fins and bones are prized as traditional-medicine ingredients.
1642.name: seadra

1643.text: Its body bristles with sharp spikes. Carelessly trying to touch it could cause fainting from the spikes.
1643.name: seadra

1644.text: It is capable of swimming backwards by rapidly flapping its winglike pectoral fins and stout tail.
1644.name: seadra

1645.text: Seadra sleeps after wriggling itself between the branches of coral. Those trying to harvest coral are occasionally stung by this Pokémon’s poison barbs if they fail to notice it.
1645.name: seadra

1646.text: Seadra generates whirlpools by spinning its body. The whirlpools are strong enough to swallow even fishing boats. This Pokémon weakens prey with these currents, then swallows it whole.
1646.name: seadra

1647.text: Touching the back fin causes numbness. It hooks its tail to coral to stay in place while sleeping.
1647.name: seadra

1648.text: It’s the males that raise the offspring. While Seadra are raising young, the spines on their backs secrete thicker and stronger poison.
1648.name: seadra

1649.text: Seadra’s mouth is slender, but its suction power is strong. In an instant, Seadra can suck in food that’s larger than the opening of its mouth.
1649.name: seadra

1650.text: During spawning season, they swim gracefully in the water, searching for their perfect mate.
1650.name: goldeen

1651.text: GOLDEEN is a very beautiful POKéMON with fins that billow elegantly in water. However, don’t let your guard down around this POKéMON - it could ram you powerfully with its horn.
1651.name: goldeen

1652.text: GOLDEEN loves swimming wild and free in rivers and ponds. If one of these POKéMON is placed in an aquarium, it will shatter even the thickest glass with one ram of its horn and make its escape.
1652.name: goldeen

1653.text: In the springtime, schools of GOLDEEN can be seen swimming up falls and rivers. It metes out staggering damage with its single horn.
1653.name: goldeen

1654.text: Its tail fin billows like an elegant ballroom dress, giving it the nickname of “The Water Queen.”
1654.name: goldeen

1655.text: It swims elegantly by flittering its tail fin as if it were a dress. It has the look of a queen.
1655.name: goldeen

1656.text: A strong swimmer, it is capable of swimming nonstop up fast streams at a steady speed of five knots per hour.
1656.name: goldeen

1657.text: Though it appears very elegant when swimming with fins unfurled, it can jab powerfully with its horn.
1657.name: goldeen

1658.text: It swims at a steady 5 knots. If it senses danger, it will strike back with its sharp horn.
1658.name: goldeen

1659.text: Goldeen is a very beautiful Pokémon with fins that billow elegantly in water. However, don’t let your guard down around this Pokémon—it could ram you powerfully with its horn.
1659.name: goldeen

1660.text: Goldeen loves swimming wild and free in rivers and ponds. If one of these Pokémon is placed in an aquarium, it will shatter even the thickest glass with one ram of its horn and make its escape.
1660.name: goldeen

1661.text: When the weather grows warm, they form groups and swim upriver. This sight serves as a poetic reminder that spring has arrived.
1661.name: goldeen

1662.text: Spellbound by the length of its horn and the beauty of its fins, many strange Trainers raise Goldeen and nothing but Goldeen.
1662.name: goldeen

1663.text: Although known for their splendid tail fins, Goldeen apparently compete among themselves to see whose horn is thickest and sharpest.
1663.name: goldeen

1664.text: The way it swims along fluttering its dress-like fins has earned it the name “princess of the water.”
1664.name: goldeen

1665.text: When it is time for them to lay eggs, they can be seen swimming up rivers and falls in large groups.
1665.name: goldeen

1666.text: Its dorsal, pectoral, and tail fins wave elegantly in water. That is why it is known as the Water Dancer.
1666.name: goldeen

1667.text: Its dorsal and pectoral fins are strongly developed like muscles. It can swim at a speed of five knots.
1667.name: goldeen

1668.text: When autumn comes, the males patrol the area around their nests in order to protect their offspring.
1668.name: seaking

1669.text: It punches holes in boulders on stream­ beds. This is a clever innovation that prevents its eggs from being attacked or washed away by the current.
1669.name: seaking

1670.text: The horn on its head is sharp like a drill. It bores a hole in a boulder to make its nest.
1670.name: seaking

1671.text: To protect its family, it will fight with its drill-sharp horn. It lives in hollowed rocks in streams.
1671.name: seaking

1672.text: During spawning season, SEAKING gather from all over, causing rivers to appear a brilliant red.
1672.name: seaking

1673.text: In the autumn spawning season, they can be seen swimming powerfully up rivers and creeks.
1673.name: seaking

1674.text: It makes its nest by hollowing out boulders in streams with its horn. It defends its eggs with its life.
1674.name: seaking

1675.text: In the autumn, Seaking males can be seen performing courtship dances in riverbeds to woo females. During this season, this Pokémon’s body coloration is at its most beautiful.
1675.name: seaking

1676.text: Seaking is very protective of its eggs. The male and female will take turns patrolling around their nest and eggs. The guarding of eggs by these Pokémon goes on for over a month.
1676.name: seaking

1677.text: When the weather grows cold, its whole body flushes a deep red. This sight serves as a poetic reminder that autumn has arrived.
1677.name: seaking

1678.text: Trainers who are crazy for Seaking are divided into horn enthusiasts and fin enthusiasts. The two groups do not get along well.
1678.name: seaking

1679.text: Its horn spins like a drill to steadily hollow out rocks—even harder ones. The coloration of the male is more vivid.
1679.name: seaking

1680.text: To attract females, males dance on the river’s floor. The females gather around the male that dances most gracefully.
1680.name: seaking

1681.text: It is the male’s job to make a nest by carving out boulders in a stream using the horn on its head.
1681.name: seaking

1682.text: In autumn, its body becomes more fatty in preparing to propose to a mate. It takes on beautiful colors.
1682.name: seaking

1683.text: Using its horn, it bores holes in riverbed boulders, making nests to prevent its eggs from washing away.
1683.name: seaking

1684.text: As long as the center section is unharmed, it can grow back fully even if it is chopped to bits.
1684.name: staryu

1685.text: When the stars twinkle at night, it floats up from the sea floor, and its body's center core flickers.
1685.name: staryu

1686.text: It gathers with others in the night and makes its red core glow on and off with the twinkling stars. It can regenerate limbs if they are severed from its body.
1686.name: staryu

1687.text: An enigmatic POKéMON that can effortlessly regenerate any appendage it loses in battle.
1687.name: staryu

1688.text: At night, the middle of its body slowly flickers with the same rhythm as a human heartbeat.
1688.name: staryu

1689.text: If its body is torn, it can grow back if the red core remains. The core flashes at midnight.
1689.name: staryu

1690.text: As long as its red core remains, it can regenerate its body instantly, even if it’s torn apart.
1690.name: staryu

1691.text: Even if its body is torn, it can regenerate as long as the glowing central core remains intact.
1691.name: staryu

1692.text: It appears in large numbers by seashores. At night, its central core flashes with a red light.
1692.name: staryu

1693.text: Staryu’s center section has an organ called the core that shines bright red. If you go to a beach toward the end of summer, the glowing cores of these Pokémon look like the stars in the sky.
1693.name: staryu

1694.text: Staryu apparently communicates with the stars in the night sky by flashing the red core at the center of its body. If parts of its body are torn, this Pokémon simply regenerates the missing pieces and limbs.
1694.name: staryu

1695.text: Large numbers of these Pokémon make their home at the seaside. At night, a strange red glow radiates from the center of their bodies.
1695.name: staryu

1696.text: This Pokémon gets nibbled on by Lumineon and others. Thanks to its red core, it regenerates fast, so it’s unconcerned by their snack attacks.
1696.name: staryu

1697.text: In many places, there are folktales of stardust falling into the ocean and becoming Staryu.
1697.name: staryu

1698.text: No number of injuries can bother Staryu. Its amazing regenerative powers return it to its previous state in half a day!
1698.name: staryu

1699.text: As long as the center section is unharmed, this Pokémon can grow back fully even if it is chopped to bits.
1699.name: staryu

1700.text: If you visit a beach at the end of summer, you’ll be able to see groups of Staryu lighting up in a steady rhythm.
1700.name: staryu

1701.text: Fish Pokémon nibble at it, but Staryu isn’t bothered. Its body regenerates quickly, even if part of it is completely torn off.
1701.name: staryu

1702.text: It is said that it uses the seven- colored core of its body to send electric waves into outer space.
1702.name: starmie

1703.text: People in ancient times imagined that STARMIE were transformed from the reflections of stars that twinkled on gentle waves at night.
1703.name: starmie

1704.text: This POKéMON has a geometric body. Because of its body, the locals suspect that it is an alien creature.
1704.name: starmie

1705.text: The middle section of its body is called the core. It glows in a different color each time it is seen.
1705.name: starmie

1706.text: Regardless of the environment it lives in, its body grows to form a symmetrical geometric shape.
1706.name: starmie

1707.text: Its core shines in many colors and sends radio signals into space to communicate with something.
1707.name: starmie

1708.text: Its central core glows with the seven colors of the rainbow. Some people value the core as a gem.
1708.name: starmie

1709.text: At the center of its body is a red core, which sends mysterious radio signals into the night sky.
1709.name: starmie

1710.text: Starmie’s center section—the core—glows brightly in seven colors. Because of its luminous nature, this Pokémon has been given the nickname “the gem of the sea.”
1710.name: starmie

1711.text: Starmie swims through water by spinning its star-shaped body as if it were a propeller on a ship. The core at the center of this Pokémon’s body glows in seven colors.
1711.name: starmie

1712.text: Its shining core is thought to receive and transmit enigmatic signals. It has been known to cause headaches in those who approach it.
1712.name: starmie

1713.text: Its unusual body shape, reminiscent of abstract art, led local people to spread rumors that this Pokémon may be an invader from outer space.
1713.name: starmie

1714.text: Its sparkling core is called “the gem of the sea.” This core can be made into high-priced accessories that are traded in secret.
1714.name: starmie

1715.text: It rotates its geometrically shaped body to swim through the water. It always seems to be sending out mysterious radio waves.
1715.name: starmie

1716.text: The center section is named the core. People think it is communicating when it glows in seven colors.
1716.name: starmie

1717.text: This Pokémon has an organ known as its core. The organ glows in seven colors when Starmie is unleashing its potent psychic powers.
1717.name: starmie

1718.text: Starmie swims by spinning its body at high speed. As this Pokémon cruises through the ocean, it absorbs tiny plankton.
1718.name: starmie

1719.text: It uses the mysterious power it has in its fingers to solidify air into an invisible wall.
1719.name: mr-mime

1720.text: A MR. MIME is a master of pantomime. It can convince others that something unseeable actually exists. Once believed, the imaginary object does become real.
1720.name: mr-mime

1721.text: If interrupted while it is miming, it will suddenly DOUBLESLAP the offender with its broad hands.
1721.name: mr-mime

1722.text: It is a pantomime expert that can create invisible but solid walls using miming gestures.
1722.name: mr-mime

1723.text: A skilled mime from birth, it gains the ability to create invisible objects as it matures.
1723.name: mr-mime

1724.text: Its fingertips emit a peculiar force field that hardens air to create an actual wall.
1724.name: mr-mime

1725.text: It shapes an invisible wall in midair by minutely vibrating its fingertips to stop molecules in the air.
1725.name: mr-mime

1726.text: Emanations from its fingertips solidify the air into invisible walls that repel even harsh attacks.
1726.name: mr-mime

1727.text: It is adept at conning people. It is said to be able to create walls out of thin air by miming.
1727.name: mr-mime

1728.text: Mr. Mime is a master of pantomime. Its gestures and motions convince watchers that something unseeable actually exists. Once the watchers are convinced, the unseeable thing exists as if it were real.
1728.name: mr-mime

1729.text: Its pantomime skills are wonderful. You may become enraptured while watching it, but next thing you know, Mr. Mime has made a real wall.
1729.name: mr-mime

1730.text: It creates invisible walls with its pantomiming. If you don’t act impressed, it will attack you with a double slap!
1730.name: mr-mime

1731.text: Always practicing its pantomime act. It makes enemies believe something exists that really doesn’t.
1731.name: mr-mime

1732.text: The broadness of its hands may be no coincidence—many scientists believe its palms became enlarged specifically for pantomiming.
1732.name: mr-mime

1733.text: It’s known for its top-notch pantomime skills. It protects itself from all sorts of attacks by emitting auras from its fingers to create walls.
1733.name: mr-mime

1734.text: The behavior of this clown-like Pokémon reminds one of pantomime. It creates invisible walls using a force emitted from its fingertips.
1734.name: mr-mime

1735.text: It's very proud of its speed. It moves so fast that its opponent does not even know what knocked it down.
1735.name: scyther

1736.text: SCYTHER is blindingly fast. Its blazing speed enhances the effectiveness of the twin scythes on its forearms. This POKéMON’s scythes are so effective, they can slice through thick logs in one wicked stroke.
1736.name: scyther

1737.text: Its blindingly fast speed adds to the sharpness of its twin forearm scythes. The scythes can slice through thick logs in one wicked stroke.
1737.name: scyther

1738.text: With ninja-like agility and speed, it can create the illusion that there is more than one of itself.
1738.name: scyther

1739.text: It is nearly impossible to parry its attacking scythes. Its movements are like a ninja’s.
1739.name: scyther

1740.text: When it moves, it leaves only a blur. If it hides in grass, its protective coloration makes it invisible.
1740.name: scyther

1741.text: The sharp scythes on its forearms become increasingly sharp by cutting through hard objects.
1741.name: scyther

1742.text: It tears and shreds prey with its wickedly sharp scythes. It very rarely spreads its wings to fly.
1742.name: scyther

1743.text: It slashes through grass with its sharp scythes, moving too fast for the human eye to track.
1743.name: scyther

1744.text: Scyther is blindingly fast. Its blazing speed enhances the effectiveness of the twin scythes on its forearms. This Pokémon’s scythes are so effective, they can slice through thick logs in one wicked stroke.
1744.name: scyther

1745.text: It confuses its prey with its quick, ninja-like movements. Then, in an instant, it cleaves them with its scythes.
1745.name: scyther

1746.text: While young, they live together deep in the mountains, training themselves in how to fight with their scythes and move at high speeds.
1746.name: scyther

1747.text: Its two sharp scythes are more than just weapons. It uses them with dexterity to dress its prey before eating.
1747.name: scyther

1748.text: Some call it a ninja. Its movements— imperceptibly quick—are sufficient to cleave the air in two. It’s very popular in Alola.
1748.name: scyther

1749.text: Leaps out of tall grass and slices prey with its scythes. The movement looks like that of a ninja.
1749.name: scyther

1750.text: As Scyther fights more and more battles, its scythes become sharper and sharper. With a single slice, Scyther can fell a massive tree.
1750.name: scyther

1751.text: If you come across an area in a forest where a lot of the trees have been cut down, what you’ve found is a Scyther’s territory.
1751.name: scyther

1752.text: The large, wickedly sharp scythes on its forearms are truly fearsome weapons. Prey's attempts to flee are unfailingly thwarted by this Pokémon's nimble motions.
1752.name: scyther

1753.text: It has several different cry pat­ terns, each of which seems to have its own meaning.
1753.name: jynx

1754.text: It rocks its body rhythmically. It appears to alter the rhythm depending on how it is feeling.
1754.name: jynx

1755.text: It speaks a language similar to that of humans. However, it seems to use dancing to communicate.
1755.name: jynx

1756.text: Its cries sound like human speech. However, it is impossible to tell what it is trying to say.
1756.name: jynx

1757.text: It wiggles its hips as it walks. It can cause people to dance in unison with it.
1757.name: jynx

1758.text: It speaks using a language that sounds human. Research is under way to determine what is being said.
1758.name: jynx

1759.text: Jynx walks rhythmically, swaying and shaking its hips as if it were dancing. Its motions are so bouncingly alluring, people seeing it are compelled to shake their hips without giving any thought to what they are doing.
1759.name: jynx

1760.text: It sways its hips to a rhythm all its own. The precise movements of Jynx living in Alola are truly wonderful.
1760.name: jynx

1761.text: Its strange cries sound like human language. There are some musicians who compose songs for Jynx to sing.
1761.name: jynx

1762.text: Appears to move to a rhythm of its own, as if it were dancing. It wiggles its hips as it walks.
1762.name: jynx

1763.text: In certain parts of Galar, Jynx was once feared and worshiped as the Queen of Ice.
1763.name: jynx

1764.text: The Jynx of Galar often have beautiful and delicate voices. Some of these Pokémon have even gathered a fan base.
1764.name: jynx

1765.text: When two ELECTABUZZ touch, they control the electric currents to communicate their feelings.
1765.name: electabuzz

1766.text: When a storm approaches, it competes with others to scale heights that are likely to be stricken by lightning. Some towns use ELECTABUZZ in place of lightning rods.
1766.name: electabuzz

1767.text: Normally found near power plants, they can wander away and cause major blackouts in cities.
1767.name: electabuzz

1768.text: Half of all blackouts occur when this Pokémon appears at power plants and eats electricity.
1768.name: electabuzz

1769.text: Its body constantly discharges electricity. Getting close to it will make your hair stand on end.
1769.name: electabuzz

1770.text: It windmills its arms to slightly boost its punches. Foes have been known to escape in the meantime.
1770.name: electabuzz

1771.text: Research is progressing on storing lightning in Electabuzz so this energy can be used at any time.
1771.name: electabuzz

1772.text: Electricity runs across the surface of its body. In darkness, its entire body glows a whitish blue.
1772.name: electabuzz

1773.text: It loves to feed on strong electricity. It occasionally appears around large power plants and so on.
1773.name: electabuzz

1774.text: When a storm arrives, gangs of this Pokémon compete with each other to scale heights that are likely to be stricken by lightning bolts. Some towns use Electabuzz in place of lightning rods.
1774.name: electabuzz

1775.text: Half of all sudden blackouts are caused by Electabuzz gathering at electric power plants and gobbling up electricity.
1775.name: electabuzz

1776.text: Electricity leaks from it in amounts far greater than the amount of electricity it eats.
1776.name: electabuzz

1777.text: Electricity permeates its body. It swings its arms round and round to charge up electricity before unleashing a punch.
1777.name: electabuzz

1778.text: While it’s often blamed for power outages, the truth is the cause of outages is more often an error on the part of the electric company.
1778.name: electabuzz

1779.text: If a major power outage occurs, it is certain that this Pokémon has eaten electricity at a power plant.
1779.name: electabuzz

1780.text: Many power plants keep Ground-type Pokémon around as a defense against Electabuzz that come seeking electricity.
1780.name: electabuzz

1781.text: With the coming of a storm, many of these Pokémon will gather under tall trees and sit there waiting for lightning to strike.
1781.name: electabuzz

1782.text: Feeds on electrical energy. During sudden showers beneath looming thunderclouds, one can observe Electabuzz scaling tall trees, where the Pokémon will then wait for lightning to strike.
1782.name: electabuzz

1783.text: It moves more frequently in hot areas. It can heal itself by dipping its wound into lava.
1783.name: magmar

1784.text: In battle, it blows out intense flames from all over its body to intimidate its foe. These fiery bursts create heat waves that ignite grass and trees in the area.
1784.name: magmar

1785.text: Its body always burns with an orange glow that enables it to hide perfectly amidst flames.
1785.name: magmar

1786.text: It dislikes cold places, so it blows scorching flames to make the environment suitable for itself.
1786.name: magmar

1787.text: The fiery surface of its body gives off a wavering, rippling glare that is similar to the sun.
1787.name: magmar

1788.text: When it breathes deeply, heat waves form around its body, making it hard to see clearly.
1788.name: magmar

1789.text: The scorching fire exhaled by Magmar forms heat waves around its body, making it hard to see the Pokémon clearly.
1789.name: magmar

1790.text: Found near the mouth of a volcano. This fire-breather’s body temperature is nearly 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit.
1790.name: magmar

1791.text: Born in the spout of a volcano, its body is covered by flames that shimmer like the sun.
1791.name: magmar

1792.text: In battle, Magmar blows out intensely hot flames from all over its body to intimidate its opponent. This Pokémon’s fiery bursts create heat waves that ignite grass and trees in its surroundings.
1792.name: magmar

1793.text: When it’s tired, it leaps into the mouth of a volcano and soaks its body in magma to ease its weariness. Its body burns at 2,192 degrees F.
1793.name: magmar

1794.text: When angered, it spouts brilliant fire from all over its body. It doesn’t calm down until its opponent has burned to ash.
1794.name: magmar

1795.text: Its entire body is burning. When it breathes, the temperature rises. When it sneezes, flames shoot out!
1795.name: magmar

1796.text: The hotter the place, the better they feel. Magmar in Alola are said to be hardier than those in other areas.
1796.name: magmar

1797.text: Born in an active volcano. Its body is always cloaked in flames, so it looks like a big ball of fire.
1797.name: magmar

1798.text: Magmar dispatches its prey with fire. But it regrets this habit once it realizes that it has burned its intended prey to a charred crisp.
1798.name: magmar

1799.text: These Pokémon’s bodies are constantly burning. Magmar are feared as one of the causes behind fires.
1799.name: magmar

1800.text: Legend has it that this Pokémon was born from the crater of a volcano. When wounded, it bathes in lava to heal its body, much as one would soak in a hot spring.
1800.name: magmar

1801.text: If it fails to crush the victim in its pincers, it will swing it around and toss it hard.
1801.name: pinsir

1802.text: Swings its long antlers wildly to attack. During cold periods, it hides deep in forests.
1802.name: pinsir

1803.text: When the tempera­ ture drops at night, it sleeps on treetops or among roots where it is well hidden.
1803.name: pinsir

1804.text: Their pincers are strong enough to shatter thick logs. Because they dislike cold, PINSIR burrow and sleep under the ground on chilly nights.
1804.name: pinsir

1805.text: Its two long pincer horns are powerful. Once they grip an enemy, they won’t release until the foe is torn.
1805.name: pinsir

1806.text: If it fails to crush the foe in its pincers, it will swing around and toss the opponent.
1806.name: pinsir

1807.text: With its pincer horns, it digs burrows to sleep in at night. In the morning, damp soil clings to its body.
1807.name: pinsir

1808.text: It grips prey with its powerful pincers and will not let go until the prey is torn in half.
1808.name: pinsir

1809.text: It grips prey with its pincers until the prey is torn in half. What it can’t tear, it tosses far.
1809.name: pinsir

1810.text: It swings its long pincer horns wildly to attack. During cold periods, it hides deep in forests.
1810.name: pinsir

1811.text: Pinsir is astoundingly strong. It can grip a foe weighing twice its weight in its horns and easily lift it. This Pokémon’s movements turn sluggish in cold places.
1811.name: pinsir

1812.text: Pinsir has a pair of massive horns. Protruding from the surface of these horns are thorns. These thorns are driven deeply into the foe’s body when the pincer closes, making it tough for the foe to escape.
1812.name: pinsir

1813.text: It grips its prey in its pincers and splits them apart. Although it is a powerful Pokémon, it can’t deal with the cold.
1813.name: pinsir

1814.text: One solid blow from its horns is enough to split apart a large tree. Its greatest rival in Alola is Vikavolt.
1814.name: pinsir

1815.text: It gets into territorial disputes with Vikavolt. For some reason, it apparently gets along well with Heracross in Alola.
1815.name: pinsir

1816.text: Although it’s tough, it can’t handle cold well. When night falls, it buries itself in leafage and sleeps.
1816.name: pinsir

1817.text: Grips its prey in its pincers and squeezes hard! It can’t move if it’s cold out, so it lives in warm places.
1817.name: pinsir

1818.text: These Pokémon judge one another based on pincers. Thicker, more impressive pincers make for more popularity with the opposite gender.
1818.name: pinsir

1819.text: This Pokémon clamps its pincers down on its prey and then either splits the prey in half or flings it away.
1819.name: pinsir

1820.text: These violent POKéMON fight with other mem­ bers of their herd in order to prove their strength.
1820.name: tauros

1821.text: It is not satisfied unless it is rampaging at all times. If there is no opponent for TAUROS to battle, it will charge at thick trees and knock them down to calm itself.
1821.name: tauros

1822.text: When it targets an enemy, it charges furiously while whipping its body with its long tails.
1822.name: tauros

1823.text: They fight each other by locking horns. The herd’s protector takes pride in its battle-scarred horns.
1823.name: tauros

1824.text: Once it takes aim at its foe, it makes a headlong charge. It is famous for its violent nature.
1824.name: tauros

1825.text: After heightening its will to fight by whipping itself with its three tails, it charges at full speed.
1825.name: tauros

1826.text: When it is about to tackle, it whips its body repeatedly with its three long tails.
1826.name: tauros

1827.text: This Pokémon is not satisfied unless it is rampaging at all times. If there is no opponent for Tauros to battle, it will charge at thick trees and knock them down to calm itself.
1827.name: tauros

1828.text: Historically, people in areas all over the world have ridden Tauros, but the practice is said to have started in Alola.
1828.name: tauros

1829.text: Although it’s known to be a fierce Pokémon, Tauros in the Alola region are said to possess a measure of calmness.
1829.name: tauros

1830.text: They live in groups. The one with the longest, thickest, and most-scarred horns is the boss of the herd.
1830.name: tauros

1831.text: The climate seems to be related to the reason Tauros in Alola are a little calmer than those in other regions.
1831.name: tauros

1832.text: A rowdy Pokémon with a lot of stamina. Once running, it won’t stop until it hits something.
1832.name: tauros

1833.text: When Tauros begins whipping itself with its tails, it’s a warning that the Pokémon is about to charge with astounding speed.
1833.name: tauros

1834.text: The Tauros of the Galar region are volatile in nature, and they won’t allow people to ride on their backs.
1834.name: tauros

1835.text: Its swimming muscles are weak, so it is easily washed away by currents. In places where water pools, you can see many MAGIKARP deposited there by the flow.
1835.name: magikarp

1836.text: It is said to be the world’s weakest Pokémon. No one knows why it has managed to survive.
1836.name: magikarp

1837.text: It is unable to swim against even slow-moving currents. It always splashes about for some reason.
1837.name: magikarp

1838.text: An underpowered, pathetic Pokémon. It may jump high on rare occasions, but usually not more than seven feet.
1838.name: magikarp

1839.text: For no reason, it jumps and splashes about, making it easy for predators like PIDGEOTTO to catch it mid-jump.
1839.name: magikarp

1840.text: A Magikarp living for many years can leap a mountain using Splash. The move remains useless, though.
1840.name: magikarp

1841.text: In the distant past, it was somewhat stronger than the horribly weak descendants that exist today.
1841.name: magikarp

1842.text: Magikarp is a pathetic excuse for a Pokémon that is only capable of flopping and splashing. This behavior prompted scientists to undertake research into it.
1842.name: magikarp

1843.text: Magikarp is virtually useless in battle as it can only splash around. As a result, it is considered to be weak. However, it is actually a very hardy Pokémon that can survive in any body of water no matter how polluted it is.
1843.name: magikarp

1844.text: Although weak and helpless, this Pokémon is incredibly fertile. They exist in such multitudes, you’ll soon grow tired of seeing them.
1844.name: magikarp

1845.text: Its reckless leaps make it easy pickings for predators. On the bright side, many Pokémon enjoy longer life spans, thanks to Magikarp.
1845.name: magikarp

1846.text: In the distant past, they were fairly strong, but they have become gradually weaker over time.
1846.name: magikarp

1847.text: Thanks to their strong hold on life, dirty water doesn’t bother them at all. They live in waters all over the world!
1847.name: magikarp

1848.text: Famous for being very unreliable. It can be found swimming in seas, lakes, rivers, and shallow puddles.
1848.name: magikarp

1849.text: It is virtually worthless in terms of both power and speed. It is the most weak and pathetic Pokémon in the world.
1849.name: magikarp

1850.text: This weak and pathetic Pokémon gets easily pushed along rivers when there are strong currents.
1850.name: magikarp

1851.text: A feeble, pitiful imbecile of a Pokémon that is nonetheless very hardy. Unperturbed by turbid water, it can be found living in all sorts of places.
1851.name: magikarp

1852.text: They say that during past wars, GYARADOS would appear and leave blazing ruins in its wake.
1852.name: gyarados

1853.text: Once it appears, it goes on a ram­ page. It remains enraged until it demolishes every­ thing around it.
1853.name: gyarados

1854.text: It appears when­ ever there is world conflict, burning down any place it travels through.
1854.name: gyarados

1855.text: It is an extremely vicious and violent POKéMON. When humans begin to fight, it will appear and burn everything to the ground with intensely hot flames.
1855.name: gyarados

1856.text: Once it appears, its rage never settles until it has razed the fields and mountains around it.
1856.name: gyarados

1857.text: Once it appears, it goes on a rampage. It remains enraged until it demolishes everything around it.
1857.name: gyarados

1858.text: In ancient literature, there is a record of a Gyarados that razed a village when violence flared.
1858.name: gyarados

1859.text: Rarely seen in the wild. Huge and vicious, it is capable of destroying entire cities in a rage.
1859.name: gyarados

1860.text: When Magikarp evolves into Gyarados, its brain cells undergo a structural transformation. It is said that this transformation is to blame for this Pokémon’s wildly violent nature.
1860.name: gyarados

1861.text: Once Gyarados goes on a rampage, its ferociously violent blood doesn’t calm until it has burned everything down. There are records of this Pokémon’s rampages lasting a whole month.
1861.name: gyarados

1862.text: A tale is told of a town that angered Gyarados. Before the sun rose the next day, flames utterly consumed the town, leaving not a trace behind.
1862.name: gyarados

1863.text: There are people who swear that any place Gyarados appears is fated for destruction.
1863.name: gyarados

1864.text: It fires hyper beams in all directions, burning the surrounding area to ash. There are some regions where it’s called “the deity of destruction.”
1864.name: gyarados

1865.text: The energy from evolution stimulated its brain cells strongly, causing it to become very ferocious.
1865.name: gyarados

1866.text: Brutally vicious and enormously destructive. Known for totally destroying cities in ancient times.
1866.name: gyarados

1867.text: It has an extremely aggressive nature. The Hyper Beam it shoots from its mouth totally incinerates all targets.
1867.name: gyarados

1868.text: Once it begins to rampage, a Gyarados will burn everything down, even in a harsh storm.
1868.name: gyarados

1869.text: I suspect this Pokémon to be the true identity of a dragon written of in ancient texts, which claimed that it razed an entire village with white-hot beams from its maw.
1869.name: gyarados

1870.text: This gentle POKéMON loves to give people rides and provides a ve­ ry comfortable way to get around.
1870.name: lapras

1871.text: People have driven LAPRAS almost to the point of extinction. In the evenings, it is said to sing plaintively as it seeks what few others of its kind still remain.
1871.name: lapras

1872.text: A POKéMON that has been overhunted almost to extinction. It can ferry people on its back.
1872.name: lapras

1873.text: It ferries people across the sea on its back. It may sing an enchanting cry if it is in a good mood.
1873.name: lapras

1874.text: It loves crossing the sea with people and Pokémon on its back. It understands human speech.
1874.name: lapras

1875.text: Able to understand human speech and very intelligent, it loves to swim in the sea with people on its back.
1875.name: lapras

1876.text: They have gentle hearts. Because they rarely fight, many have been caught. Their number has dwindled.
1876.name: lapras

1877.text: Its high intelligence enables it to understand human speech. It likes to ferry people on its back.
1877.name: lapras

1878.text: People have driven Lapras almost to the point of extinction. In the evenings, this Pokémon is said to sing plaintively as it seeks what few others of its kind still remain.
1878.name: lapras

1879.text: Its high intelligence enables it to comprehend human speech. When it’s in a good mood, it sings in its beautiful voice.
1879.name: lapras

1880.text: These Pokémon were once near extinction due to poaching. Following protective regulations, there is now an overabundance of them.
1880.name: lapras

1881.text: It likes swimming around with people on its back. In the Alola region, it’s an important means of transportation over water.
1881.name: lapras

1882.text: They’ve been so cherished that there’s now an overabundance. The fish Pokémon population has declined in waters with too many Lapras.
1882.name: lapras

1883.text: A gentle soul that can understand human speech. It can ferry people across the sea on its back.
1883.name: lapras

1884.text: A smart and kindhearted Pokémon, it glides across the surface of the sea while its beautiful song echoes around it.
1884.name: lapras

1885.text: Crossing icy seas is no issue for this cold-resistant Pokémon. Its smooth skin is a little cool to the touch.
1885.name: lapras

1886.text: A DITTO rearranges its cell structure to transform itself. However, if it tries to change based on its memory, it will get details wrong.
1886.name: ditto

1887.text: Capable of copying an opponent’s genetic code to instantly transform itself into a duplicate of the enemy.
1887.name: ditto

1888.text: It can transform into anything. When it sleeps, it changes into a stone to avoid being attacked.
1888.name: ditto

1889.text: Its transformation ability is perfect. However, if made to laugh, it can’t maintain its disguise.
1889.name: ditto

1890.text: It has the ability to reconstitute its entire cellular structure to transform into whatever it sees.
1890.name: ditto

1891.text: It can freely recombine its own cellular structure to transform into other life-forms.
1891.name: ditto

1892.text: Ditto rearranges its cell structure to transform itself into other shapes. However, if it tries to transform itself into something by relying on its memory, this Pokémon manages to get details wrong.
1892.name: ditto

1893.text: It can reorganize its cells to make itself into a duplicate of anything it sees. The quality of the duplicate depends on the individual.
1893.name: ditto

1894.text: With its astonishing capacity for metamorphosis, it can get along with anything. It does not get along well with its fellow Ditto.
1894.name: ditto

1895.text: While it can transform into anything, each Ditto apparently has its own strengths and weaknesses when it comes to transformations.
1895.name: ditto

1896.text: It transforms into whatever it sees. If the thing it’s transforming into isn’t right in front of it, Ditto relies on its memory—so sometimes it fails.
1896.name: ditto

1897.text: When it spots an enemy, its body transfigures into an almost-perfect copy of its opponent.
1897.name: ditto

1898.text: It can reconstitute its entire cellular structure to change into what it sees, but it returns to normal when it relaxes.
1898.name: ditto

1899.text: When it encounters another Ditto, it will move faster than normal to duplicate that opponent exactly.
1899.name: ditto

1900.text: Its genetic code is unstable, so it could evolve in a variety of ways. There are only a few alive.
1900.name: eevee

1901.text: Its ability to evolve into many forms allows it to adapt smoothly and perfectly to any environment.
1901.name: eevee

1902.text: An EEVEE has an unstable genetic makeup that suddenly mutates due to its environment. Radiation from various STONES causes this POKéMON to evolve.
1902.name: eevee

1903.text: An extremely rare POKéMON that may evolve in a number of different ways depending on stimuli.
1903.name: eevee

1904.text: Its genetic code is irregular. It may mutate if it is exposed to radiation from element STONES.
1904.name: eevee

1905.text: Its irregularly configured DNA is affected by its surroundings. It evolves if its environment changes.
1905.name: eevee

1906.text: Because its genetic makeup is irregular, it quickly changes its form due to a variety of causes.
1906.name: eevee

1907.text: A rare Pokémon that adapts to harsh environments by taking on different evolutionary forms.
1907.name: eevee

1908.text: Eevee has an unstable genetic makeup that suddenly mutates due to the environment in which it lives. Radiation from various stones causes this Pokémon to evolve.
1908.name: eevee

1909.text: Possessing an unbalanced and unstable genetic makeup, it conceals many possible evolutions.
1909.name: eevee

1910.text: Current studies show it can evolve into an incredible eight different species of Pokémon.
1910.name: eevee

1911.text: The question of why only Eevee has such unstable genes has still not been solved.
1911.name: eevee

1912.text: Its genes are easily influenced by its surroundings. Even its face starts to look like that of its Trainer.
1912.name: eevee

1913.text: It can evolve into a variety of forms. Eevee’s genes are the key to solving the mysteries of Pokémon evolution.
1913.name: eevee

1914.text: It has the ability to alter the composition of its body to suit its surrounding environment.
1914.name: eevee

1915.text: Thanks to its unstable genetic makeup, this special Pokémon conceals many different possible evolutions.
1915.name: eevee

1916.text: Harbors the potential to evolve into manifold forms. Within Eevee lies the key to the mysteries of Pokémon evolution—I'm certain of it.
1916.name: eevee

1917.text: As it uses the fins on the tip of its tail to swim, it blends with the water perfectly.
1917.name: vaporeon

1918.text: VAPOREON underwent a spontaneous mutation and grew fins and gills that allow them to live underwater. They have the ability to freely control water.
1918.name: vaporeon

1919.text: Lives close to water. Its long tail is ridged with a fin which is often mistaken for a mermaid’s.
1919.name: vaporeon

1920.text: When VAPOREON’s fins begin to vibrate, it is a sign that rain will come within a few hours.
1920.name: vaporeon

1921.text: Its cell composition is similar to water molecules. As a result, it can’t be seen when it melts away into water.
1921.name: vaporeon

1922.text: It prefers beautiful shores. With cells similar to water molecules, it could melt in water.
1922.name: vaporeon

1923.text: It has evolved to be suitable for an aquatic life. It can invisibly melt away into water.
1923.name: vaporeon

1924.text: Vaporeon underwent a spontaneous mutation and grew fins and gills that allow it to live underwater. This Pokémon has the ability to freely control water.
1924.name: vaporeon

1925.text: Its cells are composed of units much like water molecules. It lives close to water and is often mistaken for a mermaid.
1925.name: vaporeon

1926.text: Blending in with the water and erasing all signs of its presence, it patiently waits for its prey, fish Pokémon.
1926.name: vaporeon

1927.text: Clean, clear waters are its usual habitat. When it’s about to be attacked by an invading enemy, it dives into the water to hide.
1927.name: vaporeon

1928.text: It detects nearby moisture with its fin. When its fin begins trembling rapidly, that means rain will fall in a few hours.
1928.name: vaporeon

1929.text: Its cell structure is similar to water molecules. It melts into the water and becomes invisible.
1929.name: vaporeon

1930.text: When Vaporeon’s fins begin to vibrate, it is a sign that rain will come within a few hours.
1930.name: vaporeon

1931.text: Its body’s cellular structure is similar to the molecular composition of water. It can melt invisibly in water.
1931.name: vaporeon

1932.text: Tests show that its cells closely resemble water molecules, which perhaps explains its ability to conceal its form while submerged. I believe the origins of mermaid folklore lie with this Pokémon.
1932.name: vaporeon

1933.text: A sensitive POKé­ MON that easily becomes sad or angry. Every time its mood changes, it charges power.
1933.name: jolteon

1934.text: The negatively charged ions generated in its fur create a constant sparking noise.
1934.name: jolteon

1935.text: Its cells generate weak power that is amplified by its fur’s static electricity to drop thunderbolts. The bristling fur is made of electrically charged needles.
1935.name: jolteon

1936.text: It controls 10,000-volt power and can raise all the fur on its body as if it were sharp needles.
1936.name: jolteon

1937.text: It concentrates the weak electric charges emitted by its cells and launches wicked lightning bolts.
1937.name: jolteon

1938.text: If agitated, it uses electricity to straighten out its fur and launch it in small bunches.
1938.name: jolteon

1939.text: By storing electricity in its body, it can shoot its bristlelike fur like a barrage of missiles.
1939.name: jolteon

1940.text: Every hair on its body starts to stand sharply on end if it becomes charged with electricity.
1940.name: jolteon

1941.text: Jolteon’s cells generate a low level of electricity. This power is amplified by the static electricity of its fur, enabling the Pokémon to drop thunderbolts. The bristling fur is made of electrically charged needles.
1941.name: jolteon

1942.text: They send out electrical charges of about 10,000 volts. Because they are high-strung, it can be difficult to grow close to them.
1942.name: jolteon

1943.text: When its fur stands on end, that’s a sign it’s about to give off a jolt of electricity. Take care, as sometimes lightning strikes next to it, too.
1943.name: jolteon

1944.text: Its lungs contain an organ that creates electricity. The crackling sound of electricity can be heard when it exhales.
1944.name: jolteon

1945.text: Its fur stands on end, becoming like needles it fires at enemies. Once they’re weakened, it finishes them off with a 10,000 volt shock.
1945.name: jolteon

1946.text: A sensitive Pokémon that easily becomes sad or angry. Every time its mood changes, it charges power.
1946.name: jolteon

1947.text: If it is angered or startled, the fur all over its body bristles like sharp needles that pierce foes.
1947.name: jolteon

1948.text: It accumulates negative ions in the atmosphere to blast out 10,000-volt lightning bolts.
1948.name: jolteon

1949.text: Bristles its fur into sharp, needlelike points when enraged. One can hear electricity crackle in its breath when it exhales.
1949.name: jolteon

1950.text: Once it has stored up enough heat, this POKéMON's body temperature can reach up to 1700 degrees.
1950.name: flareon

1951.text: FLAREON’s fluffy fur releases heat into the air so that its body does not get excessively hot. Its body temperature can rise to a maximum of 1,650 degrees F.
1951.name: flareon

1952.text: When storing thermal energy in its body, its temperature can soar to over 1,600 degrees Fahrenheit.
1952.name: flareon

1953.text: It fluffs out its fur collar to cool down its body temperature, which can reach 1,650 degrees Fahrenheit.
1953.name: flareon

1954.text: Inhaled air is carried to its flame sac, heated, and exhaled as fire that reaches over 3,000 degrees F.
1954.name: flareon

1955.text: It has a flame sac in its body. Its body temperature tops 1,650 degrees Fahrenheit before battle.
1955.name: flareon

1956.text: It has a flame bag inside its body. After inhaling deeply, it blows out flames of nearly 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.
1956.name: flareon

1957.text: Flareon’s fluffy fur has a functional purpose—it releases heat into the air so that its body does not get excessively hot. This Pokémon’s body temperature can rise to a maximum of 1,650 degrees Fahrenheit.
1957.name: flareon

1958.text: When it catches prey or finds berries, it breathes fire on them until they’re well done, and then it gobbles them up.
1958.name: flareon

1959.text: Its average body temperature is between 1,300 and 1,500 degrees Fahrenheit. In its internal flame sac, temperatures reach 3,000 degrees.
1959.name: flareon

1960.text: If it inhales deeply, that’s a sign it’s about to attack. Prepare to be hit by flames of over 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit!
1960.name: flareon

1961.text: The flame chamber inside its body ignites when Flareon gets agitated, reaching temperatures of up to 1,650 degrees Fahrenheit.
1961.name: flareon

1962.text: It has a flame chamber inside its body. It inhales, then breathes out fire that is over 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.
1962.name: flareon

1963.text: Once it has stored up enough heat, this Pokémon’s body temperature can reach up to 1,700 degrees Fahrenheit.
1963.name: flareon

1964.text: It stores some of the air it inhales in its internal flame pouch, which heats it to over 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.
1964.name: flareon

1965.text: Flames burn within a saclike organ inside this Pokémon. When Flareon inhales, these flames grow in intensity, reaching a mighty 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.
1965.name: flareon

1966.text: A manmade POKéMON that came about as a result of re­ search. It is pro­ grammed with only basic motions.
1966.name: porygon

1967.text: An artificial POKéMON created due to extensive research, it can perform only what is in its program.
1967.name: porygon

1968.text: It is capable of reverting itself entirely back to program data in order to enter cyberspace. A PORYGON is copy- protected so it cannot be duplicated.
1968.name: porygon

1969.text: Using the most advanced technologies, scientists finally succeeded in making the first artificial POKéMON.
1969.name: porygon

1970.text: The world’s first artificially created Pokémon. It can travel through electronic space.
1970.name: porygon

1971.text: It is a manmade Pokémon. Since it doesn’t breathe, people are eager to try it in any environment.
1971.name: porygon

1972.text: A man-made Pokémon created using advanced scientific means. It can move freely in cyberspace.
1972.name: porygon

1973.text: A man-made Pokémon that came about as a result of research. It is programmed with only basic motions.
1973.name: porygon

1974.text: A Pokémon that consists entirely of programming code. It is capable of moving freely in cyberspace.
1974.name: porygon

1975.text: Porygon is capable of reverting itself entirely back to program data and entering cyberspace. This Pokémon is copy protected so it cannot be duplicated by copying.
1975.name: porygon

1976.text: Roughly 20 years ago, it was artificially created, utilizing the latest technology of the time.
1976.name: porygon

1977.text: It can convert its body into digital data, which enables it to enter cyberspace.
1977.name: porygon

1978.text: This Pokémon was created using the cutting-edge science of 20 years ago, so many parts of it have since become obsolete.
1978.name: porygon

1979.text: It was built 20 years ago by scientists who dreamed of exploring space. Their dreams have yet to come true.
1979.name: porygon

1980.text: The only Pokémon that people anticipate can fly into space. None has managed the feat yet, however.
1980.name: porygon

1981.text: State-of-the-art technology was used to create Porygon. It was the first artificial Pokémon to be created via computer programming.
1981.name: porygon

1982.text: In recent years, this species has been very helpful in cyberspace. These Pokémon will go around checking to make sure no suspicious data exists.
1982.name: porygon

1983.text: It has no discernible heartbeat and does not seem to draw breath, and yet it appears to function without issue. I cannot even begin to explain this utterly bizarre anomaly.
1983.name: porygon

1984.text: In prehistoric times, it swam on the sea floor, eating plankton. Its fossils are sometimes found.
1984.name: omanyte

1985.text: OMANYTE is one of the ancient and long- since-extinct POKéMON that have been regenerated from fossils by people. If attacked by an enemy, it withdraws itself inside its hard shell.
1985.name: omanyte

1986.text: One of the ancient and long-since-extinct POKéMON that have been regenerated from fossils by humans. If attacked, it withdraws into its hard shell.
1986.name: omanyte

1987.text: Although long extinct, in rare cases, it can be genetically regenerated from fossils.
1987.name: omanyte

1988.text: This Pokémon from ancient times is said to have navigated the sea by adeptly twisting its 10 tentacles.
1988.name: omanyte

1989.text: A Pokémon that was resurrected from a fossil using modern science. It swam in ancient seas.
1989.name: omanyte

1990.text: A prehistoric Pokémon that lived in the primordial sea, it swims by twisting its 10 tentacles about.
1990.name: omanyte

1991.text: Revived from an ancient fossil, this Pokémon uses air stored in its shell to sink and rise in water.
1991.name: omanyte

1992.text: Omanyte is one of the ancient and long-since-extinct Pokémon that have been regenerated from fossils by people. If attacked by an enemy, it withdraws itself inside its hard shell.
1992.name: omanyte

1993.text: Omanyte lived in the seas of antiquity. Its fossils have been found bearing bite marks from Archeops, so apparently Archeops preyed on it.
1993.name: omanyte

1994.text: It was restored from an ancient fossil. Those Helix Fossils are excavated from areas that were once oceans long, long ago.
1994.name: omanyte

1995.text: An ancient Pokémon that was recovered from a fossil. It swam by cleverly twisting its 10 tentacles about.
1995.name: omanyte

1996.text: Because some Omanyte manage to escape after being restored or are released into the wild by people, this species is becoming a problem.
1996.name: omanyte

1997.text: This Pokémon is a member of an ancient, extinct species. Omanyte paddles through water with its 10 tentacles, looking like it’s just drifting along.
1997.name: omanyte

1998.text: A prehistoric POKéMON that died out when its heavy shell made it impossible to catch prey.
1998.name: omastar

1999.text: Its heavy shell allowed it to reach only nearby food. This could be the reason it is extinct.
1999.name: omastar

2000.text: An OMASTAR uses its tentacles to capture its prey. It is believed to have become extinct because its shell grew too large, making its movements slow and ponderous.
2000.name: omastar

2001.text: Despite having strong fangs and tentacles, it went extinct when its heavy shell made it unable to catch prey.
2001.name: omastar

2002.text: Apparently, it cracked SHELLDER’s shell with its sharp fangs and sucked out the insides.
2002.name: omastar

2003.text: It is thought that this Pokémon became extinct because its spiral shell grew too large.
2003.name: omastar

2004.text: Its tentacles are highly developed as if they are hands and feet. As soon as it ensnares prey, it bites.
2004.name: omastar

2005.text: Once wrapped around its prey, it never lets go. It eats the prey by tearing at it with sharp fangs.
2005.name: omastar

2006.text: Omastar uses its tentacles to capture its prey. It is believed to have become extinct because its shell grew too large and heavy, causing its movements to become too slow and ponderous.
2006.name: omastar

2007.text: Its heavy shell is thought to be the reason this ancient Pokémon died out. It’s apparently a distant ancestor of Octillery.
2007.name: omastar

2008.text: It wraps its prey in its tentacles to immobilize them and then finishes them off with its sharp fangs.
2008.name: omastar

2009.text: Its sharp beak rings its mouth. Its shell was too big for it to move freely, so it became extinct.
2009.name: omastar

2010.text: Weighed down by a large and heavy shell, Omastar couldn’t move very fast. Some say it went extinct because it was unable to catch food.
2010.name: omastar

2011.text: Omastar’s sharp fangs could crush rock, but the Pokémon can attack only the prey that come within reach of its tentacles.
2011.name: omastar

2012.text: A POKéMON that was resurrected from a fossil found in what was once the ocean floor eons ago.
2012.name: kabuto

2013.text: Three hundred million years ago, it hid on the sea floor. It also has eyes on its back that glow.
2013.name: kabuto

2014.text: It is a POKéMON that has been regenerated from a fossil. However, in rare cases, living examples have been discovered. KABUTO have not changed for 300 million years.
2014.name: kabuto

2015.text: A POKéMON that was regenerated from a fossil found in what was once the ocean floor long ago.
2015.name: kabuto

2016.text: On rare occasions, some have been found as fossils which they became while hiding on the ocean floor.
2016.name: kabuto

2017.text: This Pokémon lived in ancient times. On rare occasions, it has been discovered as a living fossil.
2017.name: kabuto

2018.text: It is thought to have inhabited beaches 300 million years ago. It is protected by a stiff shell.
2018.name: kabuto

2019.text: This Pokémon was regenerated from the fossil of an ancient creature. It protects itself with a hard shell.
2019.name: kabuto

2020.text: Kabuto is a Pokémon that has been regenerated from a fossil. However, in extremely rare cases, living examples have been discovered. The Pokémon has not changed at all for 300 million years.
2020.name: kabuto

2021.text: This Pokémon thrived 300 million years ago. It’s said that living specimens can still be seen in a certain region—a rare sight.
2021.name: kabuto

2022.text: This Pokémon became extinct everywhere, except in a few areas. It protects itself with its hard shell.
2022.name: kabuto

2023.text: A Pokémon that was recovered from a fossil. It used the eyes on its back while hiding on the seafloor.
2023.name: kabuto

2024.text: This species is almost entirely extinct. Kabuto molt every three days, making their shells harder and harder.
2024.name: kabuto

2025.text: While some say this species has gone extinct, Kabuto sightings are apparently fairly common in some places.
2025.name: kabuto

2026.text: It was able to swim quickly thro­ ugh the water by compactly folding up its razor-sharp sickles.
2026.name: kabutops

2027.text: KABUTOPS once swam underwater to hunt  for prey. It was apparently evolving from being a water dweller to living on land as evident from changes in its gills and legs.
2027.name: kabutops

2028.text: It swims freely through water. It catches prey with its scythe-like arms and drains the victim’s fluids.
2028.name: kabutops

2029.text: Its sleek shape is perfect for swimming. It slashes prey with its claws and drains their fluids.
2029.name: kabutops

2030.text: With sharp claws, this ferocious, ancient Pokémon rips apart prey and sucks their body fluids.
2030.name: kabutops

2031.text: It is thought that this Pokémon came onto land because its prey adapted to life on land.
2031.name: kabutops

2032.text: In the water, it tucks in its limbs to become more compact, then it wiggles its shell to swim fast.
2032.name: kabutops

2033.text: Kabutops swam underwater to hunt for its prey in ancient times. The Pokémon was apparently evolving from being a water dweller to living on land as evident from the beginnings of change in its gills and legs.
2033.name: kabutops

2034.text: Its body had begun to change so it could function on land. But it didn’t adapt in time and went extinct.
2034.name: kabutops

2035.text: It swims at speeds of roughly 29 knots, quickly closing in on its prey and slashing into them with its scythes to finish them off.
2035.name: kabutops

2036.text: A slim and fast swimmer. It sliced its prey with its sharp sickles and drank the body fluids.
2036.name: kabutops

2037.text: Kabutops slices its prey apart and sucks out the fluids. The discarded body parts become food for other Pokémon.
2037.name: kabutops

2038.text: The cause behind the extinction of this species is unknown. Kabutops were aggressive Pokémon that inhabited warm seas.
2038.name: kabutops

2039.text: This vicious POKé­ MON is said to have flown in an­ cient skies while shrieking high- pitched cries.
2039.name: aerodactyl

2040.text: In prehistoric times, this POKéMON flew freely and fearlessly through the skies.
2040.name: aerodactyl

2041.text: A ferocious, prehistoric POKéMON that goes for the enemy’s throat with its serrated, sawlike fangs.
2041.name: aerodactyl

2042.text: A vicious Pokémon from the distant past, it appears to have flown by spreading its wings and gliding.
2042.name: aerodactyl

2043.text: A Pokémon that roamed the skies in the dinosaur era. Its teeth are like saw blades.
2043.name: aerodactyl

2044.text: It was regenerated from a dinosaur’s genetic matter that was found in amber. It flies with high-pitched cries.
2044.name: aerodactyl

2045.text: This vicious Pokémon is said to have flown in ancient skies while shrieking high-pitched cries.
2045.name: aerodactyl

2046.text: Aerodactyl is a Pokémon from the age of dinosaurs. It was regenerated from genetic material extracted from amber. It is imagined to have been the king of the skies in ancient times.
2046.name: aerodactyl

2047.text: A Pokémon from the age of the dinosaurs. It used its sawlike fangs to shred its prey before eating them.
2047.name: aerodactyl

2048.text: In ancient times, it ruled the skies. A widely accepted theory is that it went extinct due to a large meteor impact.
2048.name: aerodactyl

2049.text: Restored from DNA found in amber, this Pokémon exhibited ferocity that was greater than expected. Some casualties resulted.
2049.name: aerodactyl

2050.text: It flew through the open skies over the ancient continent as if they were its own. When it touched ground, its walk was weak and slow.
2050.name: aerodactyl

2051.text: A savage Pokémon that died out in ancient times. It was resurrected using DNA taken from amber.
2051.name: aerodactyl

2052.text: This is a ferocious Pokémon from ancient times. Apparently even modern technology is incapable of producing a perfectly restored specimen.
2052.name: aerodactyl

2053.text: Aerodactyl’s sawlike fangs can shred skin to tatters—even the skin of Steel-type Pokémon.
2053.name: aerodactyl

2054.text: SNORLAX’s typical day consists of nothing more than eating and sleeping. It is such a docile POKéMON that there are children who use its big belly as a place to play.
2054.name: snorlax

2055.text: Very lazy. Just eats and sleeps. As its rotund bulk builds, it becomes steadily more slothful.
2055.name: snorlax

2056.text: It stops eating only to sleep. It doesn’t feel full unless it eats nearly 900 pounds a day.
2056.name: snorlax

2057.text: What sounds like its cry may actually be its snores or the rumblings of its hungry belly.
2057.name: snorlax

2058.text: Its stomach’s digestive juices can dissolve any kind of poison. It can even eat things off the ground.
2058.name: snorlax

2059.text: When its belly is full, it becomes too lethargic to even lift a finger, so it is safe to bounce on its belly.
2059.name: snorlax

2060.text: Its stomach can digest any kind of food, even if it happens to be moldy or rotten.
2060.name: snorlax

2061.text: Snorlax’s typical day consists of nothing more than eating and sleeping. It is such a docile Pokémon that there are children who use its expansive belly as a place to play.
2061.name: snorlax

2062.text: Its stomach is said to be incomparably strong. Even Muk’s poison is nothing more than a hint of spice on Snorlax’s tongue.
2062.name: snorlax

2063.text: It eats nearly 900 pounds of food every day. It starts nodding off while eating—and continues to eat even while it’s asleep.
2063.name: snorlax

2064.text: It doesn’t do anything other than eat and sleep. When prompted to make a serious effort, though, it apparently displays awesome power.
2064.name: snorlax

2065.text: It has no interest in anything other than eating. Even if you climb up on its stomach while it’s napping, it doesn’t seem to mind at all!
2065.name: snorlax

2066.text: Will eat anything, even if the food happens to be a little moldy. It never gets an upset stomach.
2066.name: snorlax

2067.text: It is not satisfied unless it eats over 880 pounds of food every day. When it is done eating, it goes promptly to sleep.
2067.name: snorlax

2068.text: This Pokémon’s stomach is so strong, even eating moldy or rotten food will not affect it.
2068.name: snorlax

2069.text: This glutton appears in villages without warning and devours the entirety of their rice granaries—such occurrences have long been counted among the gravest of disasters.
2069.name: snorlax

2070.text: One of the legen­ dary bird POKéMON, it chills moisture in the atmosphere to create snow while flying.
2070.name: articuno

2071.text: Legendary bird POKéMON. As it flies through the sky, it cools the air, causing snow to fall.
2071.name: articuno

2072.text: ARTICUNO is a legendary bird POKéMON that can control ice. The flapping of its wings chills the air. As a result, it is said that when this POKéMON flies, snow will fall.
2072.name: articuno

2073.text: One of the legendary bird POKéMON. With its long tail trailing behind, its flying form is magnificent.
2073.name: articuno

2074.text: The magnificent, seemingly translucent wings of this legendary bird Pokémon are said to be made of ice.
2074.name: articuno

2075.text: One of the legendary bird Pokémon, it chills moisture in the atmosphere to create snow while flying.
2075.name: articuno

2076.text: A legendary bird Pokémon. It can create blizzards by freezing moisture in the air.
2076.name: articuno

2077.text: A legendary bird Pokémon that is said to appear to doomed people who are lost in icy mountains.
2077.name: articuno

2078.text: Articuno is a legendary bird Pokémon that can control ice. The flapping of its wings chills the air. As a result, it is said that when this Pokémon flies, snow will fall.
2078.name: articuno

2079.text: A legendary bird Pokémon. It freezes water that is contained in winter air and makes it snow.
2079.name: articuno

2080.text: It’s said that this Pokémon’s beautiful blue wings are made of ice. Articuno flies over snowy mountains, its long tail fluttering along behind it.
2080.name: articuno

2081.text: This Pokémon can control ice at will. Articuno is said to live in snowy mountains riddled with permafrost.
2081.name: articuno

2082.text: Legendary bird POKéMON. They say lightning caused by the flapping of its wings causes summer storms.
2082.name: zapdos

2083.text: ZAPDOS is a legendary bird POKéMON that has the ability to control electricity. It usually lives in thunderclouds. It gains power if it is stricken by lightning bolts.
2083.name: zapdos

2084.text: One of the legendary bird POKéMON. While it is flying, it makes crackling and snapping sounds.
2084.name: zapdos

2085.text: This legendary bird Pokémon causes savage thunderstorms by flapping its glittering wings.
2085.name: zapdos

2086.text: This legendary bird Pokémon is said to appear only when a thundercloud parts into two halves.
2086.name: zapdos

2087.text: A legendary bird Pokémon that is said to appear from clouds while dropping enormous lightning bolts.
2087.name: zapdos

2088.text: A legendary Pokémon that is said to live in thunderclouds. It freely controls lightning bolts.
2088.name: zapdos

2089.text: Zapdos is a legendary bird Pokémon that has the ability to control electricity. It usually lives in thunderclouds. The Pokémon gains power if it is stricken by lightning bolts.
2089.name: zapdos

2090.text: This legendary bird Pokémon is said to appear when the sky turns dark and lightning showers down.
2090.name: zapdos

2091.text: This Pokémon has complete control over electricity. There are tales of Zapdos nesting in the dark depths of pitch-black thunderclouds.
2091.name: zapdos

2092.text: Zapdos is a legendary bird Pokémon. It’s said that when Zapdos rubs its feathers together, lightning will fall immediately after.
2092.name: zapdos

2093.text: Known as the legendary bird of fire. Every flap of its wings creates a dazzling flash of flames.
2093.name: moltres

2094.text: Legendary bird POKéMON. It is said to migrate from the south along with the spring.
2094.name: moltres

2095.text: One of the legendary bird POKéMON. Those seeing it are overwhelmed by its orange wings that seem to be on fire.
2095.name: moltres

2096.text: This legendary Pokémon scatters embers with every flap of its wings. It is a thrilling sight to behold.
2096.name: moltres

2097.text: This legendary bird Pokémon is said to bring early spring to the wintry lands it visits.
2097.name: moltres

2098.text: It is said to be the legendary bird Pokémon of fire. Every flap of its wings creates a dazzling flare of flames.
2098.name: moltres

2099.text: One of the legendary bird Pokémon. It is said that its appearance indicates the coming of spring.
2099.name: moltres

2100.text: Moltres is a legendary bird Pokémon that has the ability to control fire. If this Pokémon is injured, it is said to dip its body in the molten magma of a volcano to burn and heal itself.
2100.name: moltres

2101.text: A legendary bird Pokémon. As it flaps its flaming wings, even the night sky will turn red.
2101.name: moltres

2102.text: It’s one of the legendary bird Pokémon. When Moltres flaps its flaming wings, they glimmer with a dazzling red glow.
2102.name: moltres

2103.text: There are stories of this Pokémon using its radiant, flame-cloaked wings to light up paths for those lost in the mountains.
2103.name: moltres

2104.text: It sheds many lay­ ers of skin as it grows larger. Dur­ ing this process, it is protected by a rapid waterfall.
2104.name: dratini

2105.text: Even the young can exceed 6.5 feet in length. It grows larger by repeatedly shedding skin.
2105.name: dratini

2106.text: Long considered a mythical POKéMON until recently, when a small colony was found living underwater.
2106.name: dratini

2107.text: It is born large to start with. It repeatedly sheds its skin as it steadily grows longer.
2107.name: dratini

2108.text: It is called the “Mirage Pokémon” because so few have seen it. Its shed skin has been found.
2108.name: dratini

2109.text: This Pokémon is full of life energy. It continually sheds its skin and grows steadily larger.
2109.name: dratini

2110.text: Dratini continually molts and sloughs off its old skin. It does so because the life energy within its body steadily builds to reach uncontrollable levels.
2110.name: dratini

2111.text: It grows by molting repeatedly. Boots made from the tanned cast-off skin are a super luxury item.
2111.name: dratini

2112.text: After a 10-hour struggle, a fisherman was able to pull one up and confirm its existence.
2112.name: dratini

2113.text: It’s still weak, so it lurks on the floor of bodies of water, eating whatever food sinks down and living a quiet life.
2113.name: dratini

2114.text: It sheds its skin—almost on a daily basis—and grows larger. Its skin is soft just after it’s been shed.
2114.name: dratini

2115.text: Long thought to be a myth, this Pokémon’s existence was only recently confirmed by a fisherman who caught one.
2115.name: dratini

2116.text: Dratini dwells near bodies of rapidly flowing water, such as the plunge pools of waterfalls. As it grows, Dratini will shed its skin many times.
2116.name: dratini

2117.text: This Pokémon was long considered to be no more than a myth. The small lump on a Dratini’s forehead is actually a horn that’s still coming in.
2117.name: dratini

2118.text: It is called the divine POKéMON. When its entire body brightens slightly, the weather changes.
2118.name: dragonair

2119.text: A DRAGONAIR stores an enormous amount of energy inside its body. It is said to alter the weather around it by loosing energy from the crystals on its neck and tail.
2119.name: dragonair

2120.text: It is said to live in seas and lakes. Even though it has no wings, it has been seen flying occasionally.
2120.name: dragonair

2121.text: They say that if it emits an aura from its whole body, the weather will begin to change instantly.
2121.name: dragonair

2122.text: If its body takes on an aura, the weather changes instantly. It is said to live in seas and lakes.
2122.name: dragonair

2123.text: Its crystalline orbs appear to give this Pokémon the power to freely control the weather.
2123.name: dragonair

2124.text: A mystical Pokémon that exudes a gentle aura. It is said to have the ability to change the weather.
2124.name: dragonair

2125.text: Dragonair stores an enormous amount of energy inside its body. It is said to alter weather conditions in its vicinity by discharging energy from the crystals on its neck and tail.
2125.name: dragonair

2126.text: It has long been thought that its crystalline orbs are imbued with the power to control the weather.
2126.name: dragonair

2127.text: From time immemorial, it has been venerated by agricultural peoples as an entity able to control the weather.
2127.name: dragonair

2128.text: Lakes where Dragonair live are filled with offerings from people, because they believe this Pokémon is able to control the weather.
2128.name: dragonair

2129.text: Some say that if you see it at the start of the year, flying through the sky and twisting its body, you’ll be healthy all year long.
2129.name: dragonair

2130.text: According to a witness, its body was surrounded by a strange aura that gave it a mystical look.
2130.name: dragonair

2131.text: This Pokémon lives in pristine oceans and lakes. It can control the weather, and it uses this power to fly into the sky, riding on the wind.
2131.name: dragonair

2132.text: This Pokémon gathers power in the orbs on its tail and controls the weather. When enshrouded by an aura, Dragonair has a mystical appearance.
2132.name: dragonair

2133.text: An extremely rarely seen marine POKéMON. Its intelligence is said to match that of humans.
2133.name: dragonite

2134.text: This marine POKé­ MON has an impres­ sive build that lets it freely fly over raging seas without trouble.
2134.name: dragonite

2135.text: It is said that somewhere in the ocean lies an island where these gather. Only they live there.
2135.name: dragonite

2136.text: DRAGONITE is capable of circling the globe in just sixteen hours. It is a kindhearted POKéMON that leads lost and foundering ships in a storm to the safety of land.
2136.name: dragonite

2137.text: It can circle the globe in just 16 hours. It is a kindhearted POKéMON that leads lost and foundering ships in a storm to the safety of land.
2137.name: dragonite

2138.text: Only a very few people ever see this POKéMON. Its intelligence is said to match that of humans.
2138.name: dragonite

2139.text: It is said that this Pokémon constantly flies over the immense seas and rescues drowning people.
2139.name: dragonite

2140.text: This marine Pokémon has an impressive build that lets it freely fly over raging seas without trouble.
2140.name: dragonite

2141.text: It can fly in spite of its big and bulky physique. It circles the globe in just 16 hours.
2141.name: dragonite

2142.text: It is said to make its home somewhere in the sea. It guides crews of shipwrecks to shore.
2142.name: dragonite

2143.text: Dragonite is capable of circling the globe in just 16 hours. It is a kindhearted Pokémon that leads lost and foundering ships in a storm to the safety of land.
2143.name: dragonite

2144.text: This Pokémon saved a shipwrecked man, taking him to a remote island—a paradise occupied solely by Dragonite.
2144.name: dragonite

2145.text: Incur the wrath of this normally calm Pokémon at your peril, because it will smash everything to smithereens before it’s satisfied.
2145.name: dragonite

2146.text: It flies over raging seas as if they were nothing. Observing this, a ship’s captain dubbed this Pokémon “the sea incarnate.”
2146.name: dragonite

2147.text: You’ll often hear tales of this kindhearted Pokémon rescuing people or Pokémon that are drowning.
2147.name: dragonite

2148.text: It is said that this Pokémon lives somewhere in the sea and that it flies. However, these are only rumors.
2148.name: dragonite
