3182.text: In the jungle, its power is without equal. This POKéMON carefully grows trees and plants. It regulates its body temperature by basking in sunlight.
3182.name: sceptile

3183.text: The leaves on its forelegs are as sharp as swords. It agilely leaps about the branches of trees to strike.
3183.name: sceptile

3184.text: The leaves that grow on its arms can slice down thick trees. It is without peer in jungle combat.
3184.name: sceptile

3185.text: It agilely leaps about the jungle and uses the sharp leaves on its arms to strike its prey.
3185.name: sceptile

3186.text: The leaves growing on Sceptile’s body are very sharp edged. This Pokémon is very agile—it leaps all over the branches of trees and jumps on its foe from above or behind.
3186.name: sceptile

3187.text: Sceptile has seeds growing on its back. They are said to be bursting with nutrients that revitalize trees. This Pokémon raises the trees in a forest with loving care.
3187.name: sceptile

3188.text: TORCHIC has a place inside its body where it keeps its flame. Give it a hug - it will be glowing with warmth. This POKéMON is covered all over by a fluffy coat of down.
3188.name: torchic

3189.text: If attacked, it strikes back by spitting balls of fire it forms in its stomach. A TORCHIC dislikes darkness because it can’t see its surroundings.
3189.name: torchic

3190.text: Inside its body is a place where it keeps a small flame. Hug it! It will be as warm as a hot-water bottle.
3190.name: torchic

3191.text: It has a flame sac inside its belly that perpetually burns. It feels warm if it is hugged.
3191.name: torchic

3192.text: A fire burns inside, so it feels very warm to hug. It launches fireballs of 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit.
3192.name: torchic

3193.text: Torchic sticks with its Trainer, following behind with unsteady steps. This Pokémon breathes fire of over 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit, including fireballs that leave the foe scorched black.
3193.name: torchic

3194.text: Torchic has a place inside its body where it keeps its flame. Give it a hug—it will be glowing with warmth. This Pokémon is covered all over by a fluffy coat of down.
3194.name: torchic

3195.text: It lashes out with 10 kicks per second. Its strong fighting instinct compels it to keep up its offensive until the opponent gives up.
3195.name: combusken

3196.text: It boosts its concentration by emitting harsh cries. Its kicks have outstanding destructive power.
3196.name: combusken

3197.text: Its kicking mastery lets it loose 10 kicks per second. It emits sharp cries to intimidate foes.
3197.name: combusken

3198.text: During a battle, the hot flame in its body increases. Its kicks have outstanding destructive power.
3198.name: combusken

3199.text: Combusken toughens up its legs and thighs by running through fields and mountains. This Pokémon’s legs possess both speed and power, enabling it to dole out 10 kicks in one second.
3199.name: combusken

3200.text: Combusken battles with the intensely hot flames it spews from its beak and with outstandingly destructive kicks. This Pokémon’s cry is very loud and distracting.
3200.name: combusken

3201.text: BLAZIKEN has incredibly strong legs - it can easily clear a 30-story building in one leap. This POKéMON’s blazing punches leave its foes scorched and blackened.
3201.name: blaziken

3202.text: It learns martial arts that use punches and kicks. Every several years, its old feathers burn off, and new, supple feathers grow back in their place.
3202.name: blaziken

3203.text: Flames spout from its wrists, enveloping its knuckles. Its punches scorch its foes.
3203.name: blaziken

3204.text: It can clear a 30-story building in a leap. Its fiery punches scorch its foes.
3204.name: blaziken

3205.text: When facing a tough foe, it looses flames from its wrists. Its powerful legs let it jump clear over buildings.
3205.name: blaziken

3206.text: In battle, Blaziken blows out intense flames from its wrists and attacks foes courageously. The stronger the foe, the more intensely this Pokémon’s wrists burn.
3206.name: blaziken

3207.text: Blaziken has incredibly strong legs—it can easily clear a 30-story building in one leap. This Pokémon’s blazing punches leave its foes scorched and blackened.
3207.name: blaziken

3208.text: On land, it can powerfully lift large boulders by planting its four feet and heaving. It sleeps by burying itself in soil at the water’s edge.
3208.name: mudkip

3209.text: Its power can crush boulders. It rests by covering itself with mud at the bottom of a river.
3209.name: mudkip

3210.text: Its large tail fin propels it through water with powerful acceleration. It is strong in spite of its size.
3210.name: mudkip

3211.text: To alert it, the fin on its head senses the flow of water. It has the strength to heft boulders.
3211.name: mudkip

3212.text: The fin on Mudkip’s head acts as highly sensitive radar. Using this fin to sense movements of water and air, this Pokémon can determine what is taking place around it without using its eyes.
3212.name: mudkip

3213.text: In water, Mudkip breathes using the gills on its cheeks. If it is faced with a tight situation in battle, this Pokémon will unleash its amazing power—it can crush rocks bigger than itself.
3213.name: mudkip

3214.text: Its toughened hind legs enable it to stand upright. Because it weakens if its skin dries out, it replenishes fluids by playing in mud.
3214.name: marshtomp

3215.text: It is at its best when on muddy ground with poor footing. It quickly overwhelms foes struggling in mud.
3215.name: marshtomp

3216.text: Its sturdy legs give it sure footing, even in mud. It burrows into dirt to sleep.
3216.name: marshtomp

3217.text: Living on muddy ground that provides poor footing has made its legs sturdy.
3217.name: marshtomp

3218.text: The surface of Marshtomp’s body is enveloped by a thin, sticky film that enables it to live on land. This Pokémon plays in mud on beaches when the ocean tide is low.
3218.name: marshtomp

3219.text: Marshtomp is much faster at traveling through mud than it is at swimming. This Pokémon’s hindquarters exhibit obvious development, giving it the ability to walk on just its hind legs.
3219.name: marshtomp

3220.text: SWAMPERT is very strong. It has enough power to easily drag a boulder weighing more than a ton. This POKéMON also has powerful vision that lets it see even in murky water.
3220.name: swampert

3221.text: SWAMPERT predicts storms by sensing subtle differences in the sounds of waves and tidal winds with its fins. If a storm is approaching, it piles up boulders to protect itself.
3221.name: swampert

3222.text: If it senses the approach of a storm and a tidal wave, it protects its seaside nest by piling up boulders. It swims as fast as a jet ski.
3222.name: swampert

3223.text: Its arms are rock-hard. With one swing, they can batter down its foe. It makes its nest on beautiful beaches.
3223.name: swampert

3224.text: Its arms are hard as rock. With one swing, it can break a boulder into pieces.
3224.name: swampert

3225.text: It can swim while towing a large ship. It bashes down foes with a swing of its thick arms.
3225.name: swampert

3226.text: Swampert is very strong. It has enough power to easily drag a boulder weighing more than a ton. This Pokémon also has powerful vision that lets it see even in murky water.
3226.name: swampert

3227.text: Swampert predicts storms by sensing subtle differences in the sounds of waves and tidal winds with its fins. If a storm is approaching, it piles up boulders to protect itself.
3227.name: swampert

3228.text: At first sight, POOCHYENA takes a bite at anything that moves. This POKéMON chases after prey until the victim becomes exhausted. However, it may turn tail if the prey strikes back.
3228.name: poochyena

3229.text: POOCHYENA is an omnivore - it will eat anything. A distinguishing feature is how large its fangs are compared to its body. This POKéMON tries to intimidate its foes by making the hair on its tail bristle out.
3229.name: poochyena

3230.text: It savagely threatens foes with bared fangs. It chases after fleeing targets tenaciously. It turns tail and runs, however, if the foe strikes back.
3230.name: poochyena

3231.text: It chases its prey until the victim becomes exhausted. However, it turns tail if the prey strikes back.
3231.name: poochyena

3232.text: A Pokémon with a persistent nature, it chases its chosen prey until the prey becomes exhausted.
3232.name: poochyena

3233.text: It has a very tenacious nature. Its acute sense of smell lets it chase a chosen prey without ever losing track.
3233.name: poochyena

3234.text: At first sight, Poochyena takes a bite at anything that moves. This Pokémon chases after prey until the victim becomes exhausted. However, it may turn tail if the prey strikes back.
3234.name: poochyena

3235.text: Poochyena is an omnivore—it will eat anything. A distinguishing feature is how large its fangs are compared to its body. This Pokémon tries to intimidate its foes by making the hair on its tail bristle out.
3235.name: poochyena

3236.text: In the wild, MIGHTYENA live in a pack. They never defy their leader’s orders. They defeat foes with perfectly coordinated teamwork.
3236.name: mightyena

3237.text: It chases down prey in a pack. It will never disobey the commands of a skilled Trainer.
3237.name: mightyena

3238.text: It will always obey the commands of a skilled Trainer. Its behavior arises from its living in packs in ancient times.
3238.name: mightyena

3239.text: It chases down prey in a pack of around ten. They defeat foes with perfectly coordinated teamwork.
3239.name: mightyena

3240.text: Mightyena gives obvious signals when it is preparing to attack. It starts to growl deeply and then flattens its body. This Pokémon will bite savagely with its sharply pointed fangs.
3240.name: mightyena

3241.text: Mightyena travel and act as a pack in the wild. The memory of its life in the wild compels the Pokémon to obey only those Trainers that it recognizes to possess superior skill.
3241.name: mightyena

3242.text: Rubbing its nose against the ground, it always wanders about back and forth in search of something. It is distinguished by the zigzag footprints it leaves.
3242.name: zigzagoon

3243.text: It gets interested in everything, which is why it zigs and zags. It is good at finding items.
3243.name: zigzagoon

3244.text: It walks in zigzag fashion. It’s good at finding items in the grass and even in the ground.
3244.name: zigzagoon

3245.text: A Pokémon with abundant curiosity. It shows an interest in everything, so it always zigzags.
3245.name: zigzagoon

3246.text: Zigzagoon restlessly wanders everywhere at all times. This Pokémon does so because it is very curious. It becomes interested in anything that it happens to see.
3246.name: zigzagoon

3247.text: The hair on Zigzagoon’s back is bristly. It rubs the hard back hair against trees to leave its territorial markings. This Pokémon may play dead to fool foes in battle.
3247.name: zigzagoon

3248.text: It marks its territory by rubbing its bristly fur on trees. This variety of Zigzagoon is friendlier and calmer than the kind native to Galar.
3248.name: zigzagoon

3249.text: Zigzagoon that adapted to regions outside Galar acquired this appearance. If you’ve lost something, this Pokémon can likely find it.
3249.name: zigzagoon

3250.text: It is exceedingly fast if it only has to run in a straight line. When it spots pond- dwelling prey underwater, it quickly leaps in and catches it with its sharp claws.
3250.name: linoone

3251.text: When running in a straight line, it can easily top 60 miles an hour. It has a tough time with curved roads.
3251.name: linoone

3252.text: It charges prey at speeds over 60 mph. However, because it can only run straight, it often fails.
3252.name: linoone

3253.text: Linoone always runs full speed and only in straight lines. If facing an obstacle, it makes a right-angle turn to evade it. This Pokémon is very challenged by gently curving roads.
3253.name: linoone

3254.text: When hunting, Linoone will make a beeline straight for the prey at a full run. While this Pokémon is capable of topping 60 mph, it has to come to a screeching halt before it can turn.
3254.name: linoone

3255.text: Its fur is strong and supple. Shaving brushes made with shed Linoone hairs are highly prized.
3255.name: linoone

3256.text: It uses its explosive speed and razor-sharp claws to bring down prey. Running along winding paths is not its strong suit.
3256.name: linoone

3257.text: Using the spikes on its rear end,   WURMPLE peels the bark off trees and feeds on the sap that oozes out. This POKéMON’s feet are tipped with suction pads that allow it to cling to glass without slipping.
3257.name: wurmple

3258.text: WURMPLE is targeted by SWELLOW as prey. This POKéMON will try to resist by pointing the spikes on its rear at the attacking predator. It will weaken the foe by leaking poison from the spikes.
3258.name: wurmple

3259.text: It sticks to tree branches and eats leaves. The thread it spits from its mouth, which becomes gooey when it touches air, slows the movement of its foes.
3259.name: wurmple

3260.text: It lives amidst tall grass and in forests. When attacked, it resists by pointing its venomous spikes at the foe.
3260.name: wurmple

3261.text: It spits a white silk that turns sticky when it contacts air. It is used to immobilize foes.
3261.name: wurmple

3262.text: Often targeted by bird Pokémon, it desperately resists by releasing poison from its tail spikes.
3262.name: wurmple

3263.text: It loves to eat leaves. If it is attacked by a Starly, it will defend itself with its spiked rear.
3263.name: wurmple

3264.text: It lives among the tall grass and in forests. It repels attacks by raising up the spikes on its rear.
3264.name: wurmple

3265.text: Using the spikes on its rear end, Wurmple peels the bark off trees and feeds on the sap that oozes out. This Pokémon’s feet are tipped with suction pads that allow it to cling to glass without slipping.
3265.name: wurmple

3266.text: Wurmple is targeted by Swellow as prey. This Pokémon will try to resist by pointing the spikes on its rear at the attacking predator. It will weaken the foe by leaking poison from the spikes.
3266.name: wurmple

3267.text: Likes sap and is abundant in the wild. Why it evolves into various different forms is unknown. One cannot tell from a Wurmple's appearance which form it will take when it evolves.
3267.name: wurmple

3268.text: It prepares for evolution using the energy it stored while it was a WURMPLE. It keeps watch over the surroundings with its two eyes.
3268.name: silcoon

3269.text: It conserves its energy by moving as little as possible. It awaits evolution while drinking only a little rainwater.
3269.name: silcoon

3270.text: It anchors itself by wrapping twigs with the silk from its body. It motionlessly awaits evolution.
3270.name: silcoon

3271.text: Having wrapped silk around the branches of a tree, it quiescently awaits evolution.
3271.name: silcoon

3272.text: It wraps silk around the branches of a tree. It drinks rainwater on its silk while awaiting evolution.
3272.name: silcoon

3273.text: It drinks dew that collects on its silk and waits for evolution. Its hard cocoon repels attacks.
3273.name: silcoon

3274.text: Silcoon tethers itself to a tree branch using silk to keep from falling. There, this Pokémon hangs quietly while it awaits evolution. It peers out of the silk cocoon through a small hole.
3274.name: silcoon

3275.text: Silcoon was thought to endure hunger and not consume anything before its evolution. However, it is now thought that this Pokémon slakes its thirst by drinking rainwater that collects on its silk.
3275.name: silcoon

3276.text: Wraps itself in thin strings of silk while it stores energy for evolution. It can't extend its limbs and its movement is slow, but its eyes keep a sharp lookout—Silcoon is always on guard.
3276.name: silcoon

3277.text: Its colorfully patterned wings are its most prominent feature. It flies through flower-covered fields collecting pollen. It attacks ferociously when angered.
3277.name: beautifly

3278.text: Despite its appearance, it has an aggressive nature. It attacks by jabbing with its long, thin mouth.
3278.name: beautifly

3279.text: When flower fields bloom, it flits around, collecting pollen. Despite its appearance, it is savage.
3279.name: beautifly

3280.text: Despite its looks, it is aggressive. It jabs with its long, thin mouth if disturbed while collecting pollen.
3280.name: beautifly

3281.text: Vibrantly patterned wings are its prominent feature. It sucks sweet flower nectar with its long mouth.
3281.name: beautifly

3282.text: It has an aggressive nature. It stabs prey with its long, narrow mouth to drain the prey’s fluids.
3282.name: beautifly

3283.text: Beautifly’s favorite food is the sweet pollen of flowers. If you want to see this Pokémon, just leave a potted flower by an open window. Beautifly is sure to come looking for pollen.
3283.name: beautifly

3284.text: Beautifly has a long mouth like a coiled needle, which is very convenient for collecting pollen from flowers. This Pokémon rides the spring winds as it flits around gathering pollen.
3284.name: beautifly

3285.text: A colorful and incredibly beautiful but also greedy Pokémon. In an effort to keep its favorite food all to itself, it will chase away Combee as they try to gather nectar.
3285.name: beautifly

3286.text: If it is attacked, CASCOON remains motionless however badly it may be hurt. It does so because if it were to move, its body would be weak upon evolution. This POKéMON will also not forget the pain it endured.
3286.name: cascoon

3287.text: To avoid detection by its enemies, it hides motionlessly beneath large leaves and in the gaps of branches. It also attaches dead leaves to its body for camouflage.
3287.name: cascoon

3288.text: It is hot inside its cocoon. All the cells in its body create the energy for it to evolve.
3288.name: cascoon

3289.text: Encased within its tough cocoon, it endures attacks. It never forgets the appearance of its foes.
3289.name: cascoon

3290.text: It endures attacks with patience, because the more pain before evolution, the sturdier it becomes.
3290.name: cascoon

3291.text: Its body, which is made of soft silk, hardens over time. When cracks appear, evolution is near.
3291.name: cascoon

3292.text: It never forgets any attack it endured while in the cocoon. After evolution, it seeks payback.
3292.name: cascoon

3293.text: Cascoon makes its protective cocoon by wrapping its body entirely with a fine silk from its mouth. Once the silk goes around its body, it hardens. This Pokémon prepares for its evolution inside the cocoon.
3293.name: cascoon

3294.text: If it is attacked, Cascoon remains motionless however badly it may be hurt. It does so because if it were to move, its body would be weak upon evolution. This Pokémon will also not forget the pain it endured.
3294.name: cascoon

3295.text: The silk coating its body is thin but sufficiently strong. Cascoon's silk has a luster and texture superior to that of Silcoon's, and clothes made using Cascoon silk are regarded as top-notch.
3295.name: cascoon

3296.text: It is a nocturnal POKéMON that flies from fields and mountains to the attraction of streetlights at night. It looses highly toxic powder from its wings.
3296.name: dustox

3297.text: It scatters horribly toxic dust when it senses danger. They tend to gather in the glow of streetlamps at night.
3297.name: dustox

3298.text: It scatters its fine dust all over when it is attacked. It is a nocturnal Pokémon.
3298.name: dustox

3299.text: Toxic powder is scattered with each flap. At night, it is known to strip leaves off trees lining boulevards.
3299.name: dustox

3300.text: A nocturnal Pokémon. Drawn by streetlights, they messily eat the leaves of trees lining boulevards.
3300.name: dustox

3301.text: It violently flutters its wings to scatter toxic dust when attacked. It becomes active after sunset.
3301.name: dustox

3302.text: Dustox is instinctively drawn to light. Swarms of this Pokémon are attracted by the bright lights of cities, where they wreak havoc by stripping the leaves off roadside trees for food.
3302.name: dustox

3303.text: When Dustox flaps its wings, a fine dust is scattered all over. This dust is actually a powerful poison that will even make a pro wrestler sick. This Pokémon searches for food using its antennae like radar.
3303.name: dustox

3304.text: Tends to be drawn to bonfires on dark nights. Difficult to chase away from settlements because of the way it scatters highly toxic scales.
3304.name: dustox

3305.text: This POKéMON lives in ponds with clean water. It is known to ferry small POKéMON across ponds by carrying them on the broad leaf on its head.
3305.name: lotad

3306.text: It looks like an aquatic plant and serves as a ferry to Pokémon that can’t swim.
3306.name: lotad

3307.text: Lotad live in ponds and lakes, where they float on the surface. It grows weak if its broad leaf dies. On rare occasions, this Pokémon travels on land in search of clean water.
3307.name: lotad

3308.text: Lotad is said to have dwelled on land before. However, this Pokémon is thought to have returned to water because the leaf on its head grew large and heavy. It now lives by floating atop the water.
3308.name: lotad

3309.text: It searches about for clean water. If it does not drink water for too long, the leaf on its head wilts.
3309.name: lotad

3310.text: Its leaf grew too large for it to live on land. That is how it began to live floating in the water.
3310.name: lotad

3311.text: LOMBRE is nocturnal - it will get active after dusk. It is also a mischief-maker. When this POKéMON spots anglers, it tugs on their fishing lines from beneath the surface and enjoys their consternation.
3311.name: lombre

3312.text: In the evening, it takes great delight in popping out of rivers and startling people. It feeds on aquatic moss that grows on rocks in the riverbed.
3312.name: lombre

3313.text: It has a mischievous spirit. If it spots an angler, it will tug on the fishing line to interfere.
3313.name: lombre

3314.text: Lombre is nocturnal—it will get active after dusk. It is also a mischief maker. When this Pokémon spots anglers, it tugs on their fishing lines from beneath the surface and enjoys their consternation.
3314.name: lombre

3315.text: Lombre’s entire body is covered by a slippery, slimy film. It feels horribly unpleasant to be touched by this Pokémon’s hands. Lombre is often mistaken for a human child.
3315.name: lombre

3316.text: It is nocturnal and becomes active at nightfall. It feeds on aquatic mosses that grow in the riverbed.
3316.name: lombre

3317.text: It lives at the water’s edge where it is sunny. It sleeps on a bed of water grass by day and becomes active at night.
3317.name: lombre

3318.text: LUDICOLO begins dancing as soon as it hears cheerful, festive music. This POKéMON is said to appear when it hears the singing of children on hiking outings.
3318.name: ludicolo

3319.text: When it hears festive music, all the cells in its body become stimulated, and it begins moving in rhythm. It does not quail even when it faces a tough opponent.
3319.name: ludicolo

3320.text: The rhythm of bright, festive music activates LUDICOLO’s cells, making it more powerful.
3320.name: ludicolo

3321.text: If it hears festive music, all its muscles fill with energy. It can’t help breaking out into a dance.
3321.name: ludicolo

3322.text: Ludicolo begins dancing as soon as it hears cheerful, festive music. This Pokémon is said to appear when it hears the singing of children on hiking outings.
3322.name: ludicolo

3323.text: Upon hearing an upbeat and cheerful rhythm, the cells in Ludicolo’s body become very energetic and active. Even in battle, this Pokémon will exhibit an amazing amount of power.
3323.name: ludicolo

3324.text: The rhythm of bright, festive music activates Ludicolo’s cells, making it more powerful.
3324.name: ludicolo

3325.text: If it hears festive music, it begins moving in rhythm in order to amplify its power.
3325.name: ludicolo

3326.text: SEEDOT attaches itself to a tree branch using the top of its head. It sucks moisture from the tree while hanging off the branch. The more water it drinks, the glossier this POKéMON’s body becomes.
3326.name: seedot

3327.text: SEEDOT looks exactly like an acorn when it is dangling from a tree branch. It startles other POKéMON by suddenly moving. This POKéMON polishes its body once a day using leaves.
3327.name: seedot

3328.text: It hangs off branches and absorbs nutrients. When it finishes eating, its body becomes so heavy that it drops to the ground with a thump.
3328.name: seedot

3329.text: If it remains still, it becomes impossible to distinguish from real nuts. It delights in surprising foraging PIDGEY.
3329.name: seedot

3330.text: When it dangles from a tree branch, it looks just like an acorn. It enjoys scaring other Pokémon.
3330.name: seedot

3331.text: Seedot attaches itself to a tree branch using the top of its head. It sucks moisture from the tree while hanging off the branch. The more water it drinks, the glossier this Pokémon’s body becomes.
3331.name: seedot

3332.text: Seedot looks exactly like an acorn when it is dangling from a tree branch. It startles other Pokémon by suddenly moving. This Pokémon polishes its body once a day using leaves.
3332.name: seedot

3333.text: If it remains still, it looks just like a real nut. It delights in surprising foraging Pokémon.
3333.name: seedot

3334.text: It attaches itself to a tree branch using the top of its head. Strong winds can sometimes make it fall.
3334.name: seedot

3335.text: A forest-dwelling POKéMON that is skilled at climbing trees. Its long and pointed nose is its weak point. It loses power if the nose is gripped.
3335.name: nuzleaf

3336.text: The sound of its grass flute makes its listeners uneasy. It lives deep in forests.
3336.name: nuzleaf

3337.text: Nuzleaf live in densely overgrown forests. They occasionally venture out of the forest to startle people. This Pokémon dislikes having its long nose pinched.
3337.name: nuzleaf

3338.text: This Pokémon pulls out the leaf on its head and makes a flute with it. The sound of Nuzleaf’s flute strikes fear and uncertainty in the hearts of people lost in a forest.
3338.name: nuzleaf

3339.text: It lives deep in forests. With the leaf on its head, it makes a flute whose song makes listeners uneasy.
3339.name: nuzleaf

3340.text: They live in holes bored in large trees. The sound of Nuzleaf’s grass flute fills listeners with dread.
3340.name: nuzleaf

3341.text: It is said to arrive on chilly, wintry winds. Feared from long ago as the guardian of forests, this POKéMON lives in a deep forest where people do not venture.
3341.name: shiftry

3342.text: By flapping its leafy fan, it can whip up gusts of 100 feet per second that can level houses.
3342.name: shiftry

3343.text: Shiftry is a mysterious Pokémon that is said to live atop towering trees dating back over a thousand years. It creates terrific windstorms with the fans it holds.
3343.name: shiftry

3344.text: Shiftry’s large fans generate awesome gusts of wind at a speed close to 100 feet per second. The whipped-up wind blows anything away. This Pokémon chooses to live quietly deep in forests.
3344.name: shiftry

3345.text: A Pokémon that was feared as a forest guardian. It can read the foe’s mind and take preemptive action.
3345.name: shiftry

3346.text: It lives quietly in the deep forest. It is said to create chilly winter winds with the fans it holds.
3346.name: shiftry

3347.text: TAILLOW courageously stands its ground against foes, however strong they may be. This gutsy POKéMON will remain defiant even after a loss. On the other hand, it cries loudly if it becomes hungry.
3347.name: taillow

3348.text: TAILLOW is young - it has only just left its nest. As a result, it sometimes becomes lonesome and cries at night. This POKéMON feeds on WURMPLE that live in forests.
3348.name: taillow

3349.text: Although it is small, it is very courageous. It will take on a larger SKARMORY on an equal footing. However, its will weakens if it becomes hungry.
3349.name: taillow

3350.text: When it gets cold, they migrate, flying over 180 miles a day. It hunts for tasty prey.
3350.name: taillow

3351.text: It has a gutsy spirit that makes it bravely take on tough foes. It flies in search of warm climates.
3351.name: taillow

3352.text: It dislikes cold seasons. They migrate to other lands in search of warmth, flying over 180 miles a day.
3352.name: taillow

3353.text: Taillow courageously stands its ground against foes, however strong they may be. This gutsy Pokémon will remain defiant even after a loss. On the other hand, it cries loudly if it becomes hungry.
3353.name: taillow

3354.text: Taillow is young—it has only just left its nest. As a result, it sometimes becomes lonesome and cries at night. This Pokémon feeds on Wurmple that live in forests.
3354.name: taillow

3355.text: A SWELLOW dives upon prey from far above. It never misses its targets. It takes to the skies in search of lands with a warm climate.
3355.name: swellow

3356.text: It circles the sky in search of prey. When it spots one, it dives steeply to catch the prey.
3356.name: swellow

3357.text: If its two tail feathers are standing at attention, it is proof of good health. It soars elegantly in the sky.
3357.name: swellow

3358.text: It dives at a steep angle as soon as it spots its prey. It catches its prey with sharp claws.
3358.name: swellow

3359.text: Swellow flies high above our heads, making graceful arcs in the sky. This Pokémon dives at a steep angle as soon as it spots its prey. The hapless prey is tightly grasped by Swellow’s clawed feet, preventing escape.
3359.name: swellow

3360.text: Swellow is very conscientious about the upkeep of its glossy wings. Once two Swellow are gathered, they diligently take care of cleaning each other’s wings.
3360.name: swellow

3361.text: It makes its nest on a sheer cliff at the edge of the sea. It has trouble keeping its wings flapping in flight. Instead, it soars on updrafts.
3361.name: wingull

3362.text: It rides upon ocean winds as if it were a glider. In the winter, it hides food around its nest.
3362.name: wingull

3363.text: It soars high in the sky, riding on updrafts like a glider. It carries food tucked in its bill.
3363.name: wingull

3364.text: Catching sea winds with its long wings, it soars as if it were a glider. It folds its wings to rest.
3364.name: wingull

3365.text: It makes its nest on steep sea cliffs. Riding updrafts, it soars to great heights.
3365.name: wingull

3366.text: Wingull has the habit of carrying prey and valuables in its beak and hiding them in all sorts of locations. This Pokémon rides the winds and flies as if it were skating across the sky.
3366.name: wingull

3367.text: Wingull rides updrafts rising from the sea by extending its long and narrow wings to glide. This Pokémon’s long beak is useful for catching prey.
3367.name: wingull

3368.text: Its hollow bones enhance its lightness. It spreads its wings to the wind and soars away into the sky.
3368.name: wingull

3369.text: Fishermen keep an eye out for Wingull in the sky, because wherever they’re circling, the ocean is sure to be teeming with fish Pokémon.
3369.name: wingull

3370.text: With its long, thin wings, it catches updrafts and flies like a glider high up into the sky.
3370.name: wingull

3371.text: It builds nests in cliffs by the sea. It circles the skies above the ocean looking for its favorite food—Wishiwashi.
3371.name: wingull

3372.text: It makes its nest on sheer cliffs. Riding the sea breeze, it glides up into the expansive skies.
3372.name: wingull

3373.text: It soars on updrafts without flapping its wings. It makes a nest on sheer cliffs at the sea’s edge.
3373.name: wingull

3374.text: PELIPPER is a flying transporter that carries small POKéMON and eggs inside its massive bill. This POKéMON builds its nest on steep cliffs facing the sea.
3374.name: pelipper

3375.text: It skims the tops of waves as it flies. When it spots prey, it uses its large beak to scoop up the victim with water. It protects its eggs in its beak.
3375.name: pelipper

3376.text: It is a flying transporter that carries small POKéMON in its beak. It bobs on the waves to rest its wings.
3376.name: pelipper

3377.text: It acts as a delivery service by carrying small Pokémon in its bill. It bobs on the waves to rest.
3377.name: pelipper

3378.text: It protects its young in its beak. It bobs on waves, resting on them on days when the waters are calm.
3378.name: pelipper

3379.text: It dips its large bill in the sea, then scoops up numerous prey along with water.
3379.name: pelipper

3380.text: Pelipper is a flying transporter that carries small Pokémon and eggs inside its massive bill. This Pokémon builds its nest on steep cliffs facing the sea.
3380.name: pelipper

3381.text: Pelipper searches for food while in flight by skimming the wave tops. This Pokémon dips its large bill in the sea to scoop up food, then swallows everything in one big gulp.
3381.name: pelipper

3382.text: Its spacious beak is large enough for a small child to fit right inside.
3382.name: pelipper

3383.text: Gathering food is the work of young males. They store food in their capacious beaks and carry it back to others waiting in the nest.
3383.name: pelipper

3384.text: It places small Pokémon into its spacious beak and carries them around. No one knows where it’s taking them.
3384.name: pelipper

3385.text: It scoops up Wishiwashi in its huge beak and swallows them whole. It can devour more than 30 at one go!
3385.name: pelipper

3386.text: It is a messenger of the skies, carrying small Pokémon and eggs to safety in its bill.
3386.name: pelipper

3387.text: Skimming the water’s surface, it dips its large bill in the sea, scoops up food and water, and carries it.
3387.name: pelipper

3388.text: RALTS has the ability to sense the emotions of people. If its TRAINER is in a cheerful mood, this POKéMON grows cheerful and joyous in the same way.
3388.name: ralts

3389.text: A RALTS has the power to sense the emotions of people and POKéMON with the horns on its head. It takes cover if it senses any hostility.
3389.name: ralts

3390.text: It uses the horns on its head to sense human emotions. It is said to appear in front of cheerful people.
3390.name: ralts

3391.text: The horns on its head provide a strong power that enables it to sense people’s emotions.
3391.name: ralts

3392.text: Ralts senses the emotions of people using the horns on its head. This Pokémon rarely appears before people. But when it does, it draws closer if it senses that the person has a positive disposition.
3392.name: ralts

3393.text: Ralts has the ability to sense the emotions of people. If its Trainer is in a cheerful mood, this Pokémon grows cheerful and joyous in the same way.
3393.name: ralts

3394.text: It is highly attuned to the emotions of people and Pokémon. It hides if it senses hostility.
3394.name: ralts

3395.text: If its horns capture the warm feelings of people or Pokémon, its body warms up slightly.
3395.name: ralts

3396.text: Tends to prefer people with a chipper disposition to those who are gloomy, but it has shown no discrimination with regard to age or gender. Needs more research.
3396.name: ralts

3397.text: A KIRLIA has the psychic power to create  a rip in the dimensions and see into the future. It is said to dance with pleasure on sunny mornings.
3397.name: kirlia

3398.text: It is highly perceptive of its Trainer’s feelings. It dances when it is feeling happy.
3398.name: kirlia

3399.text: The cheerful spirit of its Trainer gives it energy for its psychokinetic power. It spins and dances when happy.
3399.name: kirlia

3400.text: It is said that a Kirlia that is exposed to the positive emotions of its Trainer grows beautiful. This Pokémon controls psychokinetic powers with its highly developed brain.
3400.name: kirlia

3401.text: Kirlia uses the horns on its head to amplify its psychokinetic power. When the Pokémon uses its power, the air around it becomes distorted, creating mirages of nonexistent scenery.
3401.name: kirlia

3402.text: If its Trainer becomes happy, it overflows with energy, dancing joyously while spinning about.
3402.name: kirlia

3403.text: It has a psychic power that enables it to distort the space around it and see into the future.
3403.name: kirlia

3404.text: It resembles a maiden in appearance, but it wields strange powers to project visions of paradise. I suspect the crimson ornaments on its head are the key to its abilities.
3404.name: kirlia

3405.text: GARDEVOIR has the ability to read the future. If it senses impending danger to its TRAINER, this POKéMON is said to unleash its psychokinetic energy at full power.
3405.name: gardevoir

3406.text: GARDEVOIR has the psychokinetic power to distort the dimensions and create a small black hole. This POKéMON will try to protect its TRAINER even at the risk of its own life.
3406.name: gardevoir

3407.text: It apparently does not feel the pull of gravity because it supports itself with psychic power. It will give its life to protect its TRAINER.
3407.name: gardevoir

3408.text: It will try to guard its trusted Trainer with its life. It has the ability to see the future.
3408.name: gardevoir

3409.text: It unleashes psychokinetic energy at full power when protecting a Trainer it has bonded closely with.
3409.name: gardevoir

3410.text: Gardevoir has the ability to read the future. If it senses impending danger to its Trainer, this Pokémon is said to unleash its psychokinetic energy at full power.
3410.name: gardevoir

3411.text: Gardevoir has the psychokinetic power to distort the dimensions and create a small black hole. This Pokémon will try to protect its Trainer even at the risk of its own life.
3411.name: gardevoir

3412.text: It has the power to predict the future. Its power peaks when it is protecting its Trainer.
3412.name: gardevoir

3413.text: To protect its Trainer, it will expend all its psychic power to create a small black hole.
3413.name: gardevoir

3414.text: It will dedicate itself to defending a master it has come to adore. Its pure white dress, reminiscent of those worn by ladies of nobility, is the dress of one who is willing to risk their life.
3414.name: gardevoir

3415.text: From the tips of its feet, SURSKIT secretes an oil that enables it to walk on water as if it were skating. This POKéMON feeds on microscopic organisms in ponds and lakes.
3415.name: surskit

3416.text: If SURSKIT senses danger, it secretes a thick, sugary syrup from the tip of its head. There are some POKéMON that love eating this syrup.
3416.name: surskit

3417.text: They gather on puddles after evening downpours, gliding across the surface of water as if sliding. It secretes honey with a sweet aroma from its head.
3417.name: surskit

3418.text: It secretes a thick, sweet-scented syrup from the tip of its head. It lives on weed-choked ponds.
3418.name: surskit

3419.text: They usually live on ponds, but after an evening shower, they may appear on puddles in towns.
3419.name: surskit

3420.text: It appears as if it is skating on water. It draws prey with a sweet scent from the tip of its head.
3420.name: surskit

3421.text: From the tips of its feet, Surskit secretes an oil that enables it to walk on water as if it were skating. This Pokémon feeds on microscopic organisms in ponds and lakes.
3421.name: surskit

3422.text: If Surskit senses danger, it secretes a thick, sugary syrup from the tip of its head. There are some Pokémon that love eating this syrup.
3422.name: surskit

3423.text: It moves as if skating on the surface of the water. It often fights with Dewpider over food.
3423.name: surskit

3424.text: When this Pokémon senses danger, a sweet fluid oozes from the tip of its head. The taste of it disgusts bird Pokémon.
3424.name: surskit

3425.text: If it’s in a pinch, it will secrete a sweet liquid from the tip of its head. Syrup made from gathering that liquid is tasty on bread.
3425.name: surskit

3426.text: It lives in ponds and marshes that feature lots of plant life. It often fights with Dewpider, whose habitat and diet are similar.
3426.name: surskit

3427.text: MASQUERAIN intimidates enemies with the eyelike patterns on its antennas. This POKéMON flaps its four wings to freely fly in any direction - even sideways and backwards - as if it were a helicopter.
3427.name: masquerain

3428.text: MASQUERAIN’s antennas have eyelike patterns that usually give it an angry look. If the “eyes” are droopy and appear sad, it is said to be a sign that a heavy rainfall is on its way.
3428.name: masquerain

3429.text: It intimidates foes with the large eyelike patterns on its antennae. Because it can’t fly if its wings get wet, it shelters itself from rain under large trees and eaves.
3429.name: masquerain

3430.text: The antennae have distinctive patterns that look like eyes. When it rains, they grow heavy, making flight impossible.
3430.name: masquerain

3431.text: Its antennae have eye patterns on them. Its four wings enable it to hover and fly in any direction.
3431.name: masquerain

3432.text: It flaps its four wings to hover and fly freely in any direction--to and fro and sideways.
3432.name: masquerain

3433.text: Masquerain intimidates enemies with the eyelike patterns on its antennas. This Pokémon flaps its four wings to freely fly in any direction—even sideways and backwards—as if it were a helicopter.
3433.name: masquerain

3434.text: Masquerain’s antennas have eyelike patterns that usually give it an angry look. If the “eyes” are droopy and appear sad, it is said to be a sign that a heavy rainfall is on its way.
3434.name: masquerain

3435.text: It intimidates enemies with the eye-like patterns on its antennae. Its four wings allow it to fly in any direction.
3435.name: masquerain

3436.text: Its wings and antennae don’t cope well with moisture. After a rain, it faces sunward to dry off.
3436.name: masquerain

3437.text: Masquerain intimidates enemies with the eyelike patterns of its eyespots. If that doesn’t work, it deftly makes its escape on its set of four wings.
3437.name: masquerain

3438.text: Its thin, winglike antennae are highly absorbent. It waits out rainy days in tree hollows.
3438.name: masquerain

3439.text: It loves to eat damp, composted soil in forests. If you enter a forest after a long rain, you can see many SHROOMISH feasting on composted soil.
3439.name: shroomish

3440.text: If it senses danger, it scatters spores from the top of its head to protect itself.
3440.name: shroomish

3441.text: It prefers damp places. By day it remains still in the forest shade. It releases toxic powder from its head.
3441.name: shroomish

3442.text: It spouts poison spores from the top of its head. These spores cause pain all over if inhaled.
3442.name: shroomish

3443.text: Shroomish live in damp soil in the dark depths of forests. They are often found keeping still under fallen leaves. This Pokémon feeds on compost that is made up of fallen, rotted leaves.
3443.name: shroomish

3444.text: If Shroomish senses danger, it shakes its body and scatters spores from the top of its head. This Pokémon’s spores are so toxic, they make trees and weeds wilt.
3444.name: shroomish

3445.text: BRELOOM closes in on its foe with light and sprightly footwork, then throws punches with its stretchy arms. This POKéMON’s fighting technique puts boxers to shame.
3445.name: breloom

3446.text: It scatters spores from holes in the cap on its head. It loves warm and humid climates. It feeds on trees and plants in fields and forests.
3446.name: breloom

3447.text: The seeds on its tail are made of toxic spores. It knocks out foes with quick, virtually invisible punches.
3447.name: breloom

3448.text: Its short arms stretch when it throws punches. Its technique is equal to that of pro boxers.
3448.name: breloom

3449.text: It scatters poisonous spores and throws powerful punches while its foe is hampered by inhaled spores.
3449.name: breloom

3450.text: Breloom closes in on its foe with light and sprightly footwork, then throws punches with its stretchy arms. This Pokémon’s fighting technique puts boxers to shame.
3450.name: breloom

3451.text: The seeds ringing Breloom’s tail are made of hardened toxic spores. It is horrible to eat the seeds. Just taking a bite of this Pokémon’s seed will cause your stomach to rumble.
3451.name: breloom

3452.text: It sleeps virtually all day and night long. It doesn’t change its nest its entire life, but it sometimes travels great distances by swimming in rivers.
3452.name: slakoth

3453.text: It sleeps for 20 hours every day. Making drowsy those that see it is one of its abilities.
3453.name: slakoth

3454.text: It spends nearly all its time in a day sprawled out. Just seeing it makes one drowsy.
3454.name: slakoth

3455.text: The way Slakoth lolls around makes anyone who watches it feel like doing the same.
3455.name: slakoth

3456.text: If it eats just three leaves in a day, it is satisfied. Other than that, it sleeps for 20 hours a day.
3456.name: slakoth

3457.text: Slakoth lolls around for over 20 hours every day. Because it moves so little, it does not need much food. This Pokémon’s sole daily meal consists of just three leaves.
3457.name: slakoth

3458.text: Slakoth’s heart beats just once a minute. Whatever happens, it is content to loaf around motionless. It is rare to see this Pokémon in motion.
3458.name: slakoth

3459.text: It can’t keep still because its blood boils with energy. It runs through the fields and mountains all day to calm itself. If it doesn’t, it can’t sleep at night.
3459.name: vigoroth

3460.text: It is always hungry because it won’t stop rampaging. Even while it is eating, it can’t keep still.
3460.name: vigoroth

3461.text: Its heart beats at a tenfold tempo, so it cannot sit still for even a moment.
3461.name: vigoroth

3462.text: Its heartbeat is fast and its blood so agitated that it can’t sit still for one second.
3462.name: vigoroth

3463.text: Its stress level rises if it cannot keep moving constantly. Too much stress makes it feel sick.
3463.name: vigoroth

3464.text: Vigoroth is always itching and agitated to go on a wild rampage. It simply can’t tolerate sitting still for even a minute. This Pokémon’s stress level rises if it can’t be moving constantly.
3464.name: vigoroth

3465.text: Vigoroth is simply incapable of remaining still. Even when it tries to sleep, the blood in its veins grows agitated, compelling this Pokémon to run wild throughout the jungle before it can settle down.
3465.name: vigoroth

3466.text: Hordes of SLAKING gather around trees when fruits come into season. They wait around patiently for ripened fruits to fall out of the trees.
3466.name: slaking

3467.text: The world’s laziest Pokémon. When it is lounging, it is actually saving energy for striking back.
3467.name: slaking

3468.text: This Pokémon lives lying on its side. It only rolls over and moves when there is no more grass to eat.
3468.name: slaking

3469.text: The world’s laziest Pokémon. It moves to another spot when there’s no food left within its reach.
3469.name: slaking

3470.text: It is the world’s most slothful Pokémon. However, it can exert horrifying power by releasing pent-up energy all at once.
3470.name: slaking

3471.text: Slaking spends all day lying down and lolling about. It eats grass growing within its reach. If it eats all the grass it can reach, this Pokémon reluctantly moves to another spot.
3471.name: slaking

3472.text: Wherever Slaking live, rings of over a yard in diameter appear in grassy fields. They are made by the Pokémon as it eats all the grass within reach while lying prone on the ground.
3472.name: slaking

3473.text: NINCADA lives underground. It uses its sharp claws to carve the roots of trees and absorb moisture and nutrients. This POKéMON can’t withstand bright sunlight so avoids it.
3473.name: nincada

3474.text: It makes its nest at the roots of a mighty tree. Using its whiskerlike antennae, it probes its surroundings in the pitch-black darkness of soil.
3474.name: nincada

3475.text: It grows underground, sensing its surroundings using antennae instead of its virtually blind eyes.
3475.name: nincada

3476.text: Nincada lives underground for many years in complete darkness. This Pokémon absorbs nutrients from the roots of trees. It stays motionless as it waits for evolution.
3476.name: nincada

3477.text: Nincada lives underground. It uses its sharp claws to carve the roots of trees and absorb moisture and nutrients. This Pokémon can’t withstand bright sunlight so avoids it.
3477.name: nincada

3478.text: Because it lived almost entirely underground, it is nearly blind. It uses its antennae instead.
3478.name: nincada

3479.text: It can sometimes live underground for more than 10 years. It absorbs nutrients from the roots of trees.
3479.name: nincada

3480.text: Because it darts about vigorously at high speed, it is very difficult to see. Hearing its distinctive cries for too long induces a headache.
3480.name: ninjask

3481.text: Because it moves so quickly, it sometimes becomes unseeable. It congregates around tree sap.
3481.name: ninjask

3482.text: Ninjask moves around at such a high speed that it cannot be seen, even while its crying can be clearly heard. For that reason, this Pokémon was long believed to be invisible.
3482.name: ninjask

3483.text: If Ninjask is not trained properly, it will refuse to obey the Trainer and cry loudly continuously. Because of this quality, this Pokémon is said to be one that puts the Trainer’s abilities to the test.
3483.name: ninjask

3484.text: Its cry leaves a lasting headache if heard for too long. It moves so quickly that it is almost invisible.
3484.name: ninjask

3485.text: This Pokémon is so quick, it is said to be able to avoid any attack. It loves to feed on tree sap.
3485.name: ninjask

3486.text: SHEDINJA is a peculiar POKéMON. It seems to appear unsought in a POKé BALL after a NINCADA evolves. This bizarre POKéMON is entirely immobile - it doesn’t even breathe.
3486.name: shedinja

3487.text: A peculiar POKéMON that floats in air even though its wings remain completely still. The inside of its body is hollow and utterly dark.
3487.name: shedinja

3488.text: A discarded bug shell that came to life. Peering into the crack on its back is said to steal one’s spirit.
3488.name: shedinja

3489.text: Shedinja’s hard body doesn’t move—not even a twitch. In fact, its body appears to be merely a hollow shell. It is believed that this Pokémon will steal the spirit of anyone peering into its hollow body from its back.
3489.name: shedinja

3490.text: Shedinja is a peculiar Pokémon. It seems to appear unsought in a Poké Ball after a Nincada evolves. This bizarre Pokémon is entirely immobile—it doesn’t even breathe.
3490.name: shedinja

3491.text: A most peculiar Pokémon that somehow appears in a Poké Ball when a Nincada evolves.
3491.name: shedinja

3492.text: A strange Pokémon—it flies without moving its wings, has a hollow shell for a body, and does not breathe.
3492.name: shedinja

3493.text: Its cries equal a jet plane in volume. It inhales through its ear canals. Because of this system, it can cry continually without having to catch its breath.
3493.name: whismur

3494.text: Usually, its cries are like quiet murmurs. If frightened, it shrieks at the same volume as a jet plane.
3494.name: whismur

3495.text: It usually murmurs but starts crying loudly if it senses danger. It stops when its ear covers are shut.
3495.name: whismur

3496.text: If it senses danger, it scares the foe by crying out with the volume of a jet-plane engine.
3496.name: whismur

3497.text: Normally, Whismur’s voice is very quiet—it is barely audible even if one is paying close attention. However, if this Pokémon senses danger, it starts crying at an earsplitting volume.
3497.name: whismur

3498.text: Whismur is very timid. If it starts to cry loudly, it becomes startled by its own crying and cries even harder. When it finally stops crying, the Pokémon goes to sleep, all tired out.
3498.name: whismur

3499.text: The cry of a Whismur is over 100 decibels. If you’re close to a Whismur when it lets out a cry, you’ll be stuck with an all-day headache.
3499.name: whismur

3500.text: When Whismur cries, the sound of its own voice startles it, making the Pokémon cry even louder. It cries until it’s exhausted, then it falls asleep.
3500.name: whismur

3501.text: LOUDRED’s bellowing can completely decimate a wood-frame house. It uses its voice to punish its foes. This POKéMON’s round ears serve as loudspeakers.
3501.name: loudred

3502.text: LOUDRED shouts while stamping its feet. After it finishes shouting, this POKéMON becomes incapable of hearing anything for a while. This is considered to be a weak point.
3502.name: loudred

3503.text: It positions the round speakers on its head to assail foes with ultrasonic waves at massive volume. It builds power by stomping the ground.
3503.name: loudred

3504.text: When it stamps its feet and bellows, it generates ultrasonic waves that can blow apart a house.
3504.name: loudred

3505.text: It shouts loudly by inhaling air, and then uses its well-developed stomach muscles to exhale.
3505.name: loudred

3506.text: The shock waves from its cries can tip over trucks. It stamps its feet to power up.
3506.name: loudred

3507.text: Loudred’s bellowing can completely decimate a wood-frame house. It uses its voice to punish its foes. This Pokémon’s round ears serve as loudspeakers.
3507.name: loudred

3508.text: Loudred shouts while stamping its feet. After it finishes shouting, this Pokémon becomes incapable of hearing anything for a while. This is considered to be a weak point.
3508.name: loudred

3509.text: Loudred’s ears serve as speakers, and they can put out sound waves powerful enough to blow away a house.
3509.name: loudred

3510.text: The force of this Pokémon’s loud voice isn’t just the sound—it’s also the wave of air pressure that blows opponents away and damages them.
3510.name: loudred

3511.text: EXPLOUD communicates its feelings to the others by emitting whistle-like sounds from the tubes on its body. This POKéMON only raises its voice when it is in battle.
3511.name: exploud

3512.text: It has sound-generating organs all over its body. It communicates with others by adjusting the tone and volume of the cries it emits.
3512.name: exploud

3513.text: It emits a variety of sounds from the  holes all over its body. Its loud cries can be heard from over six miles away.
3513.name: exploud

3514.text: Its howls can be heard over six miles away. It emits all sorts of noises from the ports on its body.
3514.name: exploud

3515.text: Its roar in battle shakes the ground like a tremor--or like an earthquake has struck.
3515.name: exploud

3516.text: Exploud triggers earthquakes with the tremors it creates by bellowing. If this Pokémon violently inhales from the ports on its body, it’s a sign that it is preparing to let loose a huge bellow.
3516.name: exploud

3517.text: Exploud communicates its feelings to the others by emitting whistle-like sounds from the tubes on its body. This Pokémon only raises its voice when it is in battle.
3517.name: exploud

3518.text: In the past, people would use the loud voices of these Pokémon as a means of communication between distant cities.
3518.name: exploud

3519.text: This Pokémon can do more than just shout. To communicate with others of its kind, it’ll emit all sorts of sounds from the holes in its body.
3519.name: exploud

3520.text: MAKUHITA is tenacious - it will keep getting up and attacking its foe however many times it is knocked down. Every time it gets back up, this POKéMON stores more energy in its body for evolving.
3520.name: makuhita

3521.text: It loves to toughen up its body above all else. If you hear quaking rumbles in a cave, it is the sound of MAKUHITA undertaking strenuous training.
3521.name: makuhita

3522.text: It toughens its body by slamming into thick trees. Many snapped trees can be found near its nest.
3522.name: makuhita

3523.text: It toughens up by slamming into thick trees over and over. It gains a sturdy body and dauntless spirit.
3523.name: makuhita

3524.text: It grows stronger by enduring harsh training. It is a gutsy Pokémon that can withstand any attack.
3524.name: makuhita

3525.text: Makuhita is tenacious—it will keep getting up and attacking its foe however many times it is knocked down. Every time it gets back up, this Pokémon stores more energy in its body for evolving.
3525.name: makuhita

3526.text: Makuhita has a tireless spirit—it will never give up hope. It eats a lot of food, gets plenty of sleep, and it trains very rigorously. By living that way, this Pokémon packs its body with energy.
3526.name: makuhita

3527.text: It was originally brought in from another region, but now Makuhita from Alola are more famous.
3527.name: makuhita

3528.text: Their daily routine consists of training together first thing in the morning, eating and napping in the afternoon, and then more training afterward.
3528.name: makuhita

3529.text: It practices its slaps by repeatedly slapping tree trunks. It has been known to slap an Exeggutor and get flung away.
3529.name: makuhita

3530.text: There’s a rumor of a traditional recipe for stew that Trainers can use to raise strong Makuhita.
3530.name: makuhita

3531.text: It has the habit of challenging others without hesitation to tests of strength. It’s been known to stand on train tracks and stop trains using forearm thrusts.
3531.name: hariyama

3532.text: It loves challenging others to tests of strength. It has the power to stop a train with a slap.
3532.name: hariyama

3533.text: It stomps on the ground to build power. It can send a 10-ton truck flying with a straight-arm punch.
3533.name: hariyama

3534.text: It loves to match power with big-bodied Pokémon. It can knock a truck flying with its arm thrusts.
3534.name: hariyama

3535.text: Hariyama practices its straight-arm slaps in any number of locations. One hit of this Pokémon’s powerful, openhanded, straight-arm punches could snap a telephone pole in two.
3535.name: hariyama

3536.text: Hariyama’s thick body may appear fat, but it is actually a hunk of solid muscle. If this Pokémon bears down and tightens all its muscles, its body becomes as hard as a rock.
3536.name: hariyama

3537.text: It is known for its fantastic strength, but as it grows older, it focuses more on training Makuhita.
3537.name: hariyama

3538.text: They love to compare their freakish strength— strength enough to send a truck flying with a single slap.
3538.name: hariyama

3539.text: Although they enjoy comparing their strength, they’re also kind. They value etiquette, praising opponents they battle.
3539.name: hariyama

3540.text: Hariyama that are big and fat aren’t necessarily strong. There are some small ones that move nimbly and use moves skillfully.
3540.name: hariyama

3541.text: Its tail, which is packed with nutrition, is very bouncy like a rubber ball. On sunny days they gather at the edge of water and splash about for fun.
3541.name: azurill

3542.text: It battles by flinging around its tail, which is bigger than its body. The tail is a flotation device in water.
3542.name: azurill

3543.text: Its tail is filled with nutrients necessary for growth. It plays by bouncing on its tail.
3543.name: azurill

3544.text: Its tail is packed full of the nutrients it needs to grow.
3544.name: azurill

3545.text: Its tail bounces like a rubber ball. It flings that tail around to fight opponents bigger than itself.
3545.name: azurill

3546.text: A Pokémon that lives by water. It moves quickly on land by bouncing on its big tail.
3546.name: azurill

3547.text: It swings its large, nutrient-filled tail around to fight opponents bigger than itself.
3547.name: azurill

3548.text: Azurill spins its tail as if it were a lasso, then hurls it far. The momentum of the throw sends its body flying, too. Using this unique action, one of these Pokémon managed to hurl itself a record 33 feet.
3548.name: azurill

3549.text: Azurill’s tail is large and bouncy. It is packed full of the nutrients this Pokémon needs to grow. Azurill can be seen bouncing and playing on its big, rubbery tail.
3549.name: azurill

3550.text: The ball on Azurill’s tail bounces like a rubber ball, and it’s full of the nutrients the Pokémon needs to grow.
3550.name: azurill

3551.text: Although Azurill are normally docile, an angry one will swing around the big ball on its tail and try to smash its opponents.
3551.name: azurill

3552.text: NOSEPASS’s magnetic nose is always pointed to the north. If two of these POKéMON meet, they cannot turn their faces to each other when they are close because their magnetic noses repel one another.
3552.name: nosepass

3553.text: NOSEPASS had been said to be completely unmoving, with its magnetic nose pointed due north. However, close observation has revealed that the POKéMON actually moves by a little over 3/8 of an inch every year.
3553.name: nosepass

3554.text: Its body emits a powerful magnetism. It feeds on prey that is pulled in by the force. Its magnetism is stronger in cold seasons.
3554.name: nosepass

3555.text: Its nose is a magnet. As a result, this Pokémon always keeps its face pointing north.
3555.name: nosepass

3556.text: If two of these meet, they cannot get too close because their noses repel each other.
3556.name: nosepass

3557.text: When endangered, it may protect itself by raising its magnetism and drawing iron objects to its body.
3557.name: nosepass

3558.text: Its magnetic nose always faces north and draws iron objects to its body to protect itself better.
3558.name: nosepass

3559.text: Its magnetic nose consistently faces north. Travelers check Nosepass to get their bearings.
3559.name: nosepass

3560.text: Nosepass’s magnetic nose is always pointed to the north. If two of these Pokémon meet, they cannot turn their faces to each other when they are close because their magnetic noses repel one another.
3560.name: nosepass

3561.text: Nosepass had been said to be completely unmoving, with its magnetic nose pointed due north. However, close observation has revealed that the Pokémon actually moves by a little over 3/8 of an inch every year.
3561.name: nosepass

3562.text: The magnet in Nosepass’s nose provides an unerring compass, making it an excellent partner for Trainers going on a journey.
3562.name: nosepass

3563.text: It uses powerful magnetism to drag its prey toward it. It’s also been known to pull in metal, which it collects and uses to protect itself.
3563.name: nosepass

3564.text: It moves less than an inch a year, but when it’s in a jam, it will spin and drill down into the ground in a split second.
3564.name: nosepass

3565.text: It hunts without twitching a muscle by pulling in its prey with powerful magnetism. But sometimes it pulls natural enemies in close.
3565.name: nosepass

3566.text: Once the people of Hisui discovered that its red nose always points north, they grew to rely on it greatly when traveling afar. The nose seems to work in a similar way to ancient compasses.
3566.name: nosepass

3567.text: SKITTY has the habit of becoming fascinated by moving objects and chasing them around. This POKéMON is known to chase after its own tail and become dizzy.
3567.name: skitty

3568.text: SKITTY is known to chase around playfully after its own tail. In the wild, this POKéMON lives in holes in the trees of forests. It is very popular as a pet because of its adorable looks.
3568.name: skitty

3569.text: A SKITTY’s adorably cute behavior makes it highly popular. In battle, it makes its tail puff out. It threatens foes with a sharp growl.
3569.name: skitty

3570.text: It is said to be difficult to earn its trust. However, it is extremely popular for its cute looks and behavior.
3570.name: skitty

3571.text: It’s adorable when it chases its own tail. It’s difficult to earn its trust.
3571.name: skitty

3572.text: It can’t stop itself from chasing moving things, and it runs in a circle, chasing its own tail.
3572.name: skitty

3573.text: It shows its cute side by chasing its own tail until it gets dizzy.
3573.name: skitty

3574.text: Skitty has the habit of becoming fascinated by moving objects and chasing them around. This Pokémon is known to chase after its own tail and become dizzy.
3574.name: skitty

3575.text: Skitty is known to chase around playfully after its own tail. In the wild, this Pokémon lives in holes in the trees of forests. It is very popular as a pet because of its adorable looks.
3575.name: skitty

3576.text: Rather than keeping a permanent lair, it habitually seeks comfortable spots and sleeps there. It is nocturnal and becomes active at dusk.
3576.name: delcatty

3577.text: The favorite of trend-conscious female TRAINERS, they are used in competition for their style and fur.
3577.name: delcatty

3578.text: The reason it does not have a nest is that it simply searches for a clean, comfortable place then sleeps there.
3578.name: delcatty

3579.text: It dislikes dirty places. It often searches for a comfortable place in which to groom itself.
3579.name: delcatty

3580.text: It is highly popular among female Trainers for its sublime fur. It does not keep a nest.
3580.name: delcatty

3581.text: Delcatty prefers to live an unfettered existence in which it can do as it pleases at its own pace. Because this Pokémon eats and sleeps whenever it decides, its daily routines are completely random.
3581.name: delcatty

3582.text: Delcatty sleeps anywhere it wants without keeping a permanent nest. If other Pokémon approach it as it sleeps, this Pokémon will never fight—it will just move away somewhere else.
3582.name: delcatty

3583.text: It digs branching holes in caves using its sharp claws in search of food--raw gems. A SABLEYE lurks in darkness and is seen only rarely.
3583.name: sableye

3584.text: It hides in the darkness of caves. Its diet of gems has transformed its eyes into gemstones.
3584.name: sableye

3585.text: It dwells in the darkness of caves. It uses its sharp claws to dig up gems to nourish itself.
3585.name: sableye

3586.text: Sableye lead quiet lives deep inside caverns. They are feared, however, because these Pokémon are thought to steal the spirits of people when their eyes burn with a sinister glow in the darkness.
3586.name: sableye

3587.text: Sableye digs the ground with sharpened claws to find rocks that it eats. Substances in the eaten rocks crystallize and rise up to the Pokémon’s body surface.
3587.name: sableye

3588.text: It’s a fiend for gemstones, so it stalks Carbink. Unfortunately, Gabite almost always grabs them first.
3588.name: sableye

3589.text: It digs through the ground with its hard claws and crunches down gems with its thick pointy teeth. Carbink is its favorite food.
3589.name: sableye

3590.text: Materials from gems it has eaten float to the surface of its body and can form an infinite number of patterns among individuals.
3590.name: sableye

3591.text: This Pokémon is feared. When its gemstone eyes begin to glow with a sinister shine, it’s believed that Sableye will steal people’s spirits away.
3591.name: sableye

3592.text: It feeds on gemstone crystals. In darkness, its eyes sparkle with the glitter of jewels.
3592.name: sableye

3593.text: MAWHILE’s huge jaws are actually steel horns that have been transformed. Its docile-looking face serves to lull its foe into letting down its guard. When the foe least expects it, MAWHILE chomps it with its gaping jaws.
3593.name: mawile

3594.text: Its giant jaws are actually steel horns that transformed. It fools foes into complacency with its adorable gestures, then chomps them with its huge jaws.
3594.name: mawile

3595.text: Attached to its head is a huge set of jaws formed by horns. It can chew through iron beams.
3595.name: mawile

3596.text: Mawile’s huge jaws are actually steel horns that have been transformed. Its docile-looking face serves to lull its foe into letting down its guard. When the foe least expects it, Mawile chomps it with its gaping jaws.
3596.name: mawile

3597.text: Don’t be taken in by this Pokémon’s cute face—it’s very dangerous. Mawile fools the foe into letting down its guard, then chomps down with its massive jaws. The steel jaws are really horns that have been transformed.
3597.name: mawile

3598.text: A cunning and terrifying Pokémon, its cuteness makes opponents let down their guard—and then it swallows them whole with its huge jaws.
3598.name: mawile

3599.text: It has two mouths. The big jaws on the back of its head can’t taste anything, so that’s the mouth it uses to eat foods it doesn’t like.
3599.name: mawile

3600.text: It uses its docile-looking face to lull foes into complacency, then bites with its huge, relentless jaws.
3600.name: mawile

3601.text: It chomps with its gaping mouth. Its huge jaws are actually steel horns that have been transformed.
3601.name: mawile

3602.text: A POKéMON that is clad in steel armor. A new suit of armor is made when it evolves. The old, discarded armor is salvaged as metal for making iron products.
3602.name: aron

3603.text: It eats iron to build its steel body. It is a pest that descends from mountains to eat bridges and train tracks.
3603.name: aron

3604.text: In order to build up its steel body, it eats iron ore. This pesky Pokémon is known to eat railroad tracks.
3604.name: aron

3605.text: It usually lives deep in mountains. However, hunger may drive it to eat railroad tracks and cars.
3605.name: aron

3606.text: When it evolves, it sheds the steel carapace that covered its whole body and develops a new one.
3606.name: aron

3607.text: This Pokémon has a body of steel. To make its body, Aron feeds on iron ore that it digs from mountains. Occasionally, it causes major trouble by eating bridges and rails.
3607.name: aron

3608.text: Aron has a body of steel. With one all-out charge, this Pokémon can demolish even a heavy dump truck. The destroyed dump truck then becomes a handy meal for the Pokémon.
3608.name: aron

3609.text: It eats iron ore—and sometimes railroad tracks— to build up the steel armor that protects its body.
3609.name: aron

3610.text: When Aron evolves, its steel armor peels off. In ancient times, people would collect Aron’s shed armor and make good use of it in their daily lives.
3610.name: aron

3611.text: LAIRON tempers its steel body by drinking highly nutritious mineral springwater until it is bloated. This POKéMON makes its nest close to springs of delicious water.
3611.name: lairon

3612.text: LAIRON feeds on iron contained in rocks and water. It makes its nest on mountains where iron ore is buried. As a result, the POKéMON often clashes with humans mining the iron ore.
3612.name: lairon

3613.text: When two LAIRON meet in the wild, they fight for territory by bashing into each other with their steel bodies. The sound of their collision carries for miles.
3613.name: lairon

3614.text: For food, it digs up iron ore. It smashes its steely body against others to fight over territory.
3614.name: lairon

3615.text: Lairon fight over territory, and when their steel bodies collide, sparks fly.
3615.name: lairon

3616.text: It loves iron ore. Groups of them fight for territory by bashing one another with their steel bodies.
3616.name: lairon

3617.text: It habitually shows off its strength with the size of sparks it creates by ramming its steel body into boulders.
3617.name: lairon

3618.text: Lairon tempers its steel body by drinking highly nutritious mineral springwater until it is bloated. This Pokémon makes its nest close to springs of delicious water.
3618.name: lairon

3619.text: Lairon feeds on iron contained in rocks and water. It makes its nest on mountains where iron ore is buried. As a result, the Pokémon often clashes with humans mining the iron ore.
3619.name: lairon

3620.text: Lairon live in mountains brimming with spring water and iron ore, so these Pokémon often came into conflict with humans in the past.
3620.name: lairon

3621.text: During territorial disputes, Lairon fight by slamming into each other. Close inspection of their steel armor reveals scratches and dents.
3621.name: lairon

3622.text: AGGRON claims an entire mountain as its own territory. It mercilessly beats up anything that violates its environment. This POKéMON vigilantly patrols its territory at all times.
3622.name: aggron

3623.text: AGGRON is surprisingly protective of its environment. If its mountain is ravaged by a landslide or a fire, this POKéMON will haul topsoil to the area, plant trees, and beautifully restore its own territory.
3623.name: aggron

3624.text: Its iron horns grow longer a little at a time. They are used to determine the AGGRON’s age. The gouges in its armor are worn with pride as mementos from battles.
3624.name: aggron

3625.text: It claims a large mountain as its sole territory. It mercilessly thrashes those that violate its space.
3625.name: aggron

3626.text: You can tell its age by the length of its iron horns. It claims an entire mountain as its territory.
3626.name: aggron

3627.text: It claims an entire mountain as its own. The more wounds it has, the more it has battled, so don’t take it lightly.
3627.name: aggron

3628.text: While seeking iron for food, it digs tunnels by breaking through bedrock with its steel horns.
3628.name: aggron

3629.text: Aggron claims an entire mountain as its own territory. It mercilessly beats up anything that violates its environment. This Pokémon vigilantly patrols its territory at all times.
3629.name: aggron

3630.text: Aggron is protective of its environment. If its mountain is ravaged by a landslide or a fire, this Pokémon will haul topsoil to the area, plant trees, and beautifully restore its own territory.
3630.name: aggron

3631.text: Aggron has a horn sharp enough to perforate thick iron sheets. It brings down its opponents by ramming into them horn first.
3631.name: aggron

3632.text: Long ago, there was a king who wore a helmet meant to resemble the head of an Aggron. He was trying to channel the Pokémon’s strength.
3632.name: aggron

3633.text: It continually meditates for hours every day. As a result of rigorous and dedicated yoga training, it has tempered its spiritual power so much it can fly.
3633.name: meditite

3634.text: It never skips its daily yoga training. It heightens its inner strength through meditation.
3634.name: meditite

3635.text: It never misses its daily yoga workouts, and it heightens its spiritual power through meditation.
3635.name: meditite

3636.text: It meditates to heighten its inner energy and to float in the air. It eats one berry a day.
3636.name: meditite

3637.text: It always trains deep in mountains. It levitates when it heightens its spiritual power through meditation.
3637.name: meditite

3638.text: It eats just one berry a day. By enduring hunger, its spirit is tempered and made sharper.
3638.name: meditite

3639.text: Meditite undertakes rigorous mental training deep in the mountains. However, whenever it meditates, this Pokémon always loses its concentration and focus. As a result, its training never ends.
3639.name: meditite

3640.text: Meditite heightens its inner energy through meditation. It survives on just one berry a day. Minimal eating is another aspect of this Pokémon’s training.
3640.name: meditite

3641.text: Through crushingly harsh yoga training, it gained the power to foretell its foe’s actions. It battles with elegant, dance- like movement.
3641.name: medicham

3642.text: Through yoga training, it has honed its sixth sense. Its movements are elegant.
3642.name: medicham

3643.text: Through daily meditation, it hones its spiritual power. It can sense what others are thinking.
3643.name: medicham

3644.text: It gains the ability to see the aura of its opponents by honing its mind through starvation.
3644.name: medicham

3645.text: It elegantly avoids attacks with dance-like steps, then launches a devastating blow in the same motion.
3645.name: medicham

3646.text: Through yoga training, it gained the psychic power to predict its foe’s next move.
3646.name: medicham

3647.text: It is said that through meditation, Medicham heightens energy inside its body and sharpens its sixth sense. This Pokémon hides its presence by merging itself with fields and mountains.
3647.name: medicham

3648.text: Through the power of meditation, Medicham developed its sixth sense. It gained the ability to use psychokinetic powers. This Pokémon is known to meditate for a whole month without eating.
3648.name: medicham

3649.text: It generates electricity using friction from the atmosphere. In seasons with especially arid air, its entire body blazes with violent showers of sparks.
3649.name: electrike

3650.text: Using electricity stored in its fur, it stimulates its muscles to heighten its reaction speed.
3650.name: electrike

3651.text: Electrike stores electricity in its long body hair. This Pokémon stimulates its leg muscles with electric charges. These jolts of power give its legs explosive acceleration performance.
3651.name: electrike

3652.text: Electrike runs faster than the human eye can follow. The friction from running is converted into electricity, which is then stored in this Pokémon’s fur.
3652.name: electrike

3653.text: Friction between the air and its fur produces static electricity. When Electrike runs, it makes a crackling sound.
3653.name: electrike

3654.text: Static electricity builds up all over its body as strands of its long fur rub together. This Pokémon boasts incredible speed.
3654.name: electrike

3655.text: It stores static electricity in its fur for discharging. It gives off sparks if a storm approaches.
3655.name: electrike

3656.text: It stores electricity in its fur. It gives off sparks from all over its body in seasons when the air is dry.
3656.name: electrike

3657.text: MANECTRIC is constantly discharging electricity from its mane. The sparks sometimes ignite forest fires. When it enters a battle, this POKéMON creates thunderclouds.
3657.name: manectric

3658.text: Because lightning falls in their vicinities, MANECTRIC were thought to have been born from lightning. In battle, they create thunderclouds.
3658.name: manectric

3659.text: Its nest can be found where a thunderbolt hits. It is discharging electricity from its mane.
3659.name: manectric

3660.text: It discharges electricity from its mane. It creates a thundercloud overhead to drop lightning bolts.
3660.name: manectric

3661.text: Manectric is constantly discharging electricity from its mane. The sparks sometimes ignite forest fires. When it enters a battle, this Pokémon creates thunderclouds.
3661.name: manectric

3662.text: Manectric discharges strong electricity from its mane. The mane is used for collecting electricity in the atmosphere. This Pokémon creates thunderclouds above its head.
3662.name: manectric

3663.text: Manectric can be found beneath unnatural thunderclouds. People say it can run at the same speed as lightning striking.
3663.name: manectric

3664.text: It stimulates its own muscles with electricity, so it can move quickly. It eases its soreness with electricity, too, so it can recover quickly as well.
3664.name: manectric

3665.text: It rarely appears before people. It is said to nest where lightning has fallen.
3665.name: manectric

3666.text: It has the trait of cheering on its fellow POKéMON. By shorting out the electricity it releases from its paws, it creates pom-poms for cheering.
3666.name: plusle
