3667.text: It cheers on partners while scattering sparks from its body. It climbs telephone poles to absorb electricity.
3667.name: plusle

3668.text: It cheers on friends with pom-poms made of sparks. It drains power from telephone poles.
3668.name: plusle

3669.text: It absorbs electricity from telephone poles. It shorts out its body to create crackling noises.
3669.name: plusle

3670.text: Plusle always acts as a cheerleader for its partners. Whenever a teammate puts out a good effort in battle, this Pokémon shorts out its body to create the crackling noises of sparks to show its joy.
3670.name: plusle

3671.text: When Plusle is cheering on its partner, it flashes with electric sparks from all over its body. If its partner loses, this Pokémon cries loudly.
3671.name: plusle

3672.text: MINUN is more concerned about cheering on its partners than its own safety. It shorts out the electricity in its body to create brilliant showers of sparks to cheer on its teammates.
3672.name: minun

3673.text: At a meeting of POKéMON academics, it was announced that simultaneous exposure to electricity from a PLUSLE and MINUN will promote circulation and boost vitality.
3673.name: minun

3674.text: Its dislike of water makes it take shelter under the eaves of houses in rain. It uses pom-poms made of sparks for cheering.
3674.name: minun

3675.text: Exposure to electricity from Minun and Plusle promotes blood circulation and relaxes muscles.
3675.name: minun

3676.text: It cheers on friends. If its friends are losing, its body lets off more and more sparks.
3676.name: minun

3677.text: Minun is more concerned about cheering on its partners than its own safety. It shorts out the electricity in its body to create brilliant showers of sparks to cheer on its teammates.
3677.name: minun

3678.text: Minun loves to cheer on its partner in battle. It gives off sparks from its body while it is doing so. If its partner is in trouble, this Pokémon gives off increasing amounts of sparks.
3678.name: minun

3679.text: VOLBEAT’s tail glows like a lightbulb. With other VOLBEAT, it uses its tail to draw geometric shapes in the night sky. This POKéMON loves the sweet aroma given off by ILLUMISE.
3679.name: volbeat

3680.text: With their taillights lit, VOLBEAT fly in a swarm, drawing geometric designs in the night sky. They move their nests if their pond water becomes dirty.
3680.name: volbeat

3681.text: It emits light from its tail to communicate. It loves the sweet aroma given off by ILLUMISE.
3681.name: volbeat

3682.text: It communicates with others by lighting up its rear at night. It loves Illumise’s sweet aroma.
3682.name: volbeat

3683.text: It lives around clean ponds. At night, its rear lights up. It converses with others by flashing its light.
3683.name: volbeat

3684.text: With the arrival of night, Volbeat emits light from its tail. It communicates with others by adjusting the intensity and flashing of its light. This Pokémon is attracted by the sweet aroma of Illumise.
3684.name: volbeat

3685.text: Volbeat’s tail glows like a lightbulb. With other Volbeat, it uses its tail to draw geometric shapes in the night sky. This Pokémon loves the sweet aroma given off by Illumise.
3685.name: volbeat

3686.text: ILLUMISE attracts a swarm of VOLBEAT using a sweet fragrance. Once the VOLBEAT have gathered, this POKéMON leads the lit-up swarm in drawing geometric designs on the canvas of the night sky.
3686.name: illumise

3687.text: ILLUMISE leads a flight of illuminated VOLBEAT to draw signs in the night sky. This POKéMON is said to earn greater respect from its peers by composing more complex designs in the sky.
3687.name: illumise

3688.text: A nocturnal POKéMON that becomes active upon nightfall. It leads a VOLBEAT swarm to draw patterns in the night sky. Over 200 different patterns have been confirmed.
3688.name: illumise

3689.text: It guides VOLBEAT to draw signs in night skies. There are scientists that study the patterns it creates.
3689.name: illumise

3690.text: Its fragrance attracts a swarm of Volbeat, so they draw over 200 patterns in the night sky.
3690.name: illumise

3691.text: With its sweet aroma, it guides Volbeat to draw signs with light in the night sky.
3691.name: illumise

3692.text: Illumise attracts a swarm of Volbeat using a sweet fragrance. Once the Volbeat have gathered, this Pokémon leads the lit-up swarm in drawing geometric designs on the canvas of the night sky.
3692.name: illumise

3693.text: Illumise leads a flight of illuminated Volbeat to draw signs in the night sky. This Pokémon is said to earn greater respect from its peers by composing more complex designs in the sky.
3693.name: illumise

3694.text: ROSELIA shoots sharp thorns as projectiles at any opponent that tries to steal the flowers on its arms. The aroma of this POKéMON brings serenity to living things.
3694.name: roselia

3695.text: A ROSELIA that drinks nutritionally rich springwater blooms with lovely flowers. The fragrance of its flowers has the effect of making its foes careless.
3695.name: roselia

3696.text: ROSELIA raised on clean drinking water are known to grow vividly colored flowers.
3696.name: roselia

3697.text: The beautiful flowers on its arms have toxic thorns. Don’t even think about picking those flowers.
3697.name: roselia

3698.text: ROSELIA that drink nutritionally rich springwater are said to reveal rare coloration when they bloom.
3698.name: roselia

3699.text: The more healthy the Roselia, the more pleasant its flowers’ aroma. Its scent deeply relaxes people.
3699.name: roselia

3700.text: Roselia that drink nutritionally rich springwater are said to reveal rare coloration when they bloom.
3700.name: roselia

3701.text: Roselia shoots sharp thorns as projectiles at any opponent that tries to steal the flowers on its arms. The aroma of this Pokémon brings serenity to living things.
3701.name: roselia

3702.text: On extremely rare occasions, a Roselia is said to appear with its flowers in unusual colors. The thorns on this Pokémon’s head contain a vicious poison.
3702.name: roselia

3703.text: Its flowers give off a relaxing fragrance. The stronger its aroma, the healthier the Roselia is.
3703.name: roselia

3704.text: It uses the different poisons in each hand separately when it attacks. The stronger its aroma, the healthier it is.
3704.name: roselia

3705.text: Though beautiful, it has highly poisonous thorns. There is an old tradition in my homeland wherein one would send these thorns to an opponent to challenge them to a duel.
3705.name: roselia

3706.text: Most of GULPIN’s body is made up of its stomach - its heart and brain are very small in comparison. This POKéMON’s stomach contains special enzymes that dissolve anything.
3706.name: gulpin

3707.text: This POKéMON’s stomach fluid can even digest scrap iron. In one gulp, it can swallow something that is as large as itself.
3707.name: gulpin

3708.text: Almost all its body is its stomach. Its harsh digestive juices quickly dissolve anything it swallows.
3708.name: gulpin

3709.text: It has a small heart and brain. Its stomach comprises most of its body, with enzymes to dissolve anything.
3709.name: gulpin

3710.text: There is nothing its stomach can’t digest. While it is digesting, vile, overpowering gases are expelled.
3710.name: gulpin

3711.text: Virtually all of Gulpin’s body is its stomach. As a result, it can swallow something its own size. This Pokémon’s stomach contains a special fluid that digests anything.
3711.name: gulpin

3712.text: Most of Gulpin’s body is made up of its stomach—its heart and brain are very small in comparison. This Pokémon’s stomach contains special enzymes that dissolve anything.
3712.name: gulpin

3713.text: Its powerful stomach acid is capable of digesting almost anything. The one thing in the whole world a SWALOT can’t digest is its own stomach.
3713.name: swalot

3714.text: It can swallow a tire whole in one gulp. It secretes a horribly toxic fluid from the pores on its body.
3714.name: swalot

3715.text: It swallows anything whole. It sweats toxic fluids from its follicles to douse foes.
3715.name: swalot

3716.text: It gulps anything that fits in its mouth. Its special enzymes can dissolve anything.
3716.name: swalot

3717.text: When Swalot spots prey, it spurts out a hideously toxic fluid from its pores and sprays the target. Once the prey has weakened, this Pokémon gulps it down whole with its cavernous mouth.
3717.name: swalot

3718.text: Swalot has no teeth, so what it eats, it swallows whole, no matter what. Its cavernous mouth yawns widely. An automobile tire could easily fit inside this Pokémon’s mouth.
3718.name: swalot

3719.text: CARVANHA attack ships in swarms, making them sink. Although it is said to be a very vicious POKéMON, it timidly flees as soon as it finds itself alone.
3719.name: carvanha

3720.text: They swarm any foe that invades their territory. Their sharp fangs can tear out boat hulls.
3720.name: carvanha

3721.text: They form packs to attack boats and rip out their hulls to sink them. They live in rivers in the jungle.
3721.name: carvanha

3722.text: It lives in massive rivers that course through jungles. It swarms prey that enter its territory.
3722.name: carvanha

3723.text: Carvanha’s strongly developed jaws and its sharply pointed fangs pack the destructive power to rip out boat hulls. Many boats have been attacked and sunk by this Pokémon.
3723.name: carvanha

3724.text: If anything invades Carvanha’s territory, it will swarm and tear at the intruder with its pointed fangs. On its own, however, this Pokémon turns suddenly timid.
3724.name: carvanha

3725.text: Each school has its own territory. Any intruders are mercilessly attacked with fangs bared.
3725.name: carvanha

3726.text: If they scent the faintest trace of blood, they rush to attack en masse. When alone, they’re rather cowardly.
3726.name: carvanha

3727.text: They’re such cowards that they won’t hunt alone. When five or so of them get together, they suddenly turn ferocious!
3727.name: carvanha

3728.text: With its sturdy jaws and fangs, it can easily chomp wooden boats to splinters. It fights with Basculin over food.
3728.name: carvanha

3729.text: It won’t attack while it’s alone—not even if it spots prey. Instead, it waits for other Carvanha to join it, and then the Pokémon attack as a group.
3729.name: carvanha

3730.text: These Pokémon have sharp fangs and powerful jaws. Sailors avoid Carvanha dens at all costs.
3730.name: carvanha

3731.text: Nicknamed “the bully of the sea,” SHARPEDO is widely feared. Its cruel fangs grow back immediately if they snap off. Just one of these POKéMON can thoroughly tear apart a supertanker.
3731.name: sharpedo

3732.text: SHARPEDO can swim at speeds of up to 75 mph by jetting seawater out of its backside. This POKéMON’s drawback is its inability to swim long distances.
3732.name: sharpedo

3733.text: The vicious and sly gangster of the sea. Its skin is specially textured to minimize drag in water. Its speed tops out at over 75 miles per hour.
3733.name: sharpedo

3734.text: The ruffian of the seas, it has fangs that crunch through iron. It swims by jetting water from its rear.
3734.name: sharpedo

3735.text: Its fangs rip through sheet iron. It swims at 75 mph and is known as “The Bully of the Sea.”
3735.name: sharpedo

3736.text: It can swim at speeds of 75 mph by jetting seawater through its body. It is the bandit of the sea.
3736.name: sharpedo

3737.text: Nicknamed “the bully of the sea,” Sharpedo is widely feared. Its cruel fangs grow back immediately if they snap off. Just one of these Pokémon can thoroughly tear apart a supertanker.
3737.name: sharpedo

3738.text: Sharpedo can swim at speeds of up to 75 mph by jetting seawater out of its backside. This Pokémon’s drawback is its inability to swim long distances.
3738.name: sharpedo

3739.text: It pursues its prey at speeds of 75 mph and finishes them off with fangs that can crush iron. It is known as the bully of the sea.
3739.name: sharpedo

3740.text: It has a sad history. In the past, its dorsal fin was a treasured foodstuff, so this Pokémon became a victim of overfishing.
3740.name: sharpedo

3741.text: People believe that carrying one of its discarded fangs will prevent mishaps at sea, so the fangs are made into accessories.
3741.name: sharpedo

3742.text: It drinks in seawater and jets it from its rear to propel itself. It’s very sensitive to the scent of blood.
3742.name: sharpedo

3743.text: As soon as it catches the scent of prey, Sharpedo will jet seawater from its backside, hurtling toward the target to attack at 75 mph.
3743.name: sharpedo

3744.text: This Pokémon is known as the Bully of the Sea. Any ship entering the waters Sharpedo calls home will be attacked—no exceptions.
3744.name: sharpedo

3745.text: While this POKéMON usually lives in the sea, it can survive on land, although not too long. It loses vitality if its body becomes dried out.
3745.name: wailmer

3746.text: On sunny days, it lands on beaches to bounce like a ball and play. It spouts water from its nose.
3746.name: wailmer

3747.text: It bounces playfully like a ball. The more seawater it swallows, the higher it bounces.
3747.name: wailmer

3748.text: It eats one ton of food every day. It plays by shooting stored seawater out its blowholes with great force.
3748.name: wailmer

3749.text: Wailmer’s nostrils are located above its eyes. This playful Pokémon loves to startle people by forcefully snorting out seawater it stores inside its body out of its nostrils.
3749.name: wailmer

3750.text: Wailmer can store water inside its body to transform itself into a ball for bouncing around on the ground. By filling itself up with more water, this Pokémon can elevate the height of its bounces.
3750.name: wailmer

3751.text: It loves to startle people. It fills itself up with seawater and plays by bouncing around like a ball.
3751.name: wailmer

3752.text: It swims along with its mouth open and swallows down seawater along with its food. It sprays excess water out of its nostrils.
3752.name: wailmer

3753.text: Due to their memories of when they once lived on land, pods of them will, very rarely, wash up on shore.
3753.name: wailmer

3754.text: It shows off by spraying jets of seawater from the nostrils above its eyes. It eats a solid ton of Wishiwashi every day.
3754.name: wailmer

3755.text: When it sucks in a large volume of seawater, it becomes like a big, bouncy ball. It eats a ton of food daily.
3755.name: wailmer

3756.text: It breathes through nostrils that it raises above the sea. By inhaling to its maximum capacity, a WAILORD can dive close to 10,000 feet beneath the waves.
3756.name: wailord

3757.text: It is among the largest of all POKéMON. It herds prey in a pack then swallows the massed prey in one gulp.
3757.name: wailord

3758.text: It is the largest of all identified Pokémon. They jump as a pack to herd their prey.
3758.name: wailord

3759.text: The biggest of all Pokémon. It can dive to a depth of almost 10,000 feet on only one breath.
3759.name: wailord

3760.text: Wailord is the largest of all identified Pokémon up to now. This giant Pokémon swims languorously in the vast open sea, eating massive amounts of food at once with its enormous mouth.
3760.name: wailord

3761.text: When chasing prey, Wailord herds them by leaping out of the water and making a humongous splash. It is breathtaking to see this Pokémon leaping out of the sea with others in its pod.
3761.name: wailord

3762.text: Wailord pursue their prey in pods. With their large mouths, they can swallow entire schools of Wishiwashi whole.
3762.name: wailord

3763.text: They eat so many fish Pokémon that when Wailord become too numerous, fishermen have to chase them off.
3763.name: wailord

3764.text: When a small Wailmer is attacked by Sharpedo or Dhelmise, its whole pod works together to protect it.
3764.name: wailord

3765.text: It can sometimes knock out opponents with the shock created by breaching and crashing its big body onto the water.
3765.name: wailord

3766.text: Its immense size is the reason for its popularity. Wailord watching is a favorite sightseeing activity in various parts of the world.
3766.name: wailord

3767.text: A NUMEL stores boiling magma in the hump on its back. It is a hardy POKéMON that can transport a 220-pound load. It has served humans at work since long ago.
3767.name: numel

3768.text: Magma of almost 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit courses through its body. When it grows cold, the magma hardens and slows it.
3768.name: numel

3769.text: The flaming magma it stores in the hump on its back is the source of its tremendous power.
3769.name: numel

3770.text: Its humped back stores intensely hot magma. In rain, the magma cools, slowing its movement.
3770.name: numel

3771.text: The magma in its body reaches 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit. Its hump gets smaller when it uses Fire-type moves.
3771.name: numel

3772.text: Numel is extremely dull witted—it doesn’t notice being hit. However, it can’t stand hunger for even a second. This Pokémon’s body is a seething cauldron of boiling magma.
3772.name: numel

3773.text: Numel stores magma of almost 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit within its body. If it gets wet, the magma cools and hardens. In that event, the Pokémon’s body grows heavy and its movements become sluggish.
3773.name: numel

3774.text: CAMERUPT has a volcano inside its body. Magma of 18,000 degrees F courses through its body. Occasionally, the humps on this POKéMON’s back erupt, spewing the superheated magma.
3774.name: camerupt

3775.text: A POKéMON that lives in the crater of a volcano. Every 10 years, the volcanoes on its back erupt violently. Research is under way on the cause of eruption.
3775.name: camerupt

3776.text: It lives in the crater of a volcano. It is well known that the humps on its back erupt every 10 years.
3776.name: camerupt

3777.text: It has volcanoes on its back. If magma builds up in its body, it shudders, then erupts violently.
3777.name: camerupt

3778.text: The volcanoes on its back have a major eruption every 10 years--or whenever it becomes really angry.
3778.name: camerupt

3779.text: If angered, the humps on its back erupt in a shower of molten lava. It lives in the craters of volcanoes.
3779.name: camerupt

3780.text: Camerupt has a volcano inside its body. Magma of 18,000 degrees Fahrenheit courses through its body. Occasionally, the humps on this Pokémon’s back erupt, spewing the superheated magma.
3780.name: camerupt

3781.text: The humps on Camerupt’s back are formed by a transformation of its bones. They sometimes blast out molten magma. This Pokémon apparently erupts often when it is enraged.
3781.name: camerupt

3782.text: You can tell how it’s feeling by the smoke spouting from its shell. Tremendous velocity is a sign of good health.
3782.name: torkoal

3783.text: It battles using energy it gets from burning coal. When loosing smoke from its nostrils, it lets off a sound that is similar to a locomotive’s horn.
3783.name: torkoal

3784.text: It burns coal inside its shell. If it is attacked, it belches thick, black smoke and flees.
3784.name: torkoal

3785.text: Torkoal digs through mountains in search of coal. If it finds some, it fills hollow spaces on its shell with the coal and burns it. If it is attacked, this Pokémon spouts thick black smoke to beat a retreat.
3785.name: torkoal

3786.text: Torkoal generates energy by burning coal. It grows weaker as the fire dies down. When it is preparing for battle, this Pokémon burns more coal.
3786.name: torkoal

3787.text: Coal is the source of Torkoal’s energy. Large amounts of coal can be found in the mountains where they live.
3787.name: torkoal

3788.text: If the fire burning within its shell goes out, it will die. Those who wish to raise one in their home must always keep something flammable at hand.
3788.name: torkoal

3789.text: It burns coal to produce energy. When it has burned through all of its coal, it becomes unable to move.
3789.name: torkoal

3790.text: It burns coal inside its shell for energy. It blows out black soot if it is endangered.
3790.name: torkoal

3791.text: You find abandoned coal mines full of them. They dig tirelessly in search of coal.
3791.name: torkoal

3792.text: A POKéMON that manipulates psychic power at will. It doesn’t stop bouncing even when it is asleep. It loves eating mushrooms that grow underground.
3792.name: spoink

3793.text: It apparently dies if it stops bouncing about. It carries a pearl from CLAMPERL on its head.
3793.name: spoink

3794.text: Using its tail like a spring, it keeps its heart beating by bouncing constantly. If it stops, it dies.
3794.name: spoink

3795.text: It bounces constantly, using its tail like a spring. The shock of bouncing keeps its heart beating.
3795.name: spoink

3796.text: It bounces around on its tail to keep its heart pumping. It carries a pearl from Clamperl on its head.
3796.name: spoink

3797.text: Spoink bounces around on its tail. The shock of its bouncing makes its heart pump. As a result, this Pokémon cannot afford to stop bouncing—if it stops, its heart will stop.
3797.name: spoink

3798.text: Spoink keeps a pearl on top of its head. The pearl functions to amplify this Pokémon’s psychokinetic powers. It is therefore on a constant search for a bigger pearl.
3798.name: spoink

3799.text: GRUMPIG uses the black pearls on its body to amplify its psychic power waves for gaining total control over its foe. When this POKéMON uses its special power, its snorting breath grows labored.
3799.name: grumpig

3800.text: GRUMPIG uses the black pearls on its body to wield its fantastic powers. When it is doing so, it dances bizarrely. This POKéMON’s black pearls are valuable as works of art.
3800.name: grumpig

3801.text: It stores power in the black pearls on its forehead. When it uses psychic power, it performs an odd dance step. Its style of dancing became hugely popular overseas.
3801.name: grumpig

3802.text: It can gain control over foes by doing odd dance steps. The black pearls on its forehead are precious gems.
3802.name: grumpig

3803.text: It can perform odd dance steps to influence foes. Its style of dancing became hugely popular overseas.
3803.name: grumpig

3804.text: It uses black pearls to amplify its psychic power. It does an odd dance to gain control over foes.
3804.name: grumpig

3805.text: Grumpig uses the black pearls on its body to amplify its psychic power waves for gaining total control over its foe. When this Pokémon uses its special power, its snorting breath grows labored.
3805.name: grumpig

3806.text: Grumpig uses the black pearls on its body to wield its fantastic powers. When it is doing so, it dances bizarrely. This Pokémon’s black pearls are valuable as works of art.
3806.name: grumpig

3807.text: All the SPINDA that exist in the world are said to have utterly unique spot patterns. The shaky, tottering steps of this POKéMON give it the appearance of dancing.
3807.name: spinda

3808.text: No two SPINDA are said to have identical spot patterns on their hides. This POKéMON moves in a curious manner as if it is stumbling in dizziness. Its lurching movements can cause the opponent to become confused.
3808.name: spinda

3809.text: It is distinguished by a pattern of spots that is always different. Its unsteady, tottering walk has the effect of fouling its foe’s aim.
3809.name: spinda

3810.text: No two SPINDA are said to have identical patterns. It confuses foes with its stumbling motions.
3810.name: spinda

3811.text: No two SPINDA have the same pattern of spots. Its tottering step fouls the aim of foes.
3811.name: spinda

3812.text: The chances of two SPINDA having identical spot patterns is less than one in four billion.
3812.name: spinda

3813.text: No two Spinda have the same pattern of spots. Its tottering step fouls the aim of foes.
3813.name: spinda

3814.text: The chances of two Spinda having identical spot patterns is less than one in four billion.
3814.name: spinda

3815.text: All the Spinda that exist in the world are said to have utterly unique spot patterns. The shaky, tottering steps of this Pokémon give it the appearance of dancing.
3815.name: spinda

3816.text: No two Spinda are said to have identical spot patterns on their hides. This Pokémon moves in a curious manner as if it is stumbling in dizziness. Its lurching movements can cause the opponent to become confused.
3816.name: spinda

3817.text: Its steps are staggering and unsteady, but Spinda thinks it’s walking in a straight line.
3817.name: spinda

3818.text: Each and every Spinda has a slightly different configuration of spots. There are collectors who enjoy the tiny differences in their spot patterns.
3818.name: spinda

3819.text: Its steps are shaky and stumbling. Walking for a long time makes it feel sick.
3819.name: spinda

3820.text: Each Spinda’s spot pattern is different. With its stumbling movements, it evades opponents’ attacks brilliantly!
3820.name: spinda

3821.text: TRAPINCH’s nest is a sloped, bowl-like pit dug in sand. This POKéMON patiently waits for prey to tumble down the pit. Its giant jaws have enough strength to crush even boulders.
3821.name: trapinch

3822.text: TRAPINCH is a patient hunter. It digs an inescapable pit in a desert and waits for its prey to come tumbling down. This POKéMON can go a whole week without access to any water.
3822.name: trapinch

3823.text: Its big jaws crunch through boulders. Because its head is so big, it has a hard time getting back upright if it tips over onto its back.
3823.name: trapinch

3824.text: It makes a conical pit in desert sand and lies in wait at the bottom for prey to come tumbling down.
3824.name: trapinch

3825.text: It lives in arid deserts. It makes a sloping pit trap in sand where it patiently awaits prey.
3825.name: trapinch

3826.text: Trapinch’s nest is a sloped, bowl-like pit dug in sand. This Pokémon patiently waits for prey to tumble down the pit. Its giant jaws have enough strength to crush even boulders.
3826.name: trapinch

3827.text: Trapinch is a patient hunter. It digs an inescapable pit in a desert and waits for its prey to come tumbling down. This Pokémon can go a whole week without access to any water.
3827.name: trapinch

3828.text: It can live for a week without eating a thing. It waits patiently at the bottom of its nest for prey to appear.
3828.name: trapinch

3829.text: As it digs through the sand, its giant jaws crush any rocks that obstruct its path. It builds a funnel-shaped nest.
3829.name: trapinch

3830.text: Its jaws are strong enough to crush rocks but so heavy that it can’t get up if it flips over. Sandile seize those moments as their chance.
3830.name: trapinch

3831.text: It builds nests that double as traps, lying in wait for its prey to get caught. When night falls, it digs itself a spot beneath the sand to sleep.
3831.name: trapinch

3832.text: Its nest is a sloped, bowl-like pit in the desert. Once something has fallen in, there is no escape.
3832.name: trapinch

3833.text: It makes an inescapable conical pit and lies in wait at the bottom for prey to come tumbling down.
3833.name: trapinch

3834.text: To make prey faint, VIBRAVA generates ultrasonic waves by vigorously making its two wings vibrate. This POKéMON’s ultrasonic waves are so powerful, they can bring on headaches in people.
3834.name: vibrava

3835.text: VIBRAVA’s wings have not yet completed the process of growing. Rather than flying long distances, they are more useful for generating ultrasonic waves by vibrating.
3835.name: vibrava

3836.text: It looses ultrasonic waves by rubbing its wings together. Since a VIBRAVA’s wings are still in the process of growing, it can only fly short distances.
3836.name: vibrava

3837.text: It violently shudders its wings, generating ultrasonic waves to induce headaches in people.
3837.name: vibrava

3838.text: It generates ultrasonic waves by violently flapping its wings. After making its prey faint, it melts the prey with acid.
3838.name: vibrava

3839.text: To make prey faint, Vibrava generates ultrasonic waves by vigorously making its two wings vibrate. This Pokémon’s ultrasonic waves are so powerful, they can bring on headaches in people.
3839.name: vibrava

3840.text: Vibrava’s wings have not yet completed the process of growing. Rather than flying long distances, they are more useful for generating ultrasonic waves by vibrating.
3840.name: vibrava

3841.text: Rather than using its underdeveloped wings for flight, it rubs them together, producing ultrasonic waves to attack its enemies.
3841.name: vibrava

3842.text: It vibrates its wings to generate ultrasonic waves, causing its prey to faint. Then it buries the prey alive in the sand to preserve it.
3842.name: vibrava

3843.text: It vibrates its wings to send out odd sound waves. Trainers who are with it need earplugs.
3843.name: vibrava

3844.text: The ultrasonic waves it generates by rubbing its two wings together cause severe headaches.
3844.name: vibrava

3845.text: To help make its wings grow, it dissolves quantities of prey in its digestive juices and guzzles them down every day.
3845.name: vibrava

3846.text: FLYGON is nicknamed “the elemental  spirit of the desert.” Because its flapping wings whip up a cloud of sand, this POKéMON is always enveloped in a sandstorm while flying.
3846.name: flygon

3847.text: FLYGON whips up a sandstorm by flapping its wings. The wings create a series of notes that sound like singing. Because the “singing” is the only thing that can be heard in a sandstorm, this POKéMON is said to be the desert spirit.
3847.name: flygon

3848.text: The flapping of its wings sounds like singing. To prevent detection by enemies, it hides itself by flapping up a cloud of desert sand.
3848.name: flygon

3849.text: It whips up sandstorms with powerful flaps of its wings. It is known as “The Desert Spirit.”
3849.name: flygon

3850.text: It hides itself by kicking up desert sand with its wings. Red covers shield its eyes from sand.
3850.name: flygon

3851.text: Known as “The Desert Spirit,” this Pokémon hides in the sandstorms it causes by beating its wings.
3851.name: flygon

3852.text: Flygon is nicknamed “the elemental spirit of the desert.” Because its flapping wings whip up a cloud of sand, this Pokémon is always enveloped in a sandstorm while flying.
3852.name: flygon

3853.text: Flygon whips up a sandstorm by flapping its wings. The wings create a series of notes that sound like singing. Because the “singing” is the only thing that can be heard in a sandstorm, this Pokémon is said to be the desert spirit.
3853.name: flygon

3854.text: The flapping of its wings sounds something like singing. Those lured by the sound are enveloped in a sandstorm, becoming Flygon’s prey.
3854.name: flygon

3855.text: By flapping their wings, Flygon cause sandstorms that conceal Krookodile. The team then splits the prey they catch.
3855.name: flygon

3856.text: People continue to have their hearts stolen by its enchanting songs and find themselves stranded in the desert.
3856.name: flygon

3857.text: This Pokémon hides in the heart of sandstorms it creates and seldom appears where people can see it.
3857.name: flygon

3858.text: It is nicknamed the Desert Spirit because the flapping of its wings sounds like a woman singing.
3858.name: flygon

3859.text: CACNEA lives in arid locations such as deserts. It releases a strong aroma from its flower to attract prey. When prey comes near, this POKéMON shoots sharp thorns from its body to bring the victim down.
3859.name: cacnea

3860.text: CACNEA live in deserts with virtually no rainfall. It battles by swinging its thick, spiked arms. Once a year, a yellow flower blooms.
3860.name: cacnea

3861.text: By storing water in its body, this desert dweller can survive for 30 days without water.
3861.name: cacnea

3862.text: It lives in arid locations. Its yellow flowers bloom once a year.
3862.name: cacnea

3863.text: It prefers harsh environments such as deserts. It can survive for 30 days on water stored in its body.
3863.name: cacnea

3864.text: Cacnea lives in arid locations such as deserts. It releases a strong aroma from its flower to attract prey. When prey comes near, this Pokémon shoots sharp thorns from its body to bring the victim down.
3864.name: cacnea

3865.text: The more arid and harsh the environment, the more pretty and fragrant a flower Cacnea grows. This Pokémon battles by wildly swinging its thorny arms.
3865.name: cacnea

3866.text: During the daytime, CACTURNE remains unmoving so that it does not lose any moisture to the harsh desert sun. This POKéMON becomes active at night when the temperature drops.
3866.name: cacturne

3867.text: After spending thousands of years in harsh deserts, its blood transformed into the same substances as sand. It is nocturnal, so it hunts at night.
3867.name: cacturne

3868.text: It lives in deserts. It becomes active at night when it hunts for prey exhausted from the desert’s heat.
3868.name: cacturne

3869.text: It becomes active at night, seeking prey that is exhausted from the day’s desert heat.
3869.name: cacturne

3870.text: Packs of them follow travelers through the desert until the travelers can no longer move.
3870.name: cacturne

3871.text: During the daytime, Cacturne remains unmoving so that it does not lose any moisture to the harsh desert sun. This Pokémon becomes active at night when the temperature drops.
3871.name: cacturne

3872.text: If a traveler is going through a desert in the thick of night, Cacturne will follow in a ragtag group. The Pokémon are biding their time, waiting for the traveler to tire and become incapable of moving.
3872.name: cacturne

3873.text: SWABLU has light and fluffy wings that are like cottony clouds. This POKéMON is not frightened of people. It lands on the heads of people and sits there like a cotton-fluff hat.
3873.name: swablu

3874.text: A POKéMON that has wings like cottony clouds. After enduring winter, in which little food is available, SWABLU flocks move closer to towns in the spring.
3874.name: swablu

3875.text: Its wings are like cotton tufts. If it perches on someone’s head, it looks like a cotton hat.
3875.name: swablu

3876.text: Its wings bring cottony clouds to mind. It grooms with springwater and loves to sit on heads.
3876.name: swablu

3877.text: It can’t relax if it or its surroundings are not clean. It wipes off dirt with its wings.
3877.name: swablu

3878.text: For some reason, it likes to land on people’s heads softly and act like it’s a hat.
3878.name: swablu

3879.text: It constantly grooms its cotton-like wings. It takes a shower to clean itself if it becomes dirty.
3879.name: swablu

3880.text: Swablu has light and fluffy wings that are like cottony clouds. This Pokémon is not frightened of people. It lands on the heads of people and sits there like a cotton-fluff hat.
3880.name: swablu

3881.text: Swablu loves to make things clean. If it spots something dirty, it will wipe and polish it with its cottony wings. If its wings become dirty, this Pokémon finds a stream and showers itself.
3881.name: swablu

3882.text: Its cottony wings are full of air, making them light and fluffy to the touch. Swablu takes diligent care of its wings.
3882.name: swablu

3883.text: Since Swablu looks like a cumulus cloud, foes can have a hard time finding it. Apparently its wings turned white over many generations.
3883.name: swablu

3884.text: ALTARIA sings in a gorgeous soprano. Its wings are like cotton clouds. This POKéMON catches updrafts with its buoyant wings and soars way up into the wild blue yonder.
3884.name: altaria

3885.text: It hums in a beautiful soprano voice. It flies among white clouds in the blue sky. It launches intensely hot fireballs from its mouth.
3885.name: altaria

3886.text: If you hear a beautiful melody trilling deep among mountains far from people, it is ALTARIA’s humming.
3886.name: altaria

3887.text: It looks like a fluffy cloud when it is in flight. It hums with its soprano voice.
3887.name: altaria

3888.text: If it bonds with a person, it will gently envelop the friend with its soft wings, then hum.
3888.name: altaria

3889.text: It flies gracefully through the sky. Its melodic humming makes you feel like you’re in a dream.
3889.name: altaria

3890.text: On sunny days, it flies freely through the sky and blends into the clouds. It sings in a beautiful soprano.
3890.name: altaria

3891.text: Altaria dances and wheels through the sky among billowing, cotton-like clouds. By singing melodies in its crystal-clear voice, this Pokémon makes its listeners experience dreamy wonderment.
3891.name: altaria

3892.text: Altaria sings in a gorgeous soprano. Its wings are like cotton clouds. This Pokémon catches updrafts with its buoyant wings and soars way up into the wild blue yonder.
3892.name: altaria

3893.text: As it flies in a calm and relaxed manner, Altaria performs a humming song that would enrapture any audience.
3893.name: altaria

3894.text: This Pokémon has a kind disposition, but if it’s provoked, it will threaten opponents with shrill cries before attacking them without mercy.
3894.name: altaria

3895.text: Memories of battling its arch-rival SEVIPER are etched into every cell of ZANGOOSE’s body. This POKéMON adroitly dodges attacks with incredible agility.
3895.name: zangoose

3896.text: ZANGOOSE usually stays on all fours, but when angered, it gets up on its hind legs and extends its claws. This POKéMON shares a bitter rivalry with SEVIPER that dates back over generations.
3896.name: zangoose

3897.text: When it battles, it stands on its hind legs and attacks with its sharply clawed forelegs. Its fur bristles if it encounters any SEVIPER.
3897.name: zangoose

3898.text: If it comes across a SEVIPER, its fur bristles and it assumes its battle pose. Its sharp claws are its best weapon.
3898.name: zangoose

3899.text: It’s Seviper’s archrival. To threaten those it encounters, it fans out the claws on its front paws.
3899.name: zangoose

3900.text: It has feuded with Seviper for many generations. Its sharp claws are its biggest weapons.
3900.name: zangoose

3901.text: Its fur would all stand on end if it smelled a Seviper nearby. Its sharp claws tear up its foes.
3901.name: zangoose

3902.text: Memories of battling its archrival Seviper are etched into every cell of Zangoose’s body. This Pokémon adroitly dodges attacks with incredible agility.
3902.name: zangoose

3903.text: Zangoose usually stays on all fours, but when angered, it gets up on its hind legs and extends its claws. This Pokémon shares a bitter rivalry with Seviper that dates back over generations.
3903.name: zangoose

3904.text: SEVIPER shares a generations-long feud with ZANGOOSE. The scars on its body are evidence of vicious battles. This POKéMON attacks using its sword- edged tail.
3904.name: seviper

3905.text: SEVIPER’s swordlike tail serves two purposes - it slashes foes and douses them with secreted poison. This POKéMON will not give up its long- running blood feud with ZANGOOSE.
3905.name: seviper

3906.text: SEVIPER and ZANGOOSE are eternal rivals. It counters a ZANGOOSE’s dazzling agility with its swordlike tail, which also oozes a horrible poison.
3906.name: seviper

3907.text: It sharpens its swordlike tail on hard rocks. It hides in tall grass and strikes unwary prey with venomous fangs.
3907.name: seviper

3908.text: For many generations, it has feuded with Zangoose. It whets its bladed tail on rocks for battle.
3908.name: seviper

3909.text: In battle, it uses its bladed tail to counter any Zangoose. It secretes a deadly venom in its tail.
3909.name: seviper

3910.text: Constant polishing makes the edge of the blade on its tail extremely sharp. It’s Zangoose’s archrival.
3910.name: seviper

3911.text: Seviper shares a generations-long feud with Zangoose. The scars on its body are evidence of vicious battles. This Pokémon attacks using its sword-edged tail.
3911.name: seviper

3912.text: Seviper’s swordlike tail serves two purposes—it slashes foes and douses them with secreted poison. This Pokémon will not give up its long-running blood feud with Zangoose.
3912.name: seviper

3913.text: It becomes very active on the night of a full moon. This POKéMON was first discovered 40 years ago at the site of a meteor strike.
3913.name: lunatone

3914.text: Its health ebbs and flows with the lunar cycle. It brims with power when exposed to the light of the full moon.
3914.name: lunatone

3915.text: Because it turns active on nights of the full moon, it is said to have some link to the lunar phases.
3915.name: lunatone

3916.text: Lunatone was discovered at a location where a meteoroid fell. As a result, some people theorize that this Pokémon came from space. However, no one has been able to prove this theory so far.
3916.name: lunatone

3917.text: Lunatone becomes active around the time of the full moon. Instead of walking, it moves by floating in midair. The Pokémon’s intimidating red eyes cause all those who see it to become transfixed with fear.
3917.name: lunatone

3918.text: The phase of the moon apparently has some effect on its power. It’s active on the night of a full moon.
3918.name: lunatone

3919.text: It was discovered at the site of a meteor strike 40 years ago. Its stare can lull its foes to sleep.
3919.name: lunatone

3920.text: SOLROCK is a new species of POKéMON that is said to have fallen from space. It floats in air and moves silently. In battle, this POKéMON releases intensely bright light.
3920.name: solrock

3921.text: Solar energy is the source of this  POKéMON’s power. On sunny days, groups of SOLROCK line up facing the sun and absorb its light.
3921.name: solrock

3922.text: A new Pokémon species, rumored to be from the sun. It gives off light while spinning.
3922.name: solrock

3923.text: It absorbs solar energy during the day. Always expressionless, it can sense what its foe is thinking.
3923.name: solrock

3924.text: Solrock is a new species of Pokémon that is said to have fallen from space. It floats in air and moves silently. In battle, this Pokémon releases intensely bright light.
3924.name: solrock

3925.text: Sunlight is the source of Solrock’s power. It is said to possess the ability to read the emotions of others. This Pokémon gives off intense heat while rotating its body.
3925.name: solrock

3926.text: When it rotates itself, it gives off light similar to the sun, thus blinding its foes.
3926.name: solrock

3927.text: Solar energy is the source of its power, so it is strong during the daytime. When it spins, its body shines.
3927.name: solrock

3928.text: Its body is covered with a slimy film. The film acts as a barrier to prevent germs in muddy water from entering the BARBOACH’s body.
3928.name: barboach

3929.text: BARBOACH uses its whiskers to taste things just as a person uses his or her tongue to taste things.
3929.name: barboach

3930.text: It coats its entire body with a slimy fluid so it can squirm and slip away if grabbed.
3930.name: barboach

3931.text: Its whiskers make a superb radar. They are used to locate prey, even in the murkiest of water.
3931.name: barboach

3932.text: Barboach’s sensitive whiskers serve as a superb radar system. This Pokémon hides in mud, leaving only its two whiskers exposed while it waits for prey to come along.
3932.name: barboach

3933.text: Barboach’s body is covered with a slimy film. If a foe grabs it, this Pokémon just slips out of the enemy’s grip. This Pokémon grows weak if the slimy coating dries up.
3933.name: barboach

3934.text: Its two whiskers provide a sensitive radar. Even in muddy waters, it can detect its prey’s location.
3934.name: barboach

3935.text: Its slippery body is hard to grasp, so much so that there are festivals where people compete to see how many they can catch barehanded.
3935.name: barboach

3936.text: Its entire body is gooey. When pecked at by bird Pokémon, it slips and slides its way to freedom.
3936.name: barboach

3937.text: Its whiskers are filled with nerves. They can sense smells and flavors just as a person’s nose or tongue would.
3937.name: barboach

3938.text: Its slimy body is hard to grasp. In one region, it is said to have been born from hardened mud.
3938.name: barboach

3939.text: It probes muddy riverbeds with its two long whiskers. A slimy film protects its body.
3939.name: barboach

3940.text: Makes its home in swamps with murky water. The poor visibility hides this Pokémon from predators, and the slime on its body makes grasping it difficult.
3940.name: barboach

3941.text: WHISCASH is extremely territorial. Just one of these POKéMON will claim a large pond as its exclusive territory. If a foe approaches it, it thrashes about and triggers a massive earthquake.
3941.name: whiscash

3942.text: Mysteriously, it can foretell earthquakes. In the daytime, it sleeps in mud at the bottom of a pond. When it awakens, it continually feeds throughout the night.
3942.name: whiscash

3943.text: It is very territorial. It repels foes by setting off tremors that extend over a three-mile radius.
3943.name: whiscash

3944.text: As a result of causing tremors by thrashing about, it developed the ability to foretell real quakes.
3944.name: whiscash

3945.text: It is extremely protective of its territory. If any foe approaches, it attacks using vicious tremors.
3945.name: whiscash

3946.text: Whiscash is extremely territorial. Just one of these Pokémon will claim a large pond as its exclusive territory. If a foe approaches it, it thrashes about and triggers a massive earthquake.
3946.name: whiscash

3947.text: If Whiscash goes on a wild rampage, it sets off a quake-like tremor with a radius of over three miles. This Pokémon has the ability to predict real earthquakes.
3947.name: whiscash

3948.text: A glutton that devours anything that moves, it quietly lurks at the bottom of swamps, lying in wait for prey.
3948.name: whiscash

3949.text: Sighting Whiscash leaping from the water is believed to herald an earthquake.
3949.name: whiscash

3950.text: Whiscash shakes the ground at high intensities to intimidate its opponents. It swallows its prey whole—along with mud from the swamp floor.
3950.name: whiscash

3951.text: Its vision is not that good. It senses vibrations in the water with its whiskers to determine the location of its prey.
3951.name: whiscash

3952.text: It makes its nest at the bottom of swamps. It will eat anything—if it is alive, Whiscash will eat it.
3952.name: whiscash

3953.text: It claims a large swamp to itself. If a foe comes near it, it sets off tremors by thrashing around.
3953.name: whiscash

3954.text: Strikes its caudal fin against the swamp bed to shake the ground and startle its prey. It will then swallow the fleeing prey whole. People mistook this behavior as the cause of earthquakes.
3954.name: whiscash

3955.text: Once it grips prey with its large pincers, it will never let go, no matter what. It is a hardy POKéMON that can thrive in any environment.
3955.name: corphish

3956.text: It came from overseas. It is a very hardy creature that will quickly proliferate, even in polluted streams.
3956.name: corphish

3957.text: Its hardy vitality enables it to adapt to any environment. Its pincers will never release prey.
3957.name: corphish

3958.text: Corphish were originally foreign Pokémon that were imported as pets. They eventually turned up in the wild. This Pokémon is very hardy and has greatly increased its population.
3958.name: corphish

3959.text: Corphish catches prey with its sharp claws. It has no likes or dislikes when it comes to food—it will eat anything. This Pokémon has no trouble living in filthy water.
3959.name: corphish

3960.text: Individuals that have been set free by Trainers who could no longer raise them have become common, and they can now be found in Alola.
3960.name: corphish

3961.text: It can adapt very well to its environment. Feebas and Corphish are about the only Pokémon to live in stagnant ditches.
3961.name: corphish

3962.text: No matter how dirty the water in the river, it will adapt and thrive. It has a strong will to survive.
3962.name: corphish

3963.text: It was originally a Pokémon from afar that escaped to the wild. It can adapt to the dirtiest river.
3963.name: corphish

3964.text: A brutish POKéMON that loves to battle. A veteran CRAWDAUNT that has prevailed in hundreds of battles has giant pincers marked with countless scars.
3964.name: crawdaunt

3965.text: It is a ruffian that uses its pincers to pick up and toss out other Pokémon from its pond.
3965.name: crawdaunt

3966.text: Loving to battle, this Pokémon pinches all Pokémon that enter its territory with its pincers and throws them out.
3966.name: crawdaunt

3967.text: Crawdaunt has an extremely violent nature that compels it to challenge other living things to battle. Other life-forms refuse to live in ponds inhabited by this Pokémon, making them desolate places.
3967.name: crawdaunt

3968.text: Crawdaunt molts (sheds) its shell regularly. Immediately after molting, its shell is soft and tender. Until the shell hardens, this Pokémon hides in its streambed burrow to avoid attack from its foes.
3968.name: crawdaunt

3969.text: Its temperament is rough and it loves to fight, but as soon as its pincers break off, it turns cowardly. It stays timid until they grow back.
3969.name: crawdaunt

3970.text: Its pincers often fall off. Unlike with Crabrawler or Clauncher, the meat in its claws is utterly nasty and stinking.
3970.name: crawdaunt

3971.text: A rough customer that wildly flails its giant claws. It is said to be extremely hard to raise.
3971.name: crawdaunt

3972.text: A brutish Pokémon that loves to battle. It will crash itself into any foe that approaches its nest.
3972.name: crawdaunt

3973.text: BALTOY moves while spinning around on its one foot. Primitive wall paintings depicting this POKéMON living among people were discovered in some ancient ruins.
3973.name: baltoy

3974.text: A BALTOY moves by spinning on its single foot. It has been depicted in murals  adorning the walls of a once-bustling city in an ancient age.
3974.name: baltoy

3975.text: Discovered in ancient ruins, it moves by spinning around and forms a group when it finds others.
3975.name: baltoy

3976.text: It moves by spinning on its foot. It is a rare Pokémon that was discovered in ancient ruins.
3976.name: baltoy

3977.text: Baltoy moves while spinning around on its one foot. Primitive wall paintings depicting this Pokémon living among people were discovered in some ancient ruins.
3977.name: baltoy

3978.text: As soon as it spots others of its kind, Baltoy congregates with them and then begins crying noisily in unison. This Pokémon sleeps while cleverly balancing itself on its one foot.
3978.name: baltoy

3979.text: Depictions of Pokémon similar to Baltoy have been found on the walls of caves where primitive humans lived.
3979.name: baltoy

3980.text: When they find others of their kind, they cry out loudly and gather together. Large numbers of them can be found in old graveyards.
3980.name: baltoy

3981.text: It moves while spinning around on its single foot. Some Baltoy have been seen spinning on their heads.
3981.name: baltoy

3982.text: It was discovered in ancient ruins. While moving, it constantly spins. It stands on one foot even when asleep.
3982.name: baltoy

3983.text: A CLAYDOL sleeps while hovering in midair. Its arms are separate from its body. They are kept floating by the POKéMON’s manipulation of psychic power.
3983.name: claydol

3984.text: An ancient clay figurine that came to life as a Pokémon from exposure to a mysterious ray of light.
3984.name: claydol

3985.text: It is said that it originates from clay dolls made by an ancient civilization.
3985.name: claydol

3986.text: Claydol are said to be dolls of mud made by primitive humans and brought to life by exposure to a mysterious ray. This Pokémon moves about while levitating.
3986.name: claydol

3987.text: Claydol is an enigma that appeared from a clay statue made by an ancient civilization dating back 20,000 years. This Pokémon shoots beams from both its hands.
3987.name: claydol

3988.text: If it gets wet, its body melts. When rain starts to fall, it wraps its whole body up with its psychic powers to protect itself.
3988.name: claydol

3989.text: The ancient people who made it apparently modeled it after something that descended from the sky. It fires beams from both arms.
3989.name: claydol

3990.text: This mysterious Pokémon started life as an ancient clay figurine made over 20,000 years ago.
3990.name: claydol

3991.text: It appears to have been born from clay dolls made by ancient people. It uses telekinesis to float and move.
3991.name: claydol

3992.text: LILEEP became extinct approximately a hundred million years ago. This ancient POKéMON attaches itself to a rock on the seafloor and catches approaching prey using tentacles  shaped like flower petals.
3992.name: lileep

3993.text: LILEEP is an ancient POKéMON that was regenerated from a fossil. It remains permanently anchored to a rock. From its immobile perch, this POKéMON intently scans for prey with its two eyes.
3993.name: lileep

3994.text: It disguises itself as seaweed by making its tentacles sway. Unsuspecting prey that come too close are swallowed whole. It became extinct 100 million years ago.
3994.name: lileep

3995.text: It became extinct roughly 100 million years ago. It was regenerated from a fossil using advanced techniques.
3995.name: lileep

3996.text: It disguises its tentacles as flowers to attract and catch prey. It became extinct in ancient times.
3996.name: lileep

3997.text: It lived on the seafloor 100 million years ago and was reanimated scientifically.
3997.name: lileep

3998.text: Lileep became extinct approximately a hundred million years ago. This ancient Pokémon attaches itself to a rock on the seafloor and catches approaching prey using tentacles shaped like flower petals.
3998.name: lileep

3999.text: Lileep is an ancient Pokémon that was regenerated from a fossil. It remains permanently anchored to a rock. From its immobile perch, this Pokémon intently scans for prey with its two eyes.
3999.name: lileep

4000.text: In ancient times, it lived in warm seas. It disguised itself as seaweed to ambush its prey and devoured them whole when they got close.
4000.name: lileep

4001.text: It sticks to rocks with its powerful suckers and can’t be washed away no matter how rough the surf gets.
4001.name: lileep

4002.text: This Pokémon was restored from a fossil. Lileep once lived in warm seas that existed approximately 100,000,000 years ago.
4002.name: lileep

4003.text: Lileep clings to rocks on the seabed. When prey comes close, this Pokémon entangles it with petallike tentacles.
4003.name: lileep

4004.text: CRADILY roams around the ocean floor in search of food. This POKéMON freely extends its tree trunk-like neck and captures unwary prey using its eight tentacles.
4004.name: cradily

4005.text: CRADILY’s body serves as an anchor, preventing it from being washed away in rough seas. This POKéMON secretes a strong digestive fluid from its tentacles.
4005.name: cradily

4006.text: It drags its heavy body along the seafloor. It makes its nest in the shallows of warm seas. CRADILY can be seen on beaches when the tide goes out.
4006.name: cradily

4007.text: It lives in warm seas. Its heavy body weighs it down so it won’t get washed away in rough weather.
4007.name: cradily

4008.text: It lives in the shallows of warm seas. When the tide goes out, it digs up prey from beaches.
4008.name: cradily

4009.text: It ensnares prey with its eight tentacles. It then melts the prey with a strong acid before feeding.
4009.name: cradily

4010.text: Cradily roams around the ocean floor in search of food. This Pokémon freely extends its tree trunk-like neck and captures unwary prey using its eight tentacles.
4010.name: cradily

4011.text: Cradily’s body serves as an anchor, preventing it from being washed away in rough seas. This Pokémon secretes a strong digestive fluid from its tentacles.
4011.name: cradily

4012.text: Normally, it lived on shallow sea shoals. When the tide went out, this Pokémon came up on land to search for prey.
4012.name: cradily

4013.text: This carnivorous Pokémon lived in primordial seas. It catches prey in its eight tentacles and dissolves them with digestive fluid as it eats.
4013.name: cradily

4014.text: It has short legs and can’t walk very fast, but its neck and tentacles can extend to over three times their usual length to nab distant prey.
4014.name: cradily

4015.text: Once Cradily catches prey in its tentacles, it digests them whole and absorbs their nutrients.
4015.name: cradily

4016.text: ANORITH is said to be a type of  POKéMON predecessor, with eight wings at the sides of its body. This POKéMON swam in the primordial sea by undulating these eight wings.
4016.name: anorith

4017.text: It was resurrected from a fossil using the power of science. It swims by undulating the eight wings at its sides. They were feet that adapted to life in the sea.
4017.name: anorith

4018.text: An ancestral Pokémon that lived in the ocean. Over time, its eight feet transformed into wings.
4018.name: anorith

4019.text: It is a kind of Pokémon progenitor. It uses its extending claws to catch prey hiding among rocks on the seafloor.
4019.name: anorith

4020.text: A Pokémon ancestor that was reanimated from a fossil. It lived in the sea and hunted with claws.
4020.name: anorith

4021.text: Anorith was regenerated from a prehistoric fossil. This primitive Pokémon once lived in warm seas. It grips its prey firmly between its two large claws.
4021.name: anorith

4022.text: Anorith is said to be a type of Pokémon predecessor, with eight wings at the sides of its body. This Pokémon swam in the primordial sea by undulating these eight wings.
4022.name: anorith

4023.text: When restored Anorith are released into the ocean, they don’t thrive, because the water composition has changed since their era.
4023.name: anorith

4024.text: This is one kind of primeval bug Pokémon. With eight wings, it could apparently swim a lot faster than you’d expect.
4024.name: anorith

4025.text: This Pokémon was restored from a fossil. Anorith lived in the ocean about 100,000,000 years ago, hunting with its pair of claws.
4025.name: anorith

4026.text: Anorith can swim swiftly by pulling its eight wings through the water like oars on a boat. This Pokémon is an ancestor of modern bug Pokémon.
4026.name: anorith

4027.text: ARMALDO is a POKéMON species that became extinct in prehistoric times. This POKéMON is said to have walked on its hind legs, which would have been more convenient for life on land.
4027.name: armaldo

4028.text: ARMALDO usually lives on land. However, when it hunts for prey, it dives beneath the ocean. It swims around using its two large wings.
4028.name: armaldo

4029.text: It went ashore after evolving. Its entire body is clad in a sturdy armor.
4029.name: armaldo

4030.text: Its enormous, retractable claws can cut through most anything. Its entire body is clad in sturdy plates.
4030.name: armaldo

4031.text: Protected by a hard shell, its body is very sturdy. It skewers prey with its claws to feed.
4031.name: armaldo

4032.text: Armaldo’s tough armor makes all attacks bounce off. This Pokémon’s two enormous claws can be freely extended or contracted. They have the power to punch right through a steel slab.
4032.name: armaldo

4033.text: Armaldo is a Pokémon species that became extinct in prehistoric times. This Pokémon is said to have walked on its hind legs, which would have been more convenient for life on land.
4033.name: armaldo

4034.text: It lived on land and went out into the sea to hunt for prey. Its sharp claws were its greatest weapon.
4034.name: armaldo

4035.text: Armaldo adapted from living in water to living on land. It has been determined that it is the ancestor of some bug Pokémon.
4035.name: armaldo

4036.text: After evolution, this Pokémon emerged onto land. Its lower body has become stronger, and blows from its tail are devastating.
4036.name: armaldo

4037.text: Though it lives on land, it’s also a good swimmer. It dives into the ocean in search of prey, using its sharp claws to take down its quarry.
4037.name: armaldo

4038.text: FEEBAS’s fins are ragged and tattered from the start of its life. Because of its shoddy appearance, this POKéMON is largely ignored. It is capable of living in both the sea and in rivers.
4038.name: feebas

4039.text: While FEEBAS’s body is in tatters, it has a hardy and tenacious life force that enables it to live anywhere. However, this POKéMON is also slow and dimwitted, making it an easy catch.
4039.name: feebas

4040.text: FEEBAS live in ponds that are heavily infested with weeds. Because of its hopelessly shabby appearance, it seems as if few TRAINERS raise it.
4040.name: feebas

4041.text: Ridiculed for its shabby appearance, it is ignored by researchers. It lives in ponds choked with weeds.
4041.name: feebas

4042.text: It is famous for its shabby appearance. While populous, they tend to cluster in set locations.
4042.name: feebas

4043.text: It eats anything, so it can even live in polluted streams and lakes. No one pays any attention to it.
4043.name: feebas

4044.text: It is the shabbiest Pokémon of all. It forms in schools and lives at the bottom of rivers.
4044.name: feebas

4045.text: Feebas’s fins are ragged and tattered from the start of its life. Because of its shoddy appearance, this Pokémon is largely ignored. It is capable of living in both the sea and in rivers.
4045.name: feebas

4046.text: While Feebas’s body is in tatters, it has a hardy and tenacious life force that enables it to live anywhere. However, this Pokémon is also slow and dimwitted, making it an easy catch.
4046.name: feebas

4047.text: A tough Pokémon that is perfectly fine even in dirty water. However, due to its ragged, shabby appearance, it isn’t popular.
4047.name: feebas

4048.text: They look ragged, so no one catches them. They look like they’d taste bad, so predators won’t eat them. And their numbers continue to grow.
4048.name: feebas

4049.text: Because of its wretched appearance, most people pay it no attention, but there are some who collect Feebas—and Feebas alone!
4049.name: feebas

4050.text: Although unattractive and unpopular, this Pokémon’s marvelous vitality has made it a subject of research.
4050.name: feebas

4051.text: It is a shabby and ugly Pokémon. However, it is very hardy and can survive on little water.
4051.name: feebas

4052.text: MILOTIC is said to be the most beautiful of all the POKéMON. It has the power to becalm such emotions as anger and hostility to quell bitter feuding.
4052.name: milotic

4053.text: MILOTIC live at the bottom of large lakes. When this POKéMON’s body glows a vivid pink, it releases a pulsing wave of energy that brings soothing calm to restless spirits.
4053.name: milotic

4054.text: It is said to live at the bottom of large lakes. Considered to be the most beautiful of all POKéMON, it has been depicted in paintings and statues.
4054.name: milotic

4055.text: MILOTIC is breathtakingly beautiful. Those that see it are said to forget their combative spirits.
4055.name: milotic

4056.text: When people bicker, it is said to arise from the depths of lakes to becalm violent hearts.
4056.name: milotic

4057.text: It is the world’s most beautiful Pokémon. There are many works of art featuring MILOTIC.
4057.name: milotic

4058.text: It’s said that a glimpse of a MILOTIC and its beauty will calm any hostile emotions you’re feeling.
4058.name: milotic

4059.text: Its lovely scales are described as rainbow colored. They change color depending on the viewing angle.
4059.name: milotic

4060.text: Milotic is breathtakingly beautiful. Those that see it are said to forget their combative spirits.
4060.name: milotic

4061.text: It is the world’s most beautiful Pokémon. There are many works of art featuring Milotic.
4061.name: milotic

4062.text: Milotic is said to be the most beautiful of all the Pokémon. It has the power to becalm such emotions as anger and hostility to quell bitter feuding.
4062.name: milotic

4063.text: Milotic live at the bottom of large lakes. When this Pokémon’s body glows a vivid pink, it releases a pulsing wave of energy that brings soothing calm to troubled hearts.
4063.name: milotic

4064.text: It lives at the bottom of clear lakes. In times of war, it shows itself, which soothes people’s minds and hearts.
4064.name: milotic

4065.text: While Milotic is said to be the most beautiful Pokémon, Trainers who like Feebas and have raised it are seemingly disappointed by Milotic.
4065.name: milotic

4066.text: Its dwelling place is the bottom of big lakes. Those who behold its loveliness are said to have their hearts purified.
4066.name: milotic

4067.text: Milotic has provided inspiration to many artists. It has even been referred to as the most beautiful Pokémon of all.
4067.name: milotic

4068.text: It’s said that a glimpse of a Milotic and its beauty will calm any hostile emotions you’re feeling.
4068.name: milotic

4069.text: CASTFORM’s appearance changes with the weather. This POKéMON gained the ability to use the vast power of nature to protect its tiny body.
4069.name: castform

4070.text: Its appearance changes with the weather. Recently, its molecules were found to be just like water.
4070.name: castform

4071.text: Temperature and weather affect its cellular structure, so this Pokémon changes form according to the weather.
4071.name: castform

4072.text: This Pokémon can change its cells, taking different forms based on the temperature and humidity.
4072.name: castform

4073.text: It has the ability to change its form into the sun, the rain, or a snow cloud, depending on the weather.
4073.name: castform

4074.text: Castform’s appearance changes with the weather. This Pokémon gained the ability to use the vast power of nature to protect its tiny body.
4074.name: castform

4075.text: Castform borrows the power of nature to transform itself into the guises of the sun, rain, and snow-clouds. This Pokémon’s feelings change with the weather.
4075.name: castform

4076.text: It changes its form depending on the weather. Changes in the temperature or humidity appear to affect its cellular structure.
4076.name: castform

4077.text: Its form changes on its own, due to its cells’ sensitive reactions to temperature and humidity.
4077.name: castform

4078.text: Although its form changes with the weather, that is apparently the result of a chemical reaction and not the result of its own free will.
4078.name: castform

4079.text: Its form changes depending on the weather. The rougher conditions get, the rougher Castform’s disposition!
4079.name: castform

4080.text: KECLEON is capable of changing its body colors at will to blend in with its surroundings. There is one exception - this POKéMON can’t change the zigzag pattern on its belly.
4080.name: kecleon

4081.text: KECLEON alters its body coloration to blend in with its surroundings, allowing it to sneak up on its prey unnoticed. Then it lashes out with its long, stretchy tongue to instantly ensnare the unsuspecting target.
4081.name: kecleon

4082.text: A POKéMON that has the ability to alter its body colors to match its surroundings. A KECLEON reverts to its original colors if it is startled.
4082.name: kecleon

4083.text: It changes body color to blend in with its surroundings. It also changes color if it is happy or sad.
4083.name: kecleon

4084.text: It can freely change its body’s color. The zigzag pattern on its belly doesn’t change, however.
4084.name: kecleon

4085.text: It changes its shading to match its surroundings so it can sneak up on prey. Only its belly patterns stay fixed.
4085.name: kecleon

4086.text: Kecleon is capable of changing its body colors at will to blend in with its surroundings. There is one exception—this Pokémon can’t change the zigzag pattern on its belly.
4086.name: kecleon

4087.text: Kecleon alters its body coloration to blend in with its surroundings, allowing it to sneak up on its prey unnoticed. Then it lashes out with its long, stretchy tongue to instantly ensnare the unsuspecting target.
4087.name: kecleon

4088.text: It changes its hue to blend into its surroundings. If no one takes notice of it for too long, it will pout and never reveal itself.
4088.name: kecleon

4089.text: Its color changes for concealment and also when its mood or health changes. The darker the color, the healthier it is.
4089.name: kecleon

4090.text: SHUPPET is attracted by feelings of jealousy and vindictiveness. If someone develops strong feelings of vengeance, this POKéMON will appear in a swarm and line up beneath the eaves of that person’s home.
4090.name: shuppet

4091.text: SHUPPET grows by feeding on dark emotions, such as vengefulness and  envy, in the hearts of people. It roams through cities in search of grudges that taint people.
4091.name: shuppet

4092.text: This POKéMON roams about deep in the night seeking such negative emotions as grudges and envy. It retreats to its nest when the sun begins to rise.
4092.name: shuppet

4093.text: It loves to feed on feelings like envy and malice. Its upright horn catches the emotions of people.
4093.name: shuppet

4094.text: It feeds on the dark emotions of sadness and hatred, which make it grow steadily stronger.
4094.name: shuppet

4095.text: It uses its horn to feed on envy and malice-- or so it’s said. It’s very active at night.
4095.name: shuppet

4096.text: It loves vengeful emotions and hangs in rows under the eaves of houses where vengeful people live.
4096.name: shuppet

4097.text: Shuppet is attracted by feelings of jealousy and vindictiveness. If someone develops strong feelings of vengeance, this Pokémon will appear in a swarm and line up beneath the eaves of that person’s home.
4097.name: shuppet

4098.text: Shuppet grows by feeding on dark emotions, such as vengefulness and envy, in the hearts of people. It roams through cities in search of grudges that taint people.
4098.name: shuppet

4099.text: It eats up emotions like malice, jealousy, and resentment, so some people are grateful for its presence.
4099.name: shuppet

4100.text: There’s a proverb that says, “Shun the house where Shuppet gather in the growing dusk.”
4100.name: shuppet

4101.text: BANETTE generates energy for laying strong curses by sticking pins into its own body. This POKéMON was originally a pitiful plush doll that was thrown away.
4101.name: banette

4102.text: An abandoned plush doll became this POKéMON. They are said to live in garbage dumps and wander about in search of the children that threw them away.
4102.name: banette

4103.text: This Pokémon developed from an abandoned doll that amassed a grudge. It is seen in dark alleys.
4103.name: banette

4104.text: A doll that became a Pokémon over its grudge from being junked. It seeks the child that disowned it.
4104.name: banette

4105.text: Strong feelings of hatred turned a puppet into a Pokémon. If it opens its mouth, its cursed energy escapes.
4105.name: banette

4106.text: Banette generates energy for laying strong curses by sticking pins into its own body. This Pokémon was originally a pitiful plush doll that was thrown away.
4106.name: banette

4107.text: A cursed energy permeated the stuffing of a discarded and forgotten plush doll, giving it new life as Banette. The Pokémon’s energy would escape if it were to ever open its mouth.
4107.name: banette

4108.text: It’s a stuffed toy that was thrown away and became possessed, ever searching for the one who threw it away so it can exact its revenge.
4108.name: banette

4109.text: Resentment at being cast off made it spring into being. Some say that treating it well will satisfy it, and it will once more become a stuffed toy.
4109.name: banette

4110.text: A glare from its single scarlet eye makes even burly grown-ups freeze in utter fear. It is a nocturnal POKéMON that roams about under the cloak of darkness.
4110.name: duskull

4111.text: It loves the crying of children. It startles bad kids by passing through walls and making them cry.
4111.name: duskull

4112.text: It doggedly pursues its prey wherever it goes. However, the chase is abandoned at sunrise.
4112.name: duskull

4113.text: Duskull can pass through any wall no matter how thick it may be. Once this Pokémon chooses a target, it will doggedly pursue the intended victim until the break of dawn.
4113.name: duskull

4114.text: Duskull wanders lost among the deep darkness of midnight. There is an oft-told admonishment given to misbehaving children that this Pokémon will spirit away bad children who earn scoldings from their mothers.
4114.name: duskull

4115.text: If it finds bad children who won’t listen to their parents, it will spirit them away—or so it’s said.
4115.name: duskull

4116.text: Making itself invisible, it silently sneaks up to prey. It has the ability to slip through thick walls.
4116.name: duskull

4117.text: I've heard that the children of Hisui all begin to behave once they've been told the story of how this Pokémon roams about before the witching hour to spirit away misbehaving children.
4117.name: duskull

4118.text: DUSCLOPS’s body is completely hollow - there is nothing at all inside. It is said that its body is like a black hole. This POKéMON will absorb anything into its body, but nothing will ever come back out.
4118.name: dusclops

4119.text: DUSCLOPS absorbs anything, however large the object may be. This POKéMON hypnotizes its foe by waving its hands in a macabre manner and by bringing its single eye to bear. The hypnotized foe is made to do DUSCLOPS’s bidding.
4119.name: dusclops

4120.text: It is thought that its body is hollow with only a spectral ball of fire burning inside. However, no one has been able to confirm this theory as fact.
4120.name: dusclops

4121.text: Anyone who dares peer into its body to see its spectral ball of fire will have their spirit stolen away.
4121.name: dusclops

4122.text: Its body is hollow. It is said that those who look into its body are sucked into the void.
4122.name: dusclops

4123.text: Dusclops’s body is completely hollow—there is nothing at all inside. It is said that its body is like a black hole. This Pokémon will absorb anything into its body, but nothing will ever come back out.
4123.name: dusclops

4124.text: Dusclops absorbs anything, however large the object may be. This Pokémon hypnotizes its foe by waving its hands in a macabre manner and by bringing its single eye to bear. The hypnotized foe is made to do Dusclops’s bidding.
4124.name: dusclops

4125.text: Its body is entirely hollow. When it opens its mouth, it sucks everything in as if it were a black hole.
4125.name: dusclops

4126.text: It seeks drifting will-o’-the-wisps and sucks them into its empty body. What happens inside is a mystery.
4126.name: dusclops

4127.text: There are rumors that peeking inside its bandage-wrapped body will cause one to get pulled in through the gaps between the bandages, never to return. I've been too scared to verify.
4127.name: dusclops

4128.text: It flies by flapping its broad leaves. The bunch of fruit that grows around its neck is deliciously sweet. In the spring, it scatters pollen from its neck.
4128.name: tropius

4129.text: It lives in tropical jungles. The bunch of fruit around its neck is delicious. The fruit grows twice a year.
4129.name: tropius

4130.text: Because it continually ate only its favorite fruit, the fruit started growing around its neck.
4130.name: tropius

4131.text: Delicious fruits grew out from around its neck because it always ate the same kind of fruit.
4131.name: tropius

4132.text: It flies by flapping its broad leaves and gives the sweet, delicious fruit around its neck to children.
4132.name: tropius

4133.text: The bunch of fruit around its neck ripens twice a year and is delicious. It’s a highly favored tropical snack.
4133.name: tropius

4134.text: The bunches of fruit around Tropius’s neck are very popular with children. This Pokémon loves fruit, and eats it continuously. Apparently, its love for fruit resulted in its own outgrowth of fruit.
4134.name: tropius

4135.text: Children of the southern tropics eat as snacks the fruit that grows in bunches around the neck of Tropius. This Pokémon flies by flapping the leaves on its back as if they were wings.
4135.name: tropius

4136.text: The bunches of fruit growing around the necks of Tropius in Alola are especially sweet compared to those in other regions.
4136.name: tropius

4137.text: Bunches of delicious fruit grow around its neck. In warm areas, many ranches raise Tropius.
4137.name: tropius

4138.text: They fly about very actively when the hot season arrives. They communicate among themselves using seven different and distinguishing cries.
4138.name: chimecho

4139.text: It travels by riding on winds. It cleverly uses its long tail to pluck nuts and berries, which it loves to eat.
4139.name: chimecho

4140.text: To knock foes flying, it makes the air shudder with its cries. It converses using seven cries.
4140.name: chimecho

4141.text: Its cries echo inside its hollow body to emerge as beautiful notes for startling and repelling foes.
4141.name: chimecho

4142.text: It uses the sucker on its head to hang from a tree or from eaves. It can produce seven different tones.
4142.name: chimecho

4143.text: Emitting ultrasonic cries, it floats on winds to travel great distances.
4143.name: chimecho

4144.text: Chimecho makes its cries echo inside its hollow body. When this Pokémon becomes enraged, its cries result in ultrasonic waves that have the power to knock foes flying.
4144.name: chimecho

4145.text: In high winds, Chimecho cries as it hangs from a tree branch or the eaves of a building using a suction cup on its head. This Pokémon plucks berries with its long tail and eats them.
4145.name: chimecho

4146.text: Can emit waves of air powerful enough to knock out prey taller than itself. I hypothesize that it amplifies the faint sound of wind within its body.
4146.name: chimecho

4147.text: Every time ABSOL appears before people, it is followed by a disaster such as an earthquake or a tidal wave. As a result, it came to be known as the disaster POKéMON.
4147.name: absol

4148.text: ABSOL has the ability to foretell the coming of natural disasters. It lives in a harsh, rugged mountain environment. This POKéMON very rarely ventures down from the mountains.
4148.name: absol

4149.text: It sharply senses even subtle changes in the sky and the land to predict natural disasters. It is a long-lived POKéMON that has a life-span of 100 years.
4149.name: absol

4150.text: It has the ability to foretell natural disasters. Its life span is over a hundred years.
4150.name: absol

4151.text: Rumored to sense disasters with its horn, it became a target. It fled deep into the mountains.
4151.name: absol

4152.text: It appears from deep in the mountains to warn people about upcoming disasters it has sensed with its horn.
4152.name: absol

4153.text: It senses coming disasters and appears before people only to warn them of impending danger.
4153.name: absol

4154.text: It appears when it senses an impending natural disaster. As a result, it was mistaken as a doom bringer.
4154.name: absol

4155.text: Every time Absol appears before people, it is followed by a disaster such as an earthquake or a tidal wave. As a result, it came to be known as the disaster Pokémon.
4155.name: absol

4156.text: Absol has the ability to foretell the coming of natural disasters. It lives in a harsh, rugged mountain environment. This Pokémon very rarely ventures down from the mountains.
4156.name: absol
