4157.text: Long ago, superstitions were spread about it, saying it brought disaster. This fed a hatred of it, and it was driven deep into the mountains.
4157.name: absol

4158.text: Although it’s said to bring disaster, in actuality, this Pokémon possesses a calm disposition and warns people of any crises that loom.
4158.name: absol

4159.text: The only thing unlucky about Absol is its appearance. It protects fields and warns people of disaster, so one ought to be grateful for it.
4159.name: absol

4160.text: The elderly call it the disaster Pokémon and detest it, but interest in its power to predict disasters is on the rise.
4160.name: absol

4161.text: Swift as the wind, Absol races through fields and mountains. Its curved, bow-like horn is acutely sensitive to the warning signs of natural disasters.
4161.name: absol

4162.text: Because of this Pokémon’s ability to detect danger, people mistook Absol as a bringer of doom.
4162.name: absol

4163.text: WYNAUT can always be seen with a big, happy smile on its face. Look at its tail to determine if it is angry. When angered, this POKéMON will be slapping the ground with its tail.
4163.name: wynaut

4164.text: A WYNAUT loves to eat sweet fruits. It cleverly picks fruits using its earlike arms. They gather in fruit gardens, drawn by the fragrance.
4164.name: wynaut

4165.text: It grows strong by pushing up against others en masse. It loves eating sweet fruit.
4165.name: wynaut

4166.text: Wynaut can always be seen with a big, happy smile on its face. Look at its tail to determine if it is angry. When angered, this Pokémon will be slapping the ground with its tail.
4166.name: wynaut

4167.text: Wynaut gather on moonlit nights to play by squeezing up against each other. By being squeezed, this Pokémon gains endurance and is trained to dole out powerful counterattacks.
4167.name: wynaut

4168.text: It tends to move in a pack. Individuals squash against one another to toughen their spirits.
4168.name: wynaut

4169.text: It tends to move in a pack with others. They cluster in a tight group to sleep in a cave.
4169.name: wynaut

4170.text: They tend to move about in groups of around five SNORUNT. In snowy regions, it is said that when they are seen late at night, snowfall will arrive by morning.
4170.name: snorunt

4171.text: It is said that a home visited by a SNORUNT will prosper. It can withstand cold of minus 150 degrees Fahrenheit.
4171.name: snorunt

4172.text: It is said that several Snorunt gather under giant leaves and live together in harmony.
4172.name: snorunt

4173.text: In the snow country, certain folklore says a house will prosper if a Snorunt lives there.
4173.name: snorunt

4174.text: Snorunt live in regions with heavy snowfall. In seasons without snow, such as spring and summer, this Pokémon steals away to live quietly among stalactites and stalagmites deep in caverns.
4174.name: snorunt

4175.text: Snorunt survives by eating only snow and ice. Old folklore claims that a house visited by this Pokémon is sure to prosper for many generations to come.
4175.name: snorunt

4176.text: Their numbers seem to have rapidly increased in Alola. Custom has it that houses where Snorunt live will be prosperous for generations to come.
4176.name: snorunt

4177.text: It feeds mainly on ice and snow. It’s only able to survive in a limited number of places in the warm Alola region.
4177.name: snorunt

4178.text: Rich people from cold areas all share childhood memories of playing with Snorunt.
4178.name: snorunt

4179.text: It’s said that if they are seen at midnight, they’ll cause heavy snow. They eat snow and ice to survive.
4179.name: snorunt

4180.text: It can only survive in cold areas. It bounces happily around, even in environments as cold as −150 degrees Fahrenheit.
4180.name: snorunt

4181.text: Arrives alongside the first snow. It's thought that homes Snorunt visit will prosper for many generations. By tradition, one might offer a lump of ice made from pure water at one's front door.
4181.name: snorunt

4182.text: GLALIE has a body made of rock, which it hardens with an armor of ice. This POKéMON has the ability to freeze moisture in the atmosphere into any shape it desires.
4182.name: glalie

4183.text: GLALIE has the ability to freely control ice. For example, it can instantly freeze its foe solid. After immobilizing its foe in ice, this POKéMON enjoys eating it in leisurely fashion.
4183.name: glalie

4184.text: A GLALIE has the power to instantaneously freeze moisture in the atmosphere. A dazzling cloud of diamondlike ice crystals forms around its body.
4184.name: glalie

4185.text: It prevents prey from escaping by instantaneously freezing moisture in the air.
4185.name: glalie

4186.text: To protect itself, it clad its body in an armor of ice, made by freezing moisture in the air.
4186.name: glalie

4187.text: Glalie has a body made of rock, which it hardens with an armor of ice. This Pokémon has the ability to freeze moisture in the atmosphere into any shape it desires.
4187.name: glalie

4188.text: Glalie has the ability to freely control ice. For example, it can instantly freeze its prey solid. After immobilizing its prey in ice, this Pokémon enjoys eating it in leisurely fashion.
4188.name: glalie

4189.text: Legend says a boulder on an icy mountain absorbed the distress and regrets of a stranded mountaineer, giving rise to Glalie.
4189.name: glalie

4190.text: Its prey is instantaneously frozen stiff by the cold air it exhales from its huge mouth. While they’re in that frozen state, it gobbles them up.
4190.name: glalie

4191.text: It freezes its prey and chews them whole. However, it prefers to eat Pokémon like Vanillite that are already frozen.
4191.name: glalie

4192.text: Its actual body is a rock that isn’t particularly hard. Glalie absorbs moisture from the air and drapes itself in an armor of ice.
4192.name: glalie

4193.text: It has a body of ice that won’t melt, even with fire. It can instantly freeze moisture in the atmosphere.
4193.name: glalie

4194.text: It can instantly freeze moisture in the atmosphere. It uses this power to freeze its foes.
4194.name: glalie

4195.text: It covers its body with an armor of ice harder than steel. Uses its breath to freeze prey, which it then devours as if they were frozen desserts.
4195.name: glalie

4196.text: SPHEAL is much faster rolling than  walking to get around. When groups of this POKéMON eat, they all clap at once to show their pleasure. Because of this, their mealtimes are noisy.
4196.name: spheal

4197.text: It is completely covered with plushy fur. As a result, it never feels the cold even when it is rolling about on ice floes or diving in the sea.
4197.name: spheal

4198.text: It crosses the oceans by rolling itself on drifting ice. Fluffy fur keeps it warm when the temperature is below freezing.
4198.name: spheal

4199.text: It rolls across ice floes to reach shore because its body is poorly shaped for swimming.
4199.name: spheal

4200.text: They can’t swim well yet, and they move much faster by rolling. When they’re happy, they clap fins.
4200.name: spheal

4201.text: Its body is covered in fluffy fur. The fur keeps it from feeling cold while it is rolling on ice.
4201.name: spheal

4202.text: Spheal is much faster rolling than walking to get around. When groups of this Pokémon eat, they all clap at once to show their pleasure. Because of this, their mealtimes are noisy.
4202.name: spheal

4203.text: Spheal always travels by rolling around on its ball-like body. When the season for ice floes arrives, this Pokémon can be seen rolling about on ice and crossing the sea.
4203.name: spheal

4204.text: This Pokémon’s body is covered in blubber and impressively round. It’s faster for Spheal to roll around than walk.
4204.name: spheal

4205.text: As it drifts among the waves, Spheal probes the sea. As soon as it spots prey, it informs the Walrein in its herd.
4205.name: spheal

4206.text: During the season when drift ice approaches the shore, Spheal prefers living on the ice—where fewer predators lurk—rather than the land. Its fur retains heat superbly and resists harsh cold.
4206.name: spheal

4207.text: SEALEO live in herds on ice floes. Using its powerful flippers, it shatters ice. It dives into the sea to hunt prey five times a day.
4207.name: sealeo

4208.text: It touches new things with its nose to test for smell and feel. It plays by spinning SPHEAL on its nose.
4208.name: sealeo

4209.text: It habitually spins things on its nose. By doing so, it learns textures and odors.
4209.name: sealeo

4210.text: It has a very sensitive nose. It touches new things with its nose to examine them.
4210.name: sealeo

4211.text: Be it Spheal or Poké Ball, it will spin any round object on its nose with the greatest of ease.
4211.name: sealeo

4212.text: Sealeo has the habit of always juggling on the tip of its nose anything it sees for the first time. This Pokémon occasionally entertains itself by balancing and rolling a Spheal on its nose.
4212.name: sealeo

4213.text: Sealeo often balances and rolls things on the tip of its nose. While the Pokémon is rolling something, it checks the object’s aroma and texture to determine whether it likes the object or not.
4213.name: sealeo

4214.text: Sealeo live on top of drift ice. They go swimming when they’re on the hunt, seeking out their prey by scent.
4214.name: sealeo

4215.text: This Pokémon has a habit of spinning round things on its nose, whether those things are Poké Balls or Spheal.
4215.name: sealeo

4216.text: Its white whiskers are very sensitive. Sealeo will balance Spheal on the tip of its nose, checking its scent and its feel to be sure the Spheal is healthy.
4216.name: sealeo

4217.text: To protect its herd, the leader battles anything that invades its territory, even at the cost of its life. Its tusks may snap off in battle.
4217.name: walrein

4218.text: It swims through icy seas while shattering ice floes with its large tusks. It is protected by its thick blubber.
4218.name: walrein

4219.text: Not only does its thick blubber keep it warm, it also protects it from attacks. It shatters ice with its prized tusks.
4219.name: walrein

4220.text: It shatters drift ice with its strong tusks. Its thick layer of blubber repels enemy attacks.
4220.name: walrein

4221.text: Walrein’s two massively developed tusks can totally shatter blocks of ice weighing 10 tons with one blow. This Pokémon’s thick coat of blubber insulates it from subzero temperatures.
4221.name: walrein

4222.text: Walrein swims all over in frigid seawater while crushing icebergs with its grand, imposing tusks. Its thick layer of blubber makes enemy attacks bounce off harmlessly.
4222.name: walrein

4223.text: Walrein form herds of 20 to 30 individuals. When a threat appears, the herd’s leader will protect the group with its life.
4223.name: walrein

4224.text: Walrein’s tusks keep growing throughout its life. Tusks broken in battle will grow back to their usual impressive size in a year.
4224.name: walrein

4225.text: Its thick tusks are strong enough to shatter drift ice. They have been known to break, but they will grow back by the next year. The Hisui region is well known for these broken tusks.
4225.name: walrein

4226.text: CLAMPERL’s sturdy shell is not only good for protection - it is also used for clamping and catching prey. A fully grown CLAMPERL’s shell will be scored with nicks and scratches all over.
4226.name: clamperl

4227.text: A CLAMPERL slams its shell closed on prey to prevent escape. The pearl it creates upon evolution is said to be infused with a mysterious energy.
4227.name: clamperl

4228.text: It makes a single pearl during its lifetime. The pearl is said to amplify psychic power.
4228.name: clamperl

4229.text: When it evolves, it makes a mysterious pearl that amplifies psychic powers when it’s held.
4229.name: clamperl

4230.text: It is protected by a sturdy shell. Once in a lifetime, it makes a magnificent pearl.
4230.name: clamperl

4231.text: Clamperl’s sturdy shell is not only good for protection—it is also used for clamping and catching prey. A fully grown Clamperl’s shell will be scored with nicks and scratches all over.
4231.name: clamperl

4232.text: Clamperl grows while being protected by its rock-hard shell. When its body becomes too large to fit inside the shell, it is sure evidence that this Pokémon is getting close to evolution.
4232.name: clamperl

4233.text: Despite its appearance, it’s carnivorous. It clamps down on its prey with both sides of its shell and doesn’t let go until they stop moving.
4233.name: clamperl

4234.text: Clamperl’s pearls are exceedingly precious. They can be more than 10 times as costly as Shellder’s pearls.
4234.name: clamperl

4235.text: HUNTAIL’s presence went unnoticed by people for a long time because it lives at extreme depths in the sea. This POKéMON’s eyes can see clearly even in the murky dark depths of the ocean.
4235.name: huntail

4236.text: HUNTAIL’s tail is shaped like a fish. It uses the tail to attract prey, then swallows the prey whole with its large, gaping mouth. This POKéMON swims by wiggling its slender body like a snake.
4236.name: huntail

4237.text: To withstand the crushing pressure of water deep under the sea, its spine is very thick and sturdy. Its tail, which is shaped like a small fish, has eyes that light up.
4237.name: huntail

4238.text: It lives deep in the pitch-dark sea. It attracts prey by moving its tail in mimicry of a small animal.
4238.name: huntail

4239.text: It lives deep in the sea where no light ever filters down. It lights up its small fishlike tail to attract prey.
4239.name: huntail

4240.text: It lives deep in the sea. With a tail shaped like a small fish, it attracts unsuspecting prey.
4240.name: huntail

4241.text: Huntail’s presence went unnoticed by people for a long time because it lives at extreme depths in the sea. This Pokémon’s eyes can see clearly even in the murky dark depths of the ocean.
4241.name: huntail

4242.text: Huntail’s tail is shaped like a fish. It uses the tail to attract prey, then swallows the prey whole with its large, gaping mouth. This Pokémon swims by wiggling its slender body like a snake.
4242.name: huntail

4243.text: It’s not the strongest swimmer. It wags its tail to lure in its prey and then gulps them down as soon as they get close.
4243.name: huntail

4244.text: Deep seas are their habitat. According to tradition, when Huntail wash up onshore, something unfortunate will happen.
4244.name: huntail

4245.text: GOREBYSS lives in the southern seas at extreme depths. Its body is built to withstand the enormous pressure of water at incredible depths. Because of this, this POKéMON’s body is unharmed by ordinary attacks.
4245.name: gorebyss

4246.text: Although GOREBYSS is the very picture of elegance and beauty while swimming, it is also cruel. When it spots prey, this POKéMON inserts its thin mouth into the prey’s body and drains the prey of its body fluids.
4246.name: gorebyss

4247.text: A GOREBYSS siphons the body fluids of prey through its thin, tubular mouth. Its light pink body color turns vivid when it finishes feeding.
4247.name: gorebyss

4248.text: Its pink body becomes more vivid with the rise of water temperatures in the springtime.
4248.name: gorebyss

4249.text: It lives at the bottom of the sea. In the springtime, its pink body turns more vivid for some reason.
4249.name: gorebyss

4250.text: Its swimming form is exquisitely elegant. With its thin mouth, it feeds on seaweed that grows between rocks.
4250.name: gorebyss

4251.text: Gorebyss lives in the southern seas at extreme depths. Its body is built to withstand the enormous pressure of water at incredible depths. Because of this, this Pokémon’s body is unharmed by ordinary attacks.
4251.name: gorebyss

4252.text: Although Gorebyss is the very picture of elegance and beauty while swimming, it is also cruel. When it spots prey, this Pokémon inserts its thin mouth into the prey’s body and drains the prey of its body fluids.
4252.name: gorebyss

4253.text: The color of its body changes with the water temperature. The coloration of Gorebyss in Alola is almost blindingly vivid.
4253.name: gorebyss

4254.text: It sucks bodily fluids out of its prey. The leftover meat sinks to the seafloor, where it becomes food for other Pokémon.
4254.name: gorebyss

4255.text: RELICANTH is a POKéMON species that existed for a hundred million years without ever changing its form. This ancient POKéMON feeds on microscopic organisms with its toothless mouth.
4255.name: relicanth

4256.text: RELICANTH is a rare species that was discovered in deep-sea explorations. This POKéMON’s body withstands the enormous water pressure of the ocean depths. Its body is covered in tough scales that are like craggy rocks.
4256.name: relicanth

4257.text: A POKéMON that was once believed to have been extinct. The species has not changed its form for 100 million years. It walks on the seafloor using its pectoral fins.
4257.name: relicanth

4258.text: Discovered by chance during deep-sea explorations, it has not changed since ancient times.
4258.name: relicanth

4259.text: It has remained unchanged for 100 million years. It was discovered during a deep-sea exploration.
4259.name: relicanth

4260.text: A rare Pokémon discovered during a deep-sea exploration. It has not changed in over 100 million years.
4260.name: relicanth

4261.text: Relicanth is a Pokémon species that existed for a hundred million years without ever changing its form. This ancient Pokémon feeds on microscopic organisms with its toothless mouth.
4261.name: relicanth

4262.text: Relicanth is a rare species that was discovered in deep-sea explorations. This Pokémon’s body withstands the enormous water pressure of the ocean depths. Its body is covered in tough scales that are like craggy rocks.
4262.name: relicanth

4263.text: Its form has remained the same for one hundred million years. Its body is filled with fat, so it can withstand the water pressure of the deep sea.
4263.name: relicanth

4264.text: It was fortuitously discovered during a deep sea expedition. Its teeth have atrophied, so it now survives on microscopic organisms it sucks up.
4264.name: relicanth

4265.text: Thought to have gone extinct, Relicanth was given a name that is a variation of the name of the person who discovered it.
4265.name: relicanth

4266.text: The reason it hasn’t changed at all in a hundred million years is that it’s apparently already a perfect life-form.
4266.name: relicanth

4267.text: Rock-hard scales and oil-filled swim bladders allow this Pokémon to survive the intense water pressure of the deep sea.
4267.name: relicanth

4268.text: This Pokémon was discovered during deep-sea exploration. Its appearance hasn’t changed in 100,000,000 years, so it’s called a living fossil.
4268.name: relicanth

4269.text: LUVDISC live in shallow seas in the tropics. This heart-shaped POKéMON earned its name by swimming after loving couples it spotted in the ocean’s waves.
4269.name: luvdisc

4270.text: LUVDISC’s heart-shaped body is a symbol of love and romance. It is said that any couple meeting this POKéMON is promised a loving relationship that never ends.
4270.name: luvdisc

4271.text: LUVDISC make the branches of CORSOLA their nests. There is a custom from long ago of giving a LUVDISC as a gift to express one’s feelings of love.
4271.name: luvdisc

4272.text: Its heart-shaped body makes it popular. In some places, you would give a LUVDISC to someone you love.
4272.name: luvdisc

4273.text: It lives in warm seas. It is said that a couple finding this Pokémon will be blessed with eternal love.
4273.name: luvdisc

4274.text: During the spawning season, countless Luvdisc congregate at coral reefs, turning the waters pink.
4274.name: luvdisc

4275.text: Luvdisc live in shallow seas in the tropics. This heart-shaped Pokémon earned its name by swimming after loving couples it spotted in the ocean’s waves.
4275.name: luvdisc

4276.text: Luvdisc’s heart-shaped body is a symbol of love and romance. It is said that any couple meeting this Pokémon is promised a loving relationship that never ends.
4276.name: luvdisc

4277.text: If a Luvdisc is left on its own, it becomes despondent, leaving itself open to attack. That is when Pelipper snatch them up.
4277.name: luvdisc

4278.text: Loving couples have a soft spot for this Pokémon, so honeymoon hotels often release this Pokémon into their pools.
4278.name: luvdisc

4279.text: There was an era when it was overfished due to the rumor that having one of its heart-shaped scales would enable you to find a sweetheart.
4279.name: luvdisc

4280.text: Luvdisc makes its home in coral reefs in warm seas. It especially likes sleeping in the space between Corsola’s branches.
4280.name: luvdisc

4281.text: Although it is small, this POKéMON is very powerful because its body is a bundle of muscles. It launches head-butts with its ironlike skull.
4281.name: bagon

4282.text: Its steel-hard head can shatter boulders. It longingly hopes for wings to grow so it can fly.
4282.name: bagon

4283.text: Dreaming of one day flying, it practices by leaping off cliffs every day.
4283.name: bagon

4284.text: Its well-developed neck muscles and iron-like head can smash boulders into pieces.
4284.name: bagon

4285.text: Bagon has a dream of one day soaring in the sky. In doomed efforts to fly, this Pokémon hurls itself off cliffs. As a result of its dives, its head has grown tough and as hard as tempered steel.
4285.name: bagon

4286.text: Bagon harbors a never-ending dream of one day soaring high among the clouds. As if trying to dispel its frustration over its inability to fly, this Pokémon slams its hard head against huge rocks and shatters them into pebbles.
4286.name: bagon

4287.text: Its belief that it will be able to fly one day is apparently the influence of information carried in its genes.
4287.name: bagon

4288.text: With its steel-hard stone head, it headbutts indiscriminately. This is because of the stress it feels at being unable to fly.
4288.name: bagon

4289.text: Whenever it sees bird Pokémon flying through the sky, it becomes envious and smashes its surroundings to bits with headbutts.
4289.name: bagon

4290.text: Some theories suggest that its behavior of forcefully bashing its head into things stimulates cells that affect its evolution.
4290.name: bagon

4291.text: Bagon jumps off cliffs every day, trying to grow stronger so that someday it will be able to fly.
4291.name: bagon

4292.text: Bagon is a solitary Pokémon that doesn’t form groups with others of its kind. It also has a head hard enough to cleave a boulder in one strike.
4292.name: bagon

4293.text: Covering SHELGON’s body are outgrowths much like bones. The shell is very hard and bounces off enemy attacks. When awaiting evolution, this POKéMON hides away in a cavern.
4293.name: shelgon

4294.text: It hardly eats while it awaits evolution. It becomes hardier by enduring hunger. Its shell peels off the instant it begins to evolve.
4294.name: shelgon

4295.text: It surrounds its body in an iron-hard shell to accumulate enough power to evolve.
4295.name: shelgon

4296.text: Within its rugged shell, its cells have begun changing. The shell peels off the instant it evolves.
4296.name: shelgon

4297.text: Its armored body makes all attacks bounce off. The armor is too tough, however, making it heavy and somewhat sluggish.
4297.name: shelgon

4298.text: Inside Shelgon’s armor-like shell, cells are in the midst of transformation to create an entirely new body. This Pokémon’s shell is extremely heavy, making its movements sluggish.
4298.name: shelgon

4299.text: Covering Shelgon’s body are outgrowths much like bones. The shell is very hard and bounces off enemy attacks. When awaiting evolution, this Pokémon hides away in a cavern.
4299.name: shelgon

4300.text: The cells within its shell transform with explosive speed, preparing it for evolution.
4300.name: shelgon

4301.text: They lurk deep within caves—motionless, neither eating nor drinking. Why they don’t die is not known.
4301.name: shelgon

4302.text: The cells within its body are changing at a bewildering pace. Its hard shell is made from the same substance as bone.
4302.name: shelgon

4303.text: Shelgon lives deep within caves. It stays shut up in its hard shell, dreaming of the day it will be able to fly.
4303.name: shelgon

4304.text: This Pokémon has covered its body in a hard shell that has the same composition as bone. Shelgon stores energy for evolution.
4304.name: shelgon

4305.text: Shelgon ignores its hunger entirely, never eating any food. Apparently, Shelgon will evolve once all its energy stores are used up.
4305.name: shelgon

4306.text: After many long years, its cellular structure underwent a sudden mutation to grow wings. When angered, it loses all thought and rampages out of control.
4306.name: salamence

4307.text: As a result of its long-held dream of flying, its cellular structure changed, and wings grew out.
4307.name: salamence

4308.text: It becomes uncontrollable if it is enraged. It destroys everything with shredding claws and fire.
4308.name: salamence

4309.text: It’s uncontrollable if enraged. It flies around spouting flames and scorching fields and mountains.
4309.name: salamence

4310.text: Salamence came about as a result of a strong, long-held dream of growing wings. It is said that this powerful desire triggered a sudden mutation in this Pokémon’s cells, causing it to sprout its magnificent wings.
4310.name: salamence

4311.text: By evolving into Salamence, this Pokémon finally realizes its long-held dream of growing wings. To express its joy, it flies and wheels all over the sky while spouting flames from its mouth.
4311.name: salamence

4312.text: When angered, it loses all sense of itself and destroys everything around it. The destruction will continue until Salamence has tired itself out.
4312.name: salamence

4313.text: It flies around on its wings, which have grown in at last. In its happiness, it gushes hot flames, burning up the fields it passes over.
4313.name: salamence

4314.text: Overjoyed at finally being able to fly, it flies all over the place and usually doesn’t land until it’s completely exhausted and needs to sleep.
4314.name: salamence

4315.text: Thanks to its fervent wishes, the cells in its body finally mutated, and at last it has its heart’s desire—wings.
4315.name: salamence

4316.text: Salamence is an unusual Pokémon in that it was able to evolve a body with wings just by constantly wishing to be able to fly.
4316.name: salamence

4317.text: While basking in the joy of flight generally keeps this Pokémon in high spirits, Salamence turns into an uncontrollable menace if something angers it.
4317.name: salamence

4318.text: When BELDUM gather in a swarm, they move in perfect unison as if they were but one POKéMON. They communicate with each other using brain waves.
4318.name: beldum

4319.text: It uses magnetic waves to converse with its kind. All the cells in its body are magnetic.
4319.name: beldum

4320.text: Its cells are all magnetic, and it communicates with others by using magnetic pulses.
4320.name: beldum

4321.text: The magnetic force generated by its body repels the ground’s natural magnetism, letting it float.
4321.name: beldum

4322.text: It converses with others by using magnetic pulses. In a swarm, they move in perfect unison.
4322.name: beldum

4323.text: Instead of blood, a powerful magnetic force courses throughout Beldum’s body. This Pokémon communicates with others by sending controlled pulses of magnetism.
4323.name: beldum

4324.text: Beldum keeps itself floating by generating a magnetic force that repels earth’s natural magnetism. When it sleeps, this Pokémon anchors itself to a cliff using the hooks on its rear.
4324.name: beldum

4325.text: Its cells are all magnets. It uses magnetism to communicate with others of its kind.
4325.name: beldum

4326.text: With magnetic traction, it pulls its opponents in close. When they’re in range, it slashes them with its rear claws.
4326.name: beldum

4327.text: Instead of blood, magnetism flows through its body. When it’s feeling bad, try giving it a magnet.
4327.name: beldum

4328.text: If you anger it, it will do more than rampage. It will also burst out strong magnetism, causing nearby machines to break.
4328.name: beldum

4329.text: From its rear, Beldum emits a magnetic force that rapidly pulls opponents in. They get skewered on Beldum’s sharp claws.
4329.name: beldum

4330.text: The cells in this Pokémon’s body are composed of magnetic material. Instead of blood, magnetic forces flow through Beldum’s body.
4330.name: beldum

4331.text: When two BELDUM fuse together, METANG is formed. The brains of the BELDUM are joined by a magnetic nervous system. This POKéMON turns its arms to the rear for traveling at high speed.
4331.name: metang

4332.text: The claws tipping its arms pack the destructive power to tear through thick iron sheets as if they were silk. It flies at over 60 miles per hour.
4332.name: metang

4333.text: It floats midair using magnetism. Its body is so tough, even a crash with a jet plane won’t leave a scratch.
4333.name: metang

4334.text: It is formed by two BELDUM joining together. Its steel body won’t be scratched if it collides with a jet.
4334.name: metang

4335.text: When two BELDUM fuse together, a magnetic nervous system places their brains in union.
4335.name: metang

4336.text: It is formed by two Beldum joining together. Its steel body won’t be scratched if it collides with a jet.
4336.name: metang

4337.text: It is formed by two Beldum joining together. Its two brains are linked, amplifying its psychic power.
4337.name: metang

4338.text: When two Beldum fuse together, Metang is formed. The brains of the Beldum are joined by a magnetic nervous system. This Pokémon turns its arms to the rear for traveling at high speed.
4338.name: metang

4339.text: When two Beldum link together, their psychic power is doubled. Their intelligence, however, remains unchanged.
4339.name: metang

4340.text: It adores magnetic minerals, so it pursues Nosepass at speeds exceeding 60 mph.
4340.name: metang

4341.text: With its two brains, it fires powerful psychic energy to stop its prey in their tracks.
4341.name: metang

4342.text: It flies at high speeds around the skies. When it finds its prey, Metang takes a firm grip with its sharp claws and never lets go.
4342.name: metang

4343.text: Two Beldum have become stuck together via their own magnetic forces. With two brains, the resulting Metang has doubled psychic powers.
4343.name: metang

4344.text: Using magnetic forces to stay aloft, this Pokémon flies at high speeds, weaving through harsh mountain terrain in pursuit of prey.
4344.name: metang

4345.text: METAGROSS is the result of two METANG achieving fusion. When hunting, this POKéMON pins the prey to the ground under its massive body. It then eats the helpless victim using the large  mouth on its stomach.
4345.name: metagross

4346.text: METAGROSS has four brains that are joined by a complex neural network. As a result of integration, this POKéMON is smarter than a supercomputer.
4346.name: metagross

4347.text: It is formed by two METANG fusing. Its four brains are said to be superior to a supercomputer.
4347.name: metagross

4348.text: It folds its four legs when flying. Its four brains are said to be superior to a supercomputer.
4348.name: metagross

4349.text: With four linked brains, it’s more intelligent than a supercomputer, and it uses calculations to analyze foes.
4349.name: metagross

4350.text: Metang combined to form it. With four brains, it has the intelligence of a supercomputer.
4350.name: metagross

4351.text: Metagross has four brains in total. Combined, the four brains can breeze through difficult calculations faster than a supercomputer. This Pokémon can float in the air by tucking in its four legs.
4351.name: metagross

4352.text: Metagross is the result of two Metang achieving fusion. When hunting, this Pokémon pins the prey to the ground under its massive body. It then eats the helpless victim using the large mouth on its stomach.
4352.name: metagross

4353.text: It firmly pins its prey using its four claws and large body. Then the teeth in the mouth on its stomach chew the prey to bits.
4353.name: metagross

4354.text: A linkage of two Metang, this Pokémon can perform any calculation in a flash by utilizing parallel processing in its four brains.
4354.name: metagross

4355.text: It boasts not only psychic powers but also fantastic strength. It grabs its prey with its four legs and holds them in place with its claws.
4355.name: metagross

4356.text: It analyzes its opponents with more accuracy than a supercomputer, which enables it to calmly back them into a corner.
4356.name: metagross

4357.text: Because the magnetic powers of these Pokémon get stronger in freezing temperatures, Metagross living on snowy mountains are full of energy.
4357.name: metagross

4358.text: Metagross is the result of the fusion of two Metang. This Pokémon defeats its opponents through use of its supercomputer-level brain.
4358.name: metagross

4359.text: A POKéMON that is made entirely of rocks and boulders. If parts of its body chip off in battle, REGIROCK repairs itself by adding new rocks.
4359.name: regirock

4360.text: It is entirely composed of rocks with no sign of a brain or heart. It is a mystery even to modern scientists.
4360.name: regirock

4361.text: Its entire body is made of rock. If any part chips off in battle, it attaches rocks to repair itself.
4361.name: regirock

4362.text: The same rocks that form its body have been found in ground layers around the world.
4362.name: regirock

4363.text: Regirock was sealed away by people long ago. If this Pokémon’s body is damaged in battle, it is said to seek out suitable rocks on its own to repair itself.
4363.name: regirock

4364.text: Regirock’s body is composed entirely of rocks. Recently, a study made the startling discovery that the rocks were all unearthed from different locations.
4364.name: regirock

4365.text: Every bit of Regirock’s body is made of stone. As parts of its body erode, this Pokémon sticks rocks to itself to repair what’s been lost.
4365.name: regirock

4366.text: Cutting-edge technology was used to study the internals of this Pokémon’s rock body, but nothing was found—not even a brain or a heart.
4366.name: regirock

4367.text: REGICE’s body was made during an ice age. The deep-frozen body can’t be melted, even by fire. This POKéMON controls frigid air of minus 328 degrees F.
4367.name: regice

4368.text: REGICE cloaks itself with frigid air of negative 328 degrees F. Things will freeze solid just by going near this POKéMON. Its icy body is so cold, it will not melt even if it is immersed in magma.
4368.name: regice

4369.text: Its entire body is made of Antarctic ice. After extensive studies, researchers believe the ice was formed during an ice age.
4369.name: regice

4370.text: Research revealed that its body is made of the same kind of ice that is found at the South Pole.
4370.name: regice

4371.text: It is said to have slept in a glacier for thousands of years. Its body can’t be melted, even by magma.
4371.name: regice

4372.text: Its body is made of ice from the ice age. It controls frigid air of -328 degrees Fahrenheit.
4372.name: regice

4373.text: Regice’s body was made during an ice age. The deep-frozen body can’t be melted, even by fire. This Pokémon controls frigid air of -328 degrees Fahrenheit.
4373.name: regice

4374.text: Regice cloaks itself with frigid air of -328 degrees Fahrenheit. Things will freeze solid just by going near this Pokémon. Its icy body is so cold, it will not melt even if it is immersed in magma.
4374.name: regice

4375.text: With cold air that can reach temperatures as low as −328 degrees Fahrenheit, Regice instantly freezes any creature that approaches it.
4375.name: regice

4376.text: This Pokémon’s body is made of solid ice. It’s said that Regice was born beneath thick ice in the ice age.
4376.name: regice

4377.text: Its body is harder than any other kind of metal. The body metal is composed of a mysterious substance. Not only is it hard, it shrinks and stretches flexibly.
4377.name: registeel

4378.text: It is sturdier than any kind of metal. It hardened due to pressure underground over tens of thousands of years.
4378.name: registeel

4379.text: Tempered by pressure underground over tens of thousands of years, its body cannot be scratched.
4379.name: registeel

4380.text: Its body is said to be harder than any kind of metal. A study has revealed that its body is hollow.
4380.name: registeel

4381.text: Registeel has a body that is harder than any kind of metal. Its body is apparently hollow. No one has any idea what this Pokémon eats.
4381.name: registeel

4382.text: Registeel was imprisoned by people in ancient times. The metal composing its body is thought to be a curious substance that is not of this earth.
4382.name: registeel

4383.text: Registeel’s body is made of a strange material that is flexible enough to stretch and shrink but also more durable than any metal.
4383.name: registeel

4384.text: It’s rumored that this Pokémon was born deep underground in the planet’s mantle and that it emerged onto the surface 10,000 years ago.
4384.name: registeel

4385.text: LATIAS is highly sensitive to the emotions of people. If it senses any hostility, this POKéMON ruffles the feathers all over its body and cries shrilly to intimidate the foe.
4385.name: latias

4386.text: LATIAS is highly intelligent and capable of understanding human speech. It is covered with a glass-like down. The POKéMON enfolds its body with its down and refracts light to alter its appearance.
4386.name: latias

4387.text: They make a small herd of only several members. They rarely make contact with people or other POKéMON. They disappear if they sense enemies.
4387.name: latias

4388.text: Its body is covered with a down that can refract light in such a way that it becomes invisible.
4388.name: latias

4389.text: It communicates using telepathy. Its body is covered in down that refracts light to make it invisible.
4389.name: latias

4390.text: It can telepathically communicate with people. It changes its appearance using its down that refracts light.
4390.name: latias

4391.text: Latias is highly sensitive to the emotions of people. If it senses any hostility, this Pokémon ruffles the feathers all over its body and cries shrilly to intimidate the foe.
4391.name: latias

4392.text: Latias is highly intelligent and capable of understanding human speech. It is covered with a glass-like down. The Pokémon enfolds its body with its down and refracts light to alter its appearance.
4392.name: latias

4393.text: LATIOS has the ability to make its foe see an image of what it has seen or imagines in its head. This POKéMON is intelligent and understands human speech.
4393.name: latios

4394.text: Even in hiding, it can detect the locations of others and sense their emotions since it has telepathy. Its intelligence allows it to understand human languages.
4394.name: latios

4395.text: It has a docile temperament and dislikes fighting. Tucking in its forelegs, it can fly faster than a jet plane.
4395.name: latios

4396.text: A highly intelligent Pokémon. By folding back its wings in flight, it can overtake jet planes.
4396.name: latios

4397.text: It understands human speech and is highly intelligent. It is a tender Pokémon that dislikes fighting.
4397.name: latios

4398.text: Latios has the ability to make others see an image of what it has seen or imagines in its head. This Pokémon is intelligent and understands human speech.
4398.name: latios

4399.text: Latios will only open its heart to a Trainer with a compassionate spirit. This Pokémon can fly faster than a jet plane by folding its forelegs to minimize air resistance.
4399.name: latios

4400.text: KYOGRE has the power to create massive rain clouds that cover the entire sky and bring about torrential downpours. This POKéMON saved people who were suffering from droughts.
4400.name: kyogre

4401.text: KYOGRE is named in mythology as the POKéMON that expanded the sea by covering the land with torrential rains and towering tidal waves. It took to sleep after a cataclysmic battle with GROUDON.
4401.name: kyogre

4402.text: KYOGRE has appeared in mythology as the creator of the sea. After long years of feuding with GROUDON, it took to sleep at the bottom of the sea.
4402.name: kyogre

4403.text: This POKéMON is said to have expanded the sea by bringing heavy rains. It has the power to control water.
4403.name: kyogre

4404.text: A mythical Pokémon said to have swelled the seas with rain and tidal waves. It battled with Groudon.
4404.name: kyogre

4405.text: It is said to have widened the seas by causing downpours. It had been asleep in a marine trench.
4405.name: kyogre

4406.text: Through Primal Reversion and with nature’s full power, it will take back its true form. It can summon storms that cause the sea levels to rise.
4406.name: kyogre

4407.text: Kyogre is said to be the personification of the sea itself. Legends tell of its many clashes against Groudon, as each sought to gain the power of nature.
4407.name: kyogre

4408.text: GROUDON has long been described in  mythology as the POKéMON that raised lands and expanded continents. This POKéMON took to sleep after a cataclysmic battle with KYOGRE.
4408.name: groudon

4409.text: GROUDON has the power to scatter rain clouds and make water evaporate with light and heat. It came as a savior to people who had been suffering from terrible floods.
4409.name: groudon

4410.text: GROUDON has appeared in mythology as the creator of the land. It sleeps in magma underground and is said to make volcanoes erupt on awakening.
4410.name: groudon

4411.text: It had been asleep in underground magma ever since it fiercely fought Kyogre long ago.
4411.name: groudon

4412.text: Said to have expanded the lands by evaporating water with raging heat. It battled titanically with Kyogre.
4412.name: groudon

4413.text: This legendary Pokémon is said to represent the land. It went to sleep after dueling Kyogre.
4413.name: groudon

4414.text: Groudon is said to be the personification of the land itself. Legends tell of its many clashes against Kyogre, as each sought to gain the power of nature.
4414.name: groudon

4415.text: Through Primal Reversion and with nature’s full power, it will take back its true form. It can cause magma to erupt and expand the landmass of the world.
4415.name: groudon

4416.text: RAYQUAZA lived for hundreds of millions of years in the earth’s ozone layer,  never descending to the ground. This POKéMON appears to feed on water and particles in the atmosphere.
4416.name: rayquaza

4417.text: RAYQUAZA is said to have lived for hundreds of millions of years in the earth’s ozone layer, above the clouds. Its existence had been completely unknown because it lived so high in the sky.
4417.name: rayquaza

4418.text: A POKéMON that flies endlessly in the ozone layer. It is said it would descend to the ground if KYOGRE and GROUDON were to fight.
4418.name: rayquaza

4419.text: It has lived for hundreds of millions of years in the ozone layer. Its flying form looks like a meteor.
4419.name: rayquaza

4420.text: It lives in the ozone layer far above the clouds and cannot be seen from the ground.
4420.name: rayquaza

4421.text: It flies in the ozone layer, way up high in the sky. Until recently, no one had ever seen it.
4421.name: rayquaza

4422.text: Rayquaza is said to have lived for hundreds of millions of years. Legends remain of how it put to rest the clash between Kyogre and Groudon.
4422.name: rayquaza

4423.text: It flies forever through the ozone layer, consuming meteoroids for sustenance. The many meteoroids in its body provide the energy it needs to Mega Evolve.
4423.name: rayquaza

4424.text: A legend states that JIRACHI will make true any wish that is written on notes attached to its head when it awakens. If this POKéMON senses danger, it will fight without awakening.
4424.name: jirachi

4425.text: JIRACHI will awaken from its sleep of a thousand years if you sing to it in a voice of purity. It is said to make true any wish that people desire.
4425.name: jirachi

4426.text: JIRACHI is said to make wishes come true. While it sleeps, a tough crystalline shell envelops the body to protect it from enemies.
4426.name: jirachi

4427.text: It is said to make any wish come true. It is awake for only seven days out of a thousand years.
4427.name: jirachi

4428.text: Generations have believed that any wish written on a note on its head will come true when it awakens.
4428.name: jirachi

4429.text: It is said to have the ability to grant any wish for just one week every thousand years.
4429.name: jirachi

4430.text: A legend states that Jirachi will make true any wish that is written on notes attached to its head when it awakens. If this Pokémon senses danger, it will fight without awakening.
4430.name: jirachi

4431.text: Jirachi will awaken from its sleep of a thousand years if you sing to it in a voice of purity. It is said to make true any wish that people desire.
4431.name: jirachi

4432.text: Once every 1,000 years, the singing of a pure voice will rouse this Pokémon from its near- perpetual slumber. It wakes for only seven days.
4432.name: jirachi

4433.text: It’s believed that when this Pokémon wakes from its 1,000-year slumber, it will grant any wishes written on the notes attached to its head.
4433.name: jirachi

4434.text: A POKéMON that mutated from an extraterrestrial virus exposed to a laser beam. Its body is configured for superior agility and speed.
4434.name: deoxys

4435.text: This DEOXYS has transformed into its aggressive guise. It can fool enemies by altering its appearance.
4435.name: deoxys

4436.text: When it changes form, an aurora appears. It absorbs attacks by altering its cellular structure.
4436.name: deoxys

4437.text: An alien virus that fell to earth on a meteor underwent a DNA mutation to become this Pokémon.
4437.name: deoxys

4438.text: DNA from a space virus mutated and became a Pokémon. It appears where auroras are seen.
4438.name: deoxys

4439.text: The DNA of a space virus underwent a sudden mutation upon exposure to a laser beam and resulted in Deoxys. The crystalline organ on this Pokémon’s chest appears to be its brain.
4439.name: deoxys

4440.text: Deoxys emerged from a virus that came from space. It is highly intelligent and wields psychokinetic powers. This Pokémon shoots lasers from the crystalline organ on its chest.
4440.name: deoxys

4441.text: Made from soil, the shell on its back hardens when it drinks water. It lives along lakes.
4441.name: turtwig

4442.text: The shell on its back is made of soil. On a very healthy Turtwig, the shell should feel moist.
4442.name: turtwig

4443.text: Photosynthesis occurs across its body under the sun. The shell on its back is actually hardened soil.
4443.name: turtwig

4444.text: It undertakes photosynthesis with its body, making oxygen. The leaf on its head wilts if it is thirsty.
4444.name: turtwig

4445.text: This Pokémon becomes more energetic the more sunlight there is. The part resembling a shell is similar to silt and is slightly damp and warm to the touch.
4445.name: turtwig

4446.text: The shell is hardened soil. Some Pokémon come to peck the berries growing on the trees on its back.
4446.name: grotle

4447.text: A GROTLE that lives in the forest is said to have its own secret springwater.
4447.name: grotle

4448.text: It lives along water in forests. In the daytime, it leaves the forest to sunbathe its treed shell.
4448.name: grotle

4449.text: It knows where pure water wells up. It carries fellow Pokémon there on its back.
4449.name: grotle

4450.text: Appears where there is clean spring water. The fruit that grows on the shrubs on its shell is sweet, nutritious, and truly delicious.
4450.name: grotle

4451.text: Groups of this Pokémon migrating in search of water have been mistaken for “moving forests.”
4451.name: torterra

4452.text: Some Pokémon are born on a Torterra’s back and spend their entire life there.
4452.name: torterra

4453.text: Ancient people imagined that beneath the ground, a gigantic Torterra dwelled.
4453.name: torterra

4454.text: Small Pokémon occasionally gather on its unmoving back to begin building their nests.
4454.name: torterra

4455.text: This remarkable, large-bodied Pokémon would serve beautifully as borrowed scenery for a garden, and its strength is peerless. Torterra roams the wilderness in search of clean water.
4455.name: torterra

4456.text: It agilely scales sheer cliffs to live atop craggy mountains. Its fire is put out when it sleeps.
4456.name: chimchar

4457.text: It is very agile. Before going to sleep, it extinguishes the flame on its tail to prevent fires.
4457.name: chimchar

4458.text: Its fiery rear end is fueled by gas made in its belly. Even rain can’t extinguish the fire.
4458.name: chimchar

4459.text: The gas made in its belly burns from its rear end. The fire burns weakly when it feels sick.
4459.name: chimchar

4460.text: Full of vigor and always in high spirits. It was once known by the name ”Lantern-Tail” and feared as some kind of apparition.
4460.name: chimchar

4461.text: To intimidate attackers, it stretches the fire on its tail to make itself appear bigger.
4461.name: monferno

4462.text: A bigger fire on its tail and a brighter blue pattern on its face means its rank in its pack is higher.
4462.name: monferno

4463.text: It skillfully controls the intensity of the fire on its tail to keep its foes at an ideal distance.
4463.name: monferno

4464.text: It uses ceilings and walls to launch aerial attacks. Its fiery tail is but one weapon.
4464.name: monferno

4465.text: The deeper the blue on its face, the more powerful it will grow to become. It leaps about every which way and lands powerful blows against its opponents with the flame on its tail.
4465.name: monferno

4466.text: It uses a special kind of martial arts involving all its limbs. Its fire never goes out.
4466.name: infernape

4467.text: It uses unique fighting moves with fire on its hands and feet. It will take on any opponent.
4467.name: infernape

4468.text: Its crown of fire is indicative of its fiery nature. It is beaten by none in terms of quickness.
4468.name: infernape

4469.text: It tosses its enemies around with agility. It uses all its limbs to fight in its own unique style.
4469.name: infernape

4470.text: A tall, hardy Pokémon with a dazzling appearance. It shrouds itself in flame and battles as if engaged in dance—truly a sight to behold.
4470.name: infernape

4471.text: It lives along shores in northern countries. A skilled swimmer, it dives for over 10 minutes to hunt.
4471.name: piplup

4472.text: A poor walker, it often falls down. However, its strong pride makes it puff up its chest without a care.
4472.name: piplup

4473.text: It doesn’t like to be taken care of. It’s difficult to bond with since it won’t listen to its Trainer.
4473.name: piplup

4474.text: Because it is very proud, it hates accepting food from people. Its thick down guards it from cold.
4474.name: piplup

4475.text: Prefers cold climes and appears along coasts. It's an adorable little thing—as cute as any child—but it's also prideful, unwilling to accept handouts from people.
4475.name: piplup

4476.text: Its wings deliver wicked blows that snap even the thickest of trees. It searches for prey in icy seas.
4476.name: prinplup

4477.text: Because every Prinplup considers itself to be the most important, they can never form a group.
4477.name: prinplup

4478.text: It lives alone, away from others. Apparently, every one of them believes it is the most important.
4478.name: prinplup

4479.text: It lives a solitary life. Its wings deliver wicked blows that can snap even the thickest of trees.
4479.name: prinplup

4480.text: It swims gracefully through the frigid sea and sings with a voice like the roaring tide. It has powerful, sturdy wings and dignity to match.
4480.name: prinplup

4481.text: It avoids unnecessary disputes, but it will decimate anything that threatens its pride.
4481.name: empoleon

4482.text: If anyone were to hurt its pride, it would slash them with wings that can cleave through an ice floe.
4482.name: empoleon

4483.text: It swims as fast as a jet boat. The edges of its wings are sharp and can slice apart drifting ice.
4483.name: empoleon

4484.text: The three horns that extend from its beak attest to its power. The leader has the biggest horns.
4484.name: empoleon

4485.text: Since ancient times, it has been revered by the people of Hisui, who call it the Master of the Waves. Its wings are a match for even master-crafted blades.
4485.name: empoleon

4486.text: Usually with a large flock, it is barely noticeable when alone. Its cries are very strident.
4486.name: starly

4487.text: Because they are weak individually, they form groups. However, they bicker if the group grows too big.
4487.name: starly

4488.text: They flock in great numbers. Though small, they flap their wings with great power.
4488.name: starly

4489.text: They flock around mountains and fields, chasing after bug Pokémon. Their singing is noisy and annoying.
4489.name: starly

4490.text: They live in the fields and mountains, gathering in large flocks. Their cries are quite obnoxious. Though small, their wings are strong—a strike from them leaves pain that persists for a week.
4490.name: starly

4491.text: It flies around forests and fields in search of bug Pokémon. It stays within a huge flock.
4491.name: staravia

4492.text: Recognizing their own weakness, they always live in a group. When alone, a STARAVIA cries noisily.
4492.name: staravia

4493.text: Recognizing their own weakness, they always live in a group. When alone, a Staravia cries noisily.
4493.name: staravia

4494.text: They maintain huge flocks, although fierce scuffles break out between various flocks.
4494.name: staravia

4495.text: It lives in forests and fields. Squabbles over territory occur when flocks collide.
4495.name: staravia

4496.text: They form remarkably large flocks and are constantly fighting amongst themselves. I suspect that those with magnificent plumes on their heads are the strong ones.
4496.name: staravia

4497.text: It has a savage nature. It will courageously challenge foes that are much larger.
4497.name: staraptor

4498.text: When STARAVIA evolve into STARAPTOR, they leave the flock to live alone. They have sturdy wings.
4498.name: staraptor

4499.text: It never stops attacking even if it is injured. It fusses over the shape of its comb.
4499.name: staraptor

4500.text: The muscles in its wings and legs are strong. It can easily fly while gripping a small Pokémon.
4500.name: staraptor

4501.text: When Staravia evolve into Staraptor, they leave the flock to live alone. They have sturdy wings.
4501.name: staraptor

4502.text: It has left the flock, having gained strength enough to survive on its own. The astounding force with which Staraptor flies through the air allows it to carry away large, burly targets.
4502.name: staraptor

4503.text: It lives in groups by the water.  It chews up boulders and trees around its nest with its incisors.
4503.name: bidoof

4504.text: A comparison revealed that Bidoof’s front teeth grow at the same rate as Rattata’s.
4504.name: bidoof

4505.text: With nerves of steel, nothing can perturb it. It is more agile and active than it appears.
4505.name: bidoof

4506.text: It constantly gnaws on logs and rocks to whittle down its front teeth. It nests alongside water.
4506.name: bidoof

4507.text: Bidoof has an unsophisticated face and is rarely flustered by anything. There have been incidents involving Bidoof sauntering into villages and gnawing on the houses without a single care.
4507.name: bidoof

4508.text: While its movements out of water are sluggish, it can swim as fast as any FEEBAS.
4508.name: bibarel

4509.text: A river dammed by Bibarel will never overflow its banks, which is appreciated by people nearby.
4509.name: bibarel

4510.text: It busily makes its nest with stacks of branches and roots it has cut up with its sharp incisors.
4510.name: bibarel

4511.text: It makes its nest by damming streams with bark and mud. It is known as an industrious worker.
4511.name: bibarel

4512.text: Bibarel fur repels water and is also a fantastic material for heat retention. These Pokémon create dams on rivers to live in.
4512.name: bibarel

4513.text: It shakes its head back to front, causing its antennae to hit each other and sound like a xylophone.
4513.name: kricketot

4514.text: Its legs are short. Whenever it stumbles, its stiff antennae clack with a xylophone-like sound.
4514.name: kricketot

4515.text: It chats with others using the sounds of its colliding antennae. These sounds are fall hallmarks.
4515.name: kricketot

4516.text: When its antennae hit each other, it sounds like the music of a xylophone.
4516.name: kricketot

4517.text: When the trees take on new hues, more of these Pokémon appear. The tone they create by striking their antennae together resembles that of the marimba, an instrument of foreign lands.
4517.name: kricketot

4518.text: By allowing its cry to resonate in the hollow of its belly, it produces a captivating sound.
4518.name: kricketune

4519.text: There is a village that hosts a contest based on the amazingly variable cries of this Pokémon.
4519.name: kricketune

4520.text: It crosses its knifelike arms in front of its chest when it cries. It can compose melodies ad lib.
4520.name: kricketune

4521.text: It signals its emotions with its melodies. Scientists are studying these melodic patterns.
4521.name: kricketune

4522.text: It uses its cutlass-like arms to produce sound, the melody of which varies from individual to individual. It is a worthwhile endeavor to seek out one's favorite tunes.
4522.name: kricketune

4523.text: Its forelegs have a muscle-based system of generating electricity. Its body shines if endangered.
4523.name: shinx

4524.text: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. Its fur glows when it’s in trouble.
4524.name: shinx

4525.text: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. It glows when in trouble.
4525.name: shinx

4526.text: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.
4526.name: shinx

4527.text: This Pokémon generates electricity by contracting its muscles. Excited trembling is a sign that Shinx is generating a tremendous amount of electricity.
4527.name: shinx

4528.text: Electricity makes this Pokémon’s fur glow. Shinx sends signals to others of its kind by shaking the tip of its tail while the tail tip is shining brightly.
4528.name: shinx

4529.text: Shakes its body to generate electricity. Its stature belies its aggression—one must be patient to tame this Pokémon.
4529.name: shinx

4530.text: It rests its forelegs on others to communicate with rhythmic electric pulses from its claws.
4530.name: luxio

4531.text: By gathering their tails together, they collectively generate powerful electricity from their claws.
4531.name: luxio

4532.text: Its claws loose electricity with enough amperage to cause fainting. They live in small groups.
4532.name: luxio

4533.text: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.
4533.name: luxio

4534.text: By joining its tail with that of another Luxio, this Pokémon can receive some of the other Luxio’s electricity and power up its own electric blasts.
4534.name: luxio

4535.text: Upon encountering an opponent, this Pokémon prepares for battle by extending its claws, which can put out 1,000,000 volts of electricity.
4535.name: luxio

4536.text: Proudly uses its electrified claws as weapons. It seems to be a gracious Pokémon, evenly sharing the spoils of the hunt with others of its kind.
4536.name: luxio

4537.text: It has eyes that can see through anything. It spots and captures prey hiding behind objects.
4537.name: luxray

4538.text: LUXRAY’s ability to see through objects comes in handy when it’s scouting for danger.
4538.name: luxray

4539.text: It can see clearly through walls to track down its prey and seek its lost young.
4539.name: luxray

4540.text: When its eyes gleam gold, it can spot hiding prey—even those taking shelter behind a wall.
4540.name: luxray

4541.text: Luxray’s ability to see through objects comes in handy when it’s scouting for danger.
4541.name: luxray

4542.text: Luxray can see through solid objects. It will instantly spot prey trying to hide behind walls, even if the walls are thick.
4542.name: luxray

4543.text: Seeing through solid objects uses up a lot of Luxray’s electricity, so the Pokémon sleeps for long periods of time to store up energy.
4543.name: luxray

4544.text: They form packs, each having one male as leader. Legends say that when Luxray's two eyes shimmer with gold, the Pokémon can see through anything.
4544.name: luxray

4545.text: It lives alongside clear ponds. It scatters pollen that induces harsh sneezing and runny noses.
4545.name: budew

4546.text: Sensitive to changing temperature, the bud is said to bloom when it feels the sun’s warm touch.
4546.name: budew

4547.text: Sensitive to changing temperatures, the bud blooms when it’s warm, releasing toxic pollen.
4547.name: budew

4548.text: When it feels the sun’s warm touch, it opens its bud to release pollen. It lives alongside clear pools.
4548.name: budew

4549.text: Over the winter, it closes its bud and endures the cold. In spring, the bud opens and releases pollen.
4549.name: budew

4550.text: The pollen it releases contains poison. If this Pokémon is raised on clean water, the poison’s toxicity is increased.
4550.name: budew

4551.text: This Pokémon is highly sensitive to temperature changes. When its bud starts to open, that means spring is right around the corner.
4551.name: budew

4552.text: When the sun's light strengthens, the bud atop this Pokémon's head opens. This is a sign to the people that the harsh winter is over, and the season of budding has begun.
4552.name: budew

4553.text: It attracts prey with a sweet aroma, then downs it with thorny whips hidden in its arms.
4553.name: roserade

4554.text: Its sweet aroma attracts prey. Then it spews poison. The more toxic it is, the sweeter its aroma.
4554.name: roserade

4555.text: Each of its hands contains different toxins, but both hands can jab with near-fatal power.
4555.name: roserade

4556.text: Luring prey with a sweet scent, it uses poison whips on its arms to poison, bind, and finish off the prey.
4556.name: roserade

4557.text: With the movements of a dancer, it strikes with whips that are densely lined with poison thorns.
4557.name: roserade

4558.text: After captivating opponents with its sweet scent, it lashes them with its thorny whips.
4558.name: roserade

4559.text: The poison in its right hand is quick acting. The poison in its left hand is slow acting. Both are life threatening.
4559.name: roserade

4560.text: Hidden within the bouquet on each hand are thorned whips loaded with virulent poison. Roserade moves gracefully as it corners its prey and mercilessly lashes them with its whips.
4560.name: roserade

4561.text: It lived in jungles around 100 million years ago. Its skull is as hard as iron.
4561.name: cranidos

4562.text: CRANIDOS toughen up their already rock-hard heads by headbutting one another.
4562.name: cranidos

4563.text: It was resurrected from an iron ball-like fossil. It downs prey with its headbutts.
4563.name: cranidos

4564.text: A lifelong jungle dweller from 100 million years ago, it would snap obstructing trees with headbutts.
4564.name: cranidos

4565.text: It lived in jungles around a hundred million years ago. It used its skillful headbutts to combat Aerodactyl.
4565.name: cranidos

4566.text: In rock layers where Cranidos fossils are found, the fossilized trunks of trees snapped in two are also often found.
4566.name: cranidos

4567.text: A primeval Pokémon, it possesses a hard and sturdy skull, lacking any intelligence within.
4567.name: cranidos

4568.text: Its hard skull is its distinguishing feature. It snapped trees by headbutting them, and then it fed on their ripe berries.
4568.name: cranidos

4569.text: An incredibly rare sight. They duel each other by ramming their heads together, and the resulting sound echoes throughout the area like the pealing of a bell.
4569.name: cranidos

4570.text: Its powerful head butt has enough power to shatter even the most durable things upon impact.
4570.name: rampardos

4571.text: If two were to smash their heads together, their foot-thick skulls would keep them from fainting.
4571.name: rampardos

4572.text: Its skull withstands impacts of any magnitude. As a result, its brain never gets the chance to grow.
4572.name: rampardos

4573.text: Its skull is as hard as iron. It is a brute that tears down jungle trees while catching prey.
4573.name: rampardos

4574.text: The result of repeated headbutts is a skull grown thick and hard. However, its brain has shrunk in size compared with Cranidos’s.
4574.name: rampardos

4575.text: Records exist of a revived fossil that evolved into Rampardos. It proceeded to escape and then destroy a skyscraper with a headbutt.
4575.name: rampardos

4576.text: In ancient times, people would dig up fossils of this Pokémon and use its skull, which is harder than steel, to make helmets.
4576.name: rampardos

4577.text: This ancient Pokémon used headbutts skillfully. Its brain was really small, so some theories suggest that its stupidity led to its extinction.
4577.name: rampardos

4578.text: Very little is known about its biology. Can knock down massive trees by smashing its beautiful, pearl-like crown against them.
4578.name: rampardos

4579.text: A Pokémon that lived in jungles around 100 million years ago. Its facial hide is extremely hard.
4579.name: shieldon

4580.text: It is outstandingly armored. As a result, it can eat grass and berries without having to fight.
4580.name: shieldon

4581.text: It habitually polishes its face by rubbing it against tree trunks. It is weak to attacks from behind.
4581.name: shieldon

4582.text: It was generated from a fossil dug out of a layer of clay that was older than anyone knows. It has a sturdy face.
4582.name: shieldon

4583.text: Many fossils of this Pokémon have been found, but almost none have shown signs of damage to the face.
4583.name: shieldon

4584.text: This Pokémon lived in primeval jungles. Few enemies would have been willing to square off against its heavily armored face, so it’s thought.
4584.name: shieldon

4585.text: A mild-mannered, herbivorous Pokémon, it used its face to dig up tree roots to eat. The skin on its face was plenty tough.
4585.name: shieldon

4586.text: Although its fossils can be found in layers of primeval rock, nothing but its face has ever been discovered.
4586.name: shieldon

4587.text: Much remains unknown about this Pokémon, as few have ever seen it. However, we know that it is calm and dislikes conflict, and it enjoys polishing its face against trees and rocks.
4587.name: shieldon

4588.text: When attacked, they form a wall with their shieldlike faces to protect their young.
4588.name: bastiodon

4589.text: When attacked, they form a wall. Their rock-hard faces serve to protect them from the attacks.
4589.name: bastiodon

4590.text: When they lined up side by side, no foe could break through. They shielded their young in that way.
4590.name: bastiodon

4591.text: Any frontal attack is repulsed. It is a docile Pokémon that feeds on grass and berries.
4591.name: bastiodon

4592.text: While it can guard against any sort of attack from the front, it is left without recourse when attacked from behind.
4592.name: bastiodon

4593.text: It lived in the same environments as Rampardos. Their fossils have been found together— seemingly from after they’d fought to the finish.
4593.name: bastiodon

4594.text: The bones of its face are huge and hard, so they were mistaken for its spine until after this Pokémon was successfully restored.
4594.name: bastiodon

4595.text: This Pokémon is from roughly 100 million years ago. Its terrifyingly tough face is harder than steel.
4595.name: bastiodon

4596.text: Its face is sturdy—as strong as diamond—and this hardness offers a very stable defense. Much about this species is still unknown, such as its natural habitat.
4596.name: bastiodon

4597.text: It covers itself with a cloak to shelter from the cold. When it’s hot, its cloak is thinner.
4597.name: burmy

4598.text: Even if it is born where there are no cocooning materials, it somehow always ends up with a cloak.
4598.name: burmy

4599.text: To shelter itself from cold, wintry winds, it covers itself with a cloak made of twigs and leaves.
4599.name: burmy

4600.text: If its cloak is broken in battle, it quickly remakes the cloak with materials nearby.
4600.name: burmy

4601.text: If its cloak is even slightly damaged, Burmy will immediately repair it with whatever is close at hand. The Pokémon within the cloak is scrawny and vulnerable to the cold.
4601.name: burmy

4602.text: It is said that a WORMADAM that evolves on a cold day will have a thicker cloak.
4602.name: wormadam

4603.text: When evolving, its body takes in surrounding materials. As a result, there are many body variations.
4603.name: wormadam

4604.text: Its appearance changes depending on where it evolved. The materials on hand become a part of its body.
4604.name: wormadam

4605.text: When Burmy evolved, its cloak became a part of this Pokémon’s body. The cloak is never shed.
4605.name: wormadam

4606.text: It does not keep a nest. It flies over fields and mountains in constant search of floral honey.
4606.name: mothim

4607.text: While it loves floral honey, it won’t gather any itself. Instead, it plots to steal some from Combee.
4607.name: mothim

4608.text: It loves the honey of flowers and steals honey collected by Combee.
4608.name: mothim

4609.text: It flutters around at night and steals honey from the Combee hive.
4609.name: mothim

4610.text: Scatters steel-colored scales as it flaps its wings. Despite being observed feeding primarily on the nectar of flowers, Mothim is not often seen around flower gardens.
4610.name: mothim

4611.text: A Pokémon formed by three others. It busily carries sweet floral honey to VESPIQUEN.
4611.name: combee

4612.text: At night, COMBEE sleep in a group of about a thousand, packed closely together in a lump.
4612.name: combee

4613.text: This Pokémon is a set of three. When they sleep, they gather up and form a giant hive of 100 Combee.
4613.name: combee

4614.text: The trio is together from birth. It constantly gathers honey from flowers to please Vespiquen.
4614.name: combee

4615.text: It collects and delivers honey to its colony. At night, they cluster to form a beehive and sleep.
4615.name: combee

4616.text: The members of the trio spend all their time together. Each one has a slightly different taste in nectar.
4616.name: combee

4617.text: It ceaselessly gathers nectar from sunrise to sundown, all for the sake of Vespiquen and the swarm.
4617.name: combee

4618.text: They swear fealty to a queen Pokémon and work diligently to gather nectar. Each swarm produces a different flavor of honey.
4618.name: combee

4619.text: When endangered, grubs from its six-cell honeycomb strike back. There is only one in a colony.
4619.name: vespiquen

4620.text: It raises grubs in the holes in its body. It secretes pheromones to control COMBEE.
4620.name: vespiquen

4621.text: It releases various pheromones to make the grubs in its body do its bidding while fighting foes.
4621.name: vespiquen

4622.text: It houses its colony in cells in its body and releases various pheromones to make those grubs do its bidding.
4622.name: vespiquen

4623.text: Its abdomen is a honeycomb for grubs. It raises its grubs on honey collected by Combee.
4623.name: vespiquen

4624.text: It skillfully commands its grubs in battles with its enemies. The grubs are willing to risk their lives to defend Vespiquen.
4624.name: vespiquen

4625.text: Vespiquen that give off more pheromones have larger swarms of Combee attendants.
4625.name: vespiquen

4626.text: Commands its subjects to build its hive. It will dispatch any interlopers who dare sneak into its nest and use them as nourishment for itself.
4626.name: vespiquen

4627.text: It makes electricity with pouches in its cheeks and shoots charges from its tail. It lives atop trees.
4627.name: pachirisu

4628.text: It’s one of the kinds of Pokémon  with electric cheek pouches. It shoots charges from its tail.
4628.name: pachirisu

4629.text: It makes fur balls that crackle with static electricity. It stores them with berries in tree holes.
4629.name: pachirisu

4630.text: A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek pouches together in an effort to share stored electricity.
4630.name: pachirisu

4631.text: A species related to the Pikachu line. Though Pachirisu is a calm Pokémon, it still presents a danger should one touch its electrified tail or cheeks.
4631.name: pachirisu

4632.text: It has a flotation sac that is like an inflatable collar. It floats on water with its head out.
4632.name: buizel

4633.text: It inflates its flotation sac, keeping its face above water in order to watch for prey movement.
4633.name: buizel

4634.text: It spins its two tails like a screw to propel itself through water. The tails also slice clinging seaweed.
4634.name: buizel

4635.text: It swims by rotating its two tails like a screw. When it dives, its flotation sac collapses.
4635.name: buizel

4636.text: It inflates the flotation sac around its neck and pokes its head out of the water to see what is going on.
4636.name: buizel

4637.text: It moves freely in the water by spinning its forked tail for propulsion. The resemblance to the screw of a steamboat is coincidental.
4637.name: buizel

4638.text: With its flotation sac inflated, it can carry people on its back. It deflates the sac before it dives.
4638.name: floatzel

4639.text: It is a common sight around fishing ports. It is known to rescue people and carry off prey.
4639.name: floatzel

4640.text: It floats using its well-developed flotation sac. It assists in the rescues of drowning people.
4640.name: floatzel

4641.text: Its flotation sac developed as a result of pursuing aquatic prey. It can double as a rubber raft.
4641.name: floatzel

4642.text: Has a long, rather splendid flotation sac, which prevents Floatzel from drowning even in stormy seas. One might glimpse this species around fishing hamlets from time to time.
4642.name: floatzel

4643.text: The small ball holds the nutrients needed for evolution. Apparently, it is very sweet and tasty.
4643.name: cherubi

4644.text: The small ball is not only filled with nutrients, it is also tasty. Starly try to peck it off.
4644.name: cherubi

4645.text: Sunlight colors it red. When the small ball is drained of nutrients, it shrivels to herald evolution.
4645.name: cherubi

4646.text: It evolves by sucking the energy out of the small ball where it had been storing nutrients.
4646.name: cherubi

4647.text: It nimbly dashes about to avoid getting pecked by bird Pokémon that would love to make off with its small, nutrient-rich storage ball.
4647.name: cherubi

4648.text: The deeper a Cherubi’s red, the more nutrients it has stockpiled in its body. And the sweeter and tastier its small ball!
4648.name: cherubi

4649.text: Once the fruit growing alongside the main body is large and plump, Cherubi will use the nutrients within to evolve. The fruit then detaches, becoming nourishment for other creatures.
4649.name: cherubi

4650.text: It blooms during times of strong sunlight. It tries to make up for everything it endured as a bud.
4650.name: cherrim

4651.text: It is docile as a bud, but turns cheerful when it blooms. It folds back into a bud if sunlight wanes.
4651.name: cherrim

4652.text: During times of strong sunlight, its bud blooms, its petals open fully, and it becomes very active.
4652.name: cherrim

4653.text: If it senses strong sunlight, it opens its folded petals to absorb the sun’s rays with its whole body.
4653.name: cherrim

4654.text: As a bud, it barely moves. It sits still, placidly waiting for sunlight to appear.
4654.name: cherrim

4655.text: Its folded petals are pretty tough. Bird Pokémon can peck at them all they want, and Cherrim won’t be bothered at all.
4655.name: cherrim

4656.text: Motionless, save for the occasional quiver. A rich array of Pokémon can be found gathered around it, drawn by the scent exuded from Cherrim's folded petals.
4656.name: cherrim

4657.text: Its colors and shapes differ from region to region. In the Sinnoh region, two types are confirmed.
4657.name: shellos

4658.text: It lives along bodies of water. Its body shape has changed to suit its habitat.
4658.name: shellos

4659.text: Beware of pushing strongly on its squishy body, as it makes a mysterious purple fluid ooze out.
4659.name: shellos

4660.text: Its shape and coloration vary, depending on its habitat.
4660.name: shellos

4661.text: For the most part, it makes its home along the seashore. Its color and form differ according to its habitat and the quality of its food.
4661.name: shellos

4662.text: Purple mucus sticks to the hands of anyone who touches it. Take care, as the substance is troublesome to wash off.
4662.name: shellos

4663.text: While they normally live in the sea, they can function on land, too, until their skin dries out.
4663.name: shellos

4664.text: When it senses danger, a purple liquid oozes out of it. The liquid is thought to be something like greasy sweat.
4664.name: shellos

4665.text: This Pokémon’s habitat shapes its physique. According to some theories, life in warm ocean waters causes this variation to develop.
4665.name: shellos

4666.text: Subjecting this Pokémon to a strong force causes it to secrete a strange purple fluid. Though harmless, the fluid is awfully sticky.
4666.name: shellos

4667.text: Found in abundance on seashores bordering warm waters. Shellos are unexpectedly friendly and will crawl toward any person they see. Take care not to get coated in mucus!
4667.name: shellos

4668.text: It has a pliable body without any bones. If any part of its body is torn off, it grows right back.
4668.name: gastrodon

4669.text: Long ago, its entire back was shielded with a sturdy shell. There are traces of it left in its cells.
4669.name: gastrodon

4670.text: When its natural enemy attacks, it oozes purple fluid and escapes.
4670.name: gastrodon

4671.text: It apparently had a huge shell for protection in ancient times. It lives in shallow tidal pools.
4671.name: gastrodon

4672.text: It has strong regenerative capabilities. Even if parts of it are bitten off by fish Pokémon, it will return to normal within a few hours.
4672.name: gastrodon

4673.text: Plankton, invisible to the naked eye, is its main food source. It comes onto the land periodically, but the reason for this is not known.
4673.name: gastrodon

4674.text: Long ago, it had a shell on its back. There’s now a vestigial plate on its back that’s hard but thin.
4674.name: gastrodon

4675.text: Their shape and color change, depending on their environment and diet. There are many of them at beaches where the waves are calm.
4675.name: gastrodon

4676.text: Its search for food sometimes leads it onto land, where it leaves behind a sticky trail of slime as it passes through.
4676.name: gastrodon
