4677.text: The softness of its body helps disperse the force of impacts, so although its body is uncommonly squishy, it’s also surprisingly resilient.
4677.name: gastrodon

4678.text: Eats beach sand for nourishment. Should one Gastrodon encounter another of a different color, a fierce battle will inevitably ensue.
4678.name: gastrodon

4679.text: They live on large trees. They are said to communicate by connecting their tails to those of others.
4679.name: ambipom

4680.text: It is very difficult to dodge the consecutive strikes of its two tails.
4680.name: ambipom

4681.text: Split into two, the tails are so adept at handling and doing things, Ambipom rarely uses its hands.
4681.name: ambipom

4682.text: They work in large colonies and make rings by linking their tails, apparently in friendship.
4682.name: ambipom

4683.text: To eat, it deftly shucks nuts with its two tails. It rarely uses its arms now.
4683.name: ambipom

4684.text: In their search for comfortable trees, they get into territorial disputes with groups of Passimian. They win about half the time.
4684.name: ambipom

4685.text: It uses its tails for everything. If it wraps both of its tails around you and gives you a squeeze, that’s proof it really likes you.
4685.name: ambipom

4686.text: To affirm their kinship, members of this species will form a ring by linking their newly doubled tails together. On rare occasions, humans have been accepted into such rings.
4686.name: ambipom

4687.text: It tugs on the hands of children to steal them away. However, it gets pulled around instead.
4687.name: drifloon

4688.text: It is whispered that any child who mistakes DRIFLOON for a balloon and holds on to it could wind up missing.
4688.name: drifloon

4689.text: Because of the way it floats aimlessly, an old folktale calls it a “Signpost for Wandering Spirits.”
4689.name: drifloon

4690.text: A Pokémon formed by the spirits of people and Pokémon. It loves damp, humid seasons.
4690.name: drifloon

4691.text: These Pokémon are called the “Signpost for Wandering Spirits.” Children holding them sometimes vanish.
4691.name: drifloon

4692.text: Stories go that it grabs the hands of small children and drags them away to the afterlife. It dislikes heavy children.
4692.name: drifloon

4693.text: If for some reason its body bursts, its soul spills out with a screaming sound.
4693.name: drifloon

4694.text: Its round body is stuffed with souls and expands each time it leads someone away.
4694.name: drifloon

4695.text: Wandering souls gathered together to form this Pokémon. When trying to make friends with children, Drifloon grabs them by the hand.
4695.name: drifloon

4696.text: Perhaps seeking company, it approaches children. However, it often quickly runs away again when the children play too roughly with it.
4696.name: drifloon

4697.text: The gathering of many souls gave rise to this Pokémon. During humid seasons, they seem to appear in abundance.
4697.name: drifloon

4698.text: Said to lure away young children and carry them off to the afterlife. Some whisper that Drifloon are formed of reincarnated human souls, but these rumors are as yet unconfirmed.
4698.name: drifloon

4699.text: It can generate and release gas within its body. That’s how it can control the altitude of its drift.
4699.name: drifblim

4700.text: At dusk, swarms of them are carried aloft on winds. When noticed, they suddenly vanish.
4700.name: drifblim

4701.text: They carry people and Pokémon, but the wind can catch them, so there can’t be a fixed destination.
4701.name: drifblim

4702.text: It carries people and Pokémon when it flies. But since it only drifts, it can end up anywhere.
4702.name: drifblim

4703.text: It’s drowsy in daytime, but flies off in the evening in big groups. No one knows where they go.
4703.name: drifblim

4704.text: There was once an incident in which a man took a trip riding a Drifblim, only to go missing.
4704.name: drifblim

4705.text: Even while under careful observation, large flocks of Drifblim flying at dusk will inexplicably disappear from view.
4705.name: drifblim

4706.text: There’s a rumor that if you catch a Drifblim floating on the wind at dusk, you’ll be carried away to the afterlife.
4706.name: drifblim

4707.text: The raw material for the gas inside its body is souls. When its body starts to deflate, it’s thought to carry away people and Pokémon.
4707.name: drifblim

4708.text: Some say this Pokémon is a collection of souls burdened with regrets, silently drifting through the dusk.
4708.name: drifblim

4709.text: It grabs people and Pokémon and carries them off somewhere. Where do they go? Nobody knows.
4709.name: drifblim

4710.text: It drifts along at dusk, perfectly silent. Its transient, melancholy aspect touches some people deeply—every so often, one will come upon a song or poem devoted to Drifblim.
4710.name: drifblim

4711.text: It slams foes by sharply uncoiling its rolled ears. It stings enough to make a grown-up cry in pain.
4711.name: buneary

4712.text: You can tell how it feels by the way it rolls its ears. When it’s scared, both ears are rolled up.
4712.name: buneary

4713.text: By extending its rolled-up ears and striking the ground, it can bound so high it surprises itself.
4713.name: buneary

4714.text: Its ears are always rolled up. They can be forcefully extended to shatter even a large boulder.
4714.name: buneary

4715.text: When it senses danger, it perks up its ears. On cold nights, it sleeps with its head tucked into its fur.
4715.name: buneary

4716.text: Its arms and legs are weak, but when it rolls its ears up tight and then unleashes them with its full force, it can smash boulders to dust.
4716.name: buneary

4717.text: The reason it keeps one ear rolled up is so it can launch a swift counterattack if it’s attacked by an enemy.
4717.name: buneary

4718.text: If both of Buneary’s ears are rolled up, something is wrong with its body or mind. It’s a sure sign the Pokémon is in need of care.
4718.name: buneary

4719.text: Buneary can attack by rolling up their ears and then striking with the force created by unrolling them. This attack becomes stronger with training.
4719.name: buneary

4720.text: My hypothesis as to why Buneary rolls up its ears is that its hearing is far too keen. I surmise that the Pokémon protects its hearing by limiting the sound that may enter its ears.
4720.name: buneary

4721.text: An extremely cautious Pokémon. It cloaks its body with its fluffy ear fur when it senses danger.
4721.name: lopunny

4722.text: It is very conscious of its looks and never fails to groom its ears. It runs with sprightly jumps.
4722.name: lopunny

4723.text: It sheds its fur twice a year. Its winter fur is soft and fluffy.
4723.name: lopunny

4724.text: Extremely cautious, it quickly bounds off when it senses danger.
4724.name: lopunny

4725.text: The ears appear to be delicate. If they are touched roughly, it kicks with its graceful legs.
4725.name: lopunny

4726.text: Lopunny regrows its coat twice a year. Mufflers and hats made from its fur are really warm.
4726.name: lopunny

4727.text: It’s notably wary and has a dislike of fighting, but at the same time, it can deliver powerful kicks with its lithe legs.
4727.name: lopunny

4728.text: Lopunny is constantly monitoring its surroundings. If danger approaches, this Pokémon responds with superdestructive kicks.
4728.name: lopunny

4729.text: Once hot seasons are over, Lopunny’s coat will be replaced with fur that holds a lot of insulating air in preparation for colder weather.
4729.name: lopunny

4730.text: Its fur is warm and yet remarkably light. This Pokémon kicks as though it were a master of karate, driving back its opponents with ease.
4730.name: lopunny

4731.text: Its cries sound like incantations. Those hearing it are tormented by headaches and hallucinations.
4731.name: mismagius

4732.text: Its cry sounds like an incantation. It is said the cry may rarely be imbued with happiness-giving power.
4732.name: mismagius

4733.text: It chants incantations. While they usually torment targets, some chants bring happiness.
4733.name: mismagius

4734.text: Its cries sound like incantations to torment the foe. It appears where you least expect it.
4734.name: mismagius

4735.text: It appears as if from nowhere—muttering incantations, placing curses, and giving people terrifying visions.
4735.name: mismagius

4736.text: Mismagius have been known to cast spells to make people fall in love, so some people search for this Pokémon as if their life depended on it.
4736.name: mismagius

4737.text: Feared for its wrath and the curses it spreads, this Pokémon will also, on a whim, cast spells that help people.
4737.name: mismagius

4738.text: Its muttered curses can cause awful headaches or terrifying visions that torment others.
4738.name: mismagius

4739.text: The incantations Mismagius chants can ward against misfortune, so a custom exists of inviting it into one's home. Incur the Pokémon's displeasure, however, and disaster will surely ensue.
4739.name: mismagius

4740.text: It makes its MURKROW cronies bring it food. It idles its time away, grooming itself in its nest.
4740.name: honchkrow

4741.text: It is merciless by nature. It is said that it never forgives the mistakes of its MURKROW followers.
4741.name: honchkrow

4742.text: If one utters a deep cry, many Murkrow gather quickly. For this, it is called “Summoner of Night.”
4742.name: honchkrow

4743.text: Becoming active at night, it is known to swarm with numerous Murkrow in tow.
4743.name: honchkrow

4744.text: A single cry from this nocturnal Pokémon, and more than a hundred of its Murkrow cronies will assemble.
4744.name: honchkrow

4745.text: If its Murkrow cronies fail to catch food for it, or if it feels they have betrayed it, it will hunt them down wherever they are and punish them.
4745.name: honchkrow

4746.text: It will absolutely not forgive failure from or betrayal by its goons. It has no choice in this if it wants to maintain the order of the flock.
4746.name: honchkrow

4747.text: Its goons take care of most of the fighting for it. The only time it dirties its own hands is in delivering a final blow to finish off an opponent.
4747.name: honchkrow

4748.text: One cry from this Pokémon, and a murder of Murkrow come flying. At such times, one would think the curtain of night had fallen, plunging the world into jet-black darkness.
4748.name: honchkrow

4749.text: With its sharp glare, it puts foes in a mild hypnotic state. It is a very fickle Pokémon.
4749.name: glameow

4750.text: It hides its spiteful tendency of hooking its claws into the nose of its Trainer if it isn’t fed.
4750.name: glameow

4751.text: It claws if displeased and purrs when affectionate. Its fickleness is very popular among some.
4751.name: glameow

4752.text: When it’s happy, Glameow demonstrates beautiful movements of its tail, like a dancing ribbon.
4752.name: glameow

4753.text: Bewitches humans with its helical tail and piercing gaze. Its hidden claws are quite sharp as well, making this Pokémon an exceedingly tricky opponent if antagonized.
4753.name: glameow

4754.text: It is a brazen brute that barges its way into another Pokémon’s nest and claims it as its own.
4754.name: purugly

4755.text: It binds its body with its tails to make itself look bigger. If it locks eyes, it will glare ceaselessly.
4755.name: purugly

4756.text: It would claim another Pokémon’s nest as its own if it finds a nest sufficiently comfortable.
4756.name: purugly

4757.text: To make itself appear intimidatingly beefy, it tightly cinches its waist with its twin tails.
4757.name: purugly

4758.text: Though impudent and difficult to tame, Purugly enjoys great popularity due to its fur, the beauty of which surpasses even velveteen.
4758.name: purugly

4759.text: It emits cries by agitating an orb at the back of its throat. It moves with flouncing hops.
4759.name: chingling

4760.text: It emits high-frequency cries that  people can’t hear. Once it starts, it can cry for an awfully long time.
4760.name: chingling

4761.text: Each time it hops, it makes a ringing sound. It deafens foes by emitting high-frequency cries.
4761.name: chingling

4762.text: There is an orb inside its mouth. When it hops, the orb bounces all over and makes a ringing sound.
4762.name: chingling

4763.text: This Pokémon gave me an excruciating headache when it seemingly cried out without making a sound. Perhaps there are some sounds that the human ear is simply incapable of hearing.
4763.name: chingling

4764.text: It sprays a nose-curling, stinky fluid from its rear to repel attackers.
4764.name: stunky

4765.text: The foul fluid from its rear is so revolting that it can make people feel queasy up to a mile and a quarter away.
4765.name: stunky

4766.text: It sprays a foul fluid from its rear. Its stench spreads over a mile radius, driving Pokémon away.
4766.name: stunky

4767.text: It protects itself by spraying a noxious fluid from its rear. The stench lingers for 24 hours.
4767.name: stunky

4768.text: From its rear, it sprays a foul-smelling liquid at opponents. It aims for their faces, and it can hit them from over 16 feet away.
4768.name: stunky

4769.text: If it lifts its tail and points its rear at you, beware. It’s about to spray you with a fluid stinky enough to make you faint.
4769.name: stunky

4770.text: The poison that gushes from its aft end is accompanied by an utterly evil-smelling odor with such potency that one whiff can induce memory loss.
4770.name: stunky

4771.text: It attacks by spraying a repugnant fluid from its tail, but the stench dulls after a few squirts.
4771.name: skuntank

4772.text: It attacks by spraying a horribly smelly fluid from the tip of its tail. Attacks from above confound it.
4772.name: skuntank

4773.text: It sprays a vile-smelling fluid from the tip of its tail to attack. Its range is over 160 feet.
4773.name: skuntank

4774.text: It sprays a stinky fluid from its tail. The fluid smells worse the longer it is allowed to fester.
4774.name: skuntank

4775.text: In its belly, it reserves stinky fluid that it shoots from its tail during battle. As this Pokémon’s diet varies, so does the stench of its fluid.
4775.name: skuntank

4776.text: It digs holes in the ground to make its nest. The stench of the fluid it lets fly from the tip of its tail is extremely potent.
4776.name: skuntank

4777.text: Sprays a poisonous fluid to take down prey. Sometimes, unable to stomach the stench of its own fluid, it leaves the bested prey uneaten.
4777.name: skuntank

4778.text: X-ray photos were taken to check its body structure. Nothing appeared, however.
4778.name: bronzor

4779.text: There are researchers who believe this Pokémon reflected like a mirror in the distant past.
4779.name: bronzor

4780.text: They are found in ancient tombs. The patterns on their backs are said to be imbued with mysterious power.
4780.name: bronzor

4781.text: Ancient people believed that the pattern on Bronzor’s back contained a mysterious power.
4781.name: bronzor

4782.text: Implements shaped like it were discovered in ancient tombs. It is unknown if they are related.
4782.name: bronzor

4783.text: It appears in ancient ruins. The pattern on its body doesn’t come from any culture in the Galar region, so it remains shrouded in mystery.
4783.name: bronzor

4784.text: Polishing Bronzor to a shine makes its surface reflect the truth, according to common lore. Be that as it may, Bronzor hates being polished.
4784.name: bronzor

4785.text: Floats using a mysterious energy. The pattern engraved upon its back is held as sacred and can sometimes be found in imagery from ancient cemeteries and other such timeworn places.
4785.name: bronzor

4786.text: One caused a news sensation when it was dug up at a construction site after a 2,000-year sleep.
4786.name: bronzong

4787.text: It can summon rain clouds. People long ago revered it as the bringer of plentiful harvests.
4787.name: bronzong

4788.text: It brought rains by opening portals to another world. It was revered as a bringer of plentiful harvests.
4788.name: bronzong

4789.text: In ages past, this Pokémon was revered as a bringer of rain. It was found buried in the ground.
4789.name: bronzong

4790.text: Ancient people believed that petitioning Bronzong for rain was the way to make crops grow.
4790.name: bronzong

4791.text: Some believe it to be a deity that summons rain clouds. When angered, it lets out a warning cry that rings out like the tolling of a bell.
4791.name: bronzong

4792.text: Many scientists suspect that this Pokémon originated outside the Galar region, based on the patterns on its body.
4792.name: bronzong

4793.text: Some believe that its bell-like cry opens holes to another world. It has been revered as a deity since ancient times.
4793.name: bronzong

4794.text: It looks as if it is always crying. It is actually adjusting its body’s fluid levels by eliminating excess.
4794.name: bonsly

4795.text: In order to adjust the level of fluids in its body, it exudes water from its eyes. This makes it appear to be crying.
4795.name: bonsly

4796.text: It prefers arid environments. It leaks water from its eyes to adjust its body’s fluid levels.
4796.name: bonsly

4797.text: It prefers an arid atmosphere. It leaks water that looks like tears when adjusting its moisture level.
4797.name: bonsly

4798.text: It does not deal well with water, so it lives in dry locales. Since its surroundings tend to lack greenery, it stands out noticeably.
4798.name: bonsly

4799.text: From its eyes, it can expel excess moisture from its body. This liquid is similar in composition to human sweat.
4799.name: bonsly

4800.text: It discharges moisture from its eyes, making it look like it’s crying—apparently an effective way of getting enemies to let down their guard.
4800.name: bonsly

4801.text: If its body gets too damp, it will die. So, in a process reminiscent of sweating, its eyes expel moisture.
4801.name: bonsly

4802.text: It expels both sweat and tears from its eyes. The sweat is a little salty, while the tears have a slight bitterness.
4802.name: bonsly

4803.text: This Pokémon lives in dry, rocky areas. As its green spheres dry out, their dull luster increases.
4803.name: bonsly

4804.text: Its tears elicit sympathy from those who see them, but do not be deceived! This expulsion of body water is merely a physiological mechanism for keeping itself in good health.
4804.name: bonsly

4805.text: It likes places where people gather. It mimics foes to confuse them, then makes its getaway.
4805.name: mime-jr

4806.text: It mimics the expressions and motions of those it sees to understand the feelings of others.
4806.name: mime-jr

4807.text: In an attempt to confuse its enemy, it mimics the enemy’s movements. Then it wastes no time in making itself scarce!
4807.name: mime-jr

4808.text: It habitually mimics foes. Once mimicked, the foe cannot take its eyes off this Pokémon.
4808.name: mime-jr

4809.text: It does its absolute best to mimic the movements and expressions of its opponents, but it’s still not very good at it.
4809.name: mime-jr

4810.text: When this gifted mimic surprises an opponent, Mime Jr. feels so happy that it ends up forgetting it was imitating something.
4810.name: mime-jr

4811.text: It mimics everyone it sees, but it puts extra effort into copying the graceful dance steps of Mr. Rime as practice.
4811.name: mime-jr

4812.text: It looks for a Mr. Rime that’s a good dancer and carefully copies the Mr. Rime’s steps like an apprentice.
4812.name: mime-jr

4813.text: Known to turn up in bustling marketplaces now and again. It mimics people much as a child would, then watches how they react, eyes sparkling.
4813.name: mime-jr

4814.text: It loves round white things. It carries an egg-shaped rock in imitation of CHANSEY.
4814.name: happiny

4815.text: It likes to carry around a small rock. It may wander around others’ feet and cause them to stumble.
4815.name: happiny

4816.text: It carries a round, egg-shaped rock in its belly pouch and gives the rock to its friends.
4816.name: happiny

4817.text: It carefully carries a round, white rock that it thinks is an egg. It’s bothered by how curly its hair looks.
4817.name: happiny

4818.text: It carries a round white rock in its belly pouch. If it gets along well with someone, it will sometimes give that person the rock.
4818.name: happiny

4819.text: It’s too small to lay eggs yet. As a surrogate, it searches out round white stones.
4819.name: happiny

4820.text: Usually it’s a well-behaved Pokémon, but if you take its round rock away, it will cry and fuss and throw a big old tantrum.
4820.name: happiny

4821.text: When it sees something round and white, Happiny puts it into the pouch on its stomach. It sometimes becomes overloaded and can’t move.
4821.name: happiny

4822.text: Mimicking Chansey, Happiny will place an egg- shaped stone in its belly pouch. Happiny will treasure this stone.
4822.name: happiny

4823.text: Happiny’s willing to lend its precious round stone to those it’s friendly with, but if the stone isn’t returned, Happiny will cry and throw a tantrum.
4823.name: happiny

4824.text: In imitation of Chansey, it keeps a round stone tucked into its belly pouch and cherishes it dearly. It gets along well with children and will sometimes play house with them for fun.
4824.name: happiny

4825.text: It keeps rhythm by flicking its tail feathers like a metronome. It imitates human speech.
4825.name: chatot

4826.text: Its tongue is just like a human’s. As a result, it can cleverly mimic human speech.
4826.name: chatot

4827.text: It mimics the cries of other Pokémon to trick them into thinking it’s one of them. This way they won’t attack it.
4827.name: chatot

4828.text: It can learn and speak human words. If they gather, they all learn the same saying.
4828.name: chatot

4829.text: A versatile performer skilled in the imitation of human speech. It is said that older, more experienced Chatot can even understand the meaning of the words they mimic.
4829.name: chatot

4830.text: It was formed by uniting 108 spirits. It has been bound to the Odd Keystone to keep it from doing any mischief.
4830.name: spiritomb

4831.text: Its constant mischief and misdeeds resulted in it being bound to an Odd Keystone by a mysterious spell.
4831.name: spiritomb

4832.text: A Pokémon that was formed by 108 spirits. It is bound to a fissure in an odd keystone.
4832.name: spiritomb

4833.text: It was bound to a fissure in an odd keystone as punishment for misdeeds 500 years ago.
4833.name: spiritomb

4834.text: Exactly 108 spirits gathered to become this Pokémon. Apparently there are some ill-natured spirits in the mix.
4834.name: spiritomb

4835.text: All Spiritomb’s mischief and misdeeds compelled a traveler to use a mysterious spell to bind Spiritomb to an odd keystone.
4835.name: spiritomb

4836.text: It lays curses by thinking wicked thoughts. Writings tell that this Pokémon was born out of the assembly of five score and eight malevolent spirits.
4836.name: spiritomb

4837.text: It once lived in the tropics. To avoid the cold, it lives in caves warmed by geothermal heat.
4837.name: gible

4838.text: It attacks using its huge mouth. While its attacks are powerful, it hurts itself out of clumsiness, too.
4838.name: gible

4839.text: It nests in horizontal holes warmed by geothermal heat. Foes who get too close can expect to be pounced on and bitten.
4839.name: gible

4840.text: It nests in small, horizontal holes in cave walls. It pounces to catch prey that stray too close.
4840.name: gible

4841.text: It lives in caves warmed by geothermal heat. Even so, when the weather gets cold, it will huddle close with others of its kind.
4841.name: gible

4842.text: It skulks in caves, and when prey or an enemy passes by, it leaps out and chomps them. The force of its attack sometimes chips its teeth.
4842.name: gible

4843.text: It reacts to anything that moves—flies right at it and bites it. Sometimes it injures itself, but it doesn’t care too much.
4843.name: gible

4844.text: Its original home is an area much hotter than Alola. If you’re planning to live with one, your heating bill will soar.
4844.name: gible

4845.text: Gible prefers to stay in narrow holes in the sides of caves heated by geothermal energy. This way, Gible can stay warm even during a blizzard.
4845.name: gible

4846.text: Gible attacks anything that moves, and it drags whatever it catches into the crevice that is its lair. Despite the big mouth, Gible’s stomach is small.
4846.name: gible

4847.text: It nests in caves untouched by sunlight. Its sharp teeth may fall out when worn away or after an impact, but they regrow within a few days.
4847.name: gible

4848.text: There is a long-held belief that medicine made from its scales will heal even incurable illnesses.
4848.name: gabite

4849.text: It habitually digs up and hoards gems in its nest. Its loot is constantly targeted by thieves.
4849.name: gabite

4850.text: It loves sparkly things. It seeks treasures in caves and hoards the loot in its nest.
4850.name: gabite

4851.text: As it digs to expand its nest, it habitually digs up gems that it then hoards in its nest.
4851.name: gabite

4852.text: In rare cases, it molts and sheds its scales. Medicine containing its scales as an ingredient will make a weary body feel invigorated.
4852.name: gabite

4853.text: Shiny objects are its passion. It can be found in its cave, scarcely moving, its gaze fixed on the jewels it’s amassed or Carbink it has caught.
4853.name: gabite

4854.text: It loves shiny things. When it finds a Sableye trying to catch a Carbink, Gabite becomes furiously angry and attacks the Sableye.
4854.name: gabite

4855.text: It sheds its skin and gradually grows larger. Its scales can be ground into a powder and used as raw materials for traditional medicine.
4855.name: gabite

4856.text: This Pokémon emits ultrasonic waves from a protrusion on either side of its head to probe pitch-dark caves.
4856.name: gabite

4857.text: Jewels are buried in the caves these Pokémon nest in, but you’ll be torn apart by claws and fangs the moment you enter one of these caves.
4857.name: gabite

4858.text: Though Gabite are usually of a violent disposition, when I gave one a glass bead it had been eyeing covetously, it suddenly became quite docile.
4858.name: gabite

4859.text: Its body is covered in fine scales that reduce drag, enabling it to fly at high speeds.
4859.name: garchomp

4860.text: It is said that when one runs at high speed, its wings create blades of wind that can fell nearby trees.
4860.name: garchomp

4861.text: When it folds up its body and extends its wings, it looks like a jet plane. It flies at sonic speed.
4861.name: garchomp

4862.text: It flies at speeds equal to a jet fighter plane. It never allows its prey to escape.
4862.name: garchomp

4863.text: It can fly at speeds rivaling jet planes. It dives into flocks of bird Pokémon and gulps the entire flock down whole.
4863.name: garchomp

4864.text: The protuberances on its head serve as sensors. It can even detect distant prey.
4864.name: garchomp

4865.text: It flies at the speed of sound while searching for prey, and it has midair battles with Salamence as the two compete for food.
4865.name: garchomp

4866.text: Its fine scales don’t just reduce wind resistance—their sharp edges also cause injury to any opponent who attacks it.
4866.name: garchomp

4867.text: Garchomp makes its home in volcanic mountains. It flies through the sky as fast as a jet airplane, hunting down as much prey as it can.
4867.name: garchomp

4868.text: Garchomp is fast both underground and above. It can bring down prey and return to its den before its body has chilled from being outside.
4868.name: garchomp

4869.text: Soars across the heavens at blinding speed—a magnificent sight! It has a feral disposition. Utmost caution is required if one meets a Garchomp out in the wilds.
4869.name: garchomp

4870.text: It wolfs down its weight in food once a day, swallowing food whole with almost no chewing.
4870.name: munchlax

4871.text: In its desperation to gulp down food, it forgets about the food it has hidden under its fur.
4871.name: munchlax

4872.text: It hides food under its long body hair. However, it forgets it has hidden the food.
4872.name: munchlax

4873.text: It conceals food under the long fur on its body. It carts around this food stash and swallows it without chewing.
4873.name: munchlax

4874.text: It needs to consume its own weight in food every day. As far as flavor is concerned, it’s indifferent.
4874.name: munchlax

4875.text: When it finds something that looks like it might be edible, it goes right ahead and swallows it whole. That’s why it gets fatter day by day.
4875.name: munchlax

4876.text: It hides food under its long fur, but it sometimes forgets about it and causes a stinky disturbance.
4876.name: munchlax

4877.text: Anything that looks edible, Munchlax will go on and swallow whole. Its stomach is tough enough to handle it even if the food has gone rotten.
4877.name: munchlax

4878.text: Stuffing itself with vast amounts of food is its only concern. Whether the food is rotten or fresh, yummy or tasteless—it does not care.
4878.name: munchlax

4879.text: It stores food beneath its fur. It might share just one bite, but only if it really trusts you.
4879.name: munchlax

4880.text: Its robust stomach allows it to nonchalantly devour even rotted matter. It pays frequent visits to villages, seeking out food scraps intended for compost.
4880.name: munchlax

4881.text: Its body is lithe yet powerful. It can crest three mountains and cross two canyons in one night.
4881.name: riolu

4882.text: They communicate with one another using their auras. They are able to run all through the night.
4882.name: riolu

4883.text: It has the peculiar power of being able to see emotions such as joy and rage in the form of waves.
4883.name: riolu

4884.text: It uses the shapes of auras, which change according to emotion, to communicate with others.
4884.name: riolu

4885.text: The aura that emanates from its body intensifies to alert others if it is afraid or sad.
4885.name: riolu

4886.text: It can discern the physical and emotional states of people, Pokémon, and other natural things from the shape of their aura waves.
4886.name: riolu

4887.text: It’s tough enough to run right through the night, and it’s also a hard worker, but it’s still just a youngster.
4887.name: riolu

4888.text: It knows how people and Pokémon feel by looking at their auras. It doesn’t approach dangerous opponents.
4888.name: riolu

4889.text: It uses waves called auras to communicate with others of its kind. It doesn’t make any noise during this time, so its enemies can’t detect it.
4889.name: riolu

4890.text: It’s exceedingly energetic, with enough stamina to keep running all through the night. Taking it for walks can be a challenging experience.
4890.name: riolu

4891.text: It can use waves called auras to gauge how others are feeling. These same waves can also tell this Pokémon about the state of the environment.
4891.name: riolu

4892.text: Though infantile in appearance, it has the mysterious ability to read the minds of humans. The pure of heart are met with Riolu's approval, while those of ill nature earn only its loathing.
4892.name: riolu

4893.text: It has the ability to sense the auras of all things. It understands human speech.
4893.name: lucario

4894.text: It’s said that no foe can remain invisible to LUCARIO, since it can detect auras. Even foes it could not otherwise see.
4894.name: lucario

4895.text: A well-trained one can sense auras to identify and take in the feelings of creatures over half a mile away.
4895.name: lucario

4896.text: By catching the aura emanating from others, it can read their thoughts and movements.
4896.name: lucario

4897.text: By reading the auras of all things, it can tell how others are feeling from over half a mile away.
4897.name: lucario

4898.text: Not only does it perceive auras, but it has also gained the power to control them. It employs them in battle.
4898.name: lucario

4899.text: They can detect the species of a living being— and its emotions—from over half a mile away. They control auras and hunt their prey in packs.
4899.name: lucario

4900.text: It concentrates its mental energy and fires off mysterious waves called auras, which can crush boulders of large size to dust.
4900.name: lucario

4901.text: Lucario reads its opponent’s feelings with its aura waves. It finds out things it would rather not know, so it gets stressed out easily.
4901.name: lucario

4902.text: It controls waves known as auras, which are powerful enough to pulverize huge rocks. It uses these waves to take down its prey.
4902.name: lucario

4903.text: It can tell what people are thinking. Only Trainers who have justice in their hearts can earn this Pokémon’s trust.
4903.name: lucario

4904.text: A most gallant-looking creature. It emits energy waves and controls them with precision, using them to sense even faraway beings. I have given the name ”aura” to this power.
4904.name: lucario

4905.text: It shrouds itself in sand to ward off germs. It travels easily through the sands of the desert.
4905.name: hippopotas

4906.text: It shuts its nostrils tight then travels through sand as if walking. They form colonies of around 10.
4906.name: hippopotas

4907.text: It lives in arid places. Instead of perspiration, it expels grainy sand from its body.
4907.name: hippopotas

4908.text: It enshrouds itself with sand to protect itself from germs. It does not enjoy getting wet.
4908.name: hippopotas

4909.text: It moves through the sands with its mouth open, swallowing sand along with its prey. It gets rid of the sand by spouting it from its nose.
4909.name: hippopotas

4910.text: This Pokémon is active during the day and passes the cold desert nights burrowed snugly into the sand.
4910.name: hippopotas

4911.text: Though large and languid, Hippopotas is difficult to detect due to its tendency to burrow into and lurk beneath the soil. When agitated or excited, it expels sand from its nostrils.
4911.name: hippopotas

4912.text: Its huge mouth is almost seven feet across. It has enough power to completely crush a car.
4912.name: hippowdon

4913.text: It is surprisingly quick to anger. It holds its mouth agape as a display of its strength.
4913.name: hippowdon

4914.text: It brandishes its gaping mouth in a display of fearsome strength. It raises vast quantities of sand while attacking.
4914.name: hippowdon

4915.text: It blasts internally stored sand from ports on its body to create a towering twister for attack.
4915.name: hippowdon

4916.text: Stones can get stuck in the ports on their bodies. Dwebble help dislodge such stones, so Hippowdon look after these Pokémon.
4916.name: hippowdon

4917.text: When roused to violence by its rage, it spews out the quantities of sand it has swallowed and whips up a sandstorm.
4917.name: hippowdon

4918.text: Short-tempered and easily moved to violence. It whips up whirlwinds of sand to crush its foes' spirits, then goes in for the attack.
4918.name: hippowdon

4919.text: It lives in arid lands. It buries itself in sand and lies in wait for unsuspecting prey.
4919.name: skorupi

4920.text: As soon as the tail claws close, its needle tips secrete poison. It can survive a year without food.
4920.name: skorupi

4921.text: It lives in arid regions and can go without food for a year while waiting for prey.
4921.name: skorupi

4922.text: It grips prey with its tail claws and injects poison. It tenaciously hangs on until the poison takes.
4922.name: skorupi

4923.text: It burrows under the sand to lie in wait for prey. Its tail claws can inject its prey with a savage poison.
4923.name: skorupi

4924.text: After burrowing into the sand, it waits patiently for prey to come near. This Pokémon and Sizzlipede share common descent.
4924.name: skorupi

4925.text: It attacks using the claws on its tail. Once locked in its grip, its prey is unable to move as this Pokémon’s poison seeps in.
4925.name: skorupi

4926.text: Its claws are not only razor-sharp but poisonous, making Skorupi a highly dangerous Pokémon. It seems to be weakened by cold temperatures, however.
4926.name: skorupi

4927.text: Its body is encased in a sturdy shell. Its head rotates 180 degrees, eliminating blind spots.
4927.name: drapion

4928.text: It attacks people and Pokémon that cross the desert. This has only furthered its bad reputation.
4928.name: drapion

4929.text: Possessing a sturdy build, it takes pride in its strength, taking down foes without using toxins.
4929.name: drapion

4930.text: It takes pride in its strength. Even though it can tear foes apart, it finishes them off with powerful poison.
4930.name: drapion

4931.text: It has the power in its clawed arms to make scrap of a car. The tips of its claws release poison.
4931.name: drapion

4932.text: Its poison is potent, but it rarely sees use. This Pokémon prefers to use physical force instead, going on rampages with its car-crushing strength.
4932.name: drapion

4933.text: It’s so vicious that it’s called the Sand Demon. Yet when confronted by Hippowdon, Drapion keeps a low profile and will never pick a fight.
4933.name: drapion

4934.text: Has a brutish, ferocious temperament. With immense strength and a sturdy shell off which swords will bounce, it rampages about and wreaks havoc.
4934.name: drapion

4935.text: Inflating its poison sacs, it makes an eerie blubbering sound for intimidation.
4935.name: croagunk

4936.text: Fluid squeezed from its finger, albeit poisonous, is a significant ingredient in remedies for lower back pain.
4936.name: croagunk

4937.text: It rarely fights fairly, but that is strictly to ensure survival. It is popular as a mascot.
4937.name: croagunk

4938.text: Its cheeks hold poison sacs. It tries to catch foes off guard to jab them with toxic fingers.
4938.name: croagunk

4939.text: Inflating its poison sacs, it fills the area with an odd sound and hits flinching opponents with a poison jab.
4939.name: croagunk

4940.text: It makes frightening noises with its poison-filled cheek sacs. When opponents flinch, Croagunk hits them with a poison jab.
4940.name: croagunk

4941.text: Once diluted, its poison becomes medicinal. This Pokémon came into popularity after a pharmaceutical company chose it as a mascot.
4941.name: croagunk

4942.text: A poison wielder with a dastardly personality. Despite such qualities, this species is afforded a measure of popularity due to its peculiar cry and comical features.
4942.name: croagunk

4943.text: The toxin made in its poison sacs is pumped to the knuckle claws through tubes down its arms.
4943.name: toxicroak

4944.text: Swaying and dodging the attacks of its foes, it weaves its flexible body in close, then lunges out with its poisonous claws.
4944.name: toxicroak

4945.text: The croaking that Toxicroak produces before a battle is for churning the poison it has stored in its poison sac.
4945.name: toxicroak

4946.text: It has a poison sac at its throat. When it croaks, the stored poison is churned for greater potency.
4946.name: toxicroak

4947.text: Its knuckle claws secrete a toxin so vile that even a scratch could prove fatal.
4947.name: toxicroak

4948.text: It bounces toward opponents and gouges them with poisonous claws. No more than a scratch is needed to knock out its adversaries.
4948.name: toxicroak

4949.text: It booms out a victory croak when its prey goes down in defeat. This Pokémon and Seismitoad are related species.
4949.name: toxicroak

4950.text: Its crimson claws contain a virulent toxin. This toxin can be made into a tonic by diluting it, mixing it with several types of wild grass, and boiling it down over two days.
4950.name: toxicroak

4951.text: Hanging from branches using its tentacles, it looks like a plant. It awaits prey, mouth wide open.
4951.name: carnivine

4952.text: It walks around on its tentacles in search of a tree branch where it can dangle down and ambush prey.
4952.name: carnivine

4953.text: Using its tentacles to lash itself to trees, it lies in wait for prey, luring it close with sweet-smelling drool.
4953.name: carnivine

4954.text: It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling saliva, then chomps down. It takes a whole day to eat prey.
4954.name: carnivine

4955.text: It binds itself to trees in marshes. It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling drool and gulps them down.
4955.name: carnivine

4956.text: Though this is a plant Pokémon, it has a gluttonous and unruly temperament. Carnivine attacks its prey with its cavernous maw wide open.
4956.name: carnivine

4957.text: The way its two tail fins flutter while it swims has earned it the nickname “BEAUTIFLY of the Sea.”
4957.name: finneon

4958.text: Swimming and fluttering its two tail fins, it looks like a BEAUTIFLY. At night, the patterns on its tail fins softly shine.
4958.name: finneon

4959.text: The line running down its side can store sunlight. It shines vividly at night.
4959.name: finneon

4960.text: After long exposure to sunlight, the patterns on its tail fins shine vividly when darkness arrives.
4960.name: finneon

4961.text: It absorbs sunlight with the pink areas of its skin, which then shine. This appears to be a form of camouflage.
4961.name: finneon

4962.text: Its double tail fins propel its energetic jumps. When it breaks the surface of the sea, Wingull swoop down to grab it on the fly.
4962.name: finneon

4963.text: When night falls, their pink patterns begin to shine. They’re popular with divers, so there are resorts that feed them to keep them close.
4963.name: finneon

4964.text: It lures in prey with its shining tail fins. It stays near the surface during the day and moves to the depths when night falls.
4964.name: finneon

4965.text: What a gorgeous sight this Pokémon is as it swims with its long, pink-painted caudal fins fluttering behind it. Finneon's beautiful appearance has led to its nickname: ”finery fish.”
4965.name: finneon

4966.text: LUMINEON swimming in the darkness of the deep sea look like stars shining in the night sky.
4966.name: lumineon

4967.text: It crawls along the seafloor using its long front fins like legs. It competes for food with Lanturn.
4967.name: lumineon

4968.text: It lives on the deep-sea floor. It attracts prey by flashing the patterns on its four tail fins.
4968.name: lumineon

4969.text: To avoid detection by predators, it crawls along the seafloor using the two fins on its chest.
4969.name: lumineon

4970.text: With its shining light, it lures its prey close. However, the light also happens to attract ferocious fish Pokémon—its natural predators.
4970.name: lumineon

4971.text: This deep-sea Pokémon lives at the bottom of the sea. Its fins haul it over the seabed in search of its favorite food—Starmie.
4971.name: lumineon

4972.text: Deep down at the bottom of the ocean, prey is scarce. Lumineon get into fierce disputes with Lanturn over food.
4972.name: lumineon

4973.text: They traverse the deep waters as if crawling over the seafloor. The fantastic lights of its fins shine like stars in the night sky.
4973.name: lumineon

4974.text: Uses its gleaming fins to hunt its prey. The view of Lumineon schooling near the surface of the sea at night is breathtaking— it's as though there were shining stars right there.
4974.name: lumineon

4975.text: A friendly Pokémon that captures the subtle flows of seawater using its two antennae.
4975.name: mantyke

4976.text: Scientists discovered that the distinctive patterns on its back differ by region.
4976.name: mantyke

4977.text: People organize tours to see this Pokémon frolic and skim the tops of waves with Remoraid.
4977.name: mantyke

4978.text: The pattern on its back varies by region. It often swims in a school of Remoraid.
4978.name: mantyke

4979.text: When it swims close to the surface of the ocean, people aboard ships are able to observe the pattern on its back.
4979.name: mantyke

4980.text: It’s highly friendly and easily tamed. Tours that take people swimming with Mantyke are a super-popular beach activity.
4980.name: mantyke

4981.text: Mantyke are friendly toward people and will approach boats closely. The patterns on their backs differ depending on their habitat.
4981.name: mantyke

4982.text: Mantyke living in Galar seem to be somewhat sluggish. The colder waters of the seas in this region may be the cause.
4982.name: mantyke

4983.text: It swims along with a school of Remoraid, and they’ll all fight together to repel attackers.
4983.name: mantyke

4984.text: Though ball-like in shape, this Pokémon is a proficient swimmer. I have discovered that if a Mantyke spends much time with schools of Remoraid, it will eventually achieve evolution.
4984.name: mantyke

4985.text: It lives on snowy mountains. Having had little contact with humans, it is boldly inquisitive.
4985.name: snover

4986.text: Seemingly curious about people, they gather around footsteps they find on snowy mountains.
4986.name: snover

4987.text: During cold seasons, it migrates to the mountain’s lower reaches. It returns to the snow-covered summit in the spring.
4987.name: snover

4988.text: In the spring, it grows berries with the texture of frozen treats around its belly.
4988.name: snover

4989.text: It lives on snowy mountains. It sinks its legs into the snow to absorb water and keep its own temperature down.
4989.name: snover

4990.text: The berries that grow around its belly are like ice pops. Galarian Darumaka absolutely love these berries.
4990.name: snover

4991.text: One is likely to encounter this Pokémon while out in the snow. There are stories of Snover appearing in human settlements but doing no harm—rather, they bond with the children.
4991.name: snover

4992.text: It whips up blizzards in mountains that are always buried in snow. It is the abominable snowman.
4992.name: abomasnow

4993.text: They appear when the snow flowers bloom. When the petals fall, they retreat to places unknown again.
4993.name: abomasnow

4994.text: It blankets wide areas in snow by whipping up blizzards. It is also known as “The Ice Monster.”
4994.name: abomasnow

4995.text: It lives a quiet life on mountains that are perpetually covered in snow. It hides itself by whipping up blizzards.
4995.name: abomasnow

4996.text: If it sees any packs of Darumaka going after Snover, it chases them off, swinging its sizable arms like hammers.
4996.name: abomasnow

4997.text: This Pokémon is known to bring blizzards. A shake of its massive body is enough to cause whiteout conditions.
4997.name: abomasnow

4998.text: A powerful Pokémon that can split huge boulders with ease. Dislikes associating with others and chooses to live quietly deep within the mountains, playing with the snow.
4998.name: abomasnow

4999.text: It sends signals to others by carving odd patterns in frost- covered trees and ice.
4999.name: weavile

5000.text: Evolution made it even more devious. It communicates by clawing signs in boulders.
5000.name: weavile

5001.text: They communicate by clawing signs in boulders and work together to surround enemies.
5001.name: weavile

5002.text: It lives in snowy regions. It carves patterns in trees with its claws as a signal to others.
5002.name: weavile

5003.text: They live in cold regions, forming groups of four or five that hunt prey with impressive coordination.
5003.name: weavile

5004.text: They travel in groups of four or five, leaving signs for one another on trees and rocks. They bring down their prey with coordinated attacks.
5004.name: weavile

5005.text: They dwell in cold places. This Pokémon’s main food source in Alola is Vulpix and Sandshrew, which they carefully divide among their group.
5005.name: weavile

5006.text: One Weavile will trip a Sandshrew and flip it over, and then another Weavile will deal the finishing blow with its sharp claws.
5006.name: weavile

5007.text: Thanks to its increased intelligence, scrapping over food is a thing of the past. A scratch from its claws will give you a case of frostbite!
5007.name: weavile

5008.text: They attack their quarry in packs. Prey as large as Mamoswine easily fall to the teamwork of a group of Weavile.
5008.name: weavile

5009.text: With its claws, it leaves behind signs for its friends to find. The number of distinct signs is said to be over 500.
5009.name: weavile

5010.text: This species corners prey as a pack, under the guidance of a leader. Weavile displays increased cunning, leading me to speculate that its evolution caused further brain development.
5010.name: weavile

5011.text: Exposure to a special magnetic field changed MAGNETON’s molecular structure, turning it into MAGNEZONE.
5011.name: magnezone

5012.text: A group tried to use scientific means to make Magnezone evolve, but their efforts ended in failure.
5012.name: magnezone

5013.text: Sometimes the magnetism emitted by Magnezone is too strong, making them attract each other so they cannot move.
5013.name: magnezone

5014.text: It evolved from exposure to a special magnetic field. Three units generate magnetism.
5014.name: magnezone

5015.text: Three units generate magnetism. There have been many mistaken reports of UFO sightings when Magnezone flies through the night sky.
5015.name: magnezone

5016.text: As it zooms through the sky, this Pokémon seems to be receiving signals of unknown origin, while transmitting signals of unknown purpose.
5016.name: magnezone

5017.text: It uses radar to monitor its territory. Intruders are quickly disposed of with a hyper beam.
5017.name: magnezone

5018.text: There are still people who believe that this Pokémon came from outer space. It emanates a powerful magnetic field.
5018.name: magnezone

5019.text: Some say that Magnezone receives signals from space via the antenna on its head and that it’s being controlled by some mysterious being.
5019.name: magnezone

5020.text: It’s thought that a special magnetic field changed the molecular structure of this Pokémon’s body, and that’s what caused the Pokémon’s evolution.
5020.name: magnezone

5021.text: I theorize that a special magnetic field influenced this Pokémon, changing its molecular structure and causing it to evolve. It emits strange radio waves toward space from its antenna.
5021.name: magnezone

5022.text: Its saliva can decompose anything. It wraps its long tongue around things to coat them with its sticky saliva.
5022.name: lickilicky

5023.text: It has space in its throat to store saliva. It can also roll up its tongue and store it in the same spot.
5023.name: lickilicky

5024.text: The long tongue is always soggy with slobber. The saliva contains a solvent that causes numbness.
5024.name: lickilicky

5025.text: It wraps things with its extensible tongue. Getting too close to it will leave you soaked with drool.
5025.name: lickilicky

5026.text: Their saliva contains lots of components that can dissolve anything. The numbness caused by their lick does not dissipate.
5026.name: lickilicky

5027.text: A contest is under way to determine which one can stick its tongue out the farthest. The current record is...more than 82 feet.
5027.name: lickilicky

5028.text: It uses its tongue much more skillfully than its hands or its feet. It can deftly pick up a single small bean with its tongue.
5028.name: lickilicky

5029.text: Lickilicky’s strange tongue can stretch to many times the length of its body. No one has figured out how Lickilicky’s tongue can stretch so far.
5029.name: lickilicky

5030.text: Lickilicky can do just about anything with its tongue, which is as dexterous as the human hand. In contrast, Lickilicky’s use of its fingers is clumsy.
5030.name: lickilicky

5031.text: Its tongue can extend and contract freely, and it is capable of reaching lengths over 10 times Lickilicky's height. Beware of the saliva, as it contains corrosive elements.
5031.name: lickilicky

5032.text: It puts rocks in holes in its palms and uses its muscles to shoot them. GEODUDE are shot at rare times.
5032.name: rhyperior

5033.text: It can launch a rock held in its hand like a missile by tightening then expanding muscles instantly.
5033.name: rhyperior

5034.text: From holes in its palms, it fires out Geodude. Its carapace can withstand volcanic eruptions.
5034.name: rhyperior

5035.text: It puts rocks in holes in its palms and uses its muscles to shoot them. Geodude are shot at rare times.
5035.name: rhyperior

5036.text: It can load up to three projectiles per arm into the holes in its hands. What launches out of those holes could be either rocks or Roggenrola.
5036.name: rhyperior

5037.text: It relies on its carapace to deflect incoming attacks and throw its enemy off balance. As soon as that happens, it drives its drill into the foe.
5037.name: rhyperior

5038.text: This Pokémon evolved through use of a curious item. Its rocklike hide is composed of a mysterious substance and can withstand a blow from a masterwork sword with nary a scratch.
5038.name: rhyperior

5039.text: When it remains still, it appears to be a large shrub. Unsuspecting prey that wander near get ensnared by its vines.
5039.name: tangrowth

5040.text: Its arms are made of plants that bind themselves to things. They grow back right away if cut.
5040.name: tangrowth

5041.text: Even if one of its arms is eaten, it’s fine. The Pokémon regenerates quickly and will go right back to normal.
5041.name: tangrowth

5042.text: It ensnares prey by extending arms made of vines. Losing arms to predators does not trouble it.
5042.name: tangrowth

5043.text: Its vines grow so profusely that, in the warm season, you can’t even see its eyes.
5043.name: tangrowth

5044.text: Tangrowth has two arms that it can extend as it pleases. Recent research has shown that these arms are, in fact, bundles of vines.
5044.name: tangrowth

5045.text: Vine growth is accelerated for Tangrowth living in warm climates. If the vines grow long, Tangrowth shortens them by tearing parts of them off.
5045.name: tangrowth

5046.text: Draped with long vines, it resembles a shrub in appearance. It swings bundles of vines as though they were arms, wrapping them around prey to ensnare them.
5046.name: tangrowth

5047.text: Heedless of enemy attacks, it closes in, shoves its tails onto the foe, then looses high voltage.
5047.name: electivire

5048.text: The instant it presses the tips of its tails onto an opponent, it sends over 20,000 volts of electricity into the foe.
5048.name: electivire

5049.text: As its electric charge amplifies, blue sparks begin to crackle between its horns.
5049.name: electivire

5050.text: It pushes the tips of its two tails against the foe, then lets loose with over 20,000 volts of power.
5050.name: electivire

5051.text: It pushes the tips of its tails against its foes and then lets loose a high-voltage current. Its foes are burned to a crisp in an instant.
5051.name: electivire

5052.text: When it gets excited, it thumps its chest. With every thud, thunder roars and electric sparks shower all around.
5052.name: electivire

5053.text: It grips its tail, which spews electricity, and then beats down opponents with the power of its electrified fist.
5053.name: electivire

5054.text: A single Electivire can provide enough electricity for all the buildings in a big city for a year.
5054.name: electivire

5055.text: The amount of electrical energy this Pokémon produces is proportional to the rate of its pulse. The voltage jumps while Electivire is battling.
5055.name: electivire

5056.text: In terms of electrical-energy output, Electivire is one of the best among all Electric Pokémon. It discharges high-voltage currents from its tails.
5056.name: electivire

5057.text: Its evolution was induced by an unusual item, and its electrical output rises along with its heart rate. From its tails, it can unleash an electric current measuring 20,000 volts.
5057.name: electivire

5058.text: When launching 3,600 degrees F fireballs, its body takes on a whitish hue from the intense heat.
5058.name: magmortar

5059.text: When shooting 3,600 degree F fireballs from its arms, its body takes on a whitish hue from the intense heat.
5059.name: magmortar

5060.text: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit from the ends of its arms. It lives in volcanic craters.
5060.name: magmortar

5061.text: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit out of its arms. Its breath also sears and sizzles.
5061.name: magmortar

5062.text: They dwell in volcanic craters. According to what is known, a single pair of male and female Magmortar lives in one volcano.
5062.name: magmortar

5063.text: From its arm, it launches fireballs hotter than 3,500 degrees Fahrenheit. Its arm starts to melt when it fires a whole barrage.
5063.name: magmortar

5064.text: There are still quite a few factories that rely on the flames provided by Magmortar to process metals.
5064.name: magmortar

5065.text: Magmortar takes down its enemies by shooting fireballs, which burn them to a blackened crisp. It avoids this method when hunting prey.
5065.name: magmortar

5066.text: When Magmortar inhales deeply, the fire burning in its belly intensifies, rising in temperature to over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.
5066.name: magmortar

5067.text: Living in the crater of a volcano has caused this Pokémon’s body to resemble its environment— it has an organ similar to a magma chamber.
5067.name: magmortar

5068.text: Use of a strange item caused this Pokémon to evolve. Fireballs launched from the ends of its tubelike arms are hot enough to melt an iron pot in an instant.
5068.name: magmortar

5069.text: It will never appear where there is strife. Its sightings have become rare recently.
5069.name: togekiss

5070.text: As everyone knows, it visits peaceful regions, bringing them gifts of kindness and sweet blessings.
5070.name: togekiss

5071.text: It shares many blessings with people who respect one another’s rights and avoid needless strife.
5071.name: togekiss

5072.text: These Pokémon are never seen anywhere near conflict or turmoil. In recent times, they’ve hardly been seen at all.
5072.name: togekiss

5073.text: Known as a bringer of blessings, it’s been depicted on good-luck charms since ancient times.
5073.name: togekiss

5074.text: Scant few have ever sighted this Pokémon. After studying what literature remains, I am certain Togekiss will reveal itself when peace reigns in the land.
5074.name: togekiss

5075.text: By churning its wings, it creates shock waves that inflict critical internal injuries to foes.
5075.name: yanmega

5076.text: The beat of its wings is so powerful that it accidentally dislodges full-grown trees when it takes off in flight.
5076.name: yanmega

5077.text: Its jaw power is incredible. It is adept at biting apart foes while flying by at high speed.
5077.name: yanmega

5078.text: It prefers to battle by biting apart foes’ heads instantly while flying by at high speed.
5078.name: yanmega

5079.text: This six-legged Pokémon is easily capable of transporting an adult in flight. The wings on its tail help it stay balanced.
5079.name: yanmega

5080.text: Extremely violent. When hunting, it wastes none of its energy, aiming only for prey's most vulnerable spots. Any who manage to tame this Pokémon must be of incredible bravery.
5080.name: yanmega

5081.text: It basically does not fight. With cells similar to those of plants, it can perform photosynthesis.
5081.name: leafeon

5082.text: With cells similar to those of plants, it performs photosynthesis inside its body and creates pure air.
5082.name: leafeon

5083.text: When you see Leafeon asleep in a patch of sunshine, you’ll know it is using photosynthesis to produce clean air.
5083.name: leafeon

5084.text: Just like a plant, it uses photosynthesis. As a result, it is always enveloped in clear air.
5084.name: leafeon

5085.text: Its cellular composition is closer to that of a plant than an animal. It uses photosynthesis to produce its energy supply without eating food.
5085.name: leafeon

5086.text: The younger they are, the more they smell like fresh grass. With age, their fragrance takes on the odor of fallen leaves.
5086.name: leafeon

5087.text: Although it doesn’t like disputes, it will sharpen the leaf on its tail into a blade and fight if it has to protect its friends.
5087.name: leafeon

5088.text: It gets its nutrition from photosynthesis. It lives a quiet life deep in forests where clean rivers flow.
5088.name: leafeon

5089.text: Galarians favor the distinctive aroma that drifts from this Pokémon’s leaves. There’s a popular perfume made using that scent.
5089.name: leafeon

5090.text: This Pokémon’s tail is blade sharp, with a fantastic cutting edge that can slice right though large trees.
5090.name: leafeon

5091.text: Cells similar to those of plants have been found in its fur. Its hard tail can fell a large tree with one stroke, and the tail's sharpness exceeds even that of a sword crafted by a master.
5091.name: leafeon

5092.text: As a protective technique, it can completely freeze its fur to make its hairs stand like needles.
5092.name: glaceon

5093.text: It causes small ice crystals to form by lowering the temperature of the surrounding atmosphere.
5093.name: glaceon

5094.text: It lowers its body heat to freeze its fur. The hairs then become like needles it can fire.
5094.name: glaceon

5095.text: It can control its body temperature at will. This enables it to freeze the moisture in the atmosphere, creating flurries of diamond dust.
5095.name: glaceon

5096.text: It freezes its fur into icicles, spiky and sharp, and tackles its prey.
5096.name: glaceon

5097.text: It protects itself by freezing its fur into sharp needles. It can drop its body temperature below –75 degrees Fahrenheit.
5097.name: glaceon

5098.text: It can instantaneously freeze any moisture that’s around it, creating ice pellets to shoot at its prey.
5098.name: glaceon

5099.text: Any who become captivated by the beauty of the snowfall that Glaceon creates will be frozen before they know it.
5099.name: glaceon

5100.text: The coldness emanating from Glaceon causes powdery snow to form, making it quite a popular Pokémon at ski resorts.
5100.name: glaceon

5101.text: Glaceon is able to lower its body temperature very quickly. It freezes the atmosphere, creating diamond dust that glitters like gems while it flutters and dances around.
5101.name: glaceon

5102.text: If it succeeds in catching even a faint breeze properly, it can circle the globe without flapping once.
5102.name: gliscor

5103.text: It dances silently through the sky. When it approaches prey, it can land a critical hit in an instant.
5103.name: gliscor

5104.text: It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, it swoops!
5104.name: gliscor

5105.text: Its flight is soundless. It uses its lengthy tail to carry off its prey... Then its elongated fangs do the rest.
5105.name: gliscor

5106.text: It glides soundlessly on pitch-black wings and sinks sharp fangs into the throat of its prey. It takes on a look of satisfaction once it has entirely drained its prey of blood.
5106.name: gliscor

5107.text: It flourished worldwide during the ice age but its population declined when the masses of ice began to dwindle.
5107.name: mamoswine

5108.text: A frozen one was dug up from soil dating back 10,000 years. It woke up to much amazement.
5108.name: mamoswine

5109.text: When the temperature rose at the end of the ice age, most Mamoswine disappeared.
5109.name: mamoswine

5110.text: A frozen Mamoswine was dug from ice dating back 10,000 years. This Pokémon has been around a long, long, long time.
5110.name: mamoswine

5111.text: Its impressive tusks are made of ice. The population thinned when it turned warm after the ice age.
5111.name: mamoswine

5112.text: This Pokémon can be spotted in wall paintings from as far back as 10,000 years ago. For a while, it was thought to have gone extinct.
5112.name: mamoswine

5113.text: It looks strong, and that’s exactly what it is. As the weather grows colder, its ice tusks grow longer, thicker, and more impressive.
5113.name: mamoswine

5114.text: This species reached its zenith during the period known as the ice age. I suspect that Hisui's frigid climate is in harmony with Mamoswine's constitution, thus awakening hidden potential.
5114.name: mamoswine

5115.text: Its programming was modified to enable work in alien dimensions. It did not work as planned.
5115.name: porygon-z

5116.text: Additional software was installed to make it a better Pokémon. It began acting oddly, however.
5116.name: porygon-z

5117.text: Its programming was modified to enable it to travel through alien dimensions. Seems there might have been an error...
5117.name: porygon-z

5118.text: In order to create a more advanced Pokémon, an additional program was installed, but apparently it contained a defect that makes it move oddly.
5118.name: porygon-z

5119.text: Its program was modified to facilitate extra-dimensional activities, but that led to noticeably strange behavior.
5119.name: porygon-z

5120.text: Its behavior is noticeably unstable, which is apparently due to the incompetence of the engineer who updated its programming.
5120.name: porygon-z

5121.text: A faulty update was added to its programming. Its behavior is noticeably strange, so the experiment may have been a failure.
5121.name: porygon-z

5122.text: Porygon-Z had a program installed to allow it to move between dimensions, but the program also caused instability in Porygon-Z’s behavior.
5122.name: porygon-z

5123.text: Some say an additional program made this Pokémon evolve, but even academics can’t agree on whether Porygon-Z is really an evolution.
5123.name: porygon-z

5124.text: A curious item induced this evolution. The Pokémon's offensive capabilities have greatly increased, but the strangeness of its behavior has magnified in equal measure. This worries me.
5124.name: porygon-z

5125.text: When trying to protect someone, it extends its elbows as if they were swords and fights savagely.
5125.name: gallade

5126.text: Because it can sense what its foe is thinking, its attacks burst out first, fast, and fierce.
5126.name: gallade

5127.text: A master of courtesy and swordsmanship, it fights using extending swords on its elbows.
5127.name: gallade

5128.text: True to its honorable-warrior image, it uses the blades on its elbows only in defense of something or someone.
5128.name: gallade

5129.text: Sharply attuned to others’ wishes for help, this Pokémon seeks out those in need and aids them in battle.
5129.name: gallade

5130.text: The blades extending from its elbows are sharper than the finest swords. Its swordsmanship, albeit self-taught, is astonishingly impressive.
5130.name: gallade

5131.text: It controls three units called Mini-Noses using magnetic force. With them, it can attack the foe from three directions.
5131.name: probopass

5132.text: It exudes strong magnetism from all over. It controls three small units called Mini-Noses.
5132.name: probopass

5133.text: It freely controls three small units called Mini-Noses using magnetic force.
5133.name: probopass

5134.text: It radiates such a powerful magnetic field that nearby electrical appliances become unusable.
5134.name: probopass

5135.text: The main body controls three mobile units called Mini-Noses, which it maneuvers to catch prey.
5135.name: probopass

5136.text: Although it can control its units known as Mini-Noses, they sometimes get lost and don’t come back.
5136.name: probopass

5137.text: It uses three small units to catch prey and battle enemies. The main body mostly just gives orders.
5137.name: probopass

5138.text: It is able to emit powerful magnetism, allowing it control over the iron sand that forms its luscious mustache. Using this iron sand, Probopass forms hard stones with which it smites its prey.
5138.name: probopass

5139.text: This feared Pokémon is said to travel to worlds unknown. Some even believe that it takes lost spirits along with it.
5139.name: dusknoir

5140.text: It is said to take lost spirits into its pliant body and guide them home.
5140.name: dusknoir

5141.text: The antenna on its head captures radio waves from the world of spirits that command it to take people there.
5141.name: dusknoir

5142.text: At the bidding of transmissions from the spirit world, it steals people and Pokémon away. No one knows whether it has a will of its own.
5142.name: dusknoir

5143.text: With the mouth on its belly, Dusknoir swallows its target whole. The soul is the only thing eaten— Dusknoir disgorges the body before departing.
5143.name: dusknoir

5144.text: Comes to those whose lives have come to an end and escorts their souls to the afterlife. Known to mistakenly take the souls of those who yet have life left in them, albeit rarely.
5144.name: dusknoir

5145.text: Legends in snowy regions say that a woman who was lost on an icy mountain was reborn as FROSLASS
5145.name: froslass

5146.text: It freezes prey by blowing its -58 degrees F breath. It is said to then secretly display its prey.
5146.name: froslass

5147.text: It freezes foes with an icy breath nearly -60 degrees Fahrenheit. What seems to be its body is actually hollow.
5147.name: froslass

5148.text: Legends in snowy regions say that a woman who was lost on an icy mountain was reborn as Froslass.
5148.name: froslass

5149.text: When it finds humans or Pokémon it likes, it freezes them and takes them to its chilly den, where they become decorations.
5149.name: froslass

5150.text: The soul of a woman lost on a snowy mountain possessed an icicle, becoming this Pokémon. The food it most relishes is the souls of men.
5150.name: froslass

5151.text: It freezes hikers who have come to climb snowy mountains and carries them back to its home. It only goes after men it thinks are handsome.
5151.name: froslass

5152.text: It’s said that on nights of terrible blizzards, it comes down to human settlements. If you hear it knocking at your door, do not open it!
5152.name: froslass

5153.text: After a woman met her end on a snowy mountain, her regrets lingered on. From them, this Pokémon was born. Its favorite food is frozen souls.
5153.name: froslass

5154.text: It spits out cold air of nearly −60 degrees Fahrenheit to freeze its quarry. It brings frozen prey back to its lair and neatly lines them up.
5154.name: froslass

5155.text: A Pokémon inhabited by the soul of a woman who died bearing a grudge in the snowy mountains. Legends of Froslass placing deathly curses on misbehaving men send shivers down my spine.
5155.name: froslass

5156.text: Its electric-like body can enter some kinds of machines and take control in order to make mischief.
5156.name: rotom

5157.text: Research continues on this Pokémon, which could be the power source of a unique motor.
5157.name: rotom

5158.text: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.
5158.name: rotom

5159.text: One boy’s invention led to the development of many different machines that take advantage of Rotom’s unique capabilities.
5159.name: rotom

5160.text: With a body made of plasma, it can inhabit all sorts of machines. It loves to surprise others.
5160.name: rotom

5161.text: This bizarre Pokémon appears to be a will-o'-the-wisp powered by electricity. Be wary, as Rotom is both smart and mischievous.
5161.name: rotom

5162.text: When UXIE flew, people gained the ability to solve problems. It was the birth of knowledge.
5162.name: uxie

5163.text: According to some sources, this Pokémon provided people with the intelligence necessary to solve various problems.
5163.name: uxie

5164.text: When Uxie flew, people gained the ability to solve problems. It was the birth of knowledge.
5164.name: uxie

5165.text: Known as “The Being of Knowledge.” It is said that it can wipe out the memory of those who see its eyes.
5165.name: uxie

5166.text: It is said that its emergence gave humans the intelligence to improve their quality of life.
5166.name: uxie

5167.text: A Pokémon feared but also respected for stealing away the memories of evildoers. I have found records that suggest Uxie holds dominion over knowledge.
5167.name: uxie

5168.text: When MESPRIT flew, people learned the joy and sadness of living. It was the birth of emotions.
5168.name: mesprit

5169.text: This Pokémon is said to have endowed the human heart with emotions, such as sorrow and joy.
5169.name: mesprit

5170.text: When Mesprit flew, people learned the joy and sadness of living. It was the birth of emotions.
5170.name: mesprit

5171.text: Known as “The Being of Emotion.” It taught humans the nobility of sorrow, pain, and joy.
5171.name: mesprit

5172.text: It sleeps at the bottom of a lake. Its spirit is said to leave its body to fly on the lake’s surface.
5172.name: mesprit

5173.text: Known as the Being of Emotion. In legend, this Pokémon was feared, as any who showed disrespect would have their emotions thrown into disarray.
5173.name: mesprit

5174.text: It is thought that UXIE, MESPRIT and AZELF all came from the same egg.
5174.name: azelf

5175.text: When AZELF flew, people gained the determination to do things. It was the birth of willpower.
5175.name: azelf

5176.text: This Pokémon is said to have endowed humans with the determination needed to face any of life’s difficulties.
5176.name: azelf

5177.text: When Azelf flew, people gained the determination to do things. It was the birth of willpower.
5177.name: azelf

5178.text: Known as “The Being of Willpower.” It sleeps at the bottom of a lake to keep the world in balance.
5178.name: azelf

5179.text: It is thought that Uxie, Mesprit, and Azelf all came from the same egg.
5179.name: azelf

5180.text: The dreaded Being of Willpower. Legends tell of this Pokémon manipulating the will of its adversaries and turning them into puppets of its own.
5180.name: azelf

5181.text: This Pokémon completely controls the flow of time. It uses its power to travel at will through the past and future.
5181.name: dialga

5182.text: A legendary Pokémon of Sinnoh. It is said that time flows when Dialga’s heart beats.
5182.name: dialga

5183.text: A Pokémon spoken of in legend. It is said that time began moving when Dialga was born.
5183.name: dialga

5184.text: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.
5184.name: dialga

5185.text: This Pokémon is revered as a deity in Hisuian legend. The birth of Dialga was what caused the vast river of time to begin flowing in our world.
5185.name: dialga

5186.text: Its total control over the boundaries of space enable it to transport itself to faraway places or even other dimensions.
5186.name: palkia

5187.text: A legendary Pokémon of Sinnoh. It is said that space becomes more stable with Palkia’s every breath.
5187.name: palkia

5188.text: It is said to live in a gap in the spatial dimension parallel to ours. It appears in mythology.
5188.name: palkia

5189.text: It has the ability to distort space. It is described as a deity in Sinnoh-region mythology.
5189.name: palkia

5190.text: This Pokémon is feared as a deity in Hisuian legend. The birth of Palkia was what caused the walls of our world to disappear, creating a sky that spans for infinity.
5190.name: palkia

5191.text: Its body is made of rugged steel. However, it is partially melted in spots because of its own heat.
5191.name: heatran

5192.text: It dwells in volcanic caves. It digs in with its cross-shaped feet to crawl on ceilings and walls.
5192.name: heatran

5193.text: Boiling blood, like magma, circulates through its body. It makes its dwelling place in volcanic caves.
5193.name: heatran

5194.text: Stories tell of this Pokémon being birthed from the boiling magma within Mount Coronet. Its molten-steel body holds many mysteries.
5194.name: heatran

5195.text: It is believed to have shaped REGIROCK, REGICE, and REGISTEEL out of clay, ice, and magma.
5195.name: regigigas

5196.text: It is said to have made Pokémon that look like itself from a special ice mountain, rocks, and magma.
5196.name: regigigas

5197.text: There is an enduring legend that states this Pokémon towed continents with ropes.
5197.name: regigigas

5198.text: All over the world, there are legends that tell of Regigigas creating other Pokémon in its own image.
5198.name: regigigas

5199.text: It’s said that Regigigas created other Pokémon from many different materials before it moved the continents to where they are today.
5199.name: regigigas

5200.text: According to legend, Regigigas pulled landmasses together and bound them with rope to create the continent of Hisui. Though I have my doubts, the story could well contain a shred of truth.
5200.name: regigigas

5201.text: A Pokémon that is said to live in a world on the reverse side of ours. It appears in an ancient cemetery.
5201.name: giratina

5202.text: This Pokémon is said to live in a world on the reverse side of ours, where common knowledge is distorted and strange.
5202.name: giratina

5203.text: It was banished for its violence. It silently gazed upon the old world from the Distortion World.
5203.name: giratina

5204.text: There is one Hisuian verse that tells of a powerful light creating a deep shadow. I imagine that this deep shadow is Giratina.
5204.name: giratina

5205.text: On nights around the quarter moon, the aurora from its tail extends and undulates beautifully.
5205.name: cresselia

5206.text: Shiny particles are released from its wings like a veil. It is said to represent the crescent moon.
5206.name: cresselia

5207.text: Those who sleep holding Cresselia’s feather are assured of joyful dreams. It is said to represent the crescent moon.
5207.name: cresselia

5208.text: Cresselia is reminiscent of the crescent moon. It leaves a brilliant line of light in its wake as it flies across the night sky. I daresay it resembles the heavenly maiden who created the Milky Way.
5208.name: cresselia

5209.text: A Pokémon that lives in warm seas. It inflates the flotation sac on its head to drift and search for food.
5209.name: phione

5210.text: It drifts in warm seas. It always returns to where it was born, no matter how far it may have drifted.
5210.name: phione

5211.text: When the water warms, they inflate the flotation sac on their heads and drift languidly on the sea in packs.
5211.name: phione

5212.text: Can be seen floating offshore during seasons when the seas are warm. Its azure body blends in with the ocean waters—logic suggests this is a defense mechanism against natural predators.
5212.name: phione

5213.text: Born on a cold seafloor, it will swim great distances to return to its birthplace.
5213.name: manaphy

5214.text: Water makes up 80% of its body. This Pokémon is easily affected by its environment.
5214.name: manaphy

5215.text: It starts its life with a wondrous power that permits it to bond with any kind of Pokémon.
5215.name: manaphy

5216.text: Rumored to migrate across the oceans and visit Hisui's coastal waters only rarely. Although Manaphy resembles Phione, it is also quite different. The relation between the two is unclear.
5216.name: manaphy

5217.text: Folklore has it that on moonless nights, this Pokémon will make people see horrific nightmares.
5217.name: darkrai

5218.text: To protect itself, it afflicts those around it with nightmares. However, it means no harm.
5218.name: darkrai

5219.text: It chases people and Pokémon from its territory by causing them to experience deep, nightmarish slumbers.
5219.name: darkrai

5220.text: It can lull people to sleep and make them dream. It is active during nights of the new moon.
5220.name: darkrai
