5221.text: On a moonless night, a strange incident occurred in which every one of a village's inhabitants suffered nightmares. The villagers attested that Darkrai appeared before them in these nightmares.
5221.name: darkrai

5222.text: It lives in flower patches and avoids detection by curling up to look like a flowering plant.
5222.name: shaymin

5223.text: The flowers all over its body burst into bloom if it is lovingly hugged and senses gratitude.
5223.name: shaymin

5224.text: It can dissolve toxins in the air to instantly transform ruined land into a lush field of flowers.
5224.name: shaymin

5225.text: The blooming of Gracidea flowers confers the power of flight upon it. Feelings of gratitude are the message it delivers.
5225.name: shaymin

5226.text: When the turning of seasons brings the cruel winter to its end and the joyous people give thanks to the heavens, Shaymin appears and covers the withered land with flowers.
5226.name: shaymin

5227.text: It is described in mythology as the Pokémon that shaped the universe with its 1,000 arms.
5227.name: arceus

5228.text: It is said to have emerged from an egg in a place where there was nothing then shaped the world.
5228.name: arceus

5229.text: According to the legends of Sinnoh, this Pokémon emerged from an egg and shaped all there is in this world.
5229.name: arceus

5230.text: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
5230.name: arceus

5231.text: It is the heavenly fount from which pours the light that shines across Hisui. Its luminance guides and protects all Pokémon. Hisuian mythology states that Arceus is the creator of all things.
5231.name: arceus

5232.text: It creates an unlimited supply of energy inside its body, which it shares with those who touch it.
5232.name: victini

5233.text: This Pokémon brings victory. It is said that Trainers with Victini always win, regardless of the type of encounter.
5233.name: victini

5234.text: When it shares the infinite energy it creates, that being’s entire body will be overflowing with power.
5234.name: victini

5235.text: It is very intelligent and calm. Being exposed to lots of sunlight makes its movements swifter.
5235.name: snivy

5236.text: Being exposed to sunlight makes its movements swifter. It uses vines more adeptly than its hands.
5236.name: snivy

5237.text: They photosynthesize by bathing their tails in sunlight. When they are not feeling well, their tails droop.
5237.name: snivy

5238.text: They avoid attacks by sinking into the shadows of thick foliage. They retaliate with masterful whipping techniques.
5238.name: servine

5239.text: It moves along the ground as if sliding. Its swift movements befuddle its foes, and it then attacks with a vine whip.
5239.name: servine

5240.text: When it gets dirty, its leaves can’t be used in photosynthesis, so it always keeps itself clean.
5240.name: servine

5241.text: They raise their heads to intimidate opponents but only give it their all when fighting a powerful opponent.
5241.name: serperior

5242.text: It only gives its all against strong opponents who are not fazed by the glare from Serperior’s noble eyes.
5242.name: serperior

5243.text: It can stop its opponents’ movements with just a glare. It takes in solar energy and boosts it internally.
5243.name: serperior

5244.text: It blows fire through its nose. When it catches a cold, the fire becomes pitch-black smoke instead.
5244.name: tepig

5245.text: It can deftly dodge its foe’s attacks while shooting fireballs from its nose. It roasts berries before it eats them.
5245.name: tepig

5246.text: It loves to eat roasted berries, but sometimes it gets too excited and burns them to a crisp.
5246.name: tepig

5247.text: Whatever it eats becomes fuel for the flame in its stomach. When it is angered, the intensity of the flame increases.
5247.name: pignite

5248.text: The more it eats, the more fuel it has to make the fire in its stomach stronger. This fills it with even more power.
5248.name: pignite

5249.text: When its internal fire flares up, its movements grow sharper and faster. When in trouble, it emits smoke.
5249.name: pignite

5250.text: A flaring beard of fire is proof that it is fired up. It is adept at using many different moves.
5250.name: emboar

5251.text: It can throw a fire punch by setting its fists on fire with its fiery chin. It cares deeply about its friends.
5251.name: emboar

5252.text: It has mastered fast and powerful fighting moves. It grows a beard of fire.
5252.name: emboar

5253.text: The scalchop on its stomach is made from the same elements as claws. It detaches the scalchop for use as a blade.
5253.name: oshawott

5254.text: The scalchop on its stomach isn’t just used for battle—it can be used to break open hard berries as well.
5254.name: oshawott

5255.text: It fights using the scalchop on its stomach. In response to an attack, it retaliates immediately by slashing.
5255.name: oshawott

5256.text: This Pokémon from the Unova region uses the shell on its belly as a weapon to cut down its foes. Thus, I've conferred upon this shell the name ”scalchop”.
5256.name: oshawott

5257.text: Scalchop techniques differ from one Dewott to another. It never neglects maintaining its scalchops.
5257.name: dewott

5258.text: Strict training is how it learns its flowing double-scalchop technique.
5258.name: dewott

5259.text: As a result of strict training, each Dewott learns different forms for using the scalchops.
5259.name: dewott

5260.text: Its exquisite double-scalchop technique is likely the result of daily training, and it can send even masters of the blade fleeing in defeat.
5260.name: dewott

5261.text: Part of the armor on its anterior legs becomes a giant sword. Its cry alone is enough to intimidate most enemies.
5261.name: samurott

5262.text: In the time it takes a foe to blink, it can draw and sheathe the seamitars attached to its front legs.
5262.name: samurott

5263.text: One swing of the sword incorporated in its armor can fell an opponent. A simple glare from one of them quiets everybody.
5263.name: samurott

5264.text: Hard of heart and deft of blade, this rare form of Samurott is a product of the Pokémon's evolution in the region of Hisui. Its turbulent blows crash into foes like ceaseless pounding waves.
5264.name: samurott

5265.text: Extremely cautious, they take shifts to maintain a constant watch of their nest. They feel insecure without a lookout.
5265.name: patrat

5266.text: Using food stored in cheek pouches, they can keep watch for days. They use their tails to communicate with others.
5266.name: patrat

5267.text: Extremely cautious, one of them will always be on the lookout, but it won’t notice a foe coming from behind.
5267.name: patrat

5268.text: They make the patterns on their bodies shine in order to threaten predators. Keen eyesight lets them see in the dark.
5268.name: watchog

5269.text: Using luminescent matter, it makes its eyes and body glow and stuns attacking opponents.
5269.name: watchog

5270.text: When they see an enemy, their tails stand high, and they spit the seeds of berries stored in their cheek pouches.
5270.name: watchog

5271.text: It faces strong opponents with great courage. But, when at a disadvantage in a fight, this intelligent Pokémon flees.
5271.name: lillipup

5272.text: The long hair around its face provides an amazing radar that lets it sense subtle changes in its surroundings.
5272.name: lillipup

5273.text: Though it is a very brave Pokémon, it’s also smart enough to check its foe’s strength and avoid battle.
5273.name: lillipup

5274.text: Because it doesn’t yelp, it’s extremely popular with Trainers who live in apartment buildings.
5274.name: lillipup

5275.text: The long fur surrounding its face functions as radar, enabling it to probe the condition of its battle opponents.
5275.name: lillipup

5276.text: This Pokémon has excellent judgment. If it decides it can’t defeat an opponent, it immediately turns tail and vamooses.
5276.name: lillipup

5277.text: This Pokémon is popular with beginners because it’s intelligent, obedient to its Trainer’s commands, and easy to raise.
5277.name: lillipup

5278.text: This Pokémon is courageous but also cautious. It uses the soft fur covering its face to collect information about its surroundings.
5278.name: lillipup

5279.text: This Pokémon is far brighter than the average child, and Lillipup won’t forget the love it receives or any abuse it suffers.
5279.name: lillipup

5280.text: It loyally follows its Trainer’s orders. For ages, they have helped Trainers raise Pokémon.
5280.name: herdier

5281.text: This very loyal Pokémon helps Trainers, and it also takes care of other Pokémon.
5281.name: herdier

5282.text: It has black, cape-like fur that is very hard and decreases the amount of damage it receives.
5282.name: herdier

5283.text: Its dense black fur grows continuously. The high cost of keeping its hard fur properly groomed makes this a troublesome Pokémon to train.
5283.name: herdier

5284.text: This Pokémon obeys its master’s orders faithfully. However, it refuses to listen to anything said by a person it doesn’t respect.
5284.name: herdier

5285.text: The longer its black fur grows, the harder and more impervious it gets. Claws and fangs can’t easily penetrate it.
5285.name: herdier

5286.text: It has been living with people for so long that portrayals of it can be found on the walls of caves from long, long ago.
5286.name: herdier

5287.text: Herdier is a very smart and friendly Pokémon. So much so that there’s a theory that Herdier was the first Pokémon to partner with people.
5287.name: herdier

5288.text: The black fur that covers this Pokémon’s body is dense and springy. Even sharp fangs bounce right off.
5288.name: herdier

5289.text: This extremely wise Pokémon excels at rescuing people stranded at sea or in the mountains.
5289.name: stoutland

5290.text: It rescues people stranded by blizzards in the mountains. Its shaggy fur shields it from the cold.
5290.name: stoutland

5291.text: Being wrapped in its long fur is so comfortable that a person would be fine even overnight on a wintry mountain.
5291.name: stoutland

5292.text: Intelligent, good-natured, and valiant, it’s a trustworthy partner on rescue teams.
5292.name: stoutland

5293.text: With this wise Pokémon, there could be no concern that it would ever attack people. Some parents even trust it to babysit.
5293.name: stoutland

5294.text: It pays no mind to the cold, thanks to its long warm coat. Stoutland in Alola look a little uncomfortable.
5294.name: stoutland

5295.text: Its fur is long and thick. A long time ago in cold regions, every household kept a Stoutland.
5295.name: stoutland

5296.text: These Pokémon seem to enjoy living with humans. Even a Stoutland caught in the wild will warm up to people in about three days.
5296.name: stoutland

5297.text: Stoutland is immensely proud of its impressive moustache. It’s said that moustache length is what determines social standing among this species.
5297.name: stoutland

5298.text: Their cute act is a ruse. They trick people and steal their valuables just to see the looks on their faces.
5298.name: purrloin

5299.text: Its cute act is a ruse. When victims let down their guard, they find their items taken. It attacks with sharp claws.
5299.name: purrloin

5300.text: They steal from people for fun, but their victims can’t help but forgive them. Their deceptively cute act is perfect.
5300.name: purrloin

5301.text: It steals things from people just to amuse itself with their frustration. A rivalry exists between this Pokémon and Nickit.
5301.name: purrloin

5302.text: Opponents that get drawn in by its adorable behavior come away with stinging scratches from its claws and stinging pride from its laughter.
5302.name: purrloin

5303.text: These Pokémon vanish and appear unexpectedly. Many Trainers are drawn to their beautiful form and fur.
5303.name: liepard

5304.text: Their beautiful form comes from the muscles they have developed. They run silently in the night.
5304.name: liepard

5305.text: Stealthily, it sneaks up on its target, striking from behind before its victim has a chance to react.
5305.name: liepard

5306.text: Don’t be fooled by its gorgeous fur and elegant figure. This is a moody and vicious Pokémon.
5306.name: liepard

5307.text: This stealthy Pokémon sneaks up behind prey without making any sound at all. It competes with Thievul for territory.
5307.name: liepard

5308.text: This Pokémon dwells deep in the forest. Eating a leaf from its head whisks weariness away as if by magic.
5308.name: pansage

5309.text: It shares the leaf on its head with weary-looking Pokémon. These leaves are known to relieve stress.
5309.name: pansage

5310.text: It’s good at finding berries and gathers them from all over. It’s kind enough to share them with friends.
5310.name: pansage

5311.text: It strikes its enemies with a thorn-covered tail. The leaf on its head is bitter.
5311.name: simisage

5312.text: It attacks enemies with strikes of its thorn-covered tail. This Pokémon is wild tempered.
5312.name: simisage

5313.text: Ill tempered, it fights by swinging its barbed tail around wildly. The leaf growing on its head is very bitter.
5313.name: simisage

5314.text: When it is angered, the temperature of its head tuft reaches 600° F. It uses its tuft to roast berries.
5314.name: pansear

5315.text: Very intelligent, it roasts berries before eating them. It likes to help people.
5315.name: pansear

5316.text: This Pokémon lives in caves in volcanoes. The fire within the tuft on its head can reach 600 degrees Fahrenheit.
5316.name: pansear

5317.text: It loves sweets because they become energy for the fire burning inside its body.
5317.name: simisear

5318.text: A flame burns inside its body. It scatters embers from its head and tail to sear its opponents.
5318.name: simisear

5319.text: When it gets excited, embers rise from its head and tail and it gets hot. For some reason, it loves sweets.
5319.name: simisear

5320.text: It does not thrive in dry environments. It keeps itself damp by shooting water stored in its head tuft from its tail.
5320.name: panpour

5321.text: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. It waters plants with it using its tail.
5321.name: panpour

5322.text: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. Plants that receive its water grow large.
5322.name: panpour

5323.text: The tuft on its head holds water. When the level runs low, it replenishes the tuft by siphoning up water with its tail.
5323.name: simipour

5324.text: The high-pressure water expelled from its tail is so powerful, it can destroy a concrete wall.
5324.name: simipour

5325.text: It prefers places with clean water. When its tuft runs low, it replenishes it by siphoning up water with its tail.
5325.name: simipour

5326.text: Munna always float in the air. People whose dreams are eaten by them forget what the dreams had been about.
5326.name: munna

5327.text: This Pokémon appears before people and Pokémon who are having nightmares and eats those dreams.
5327.name: munna

5328.text: It eats the dreams of people and Pokémon. When it eats a pleasant dream, it expels pink-colored mist.
5328.name: munna

5329.text: Late at night, it appears beside people’s pillows. As it feeds on dreams, the patterns on its body give off a faint glow.
5329.name: munna

5330.text: It eats dreams and releases mist. The mist is pink when it’s eating a good dream, and black when it’s eating a nightmare.
5330.name: munna

5331.text: With the mist from its forehead, it can create shapes of things from dreams it has eaten.
5331.name: musharna

5332.text: The mist emanating from their foreheads is packed with the dreams of people and Pokémon.
5332.name: musharna

5333.text: The dream mist coming from its forehead changes into many different colors depending on the dream that was eaten.
5333.name: musharna

5334.text: When dark mists emanate from its body, don’t get too near. If you do, your nightmares will become reality.
5334.name: musharna

5335.text: It drowses and dreams all the time. It’s best to leave it be if it’s just woken up, as it’s a terrible grump when freshly roused from sleep.
5335.name: musharna

5336.text: Each follows its Trainer’s orders as best it can, but they sometimes fail to understand complicated commands.
5336.name: pidove

5337.text: This very forgetful Pokémon will wait for a new order from its Trainer even though it already has one.
5337.name: pidove

5338.text: These Pokémon live in cities. They are accustomed to people. Flocks often gather in parks and plazas.
5338.name: pidove

5339.text: Where people go, these Pokémon follow. If you’re scattering food for them, be careful— several hundred of them can gather at once.
5339.name: pidove

5340.text: It’s forgetful and not very bright, but many Trainers love it anyway for its friendliness and sincerity.
5340.name: pidove

5341.text: It can return to its Trainer’s location regardless of the distance separating them.
5341.name: tranquill

5342.text: Many people believe that, deep in the forest where Tranquill live, there is a peaceful place where there is no war.
5342.name: tranquill

5343.text: No matter where in the world it goes, it knows where its nest is, so it never gets separated from its Trainer.
5343.name: tranquill

5344.text: It can fly moderately quickly. No matter how far it travels, it can always find its way back to its master and its nest.
5344.name: tranquill

5345.text: These bright Pokémon have acute memories. Apparently delivery workers often choose them as their partners.
5345.name: tranquill

5346.text: Males swing their head plumage to threaten opponents. The females’ flying abilities surpass those of the males.
5346.name: unfezant

5347.text: Males have plumage on their heads. They will never let themselves feel close to anyone other than their Trainers.
5347.name: unfezant

5348.text: Unfezant are exceptional fliers. The females are known for their stamina, while the males outclass them in terms of speed.
5348.name: unfezant

5349.text: This Pokémon is intelligent and intensely proud. People will sit up and take notice if you become the Trainer of one.
5349.name: unfezant

5350.text: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use their flashing manes to communicate with one another.
5350.name: blitzle

5351.text: When thunderclouds cover the sky, it will appear. It can catch lightning with its mane and store the electricity.
5351.name: blitzle

5352.text: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes to communicate.
5352.name: blitzle

5353.text: This ill-tempered Pokémon is dangerous because when it’s angry, it shoots lightning from its mane in all directions.
5353.name: zebstrika

5354.text: When this ill-tempered Pokémon runs wild, it shoots lightning from its mane in all directions.
5354.name: zebstrika

5355.text: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.
5355.name: zebstrika

5356.text: The hexagonal-shaped hole is its ear. It has a tendency to walk in the direction the sound is coming from.
5356.name: roggenrola

5357.text: Its ear is hexagonal in shape. Compressed underground, its body is as hard as steel.
5357.name: roggenrola

5358.text: They were discovered a hundred years ago in an earthquake fissure. Inside each one is an energy core.
5358.name: roggenrola

5359.text: Born deep within the ground, it compares itself with similar species, such as Geodude and Carbink, to settle which has the hardest body.
5359.name: roggenrola

5360.text: The hexagonal cavity is its ear. It walks in the direction of sounds it hears, but if the sounds cease, it panics and topples over.
5360.name: roggenrola

5361.text: The hexagonal hole is its ear. Deep in that ear is an energy core, so if you stick your hand in there, Roggenrola will be very angry!
5361.name: roggenrola

5362.text: It was found in a fissure in a layer of exposed rock. The material that makes up its body is dirt from several hundred years ago.
5362.name: roggenrola

5363.text: It’s as hard as steel, but apparently a long soak in water will cause it to soften a bit.
5363.name: roggenrola

5364.text: When it detects a noise, it starts to move. The energy core inside it makes this Pokémon slightly warm to the touch.
5364.name: roggenrola

5365.text: When it overflows with power, the orange crystal on its body glows. It looks for underground water in caves.
5365.name: boldore

5366.text: Because its energy was too great to be contained, the energy leaked and formed orange crystals.
5366.name: boldore

5367.text: When it is healthy, its core sticks out. Always facing the same way, it swiftly moves front to back and left to right.
5367.name: boldore

5368.text: Its orange crystal is a mass of energy. Just one crystal fragment would provide enough fuel for a hundred dump trucks.
5368.name: boldore

5369.text: It explores caves in search of underground water. It’s not comfortable around water, so this Pokémon takes great care in lapping it up.
5369.name: boldore

5370.text: The energy overflowing from its body has turned into orange crystals that are hard enough to smash diamonds.
5370.name: boldore

5371.text: Its orange crystals are lumps of powerful energy. They’re valuable, so Boldore is sometimes targeted for them.
5371.name: boldore

5372.text: If you see its orange crystals start to glow, be wary. It’s about to fire off bursts of energy.
5372.name: boldore

5373.text: It relies on sound in order to monitor what’s in its vicinity. When angered, it will attack without ever changing the direction it’s facing.
5373.name: boldore

5374.text: The solar energy absorbed by its body’s orange crystals is magnified internally and fired from its mouth.
5374.name: gigalith

5375.text: The solar rays it absorbs are processed in its energy core and fired as a ball of light.
5375.name: gigalith

5376.text: Compressing the energy from its internal core lets it fire off an attack capable of blowing away a mountain.
5376.name: gigalith

5377.text: The blasts of energy it makes from sunbeams have terrifying power. However, it’s not able to fire its blasts at night or on rainy days.
5377.name: gigalith

5378.text: Known for its hefty horsepower, this Pokémon is a popular partner for construction workers.
5378.name: gigalith

5379.text: When it fires off energy with all its might, the power creates countless fissures on its body.
5379.name: gigalith

5380.text: It absorbs rays of sunlight and shoots out energy. It’s usually lurking deep beneath the surface.
5380.name: gigalith

5381.text: This hardy Pokémon can often be found on construction sites and in mines, working alongside people and Copperajah.
5381.name: gigalith

5382.text: Although its energy blasts can blow away a dump truck, they have a limitation— they can only be fired when the sun is out.
5382.name: gigalith

5383.text: Suction from its nostrils enables it to stick to cave walls during sleep. It leaves a heart-shaped mark behind.
5383.name: woobat

5384.text: Its habitat is dark forests and caves. It emits ultrasonic waves from its nose to learn about its surroundings.
5384.name: woobat

5385.text: The heart-shaped mark left on a body after a Woobat has been attached to it is said to bring good fortune.
5385.name: woobat

5386.text: While inside a cave, if you look up and see lots of heart-shaped marks lining the walls, it’s evidence that Woobat live there.
5386.name: woobat

5387.text: It emits ultrasonic waves as it flutters about, searching for its prey—bug Pokémon.
5387.name: woobat

5388.text: It emits sound waves of various frequencies from its nose, including some powerful enough to destroy rocks.
5388.name: swoobat

5389.text: It shakes its tail vigorously when it emits ultrasonic waves strong enough to reduce concrete to rubble.
5389.name: swoobat

5390.text: Anyone who comes into contact with the ultrasonic waves emitted by a courting male experiences a positive mood shift.
5390.name: swoobat

5391.text: Emitting powerful sound waves tires it out. Afterward, it won’t be able to fly for a little while.
5391.name: swoobat

5392.text: The auspicious shape of this Pokémon’s nose apparently led some regions to consider Swoobat a symbol of good luck.
5392.name: swoobat

5393.text: It can dig through the ground at a speed of 30 mph. It could give a car running aboveground a good race.
5393.name: drilbur

5394.text: It makes its way swiftly through the soil by putting both claws together and rotating at high speed.
5394.name: drilbur

5395.text: By spinning its body, it can dig straight through the ground at a speed of 30 mph.
5395.name: drilbur

5396.text: It brings its claws together and whirls around at high speed before rushing toward its prey.
5396.name: drilbur

5397.text: It’s a digger, using its claws to burrow through the ground. It causes damage to vegetable crops, so many farmers have little love for it.
5397.name: drilbur

5398.text: Forming a drill with its steel claws and head, it can bore through a steel plate, no matter how thick it is.
5398.name: excadrill

5399.text: It can help in tunnel construction. Its drill has evolved into steel strong enough to bore through iron plates.
5399.name: excadrill

5400.text: More than 300 feet below the surface, they build mazelike nests. Their activity can be destructive to subway tunnels.
5400.name: excadrill

5401.text: It’s not uncommon for tunnels that appear to have formed naturally to actually be a result of Excadrill’s rampant digging.
5401.name: excadrill

5402.text: Known as the Drill King, this Pokémon can tunnel through the terrain at speeds of over 90 mph.
5402.name: excadrill

5403.text: Its auditory sense is astounding. It has a radarlike ability to understand its surroundings through slight sounds.
5403.name: audino

5404.text: Using the feelers on its ears, it can tell how someone is feeling or when an egg might hatch.
5404.name: audino

5405.text: It touches others with the feelers on its ears, using the sound of their heartbeats to tell how they are feeling.
5405.name: audino

5406.text: Audino’s sense of hearing is superb. Not even a pebble rolling along over a mile away will escape Audino’s ears.
5406.name: audino

5407.text: This Pokémon has a kind heart. By touching with its feelers, Audino can gauge other creatures’ feelings and physical conditions.
5407.name: audino

5408.text: It fights by swinging a piece of lumber around. It is close to evolving when it can handle the lumber without difficulty.
5408.name: timburr

5409.text: These Pokémon appear at building sites and help out with construction. They always carry squared logs.
5409.name: timburr

5410.text: Always carrying squared logs, they help out with construction. As they grow, they carry bigger logs.
5410.name: timburr

5411.text: It loves helping out with construction projects. It loves it so much that if rain causes work to halt, it swings its log around and throws a tantrum.
5411.name: timburr

5412.text: Timburr that have started carrying logs that are about three times their size are nearly ready to evolve.
5412.name: timburr

5413.text: They strengthen their bodies by carrying steel beams. They show off their big muscles to their friends.
5413.name: gurdurr

5414.text: With strengthened bodies, they skillfully wield steel beams to take down buildings.
5414.name: gurdurr

5415.text: This Pokémon is so muscular and strongly built that even a group of wrestlers could not make it budge an inch.
5415.name: gurdurr

5416.text: It shows off its muscles to Machoke and other Gurdurr. If it fails to measure up to the other Pokémon, it lies low for a little while.
5416.name: gurdurr

5417.text: Gurdurr excels at demolition—construction is not its forte. In any case, there’s skill in the way this Pokémon wields its metal beam.
5417.name: gurdurr

5418.text: They use concrete pillars as walking canes. They know moves that enable them to swing the pillars freely in battle.
5418.name: conkeldurr

5419.text: It is thought that Conkeldurr taught humans how to make concrete more than 2,000 years ago.
5419.name: conkeldurr

5420.text: Rather than rely on force, they master moves that utilize the centrifugal force of spinning concrete.
5420.name: conkeldurr

5421.text: Concrete mixed by Conkeldurr is much more durable than normal concrete, even when the compositions of the two materials are the same.
5421.name: conkeldurr

5422.text: When going all out, this Pokémon throws aside its concrete pillars and leaps at opponents to pummel them with its fists.
5422.name: conkeldurr

5423.text: They warn others of danger by vibrating their cheeks to create a high-pitched sound.
5423.name: tympole

5424.text: By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound waves imperceptible to humans and warns others of danger.
5424.name: tympole

5425.text: By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound waves imperceptible to humans. It uses the rhythm of these sounds to talk.
5425.name: tympole

5426.text: Graceful ripples running across the water’s surface are a sure sign that Tympole are singing in high-pitched voices below.
5426.name: tympole

5427.text: It uses sound waves to communicate with others of its kind. People and other Pokémon species can’t hear its cries of warning.
5427.name: tympole

5428.text: When they vibrate the bumps on their heads, they can make waves in water or earthquake-like vibrations on land.
5428.name: palpitoad

5429.text: It lives in the water and on land. It uses its long, sticky tongue to immobilize its opponents.
5429.name: palpitoad

5430.text: It weakens its prey with sound waves intense enough to cause headaches, then entangles them with its sticky tongue.
5430.name: palpitoad

5431.text: On occasion, their cries are sublimely pleasing to the ear. Palpitoad with larger lumps on their bodies can sing with a wider range of sounds.
5431.name: palpitoad

5432.text: By putting power into its bumps, it creates vibrations and increases the power of its punches.
5432.name: seismitoad

5433.text: It increases the power of its punches by vibrating the bumps on its fists. It can turn a boulder to rubble with one punch.
5433.name: seismitoad

5434.text: They shoot paralyzing liquid from their head bumps. They use vibration to hurt their opponents.
5434.name: seismitoad

5435.text: The vibrating of the bumps all over its body causes earthquake-like tremors. Seismitoad and Croagunk are similar species.
5435.name: seismitoad

5436.text: This Pokémon is popular among the elderly, who say the vibrations of its lumps are great for massages.
5436.name: seismitoad

5437.text: When they encounter foes bigger than themselves, they try to throw them. They always travel in packs of five.
5437.name: throh

5438.text: When it tightens its belt, it becomes stronger. Wild Throh use vines to weave their own belts.
5438.name: throh

5439.text: When it encounters a foe bigger than itself, it wants to throw it. It changes belts as it gets stronger.
5439.name: throh

5440.text: It performs throwing moves with first-rate skill. Over the course of many battles, Throh’s belt grows darker as it absorbs its wearer’s sweat.
5440.name: throh

5441.text: They train in groups of five. Any member that can’t keep up will discard its belt and leave the group.
5441.name: throh

5442.text: The sound of Sawk punching boulders and trees can be heard all the way from the mountains where they train.
5442.name: sawk

5443.text: Desiring the strongest karate chop, they seclude themselves in mountains and train without sleeping.
5443.name: sawk

5444.text: Tying their belts gets them pumped and makes their punches more destructive. Disturbing their training angers them.
5444.name: sawk

5445.text: If you see a Sawk training in the mountains in its single-minded pursuit of strength, it’s best to quietly pass by.
5445.name: sawk

5446.text: The karate chops of a Sawk that’s trained itself to the limit can cleave the ocean itself.
5446.name: sawk

5447.text: Leavanny dress it in clothes they made for it when it hatched. It hides its head in its hood while it is sleeping.
5447.name: sewaddle

5448.text: This Pokémon makes clothes for itself. It chews up leaves and sews them with sticky thread extruded from its mouth.
5448.name: sewaddle

5449.text: Since this Pokémon makes its own clothes out of leaves, it is a popular mascot for fashion designers.
5449.name: sewaddle

5450.text: Preferring dark, damp places, it spends the entire day eating fallen leaves that lie around it.
5450.name: swadloon

5451.text: Forests where Swadloon live have superb foliage because the nutrients they make from fallen leaves nourish the plant life.
5451.name: swadloon

5452.text: It protects itself from the cold by wrapping up in leaves. It stays on the move, eating leaves in forests.
5452.name: swadloon

5453.text: Upon finding a small Pokémon, it weaves clothing for it from leaves by using the sticky silk secreted from its mouth.
5453.name: leavanny

5454.text: It keeps its eggs warm with heat from fermenting leaves. It also uses leaves to make warm wrappings for Sewaddle.
5454.name: leavanny

5455.text: Using the feelers on its head and tail, it picks up vibrations in the air to determine its prey’s location and state.
5455.name: venipede

5456.text: It discovers what is going on around it by using the feelers on its head and tail. It is brutally aggressive.
5456.name: venipede

5457.text: Its bite injects a potent poison, enough to paralyze large bird Pokémon that try to prey on it.
5457.name: venipede

5458.text: Venipede and Sizzlipede are similar species, but when the two meet, a huge fight ensues.
5458.name: venipede

5459.text: Its fangs are highly venomous. If this Pokémon finds prey it thinks it can eat, it leaps for them without any thought of how things might turn out.
5459.name: venipede

5460.text: Storing energy for evolution, it sits. But, when predators approach, it moves to stab them with poison spikes.
5460.name: whirlipede

5461.text: Protected by a hard shell, it spins its body like a wheel and crashes furiously into its enemies.
5461.name: whirlipede

5462.text: It is usually motionless, but when attacked, it rotates at high speed and then crashes into its opponent.
5462.name: whirlipede

5463.text: This Pokémon spins itself rapidly and charges into its opponents. Its top speed is just over 60 mph.
5463.name: whirlipede

5464.text: Whirlipede protects itself with a sturdy shell and poisonous spikes while it stores up the energy it’ll need for evolution.
5464.name: whirlipede

5465.text: Highly aggressive, it uses the claws near its neck to dig into its opponents and poison them.
5465.name: scolipede

5466.text: It clasps its prey with the claws on its neck until it stops moving. Then it finishes it off with deadly poison.
5466.name: scolipede

5467.text: With quick movements, it chases down its foes, attacking relentlessly with its horns until it prevails.
5467.name: scolipede

5468.text: Scolipede latches on to its prey with the claws on its neck before slamming them into the ground and jabbing them with its claws’ toxic spikes.
5468.name: scolipede

5469.text: Scolipede engage in fierce territorial battles with Centiskorch. At the end of one of these battles, the victor makes a meal of the loser.
5469.name: scolipede

5470.text: They go wherever the wind takes them. On rainy days, their bodies are heavier, so they take shelter beneath big trees.
5470.name: cottonee

5471.text: When attacked, it escapes by shooting cotton from its body. The cotton serves as a decoy to distract the attacker.
5471.name: cottonee

5472.text: Perhaps because they feel more at ease in a group, they stick to others they find. They end up looking like a cloud.
5472.name: cottonee

5473.text: When it finds others of its kind, they all stick together. When enough of them have collected, the mass resembles a cumulonimbus cloud.
5473.name: cottonee

5474.text: Pillows and beds stuffed with cotton exhaled by Cottonee are soft and puffy, light and airy— altogether top quality.
5474.name: cottonee

5475.text: To protect itself, it shoots cotton from its body. When it gets wet in the rain, its cotton grows moist and heavy, and it can’t move as well.
5475.name: cottonee

5476.text: When attacked, it expels cotton from its body to create a diversion. The cotton it loses grows back in quickly.
5476.name: cottonee

5477.text: It shoots cotton from its body to protect itself. If it gets caught up in hurricane-strength winds, it can get sent to the other side of the Earth.
5477.name: cottonee

5478.text: Weaving together the cotton of both Cottonee and Eldegoss produces exquisite cloth that’s highly prized by many luxury brands.
5478.name: cottonee

5479.text: Riding whirlwinds, they appear. These Pokémon sneak through gaps into houses and cause all sorts of mischief.
5479.name: whimsicott

5480.text: They appear along with whirlwinds. They pull pranks, such as moving furniture and leaving balls of cotton in homes.
5480.name: whimsicott

5481.text: Like the wind, it can slip through any gap, no matter how small. It leaves balls of white fluff behind.
5481.name: whimsicott

5482.text: It rides on the wind and slips into people’s homes. After it has turned a room into a cotton- filled mess, it giggles to itself and takes off.
5482.name: whimsicott

5483.text: This Pokémon appears, riding upon the wind. But if the wind gusts up, it’ll blow the cotton on this Pokémon’s head clean off.
5483.name: whimsicott

5484.text: This nuisance sneaks into people’s homes, where it hides important things and scatters cotton all over the place.
5484.name: whimsicott

5485.text: Whimsicott doesn’t live in a fixed location. It floats around on whirling winds, appearing all over the place to perform its mischief.
5485.name: whimsicott

5486.text: It scatters cotton all over the place as a prank. If it gets wet, it’ll become too heavy to move and have no choice but to answer for its mischief.
5486.name: whimsicott

5487.text: As long as this Pokémon bathes in sunlight, its cotton keeps growing. If too much cotton fluff builds up, Whimsicott tears it off and scatters it.
5487.name: whimsicott

5488.text: The leaves on its head grow right back even if they fall out. These bitter leaves refresh those who eat them.
5488.name: petilil

5489.text: The leaves on its head are very bitter. Eating one of these leaves is known to refresh a tired body.
5489.name: petilil

5490.text: Since they prefer moist, nutrient-rich soil, the areas where Petilil live are known to be good for growing plants.
5490.name: petilil

5491.text: Although the leaves on its head are bitter enough to cause dizziness, they provide relief from weariness—even more so when boiled.
5491.name: petilil

5492.text: By pruning the leaves on its head with regularity, this Pokémon can be grown into a fine plump shape.
5492.name: petilil

5493.text: Some say if you dry the leaves on its head, boil them down, and drink the infusion, your vigor will return, so Petilil is popular with the elderly.
5493.name: petilil

5494.text: They prefer clean water and soil. When the environment they live in turns bad, the whole bunch will up and move to a new area.
5494.name: petilil

5495.text: Petilil appears around sources of clean water. Boiling leaves from this Pokémon’s head results in a liquid that’s sometimes used as a bug repellent.
5495.name: petilil

5496.text: The deeper the color of a Petilil’s leaves, the healthier the Pokémon is. Petilil sometimes makes its home in a well-tended field or flowerbed.
5496.name: petilil

5497.text: The leaves on its head are highly valued for medicinal purposes. Dry the leaves in the sun, boil them, and then drink the bitter decoction for remarkably effective relief from fatigue.
5497.name: petilil

5498.text: The fragrance of the garland on its head has a relaxing effect, but taking care of it is very difficult.
5498.name: lilligant

5499.text: The fragrance of the garland on its head has a relaxing effect. It withers if a Trainer does not take good care of it.
5499.name: lilligant

5500.text: Even veteran Trainers face a challenge in getting its beautiful flower to bloom. This Pokémon is popular with celebrities.
5500.name: lilligant

5501.text: No matter how much time and money is spent raising it, its flowers are the most beautiful when they bloom in the wild.
5501.name: lilligant

5502.text: As soon as it finds a male to be its partner, the beautiful flower on its head darkens, droops, and withers away.
5502.name: lilligant

5503.text: The fragrance of its flower differs slightly depending on the soil where it grew up. Sniffing the aroma calms your heart and mind.
5503.name: lilligant

5504.text: It’s well liked by other Pokémon because of its beauty. The flower on its head needs constant care, or it will soon wither and rot.
5504.name: lilligant

5505.text: It’s believed that even first-rate gardeners have a hard time getting the flower on a Lilligant’s head to bloom.
5505.name: lilligant

5506.text: Essential oils made from Lilligant flowers have a sublime scent, but they’re also staggeringly expensive.
5506.name: lilligant

5507.text: I suspect that its well-developed legs are the result of a life spent on mountains covered in deep snow. The scent it exudes from its flower crown heartens those in proximity.
5507.name: lilligant

5508.text: Red and blue Basculin get along so poorly, they’ll start fighting instantly. These Pokémon are very hostile.
5508.name: basculin

5509.text: Red- and blue-striped Basculin are very violent and always fighting. They are also remarkably tasty.
5509.name: basculin

5510.text: Red and blue Basculin usually do not get along, but sometimes members of one school mingle with the other’s school.
5510.name: basculin

5511.text: Savage, violent Pokémon, red and blue Basculin are always fighting each other over territory.
5511.name: basculin

5512.text: When a school of Basculin appears in a lake, everything else disappears, except for Corphish and Crawdaunt. That’s how violent Basculin are.
5512.name: basculin

5513.text: Anglers love the fight this Pokémon puts up on the hook. And there are always more to catch— many people release them into lakes illicitly.
5513.name: basculin

5514.text: In the past, it often appeared on the dinner table. The meat of red-striped Basculin is on the fatty side, and it’s more popular with the youth.
5514.name: basculin

5515.text: Though it differs from other Basculin in several respects, including demeanor—this one is gentle—I have categorized it as a regional form given the vast array of shared qualities.
5515.name: basculin

5516.text: They live hidden under hot desert sands in order to keep their body temperature from dropping.
5516.name: sandile

5517.text: It moves along below the sand’s surface, except for its nose and eyes. A dark membrane shields its eyes from the sun.
5517.name: sandile

5518.text: They live buried in the sands of the desert. The sun-warmed sands prevent their body temperature from dropping.
5518.name: sandile

5519.text: It submerges itself in sand and moves as if swimming. This wise behavior keeps its enemies from finding it and maintains its temperature.
5519.name: sandile

5520.text: It conceals itself in the sand and chomps down on the legs of any prey that unwarily walk over it. Its favorite food is Trapinch.
5520.name: sandile

5521.text: Alola, where it’s warm all year round, is a comfortable environment for this Pokémon. Sometimes you’ll even see it outside of deserts.
5521.name: sandile

5522.text: Sandile’s still not good at hunting, so it mostly eats things that have collapsed in the desert. It’s called “the cleaner of the desert.”
5522.name: sandile

5523.text: The desert gets cold at night, so when the sun sets, this Pokémon burrows deep into the sand and sleeps until sunrise.
5523.name: sandile

5524.text: Sandile is small, but its legs and lower body are powerful. Pushing sand aside as it goes, Sandile moves through the desert as if it’s swimming.
5524.name: sandile

5525.text: Protected by thin membranes, their eyes can see even in the dead of night. They live in groups of a few individuals.
5525.name: krokorok

5526.text: They live in groups of a few individuals. Protective membranes shield their eyes from sandstorms.
5526.name: krokorok

5527.text: The special membrane covering its eyes can sense the heat of objects, so it can see its surroundings even in darkness.
5527.name: krokorok

5528.text: They move in groups of a few individuals. A female is often the leader of the group, and the males will gather food.
5528.name: krokorok

5529.text: Thanks to the special membrane covering its eyes, it can see its surroundings clearly, even in the middle of the night.
5529.name: krokorok

5530.text: Krokorok really hates it when its body gets cold. On nights when the temperature drops, it digs deep into the desert sands.
5530.name: krokorok

5531.text: It buries some of its prey in the sand to use as emergency meals when its hunts are unsuccessful.
5531.name: krokorok

5532.text: Krokorok has specialized eyes that enable it to see in the dark. This ability lets Krokorok hunt in the dead of night without getting lost.
5532.name: krokorok

5533.text: Although this Pokémon has specialized eyes that allow it to see in the dark, Krokorok won’t move much at night—the desert gets cold after sunset.
5533.name: krokorok

5534.text: It can expand the focus of its eyes, enabling it to see objects in the far distance as if it were using binoculars.
5534.name: krookodile

5535.text: Very violent Pokémon, they try to clamp down on anything that moves in front of their eyes.
5535.name: krookodile

5536.text: They never allow prey to escape. Their jaws are so powerful, they can crush the body of an automobile.
5536.name: krookodile

5537.text: Its unique faculty of sight can detect small prey more than 30 miles away, even in the midst of a sandstorm.
5537.name: krookodile

5538.text: After clamping down with its powerful jaws, it twists its body around to rip its prey in half.
5538.name: krookodile

5539.text: When it spots prey, even at a distance of over 30 miles, it swims through the desert as if it were water, then jumps out and chomps them.
5539.name: krookodile

5540.text: It conceals itself in sandstorms that Flygon whip up and waits patiently for prey to appear.
5540.name: krookodile

5541.text: This Pokémon is known as the Bully of the Sands. Krookodile’s mighty jaws can bite through heavy plates of iron with almost no effort at all.
5541.name: krookodile

5542.text: While terribly aggressive, Krookodile also has the patience to stay hidden under sand for days, lying in wait for prey.
5542.name: krookodile

5543.text: When its internal fire is burning, it cannot calm down and it runs around. When the fire diminishes, it falls asleep.
5543.name: darumaka

5544.text: Darumaka’s droppings are hot, so people used to put them in their clothes to keep themselves warm.
5544.name: darumaka

5545.text: When it sleeps, it pulls its limbs into its body and its internal fire goes down to 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit.
5545.name: darumaka

5546.text: It derives its power from fire burning inside its body. If the fire dwindles, this Pokémon will immediately fall asleep.
5546.name: darumaka

5547.text: This popular symbol of good fortune will never fall over in its sleep, no matter how it’s pushed or pulled.
5547.name: darumaka

5548.text: When weakened in battle, it transforms into a stone statue. Then it sharpens its mind and fights on mentally.
5548.name: darmanitan

5549.text: When one is injured in a fierce battle, it hardens into a stone-like form. Then it meditates and sharpens its mind.
5549.name: darmanitan

5550.text: Its internal fire burns at 2,500 degrees Fahrenheit, making enough power that it can destroy a dump truck with one punch.
5550.name: darmanitan

5551.text: The thick arms of this hot-blooded Pokémon can deliver punches capable of obliterating a dump truck.
5551.name: darmanitan

5552.text: This Pokémon’s power level rises along with the temperature of its fire, which can reach 2,500 degrees Fahrenheit.
5552.name: darmanitan

5553.text: When it moves rhythmically, it makes a sound similar to maracas, making the surprised Pokémon flee.
5553.name: maractus

5554.text: It uses an up-tempo song and dance to drive away the bird Pokémon that prey on its flower seeds.
5554.name: maractus

5555.text: Arid regions are their habitat. They move rhythmically, making a sound similar to maracas.
5555.name: maractus

5556.text: With noises that could be mistaken for the rattles of maracas, it creates an upbeat rhythm, startling bird Pokémon and making them fly off in a hurry.
5556.name: maractus

5557.text: Once each year, this Pokémon scatters its seeds. They’re jam-packed with nutrients, making them a precious food source out in the desert.
5557.name: maractus

5558.text: This Pokémon can easily melt holes in hard rocks with a liquid secreted from its mouth.
5558.name: dwebble

5559.text: It makes a hole in a suitable rock. If that rock breaks, the Pokémon remains agitated until it locates a replacement.
5559.name: dwebble

5560.text: When it finds a stone of a suitable size, it secretes a liquid from its mouth to open up a hole to crawl into.
5560.name: dwebble

5561.text: When it finds a stone appealing, it creates a hole inside it and uses it as its home. This Pokémon is the natural enemy of Roggenrola and Rolycoly.
5561.name: dwebble

5562.text: It first tries to find a rock to live in, but if there are no suitable rocks to be found, Dwebble may move in to the ports of a Hippowdon.
5562.name: dwebble

5563.text: When its boulder is broken in battles for territory, it feels unsure and begins to weaken.
5563.name: crustle

5564.text: It possesses legs of enormous strength, enabling it to carry heavy slabs for many days, even when crossing arid land.
5564.name: crustle

5565.text: Competing for territory, Crustle fight viciously. The one whose boulder is broken is the loser of the battle.
5565.name: crustle

5566.text: This highly territorial Pokémon prefers dry climates. It won’t come out of its boulder on rainy days.
5566.name: crustle

5567.text: Its thick claws are its greatest weapons. They’re mighty enough to crack Rhyperior’s carapace.
5567.name: crustle

5568.text: It immediately headbutts anyone that makes eye contact with it. Its skull is massively thick.
5568.name: scraggy

5569.text: Its skin has a rubbery elasticity, so it can reduce damage by defensively pulling its skin up to its neck.
5569.name: scraggy

5570.text: Proud of its sturdy skull, it suddenly headbutts everything, but its weight makes it unstable, too.
5570.name: scraggy

5571.text: They move in small groups, walking around lazily. Anyone who makes eye contact gets smacked with a headbutt.
5571.name: scraggy

5572.text: It stretches its saggy skin up to its neck to protect itself. The saggier their skin, the more respect they garner.
5572.name: scraggy

5573.text: If it locks eyes with you, watch out! Nothing and no one is safe from the reckless headbutts of this troublesome Pokémon.
5573.name: scraggy

5574.text: It protects itself with its durable skin. It’s thought that this Pokémon will evolve once its skin has completely stretched out.
5574.name: scraggy

5575.text: Groups of them beat up anything that enters their territory. Each can spit acidic liquid from its mouth.
5575.name: scrafty

5576.text: It pulls up its shed skin to protect itself while it kicks. The bigger the crest, the more respected it is.
5576.name: scrafty

5577.text: It can smash concrete blocks with its kicking attacks. The one with the biggest crest is the group leader.
5577.name: scrafty

5578.text: This Pokémon may be rude, but it takes very good care of its family, its friends, and its turf.
5578.name: scrafty

5579.text: It taunts its opponents by spitting. It has a certain territory that it never leaves its whole life long.
5579.name: scrafty

5580.text: As halfhearted as this Pokémon’s kicks may seem, they pack enough power to shatter Conkeldurr’s concrete pillars.
5580.name: scrafty

5581.text: While mostly known for having the temperament of an aggressive ruffian, this Pokémon takes very good care of its family, friends, and territory.
5581.name: scrafty

5582.text: They never vary the route they fly, because their memories of guarding an ancient city remain steadfast.
5582.name: sigilyph

5583.text: The guardians of an ancient city, they use their psychic power to attack enemies that invade their territory.
5583.name: sigilyph

5584.text: The guardians of an ancient city, they always fly the same route while keeping watch for invaders.
5584.name: sigilyph

5585.text: Psychic power allows these Pokémon to fly. Some say they were the guardians of an ancient city. Others say they were the guardians’ emissaries.
5585.name: sigilyph

5586.text: A discovery was made in the desert where Sigilyph fly. The ruins of what may have been an ancient city were found beneath the sands.
5586.name: sigilyph

5587.text: These Pokémon arose from the spirits of people interred in graves. Each retains memories of its former life.
5587.name: yamask

5588.text: Each of them carries a mask that used to be its face when it was human. Sometimes they look at it and cry.
5588.name: yamask

5589.text: It wanders through ruins by night, carrying a mask that’s said to have been the face it had when it was still human.
5589.name: yamask

5590.text: The spirit of a person from a bygone age became this Pokémon. It rambles through ruins, searching for someone who knows its face.
5590.name: yamask

5591.text: They pretend to be elaborate coffins to teach lessons to grave robbers. Their bodies are covered in pure gold.
5591.name: cofagrigus

5592.text: It has been said that they swallow those who get too close and turn them into mummies. They like to eat gold nuggets.
5592.name: cofagrigus

5593.text: Grave robbers who mistake them for real coffins and get too close end up trapped inside their bodies.
5593.name: cofagrigus

5594.text: This Pokémon has a body of sparkling gold. People say it no longer remembers that it was once human.
5594.name: cofagrigus

5595.text: There are many depictions of Cofagrigus decorating ancient tombs. They’re symbols of the wealth that kings of bygone eras had.
5595.name: cofagrigus

5596.text: About 100 million years ago, these Pokémon swam in oceans. It is thought they also went on land to attack prey.
5596.name: tirtouga

5597.text: Restored from a fossil, this Pokémon can dive to depths beyond half a mile.
5597.name: tirtouga

5598.text: Based on studies of its skeletal structure, it can apparently dive to ocean depths of over half a mile.
5598.name: tirtouga

5599.text: Reputed to be the ancestor of most turtle Pokémon, it lived in warm seas approximately a hundred million years ago.
5599.name: tirtouga

5600.text: It was restored from an ancient fossil. Tirtouga lived in the sea but came up onto the land to search for prey.
5600.name: tirtouga

5601.text: Its hunting grounds encompassed a broad area, from the land to more than half a mile deep in the ocean.
5601.name: tirtouga

5602.text: This Pokémon inhabited ancient seas. Although it can only crawl, it still comes up onto land in search of prey.
5602.name: tirtouga

5603.text: Tirtouga is considered to be the ancestor of many turtle Pokémon. It was restored to life from a fossil.
5603.name: tirtouga

5604.text: Incredible jaw strength enables them to chew up steel beams and rocks along with their prey.
5604.name: carracosta

5605.text: They can live both in the ocean and on land. A slap from one of them is enough to open a hole in the bottom of a tanker.
5605.name: carracosta

5606.text: It could knock out a foe with a slap from one of its developed front appendages and chew it up, shell or bones and all.
5606.name: carracosta

5607.text: It constructed its sturdy shell by crunching and swallowing the hard shells or bones of its prey.
5607.name: carracosta

5608.text: Active both on land and in the sea, this Pokémon drags its land-based prey into the water to finish it off.
5608.name: carracosta

5609.text: Its jaws are terrifyingly powerful. It could eat Omastar and Omanyte whole and not be bothered in the slightest by their shells.
5609.name: carracosta

5610.text: Carracosta eats every last bit of the prey it catches, even the shells and bones, to further strengthen its sturdy shell.
5610.name: carracosta

5611.text: Carracosta completely devours its prey—bones, shells, and all. Because of this, Carracosta’s own shell grows thick and sturdy.
5611.name: carracosta

5612.text: This Pokémon emerges from the water in search of prey despite the fact that it moves more slowly on land.
5612.name: carracosta

5613.text: It was revived from an ancient fossil. Not able to fly, it lived in treetops and hopped from one branch to another.
5613.name: archen

5614.text: Revived from a fossil, this Pokémon is thought to be the ancestor of all bird Pokémon.
5614.name: archen

5615.text: Said to be an ancestor of bird Pokémon, they were unable to fly and moved about by hopping from one branch to another.
5615.name: archen

5616.text: It is the ancestor of all bird Pokémon. Archen itself could not actually fly but moved by hopping from treetop to treetop.
5616.name: archen

5617.text: To all appearances flightless, it was able to glide down from tall treetops to snag its prey.
5617.name: archen

5618.text: Once thought to be the ancestor of all bird Pokémon, some of the latest research suggests that may not be the case.
5618.name: archen

5619.text: Restored from a fossil, this ancient bird Pokémon has wings but can’t yet fly.
5619.name: archen

5620.text: This Pokémon was successfully restored from a fossil. As research suggested, Archen is unable to fly. But it’s very good at jumping.
5620.name: archen

5621.text: Archen is said to be the ancestor of bird Pokémon. It lived in treetops, eating berries and bug Pokémon.
5621.name: archen

5622.text: It runs better than it flies. It catches prey by running at speeds comparable to those of an automobile.
5622.name: archeops

5623.text: They are intelligent and will cooperate to catch prey. From the ground, they use a running start to take flight.
5623.name: archeops

5624.text: It runs better than it flies. It takes off into the sky by running at a speed of 25 mph.
5624.name: archeops

5625.text: Although apparently able to fly, they tended to run along the ground, averaging speeds of roughly 25 mph.
5625.name: archeops

5626.text: They hunted in flocks. When one Archeops had the prey cornered, another would swoop on it.
5626.name: archeops

5627.text: This ancient Pokémon’s plumage is delicate, so if anyone other than an experienced professional tries to restore it, they will fail.
5627.name: archeops

5628.text: Said to be an ancestor of bird Pokémon, the muscles it uses to flap its wings are still weak, so it needs a long runway in order to take off.
5628.name: archeops

5629.text: It needs a running start to take off. If Archeops wants to fly, it first needs to run nearly 25 mph, building speed over a course of about 2.5 miles.
5629.name: archeops

5630.text: Though capable of flight, Archeops was apparently better at hunting on the ground.
5630.name: archeops

5631.text: Wanting more garbage, they follow people who litter. They always belch poison gas.
5631.name: trubbish

5632.text: The combination of garbage bags and industrial waste caused the chemical reaction that created this Pokémon.
5632.name: trubbish

5633.text: Inhaling the gas they belch will make you sleep for a week. They prefer unsanitary places.
5633.name: trubbish

5634.text: Unsanitary places are what they like best. They can be spotted in Alola, often with Grimer in hot pursuit.
5634.name: trubbish

5635.text: It gorges on trash until its stomach is full. Then it belches toxic gas. An unlucky whiff of gas will put a person in the hospital.
5635.name: trubbish

5636.text: Poisonous gas leaks out of it when it breathes. Muk that catch a whiff of that stench will come drooling.
5636.name: trubbish

5637.text: If a young Pokémon or child breathes in the toxic gas that Trubbish belches out, it could be a life-threatening situation.
5637.name: trubbish

5638.text: Its favorite places are unsanitary ones. If you leave trash lying around, you could even find one of these Pokémon living in your room.
5638.name: trubbish

5639.text: This Pokémon was born from a bag stuffed with trash. Galarian Weezing relish the fumes belched by Trubbish.
5639.name: trubbish

5640.text: They absorb garbage and make it part of their bodies. They shoot a poisonous liquid from their right-hand fingertips.
5640.name: garbodor

5641.text: It clenches opponents with its left arm and finishes them off with foul-smelling poison gas belched from its mouth.
5641.name: garbodor

5642.text: Consuming garbage makes new kinds of poison gases and liquids inside their bodies.
5642.name: garbodor

5643.text: Beware the poisonous liquid it shoots from its right arm. If even a little of it gets on you, you’ll experience the effects of the unidentified toxin.
5643.name: garbodor

5644.text: For a time, their numbers increased explosively in Alola. Since the arrival of Grimer, their population has decreased dramatically.
5644.name: garbodor

5645.text: It locks opponents in place with its left hand, immobilizing them by entirely dousing their bodies with poisonous liquid.
5645.name: garbodor

5646.text: Some say the reason Garbodor in Alola are a little stronger than their counterparts elsewhere is the presence of Muk, their natural enemy.
5646.name: garbodor

5647.text: This Pokémon eats trash, which turns into poison inside its body. The main component of the poison depends on what sort of trash was eaten.
5647.name: garbodor

5648.text: The toxic liquid it launches from its right arm is so virulent that it can kill a weakened creature instantly.
5648.name: garbodor

5649.text: It changes into the forms of others to surprise them. Apparently, it often transforms into a silent child.
5649.name: zorua

5650.text: It changes so it looks just like its foe, tricks it, and then uses that opportunity to flee.
5650.name: zorua

5651.text: To protect themselves from danger, they hide their true identities by transforming into people and Pokémon.
5651.name: zorua

5652.text: This Pokémon has a cowardly disposition, so when it’s not around friends, it basically always stays transformed as something else.
5652.name: zorua

5653.text: If a normally talkative child suddenly stops talking, it may have been replaced by Zorua.
5653.name: zorua

5654.text: Zorua is a timid Pokémon. This disposition seems to be what led to the development of Zorua’s ability to take on the forms of other creatures.
5654.name: zorua

5655.text: Zorua sometimes transforms into a person and goes into cities to search for food. When Zorua does this, it usually takes on the form of a child.
5655.name: zorua

5656.text: A once-departed soul, returned to life in Hisui. Derives power from resentment, which rises as energy atop its head and takes on the forms of foes. In this way, Zorua vents lingering malice.
5656.name: zorua

5657.text: Stories say those who tried to catch Zoroark were trapped in an illusion and punished.
5657.name: zoroark

5658.text: Each has the ability to fool a large group of people simultaneously. They protect their lair with illusory scenery.
5658.name: zoroark

5659.text: Bonds between these Pokémon are very strong. It protects the safety of its pack by tricking its opponents.
5659.name: zoroark

5660.text: It doesn’t just transform itself—it also has the power to make hundreds of people see its illusions.
5660.name: zoroark

5661.text: If it thinks humans are going to discover its den, Zoroark shows them visions that make them wander around in the woods.
5661.name: zoroark

5662.text: This Pokémon cares deeply about others of its kind, and it will conjure terrifying illusions to keep its den and pack safe.
5662.name: zoroark

5663.text: Seeking to ease the burden of their solitude, lonely Trainers tell Zoroark to show illusions to them.
5663.name: zoroark

5664.text: With its disheveled white fur, it looks like an embodiment of death. Heedless of its own safety, Zoroark attacks its nemeses with a bitter energy so intense, it lacerates Zoroark's own body.
5664.name: zoroark

5665.text: They greet one another by rubbing each other with their tails, which are always kept well groomed and clean.
5665.name: minccino

5666.text: Minccino greet each other by grooming one another thoroughly with their tails.
5666.name: minccino

5667.text: These Pokémon prefer a tidy habitat. They are always sweeping and dusting, using their tails as brooms.
5667.name: minccino

5668.text: A clean freak that will not allow even the slightest mess, it uses its tail like a mop to thoroughly clean any and all filth.
5668.name: minccino

5669.text: When its tail has gotten dirty from self-cleaning or from cleaning its nest, Minccino spends a whole day washing its tail in clean spring water.
5669.name: minccino

5670.text: The way it brushes away grime with its tail can be helpful when cleaning. But its focus on spotlessness can make cleaning more of a hassle.
5670.name: minccino

5671.text: They pet each other with their tails as a form of greeting. Of the two, the one whose tail is fluffier is a bit more boastful.
5671.name: minccino

5672.text: Their white fur is coated in a special oil that makes it easy for them to deflect attacks.
5672.name: cinccino

5673.text: Their white fur feels amazing to touch. Their fur repels dust and prevents static electricity from building up.
5673.name: cinccino

5674.text: Cinccino’s body is coated in a special oil that helps it deflect attacks, such as punches.
5674.name: cinccino

5675.text: The white parts of its coat are covered in an oil secreted from its body, so this Pokémon can slide right away from its enemies’ attacks.
5675.name: cinccino

5676.text: The oil that seeps from its body is really smooth. For people troubled by bad skin, this oil is an effective treatment.
5676.name: cinccino

5677.text: Its body secretes oil that this Pokémon spreads over its nest as a coating to protect it from dust. Cinccino won’t tolerate even a speck of the stuff.
5677.name: cinccino

5678.text: A special oil that seeps through their fur helps them avoid attacks. The oil fetches a high price at market.
5678.name: cinccino

5679.text: It stares intently at everything. It can become so obsessed with watching that it doesn’t notice attacks.
5679.name: gothita

5680.text: Their ribbonlike feelers increase their psychic power. They are always staring at something.
5680.name: gothita

5681.text: They intently observe both Trainers and Pokémon. Apparently, they are looking at something that only Gothita can see.
5681.name: gothita

5682.text: Though they’re still only babies, there’s psychic power stored in their ribbonlike feelers, and sometimes they use that power to fight.
5682.name: gothita

5683.text: Even when nobody seems to be around, Gothita can still be heard making a muted cry. Many believe it’s speaking to something only it can see.
5683.name: gothita

5684.text: They use hypnosis to control people and Pokémon. Tales of Gothorita leading people astray are told in every corner.
5684.name: gothorita

5685.text: Starlight is the source of their power. At night, they mark star positions by using psychic power to float stones.
5685.name: gothorita

5686.text: According to many old tales, it creates friends for itself by controlling sleeping children on starry nights.
5686.name: gothorita

5687.text: It’s said that when stars shine in the night sky, this Pokémon will spirit away sleeping children. Some call it the Witch of Punishment.
5687.name: gothorita

5688.text: On nights when the stars shine, this Pokémon’s psychic power is at its strongest. It’s unknown just what link Gothorita has to the greater universe.
5688.name: gothorita

5689.text: It can see the future from the movement of the stars. When it learns its Trainer’s life span, it cries in sadness.
5689.name: gothitelle

5690.text: Starry skies thousands of light-years away are visible in the space distorted by their intense psychic power.
5690.name: gothitelle

5691.text: They can predict the future from the placement and movement of the stars. They can see Trainers’ life spans.
5691.name: gothitelle

5692.text: It has tremendous psychic power, but it dislikes conflict. It’s also able to predict the future based on the movement of the stars.
5692.name: gothitelle

5693.text: A criminal who was shown his fate by a Gothitelle went missing that same day and was never seen again.
5693.name: gothitelle

5694.text: Because their bodies are enveloped in a special liquid, they can survive in any environment.
5694.name: solosis

5695.text: Because their bodies are enveloped in a special liquid, they are fine in any environment, no matter how severe.
5695.name: solosis

5696.text: They drive away attackers by unleashing psychic power. They can use telepathy to talk with others.
5696.name: solosis

5697.text: It communicates with others telepathically. Its body is encapsulated in liquid, but if it takes a heavy blow, the liquid will leak out.
5697.name: solosis

5698.text: Many say that the special liquid covering this Pokémon’s body would allow it to survive in the vacuum of space.
5698.name: solosis

5699.text: When their brains, now divided in two, are thinking the same thoughts, these Pokémon exhibit their maximum power.
5699.name: duosion

5700.text: Since they have two divided brains, at times they suddenly try to take two different actions at once.
5700.name: duosion

5701.text: When their two divided brains think the same thoughts, their psychic power is maximized.
5701.name: duosion

5702.text: Its psychic power can supposedly cover a range of more than half a mile—but only if its two brains can agree with each other.
5702.name: duosion

5703.text: Its brain has split into two, and the two halves rarely think alike. Its actions are utterly unpredictable.
5703.name: duosion

5704.text: These remarkably intelligent Pokémon fight by controlling arms that can grip with rock-crushing power.
5704.name: reuniclus

5705.text: They use psychic power to control their arms, which are made of a special liquid. They can crush boulders psychically.
5705.name: reuniclus

5706.text: When Reuniclus shake hands, a network forms between their brains, increasing their psychic power.
5706.name: reuniclus

5707.text: While it could use its psychic abilities in battle, this Pokémon prefers to swing its powerful arms around to beat opponents into submission.
5707.name: reuniclus

5708.text: It’s said that drinking the liquid surrounding Reuniclus grants wisdom. Problem is, the liquid is highly toxic to anything besides Reuniclus itself.
5708.name: reuniclus

5709.text: These bird Pokémon are excellent divers. They swim around in the water eating their favorite food--peat moss.
5709.name: ducklett

5710.text: When attacked, it uses its feathers to splash water, escaping under cover of the spray.
5710.name: ducklett

5711.text: They are better at swimming than flying, and they happily eat their favorite food, peat moss, as they dive underwater.
5711.name: ducklett

5712.text: It administers sharp, powerful pecks with its bill. It whips its long neck to deliver forceful repeated strikes.
5712.name: swanna

5713.text: Despite their elegant appearance, they can flap their wings strongly and fly for thousands of miles.
5713.name: swanna

5714.text: Swanna start to dance at dusk. The one dancing in the middle is the leader of the flock.
5714.name: swanna

5715.text: Theoretically, this Pokémon formed from icicles bathed in energy from the morning sun. Their breath is -58° F.
5715.name: vanillite

5716.text: The temperature of their breath is -58 degrees Fahrenheit. They create snow crystals and make snow fall in the areas around them.
5716.name: vanillite

5717.text: This Pokémon formed from icicles bathed in energy from the morning sun. It sleeps buried in snow.
5717.name: vanillite

5718.text: Born of an icicle, this Pokémon uses its frosty breath to make ice crystals, causing snow to fall.
5718.name: vanillite

5719.text: It feels pleasantly cool when embraced. This Pokémon is treasured by households in warm regions.
5719.name: vanillite

5720.text: It exhales cold air that is at –58 degrees Fahrenheit. When it’s in a warm place, it shrinks little by little.
5720.name: vanillite

5721.text: When the morning sun hit an icicle, it wished not to melt, and thus Vanillite was born. At night, it buries itself in snow to sleep.
5721.name: vanillite

5722.text: Unable to survive in hot areas, it makes itself comfortable by breathing out air cold enough to cause snow. It burrows into the snow to sleep.
5722.name: vanillite

5723.text: Supposedly, this Pokémon was born from an icicle. It spews out freezing air at −58 degrees Fahrenheit to make itself more comfortable.
5723.name: vanillite

5724.text: It conceals itself from enemy eyes by creating many small ice particles and hiding among them.
5724.name: vanillish

5725.text: They cool down the surrounding air and create ice particles, which they use to freeze their foes.
5725.name: vanillish

5726.text: Snowy mountains are this Pokémon’s habitat. During an ancient ice age, they moved to southern areas.
5726.name: vanillish

5727.text: Hot days cause its body to melt. It can be restored by refreezing it, but the process leaves its body slightly warped.
5727.name: vanillish

5728.text: This Pokémon has existed since the Ice Age. It controls particles of ice, freezes its opponents, and then shatters them with a headbutt.
5728.name: vanillish

5729.text: It sprays its enemies with grains of ice to freeze them. Most Vanillish in Alola are smaller than average.
5729.name: vanillish

5730.text: This hearty Pokémon survived the Ice Age. It’s incredibly popular in very hot regions.
5730.name: vanillish

5731.text: By drinking pure water, it grows its icy body. This Pokémon can be hard to find on days with warm, sunny weather.
5731.name: vanillish

5732.text: It blasts enemies with cold air reaching −148 degrees Fahrenheit, freezing them solid. But it spares their lives afterward—it’s a kind Pokémon.
5732.name: vanillish

5733.text: If both heads get angry simultaneously, this Pokémon expels a blizzard, burying everything in snow.
5733.name: vanilluxe

5734.text: Swallowing large amounts of water, they make snow clouds inside their bodies and, when angry, cause violent blizzards.
5734.name: vanilluxe

5735.text: Each of its two heads has a brain, and when they are in agreement, it attacks its enemies by exhaling a violent blizzard.
5735.name: vanilluxe

5736.text: Even if it loses one of its heads, it can live relatively problem-free. It makes snow clouds inside its body.
5736.name: vanilluxe

5737.text: It blasts blizzards from its two mouths. It can create snow anywhere, so it gets a lot of love from skiers and snowboarders.
5737.name: vanilluxe

5738.text: Vanilluxe is born when two Vanillish, half-melted by the day’s light, stick to each other and freeze together in the cold return of night.
5738.name: vanilluxe

5739.text: When its anger reaches a breaking point, this Pokémon unleashes a fierce blizzard that freezes every creature around it, be they friend or foe.
5739.name: vanilluxe

5740.text: People believe this Pokémon formed when two Vanillish stuck together. Its body temperature is roughly 21 degrees Fahrenheit.
5740.name: vanilluxe

5741.text: The color and scent of their fur changes to match the mountain grass. When they sense hostility, they hide in the grass.
5741.name: deerling

5742.text: Their coloring changes according to the seasons and can be slightly affected by the temperature and humidity as well.
5742.name: deerling

5743.text: The turning of the seasons changes the color and scent of this Pokémon’s fur. People use it to mark the seasons.
5743.name: deerling

5744.text: The plants growing on its horns change according to the season. The leaders of the herd possess magnificent horns.
5744.name: sawsbuck

5745.text: They migrate according to the seasons. People can tell the season by looking at Sawsbuck’s horns.
5745.name: sawsbuck

5746.text: They migrate according to the seasons, so some people call Sawsbuck the harbingers of spring.
5746.name: sawsbuck

5747.text: It glides on its outstretched membrane while shocking foes with the electricity stored in the pouches on its cheeks.
5747.name: emolga

5748.text: They live on treetops and glide using the inside of a cape-like membrane while discharging electricity.
5748.name: emolga

5749.text: The energy made in its cheeks’ electric pouches is stored inside its membrane and released while it is gliding.
5749.name: emolga

5750.text: It glides using its cape-like membrane. Electrical energy scatters from it, shocking its friends and foes alike.
5750.name: emolga

5751.text: It grills berries and bug Pokémon with electric shocks and makes a meal of them. It usually nests in the holes gouged in trees by Pikipek.
5751.name: emolga

5752.text: They store up electricity to fly through the air. When thunder cracks at night, sometimes there are almost enough of them to blot out the sky.
5752.name: emolga

5753.text: As it flies, it scatters electricity around, so bird Pokémon keep their distance. That’s why Emolga can keep all its food to itself.
5753.name: emolga

5754.text: As Emolga flutters through the air, it crackles with electricity. This Pokémon is cute, but it can cause a lot of trouble.
5754.name: emolga

5755.text: This Pokémon absolutely loves sweet berries. Sometimes it stuffs its cheeks full of so much food that it can’t fly properly.
5755.name: emolga

5756.text: When they feel threatened, they spit an acidic liquid to drive attackers away. This Pokémon targets Shelmet.
5756.name: karrablast

5757.text: These mysterious Pokémon evolve when they receive electrical stimulation while they are in the same place as Shelmet.
5757.name: karrablast

5758.text: For some reason they evolve when they receive electrical energy while they are attacking Shelmet.
5758.name: karrablast

5759.text: Its strange physiology reacts to electrical energy in interesting ways. The presence of a Shelmet will cause this Pokémon to evolve.
5759.name: karrablast

5760.text: It spits a liquid from its mouth to melt through Shelmet’s shell. Karrablast doesn’t eat the shell— it eats only the contents.
5760.name: karrablast

5761.text: They fly around at high speed, striking with their pointed spears. Even when in trouble, they face opponents bravely.
5761.name: escavalier

5762.text: Wearing the shell covering they stole from Shelmet, they defend themselves and attack with two lances.
5762.name: escavalier

5763.text: These Pokémon evolve by wearing the shell covering of a Shelmet. The steel armor protects their whole body.
5763.name: escavalier

5764.text: They use shells they’ve stolen from Shelmet to arm and protect themselves. They’re very popular Pokémon in the Galar region.
5764.name: escavalier

5765.text: It charges its enemies, lances at the ready. An image of one of its duels is captured in a famous painting of Escavalier clashing with Sirfetch’d.
5765.name: escavalier

5766.text: For some reason, this Pokémon resembles a Poké Ball. They release poison spores to repel those who try to catch them.
5766.name: foongus

5767.text: It lures people in with its Poké Ball pattern, then releases poison spores. Why it resembles a Poké Ball is unknown.
5767.name: foongus
