6311.text: It wraps its ribbonlike feelers around the arm of its beloved Trainer and walks with him or her.
6311.name: sylveon

6312.text: Its ribbonlike feelers give off an aura that weakens hostility in its prey, causing them to let down their guard. Then it attacks.
6312.name: sylveon

6313.text: When this Pokémon sights its prey, it swirls its ribbonlike feelers as a distraction. A moment later, it pounces.
6313.name: sylveon

6314.text: Once a fight breaks out, it will unflinchingly charge at dragon Pokémon that are many times larger than itself.
6314.name: sylveon

6315.text: Sylveon wraps its ribbonlike feelers around its Trainer’s arm because this touch enables it to read its Trainer’s feelings.
6315.name: sylveon

6316.text: By releasing enmity-erasing waves from its ribbonlike feelers, Sylveon stops any conflict.
6316.name: sylveon

6317.text: There’s a Galarian fairy tale that describes a beautiful Sylveon vanquishing a dreadful dragon Pokémon.
6317.name: sylveon

6318.text: It emits a soothing aura from its ribbon-shaped organs. It wraps these appendages around quarrelers to instantly restore calm to the situation.
6318.name: sylveon

6319.text: Although its body is small, its proficient fighting skills enable it to keep up with big bruisers like Machamp and Hariyama.
6319.name: hawlucha

6320.text: With its wings, it controls its position in the air. It likes to attack from above, a maneuver that is difficult to defend against.
6320.name: hawlucha

6321.text: It overwhelms opponents with quick moves, but sometimes it showboats for too long when it’s using a special move and gets itself into a pinch.
6321.name: hawlucha

6322.text: In combat, Hawlucha leaps nimbly about, taking advantage of its opponents’ blind spots. It’s also skilled at using superb submission holds.
6322.name: hawlucha

6323.text: It drives its opponents to exhaustion with its agile maneuvers, then ends the fight with a flashy finishing move.
6323.name: hawlucha

6324.text: It always strikes a pose before going for its finishing move. Sometimes opponents take advantage of that time to counterattack.
6324.name: hawlucha

6325.text: Its whiskers serve as antennas. By sending and receiving electrical waves, it can communicate with others over vast distances.
6325.name: dedenne

6326.text: It uses its tail to absorb electricity from power plants or from outlets in houses, and then it fires the electricity from its whiskers.
6326.name: dedenne

6327.text: It sneaks into people’s homes and steals electricity from their outlets. When your electric bill seems off, it’s the handiwork of this rascal.
6327.name: dedenne

6328.text: Its upper whiskers are sensors that survey its surroundings. Its lower whiskers are organs that shoot electricity.
6328.name: dedenne

6329.text: A Dedenne’s whiskers pick up electrical waves other Dedenne send out. These Pokémon share locations of food or electricity with one another.
6329.name: dedenne

6330.text: Since Dedenne can’t generate much electricity on its own, it steals electricity from outlets or other electric Pokémon.
6330.name: dedenne

6331.text: Born from the temperatures and pressures deep underground, it fires beams from the stone in its head.
6331.name: carbink

6332.text: It has slept underground for hundreds of millions of years since its birth. It’s occasionally found during the excavation of caves.
6332.name: carbink

6333.text: Born from the high temperatures and pressures deep underground, it defends itself by firing beams from the jewel part of its body.
6333.name: carbink

6334.text: Although this Pokémon is not especially rare, its glittering, jewel-draped body draws attention from people.
6334.name: carbink

6335.text: Some say that deep beneath the surface of the world, a pack of Carbink live with their queen in a kingdom of jewels.
6335.name: carbink

6336.text: To keep the jewels on their bodies free of tarnish, packs of Carbink use their soft manes to polish one another’s jewels.
6336.name: carbink

6337.text: When beset by attackers, Carbink wipes them all out by firing high-energy beams from the gems embedded in its body.
6337.name: carbink

6338.text: It’s said that somewhere in the world, there’s a mineral vein housing a large pack of slumbering Carbink. It’s also said that this pack has a queen.
6338.name: carbink

6339.text: The weakest Dragon-type Pokémon, it lives in damp, shady places, so its body doesn’t dry out.
6339.name: goomy

6340.text: It’s covered in a slimy membrane that makes any punches or kicks slide off it harmlessly.
6340.name: goomy

6341.text: The weakest of all Dragon-type Pokémon, it’s unable to breathe if its skin dries out, so it sticks to shady places.
6341.name: goomy

6342.text: Its source of protection is its slimy, germ-laden mucous membrane. Anyone who touches it needs some thorough hand-washing.
6342.name: goomy

6343.text: It uses its horns to check out its surroundings. They’re very sensitive, so if you grab them, it will feel a strong shock and be unable to move.
6343.name: goomy

6344.text: Its body is mostly water. If it dries out, it will die, so it’s always sitting with perfect stillness in the shade.
6344.name: goomy

6345.text: Because most of its body is water, it will dry up if the weather becomes too arid. It’s considered the weakest dragon Pokémon.
6345.name: goomy

6346.text: Their horns are powerful sensors. As soon as Goomy pick up any sign of enemies, they go into hiding. This is how they’ve survived.
6346.name: goomy

6347.text: Goomy hides away in the shade of trees, where it's nice and humid. If the slime coating its body dries out, the Pokémon instantly becomes lethargic.
6347.name: goomy

6348.text: It drives away opponents by excreting a sticky liquid that can dissolve anything. Its eyes devolved, so it can’t see anything.
6348.name: sliggoo

6349.text: Its four horns are a high-performance radar system. It uses them to sense sounds and smells, rather than using ears or a nose.
6349.name: sliggoo

6350.text: It has trouble drawing a line between friends and food. It will calmly try to melt and eat even those it gets along well with.
6350.name: sliggoo

6351.text: This Pokémon’s mucous can dissolve anything. Toothless, it sprays mucous on its prey. Once they’re nicely dissolved, it slurps them up.
6351.name: sliggoo

6352.text: It crawls along sluggishly. The swirly protrusion on its back is filled with its brain and other organs.
6352.name: sliggoo

6353.text: Its entire body is covered with gooey mucus that can dissolve anything. Be sure to put gloves on if you’re going to touch it.
6353.name: sliggoo

6354.text: Although this Pokémon isn’t very strong, its body is coated in a caustic slime that can melt through anything, so predators steer clear of it.
6354.name: sliggoo

6355.text: The lump on its back contains its tiny brain. It thinks only of food and escaping its enemies.
6355.name: sliggoo

6356.text: A creature given to melancholy. I suspect its metallic shell developed as a result of the mucus on its skin reacting with the iron in Hisui's water.
6356.name: sliggoo

6357.text: This very friendly Dragon-type Pokémon will hug its beloved Trainer, leaving that Trainer covered in sticky slime.
6357.name: goodra

6358.text: It attacks with retractable horns. It throws a punch that’s the equivalent of the force of a hundred pro boxers.
6358.name: goodra

6359.text: An amazingly friendly Pokémon, but if left to itself, loneliness overcomes it, and it oozes gooey tears.
6359.name: goodra

6360.text: It gets picked on because it’s meek. But then, whoever teased it gets to feel the full force of its horns and a good swatting from its thick tail.
6360.name: goodra

6361.text: It’s very friendly toward people. If you grow close to it, Goodra will hug you with its sticky, slime-covered body. Don’t get mad.
6361.name: goodra

6362.text: Underneath its slimy skin is a thick layer of fat, and the combination of the two makes enemies’ attacks slide right off.
6362.name: goodra

6363.text: Sometimes it misunderstands instructions and appears dazed or bewildered. Many Trainers don’t mind, finding this behavior to be adorable.
6363.name: goodra

6364.text: Its form of offense is forcefully stretching out its horns. The strikes land 100 times harder than any blow from a heavyweight boxer.
6364.name: goodra

6365.text: Able to freely control the hardness of its metallic shell. It loathes solitude and is extremely clingy—it will fume and run riot if those dearest to it ever leave its side.
6365.name: goodra

6366.text: These key collectors threaten any attackers by fiercely jingling their keys at them.
6366.name: klefki

6367.text: It never lets go of a key that it likes, so people give it the keys to vaults and safes as a way to prevent crime.
6367.name: klefki

6368.text: This even-tempered Pokémon has a habit of collecting keys. It will sneak into people’s homes to steal their keys.
6368.name: klefki

6369.text: It inserts its horn into chinks in metal, absorbing metal ions. For some reason, it collects keys.
6369.name: klefki

6370.text: Although it’s unclear why it collects keys, giving it a key makes Klefki very happy. However, it apparently only likes master keys.
6370.name: klefki

6371.text: Long ago it lived in mines, but once the minerals that make up its diet became scarcer, Klefki began appearing in human settlements.
6371.name: klefki

6372.text: This Pokémon is constantly collecting keys. Entrust a Klefki with important keys, and the Pokémon will protect them no matter what.
6372.name: klefki

6373.text: Klefki sucks in metal ions with the horn topping its head. It seems this Pokémon loves keys so much that its head needed to look like one, too.
6373.name: klefki

6374.text: These Pokémon are created when spirits possess rotten tree stumps. They prefer to live in abandoned forests.
6374.name: phantump

6375.text: According to old tales, these Pokémon are stumps possessed by the spirits of children who died while lost in the forest.
6375.name: phantump

6376.text: These Pokémon are stumps possessed by the spirits of children who died in the forest. Their cries sound like eerie screams.
6376.name: phantump

6377.text: According to legend, medicine to cure any illness can be made by plucking the green leaves on its head, brewing them, and boiling down the liquid.
6377.name: phantump

6378.text: By imitating the voice of a child, it causes people to get hopelessly lost deep in the forest. It’s trying to make friends with them.
6378.name: phantump

6379.text: An unknown spirit came to lodge in a tree stump, creating this Pokémon. A cure-all can be made from an infusion of its green leaves.
6379.name: phantump

6380.text: After a lost child perished in the forest, their spirit possessed a tree stump, causing the spirit’s rebirth as this Pokémon.
6380.name: phantump

6381.text: With a voice like a human child’s, it cries out to lure adults deep into the forest, getting them lost among the trees.
6381.name: phantump

6382.text: It can control trees at will. It will trap people who harm the forest, so they can never leave.
6382.name: trevenant

6383.text: Using its roots as a nervous system, it controls the trees in the forest. It’s kind to the Pokémon that reside in its body.
6383.name: trevenant

6384.text: This Pokémon is said to devour anyone daring to ravage the forest. To the creatures dwelling in the forest, it offers great kindness.
6384.name: trevenant

6385.text: Through its roots, it exerts control over other trees. A deadly curse falls upon anyone cutting down trees in forests where Trevenant dwell.
6385.name: trevenant

6386.text: It’s feared as a ghost of the forest. Lumberjacks bring along Fire types, which Trevenant hates, when they enter the forest.
6386.name: trevenant

6387.text: This Pokémon controls trees via roots stretching from its feet, and it will attack anyone that dares to ravage the forest.
6387.name: trevenant

6388.text: People fear it due to a belief that it devours any who try to cut down trees in its forest, but to the Pokémon it shares its woods with, it’s kind.
6388.name: trevenant

6389.text: Small roots that extend from the tips of this Pokémon’s feet can tie into the trees of the forest and give Trevenant control over them.
6389.name: trevenant

6390.text: The pumpkin body is inhabited by a spirit trapped in this world. As the sun sets, it becomes restless and active.
6390.name: pumpkaboo

6391.text: It is said to carry wandering spirits to the place where they belong so they can move on.
6391.name: pumpkaboo

6392.text: Spirits that wander this world are placed into Pumpkaboo’s body. They’re then moved on to the afterlife.
6392.name: pumpkaboo

6393.text: The light that streams out from the holes in the pumpkin can hypnotize and control the people and Pokémon that see it.
6393.name: pumpkaboo

6394.text: Singing in eerie voices, they wander town streets on the night of the new moon. Anyone who hears their song is cursed.
6394.name: gourgeist

6395.text: It enwraps its prey in its hairlike arms. It sings joyfully as it observes the suffering of its prey.
6395.name: gourgeist

6396.text: Eerie cries emanate from its body in the dead of night. The sounds are said to be the wails of spirits who are suffering in the afterlife.
6396.name: gourgeist

6397.text: In the darkness of a new-moon night, Gourgeist will come knocking. Whoever answers the door will be swept off to the afterlife.
6397.name: gourgeist

6398.text: It blocks opponents’ attacks with the ice that shields its body. It uses cold air to repair any cracks with new ice.
6398.name: bergmite

6399.text: Using air of -150 degrees Fahrenheit, they freeze opponents solid. They live in herds above the snow line on mountains.
6399.name: bergmite

6400.text: They chill the air around them to −150 degrees Fahrenheit, freezing the water in the air into ice that they use as armor.
6400.name: bergmite

6401.text: This Pokémon lives in areas of frigid cold. It secures itself to the back of an Avalugg by freezing its feet in place.
6401.name: bergmite

6402.text: Lives on mountains blanketed in perennial snow. It freezes water vapor in the air to make the ice helmet that it dons for defense.
6402.name: bergmite

6403.text: Its ice-covered body is as hard as steel. Its cumbersome frame crushes anything that stands in its way.
6403.name: avalugg

6404.text: The way several Bergmite huddle on its back makes it look like an aircraft carrier made of ice.
6404.name: avalugg

6405.text: At high latitudes, this Pokémon can be found with clusters of Bergmite on its back as it swims among the icebergs.
6405.name: avalugg

6406.text: As Avalugg moves about during the day, the cracks in its body deepen. The Pokémon’s body returns to a pristine state overnight.
6406.name: avalugg

6407.text: The armor of ice covering its lower jaw puts steel to shame and can shatter rocks with ease. This Pokémon barrels along steep mountain paths, cleaving through the deep snow.
6407.name: avalugg

6408.text: They live in pitch-black caves. Their enormous ears can emit ultrasonic waves of 200,000 hertz.
6408.name: noibat

6409.text: Even a robust wrestler will become dizzy and unable to stand when exposed to its 200,000-hertz ultrasonic waves.
6409.name: noibat

6410.text: Fruits are its favorite foods. This gourmet carefully picks out just the ripe ones using its sonar.
6410.name: noibat

6411.text: It flies around in search of fruit to eat. It uses ultrasonic waves to detect which fruits are ripe.
6411.name: noibat

6412.text: After nightfall, they emerge from the caves they nest in during the day. Using their ultrasonic waves, they go on the hunt for ripened fruit.
6412.name: noibat

6413.text: No wavelength of sound is beyond Noibat’s ability to produce. The ultrasonic waves it generates can overcome much larger Pokémon.
6413.name: noibat

6414.text: They fly around on moonless nights and attack careless prey. Nothing can beat them in a battle in the dark.
6414.name: noivern

6415.text: The ultrasonic waves it emits from its ears can reduce a large boulder to pebbles. It swoops out of the dark to attack.
6415.name: noivern

6416.text: Although it has a violent disposition, if you give it a nice ripe fruit that it loves, Noivern will suddenly become tame.
6416.name: noivern

6417.text: This hot-blooded Pokémon attacks anything it sees with ultrasonic waves that can crush boulders.
6417.name: noivern

6418.text: Aggressive and cruel, this Pokémon will ruthlessly torment enemies that are helpless in the dark.
6418.name: noivern

6419.text: Flying through the darkness, it weakens enemies with ultrasonic waves that could crush stone. Its fangs finish the fight.
6419.name: noivern

6420.text: Legends say it can share eternal life. It slept for a thousand years in the form of a tree before its revival.
6420.name: xerneas

6421.text: When the horns on its head shine in seven colors, it is said to be sharing everlasting life.
6421.name: xerneas

6422.text: When this legendary Pokémon’s wings and tail feathers spread wide and glow red, it absorbs the life force of living creatures.
6422.name: yveltal

6423.text: When its life comes to an end, it absorbs the life energy of every living thing and turns into a cocoon once more.
6423.name: yveltal

6424.text: When the Kalos region’s ecosystem falls into disarray, it appears and reveals its secret power.
6424.name: zygarde

6425.text: It’s hypothesized that it’s monitoring those who destroy the ecosystem from deep in the cave where it lives.
6425.name: zygarde

6426.text: This is Zygarde’s form when it has gathered 50% of its cells. It wipes out all those who oppose it, showing not a shred of mercy.
6426.name: zygarde

6427.text: It’s thought to be monitoring the ecosystem. There are rumors that even greater power lies hidden within it.
6427.name: zygarde

6428.text: This is Zygarde’s form when about half of its pieces have been assembled. It plays the role of monitoring the ecosystem.
6428.name: zygarde

6429.text: Some say it can change to an even more powerful form when battling those who threaten the ecosystem.
6429.name: zygarde

6430.text: A sudden transformation of Carbink, its pink, glimmering body is said to be the loveliest sight in the whole world.
6430.name: diancie

6431.text: It can instantly create many diamonds by compressing the carbon in the air between its hands.
6431.name: diancie

6432.text: This troublemaker sends anything and everything to faraway places using its loop, which can warp space.
6432.name: hoopa

6433.text: It gathers things it likes and passes them through its loop to teleport them to a secret place.
6433.name: hoopa

6434.text: In its true form, it possess a huge amount of power. Legends of its avarice tell how it once carried off an entire castle to gain the treasure hidden within.
6434.name: hoopa

6435.text: It is said to be able to seize anything it desires with its six rings and six huge arms. With its power sealed, it is transformed into a much smaller form.
6435.name: hoopa

6436.text: It lets out billows of steam and disappears into the dense fog. It’s said to live in mountains where humans do not tread.
6436.name: volcanion

6437.text: It expels its internal steam from the arms on its back. It has enough power to blow away a mountain.
6437.name: volcanion

6438.text: This wary Pokémon uses photosynthesis to store up energy during the day, while becoming active at night.
6438.name: rowlet

6439.text: Silently it glides, drawing near its targets. Before they even notice it, it begins to pelt them with vicious kicks.
6439.name: rowlet

6440.text: It sends its feathers, which are as sharp as blades, flying in attack. Its legs are strong, so its kicks are also formidable.
6440.name: rowlet

6441.text: It feels relaxed in tight, dark places and has been known to use its Trainer’s pocket or bag as a nest.
6441.name: rowlet

6442.text: At a distance, it launches its sharp feathers while flying about. If the enemy gets too close, Rowlet switches tactics and delivers vicious kicks.
6442.name: rowlet

6443.text: During the day, it builds up energy via photosynthesis. At night, it flies silently through the sky, on the prowl for prey.
6443.name: rowlet

6444.text: Flies noiselessly on delicate wings. It has mastered the art of deftly launching dagger-sharp feathers from those same wings.
6444.name: rowlet

6445.text: A bit of a dandy, it spends its free time preening its wings. Its preoccupation with any dirt on its plumage can leave it unable to battle.
6445.name: dartrix

6446.text: It throws sharp feathers called blade quills at enemies or prey. It seldom misses.
6446.name: dartrix

6447.text: This narcissistic Pokémon is a clean freak. If you don’t groom it diligently, it will stop listening to you.
6447.name: dartrix

6448.text: Supremely sensitive to the presence of others, it can detect opponents standing behind it, flinging its sharp feathers to take them out.
6448.name: dartrix

6449.text: It throws one knifelike feather after another at its enemies, and each one precisely strikes a weak point. These feathers are known as blade quills.
6449.name: dartrix

6450.text: It never slacks when it comes to the task of cleaning its feathers. Thorough preening keeps it looking spiffy and its blade quills nice and sharp.
6450.name: dartrix

6451.text: Regularly basks in sunlight to gather power—presumably due to the frigid climate. Nonetheless, the edges of the blade quills set into its wings are keen as ever.
6451.name: dartrix

6452.text: It fires arrow quills from its wings with such precision, they can pierce a pebble at distances over a hundred yards.
6452.name: decidueye

6453.text: Although basically cool and cautious, when it’s caught by surprise, it’s seized by panic.
6453.name: decidueye

6454.text: It nocks its arrow quills and shoots them at opponents. When it simply can’t afford to miss, it tugs the vine on its head to improve its focus.
6454.name: decidueye

6455.text: Decidueye can nock and fire an arrow at an enemy in a tenth of a second, so its battles are decided in the blink of an eye.
6455.name: decidueye

6456.text: As if wielding a bow, it launches the arrow quills hidden among the feathers of its wings. Decidueye’s shots never miss.
6456.name: decidueye

6457.text: In a tenth of a second, it can nock and fire an arrow quill, piercing an opponent’s weak point before they notice what’s happening.
6457.name: decidueye

6458.text: The air stored inside the rachises of Decidueye's feathers insulates the Pokémon against Hisui's extreme cold. This is firm proof that evolution can be influenced by environment.
6458.name: decidueye

6459.text: While grooming itself, it builds up fur inside its stomach. It sets the fur alight and spews fiery attacks, which change based on how it coughs.
6459.name: litten

6460.text: It doesn’t allow its emotions to be easily seen. Earning its trust takes time. It prefers solitude.
6460.name: litten

6461.text: If you try too hard to get close to it, it won’t open up to you. Even if you do grow close, giving it too much affection is still a no-no.
6461.name: litten

6462.text: Its coat regrows twice a year. When the time comes, Litten sets its own body on fire and burns away the old fur.
6462.name: litten

6463.text: It spends even the smallest amount of downtime grooming its fur with its tongue. Loose fur gathers in its stomach and serves as fuel for fiery moves.
6463.name: litten

6464.text: Trying to pet Litten before it trusts you will result in a nasty scratch from its sharp claws. Be careful.
6464.name: litten

6465.text: At its throat, it bears a bell of fire. The bell rings brightly whenever this Pokémon spits fire.
6465.name: torracat

6466.text: It boasts powerful front legs. With a single punch, it can bend an iron bar right over.
6466.name: torracat

6467.text: It can act spoiled if it grows close to its Trainer. A powerful Pokémon, its sharp claws can leave its Trainer’s whole body covered in scratches.
6467.name: torracat

6468.text: When its mane is standing on end, you can tell it’s feeling good. When it isn’t feeling well, its fur will lie down flat.
6468.name: torracat

6469.text: In the midst of battle, the fire pouch on Torracat’s neck rings like a bell and produces stronger flames than usual.
6469.name: torracat

6470.text: When facing a powerful enemy, Torracat’s fighting spirit gets pumped up, and its fire bell blazes hotter.
6470.name: torracat

6471.text: This Pokémon has a violent, selfish disposition. If it’s not in the mood to listen, it will ignore its Trainer’s orders with complete nonchalance.
6471.name: incineroar

6472.text: After hurling ferocious punches and flinging furious kicks, it finishes opponents off by spewing fire from around its navel.
6472.name: incineroar

6473.text: Although it’s rough mannered and egotistical, it finds beating down unworthy opponents boring. It gets motivated for stronger opponents.
6473.name: incineroar

6474.text: When its fighting spirit is set alight, the flames around its waist become especially intense.
6474.name: incineroar

6475.text: It excels at violent, no-holds-barred battles. The temperature of the flames that issue from its navel exceeds 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.
6475.name: incineroar

6476.text: Incineroar’s rough and aggressive behavior is its most notable trait, but the way it helps out small Pokémon shows that it has a kind side as well.
6476.name: incineroar

6477.text: This Pokémon snorts body fluids from its nose, blowing balloons to smash into its foes. It’s famous for being a hard worker.
6477.name: popplio

6478.text: This Pokémon can control water bubbles. It practices diligently so it can learn to make big bubbles.
6478.name: popplio

6479.text: The balloons it inflates with its nose grow larger and larger as it practices day by day.
6479.name: popplio

6480.text: Popplio gets on top of its bouncy water balloons to jump higher. It’s quite the acrobatic fighter!
6480.name: popplio

6481.text: It creates special bouncy balloons to send at its opponents. When the balloons pop, the sheer force of their bursting is what deals damage.
6481.name: popplio

6482.text: If Popplio want to create big, powerful balloons, they must be persistent. It takes daily practice for these Pokémon to develop their skills.
6482.name: popplio

6483.text: A skillful dancer, it creates a sequence of water balloons as it dances, and briskly bombards its enemies.
6483.name: brionne

6484.text: It cares deeply for its companions. When its Trainer is feeling down, it performs a cheery dance to try and help.
6484.name: brionne

6485.text: It gets excited when it sees a dance it doesn’t know. This hard worker practices diligently until it can learn that dance.
6485.name: brionne

6486.text: It attacks by smacking its enemies with the exploding water balloons that it creates.
6486.name: brionne

6487.text: As if dancing, it artfully dodges the attacks of its enemies. All the while, it’s busy forming a bunch of balloons to overwhelm its foes.
6487.name: brionne

6488.text: On nights when the sea is calm, Brionne dance with one another to the singing of the Primarina that’s leading them.
6488.name: brionne

6489.text: It controls its water balloons with song. The melody is learned from others of its kind and is passed down from one generation to the next.
6489.name: primarina

6490.text: Its singing voice is its chief weapon in battle. This Pokémon’s Trainer must prioritize the daily maintenance of its throat at all costs.
6490.name: primarina

6491.text: To Primarina, every battle is a stage. It takes down its prey with beautiful singing and dancing.
6491.name: primarina

6492.text: Also known as a songstress, it has a fantastical look on moonlit nights when it leads its colony in song.
6492.name: primarina

6493.text: With its mouth, it makes sonic waves that sound like beautiful singing. It uses the sonic waves to control its water balloons.
6493.name: primarina

6494.text: For Primarina, every battle’s a stage. Its singing and the dancing of its balloons will mesmerize the audience.
6494.name: primarina

6495.text: It can peck at a rate of 16 times a second to drill holes in trees. It uses the holes for food storage and for nesting.
6495.name: pikipek

6496.text: This Pokémon feeds on berries, whose leftover seeds become the ammunition for the attacks it fires off from its mouth.
6496.name: pikipek

6497.text: It pecks at trees with its hard beak. You can get some idea of its mood or condition from the rhythm of its pecking.
6497.name: pikipek

6498.text: It may look spindly, but its neck muscles are heavy-duty. It can peck at a tree 16 times per second!
6498.name: pikipek

6499.text: It eats berries and stores their seeds in its beak. When it encounters enemies or prey, it fires off all the seeds in a burst.
6499.name: trumbeak

6500.text: By bending its beak, it can produce a variety of calls and brand itself a noisy nuisance for its neighbors.
6500.name: trumbeak

6501.text: It can bend the tip of its beak to produce over a hundred different cries at will.
6501.name: trumbeak

6502.text: From its mouth, it fires the seeds of berries it has eaten. The scattered seeds give rise to new plants.
6502.name: trumbeak

6503.text: When it battles, its beak heats up. The temperature can easily exceed 212 degrees Fahrenheit, causing severe burns when it hits.
6503.name: toucannon

6504.text: Within its beak, its internal gas ignites, explosively launching seeds with enough power to pulverize boulders.
6504.name: toucannon

6505.text: They smack beaks with others of their kind to communicate. The strength and number of hits tell each other how they feel.
6505.name: toucannon

6506.text: Known for forming harmonious couples, this Pokémon is brought to wedding ceremonies as a good luck charm.
6506.name: toucannon

6507.text: With its sharp fangs, it will bite anything. It did not originally live in Alola but was imported from another region.
6507.name: yungoos

6508.text: It wanders around in a never-ending search for food. At dusk, it collapses from exhaustion and falls asleep on the spot.
6508.name: yungoos

6509.text: Its stomach takes up most of its long torso. It’s a big eater, so the amount Trainers have to spend on its food is no laughing matter.
6509.name: yungoos

6510.text: Although it will eat anything, it prefers fresh living things, so it marches down streets in search of prey.
6510.name: yungoos

6511.text: When it finds a trace of its prey, it patiently stakes out the location...but it’s always snoozing by nightfall.
6511.name: gumshoos

6512.text: It adores having Rattata and Raticate for dinner, but as it’s diurnal, it never encounters them. This Pokémon boasts incredible patience.
6512.name: gumshoos

6513.text: Although it wasn’t originally found in Alola, this Pokémon was brought over a long time ago when there was a huge Rattata outbreak.
6513.name: gumshoos

6514.text: Patient by nature, this Pokémon loses control of itself and pounces when it spots its favorite meal—Rattata!
6514.name: gumshoos

6515.text: Its strong jaw enables it to scrape trees and slurp out the sap. It normally lives underground.
6515.name: grubbin

6516.text: They often gather near places frequented by electric Pokémon in order to avoid being attacked by bird Pokémon.
6516.name: grubbin

6517.text: If you find its nest, you shouldn’t stick your hand inside. You’ll get bitten by an irritated Grubbin.
6517.name: grubbin

6518.text: It spits a sticky thread to stop opponents in their tracks, and then it grabs them in its sharp, sturdy mandibles to take them down.
6518.name: grubbin

6519.text: Its natural enemies, like Rookidee, may flee rather than risk getting caught in its large mandibles that can snap thick tree branches.
6519.name: grubbin

6520.text: It uses its big jaws to dig nests into the forest floor, and it loves to feed on sweet tree sap.
6520.name: grubbin

6521.text: Its body is capable of storing electricity. On camping trips, people are grateful to have one around.
6521.name: charjabug

6522.text: From the food it digests, it generates electricity, and it stores this energy in its electric sac.
6522.name: charjabug

6523.text: It buries itself in fallen leaves and barely moves, munching away on humus. If you accidentally step on one, you’ll get a shock!
6523.name: charjabug

6524.text: Its stout shell provides excellent defense from attacks. It uses electricity on persistent opponents.
6524.name: charjabug

6525.text: While its durable shell protects it from attacks, Charjabug strikes at enemies with jolts of electricity discharged from the tips of its jaws.
6525.name: charjabug

6526.text: Its digestive processes convert the leaves it eats into electricity. An electric sac in its belly stores the electricity for later use.
6526.name: charjabug

6527.text: It zips around, on sharp lookout for an opening. It concentrates electrical energy within its large jaws and uses it to zap its enemies.
6527.name: vikavolt

6528.text: It produces electricity via an electrical organ in its abdomen. It overwhelms bird Pokémon with shocking beams of electrical energy.
6528.name: vikavolt

6529.text: It has an organ that generates electricity in its abdomen. It concentrates energy in its strong jaws and fires off powerful jolts of electricity.
6529.name: vikavolt

6530.text: Vikavolt flusters opponents with acrobatic flying maneuvers. This creates an opening for it to deliver an electric beam attack.
6530.name: vikavolt

6531.text: It builds up electricity in its abdomen, focuses it through its jaws, and then fires the electricity off in concentrated beams.
6531.name: vikavolt

6532.text: If it carries a Charjabug to use as a spare battery, a flying Vikavolt can rapidly fire high-powered beams of electricity.
6532.name: vikavolt

6533.text: While guarding its weak points with its pincers, it looks for an opening and unleashes punches. When it loses, it foams at the mouth and faints.
6533.name: crabrawler

6534.text: It punches so much, its pincers often come off from overuse, but they grow back quickly. What little meat they contain is rich and delicious.
6534.name: crabrawler

6535.text: Its hard pincers are well suited to both offense and defense. Fights between two Crabrawler are like boxing matches.
6535.name: crabrawler

6536.text: Crabrawler has been known to mistake Exeggutor for a coconut tree and climb it. The enraged Exeggutor shakes it off and stomps it.
6536.name: crabrawler

6537.text: It aimed for the top but got lost and ended up on a snowy mountain. Being forced to endure the cold, this Pokémon evolved and grew fur.
6537.name: crabominable

6538.text: It just throws punches indiscriminately. In times of desperation, it can lop off its own pincers and fire them like rockets.
6538.name: crabominable

6539.text: It stores coldness in its pincers and pummels its foes. It can even smash thick walls of ice to bits!
6539.name: crabominable

6540.text: Before it stops to think, it just starts pummeling. There are records of its turning back avalanches with a flurry of punches.
6540.name: crabominable

6541.text: It beats its wings together to create fire. As it moves in the steps of its beautiful dance, it bathes opponents in intense flames.
6541.name: oricorio

6542.text: This Oricorio has sipped red nectar. Its passionate dance moves cause its enemies to combust in both body and mind.
6542.name: oricorio

6543.text: It wins the hearts of its enemies with its passionate dancing and then uses the opening it creates to burn them up with blazing flames.
6543.name: oricorio

6544.text: This Oricorio has drunk red nectar. If its Trainer gives the wrong order, this passionate Pokémon becomes fiercely angry.
6544.name: oricorio

6545.text: It feeds on the nectar and pollen of flowers. Because it’s able to sense auras, it can identify which flowers are about to bloom.
6545.name: cutiefly

6546.text: Myriads of Cutiefly flutter above the heads of people who have auras resembling those of flowers.
6546.name: cutiefly

6547.text: Nectar and pollen are its favorite fare. In fields of flowers, it gets into skirmishes with Butterfree over food.
6547.name: cutiefly

6548.text: Cutiefly can pick up the auras of living things. It skillfully reads those auras to predict its foes’ movements and make fools of them.
6548.name: cutiefly

6549.text: Nectar and pollen are its favorite fare. You can find Cutiefly hovering around Gossifleur, trying to get some of Gossifleur’s pollen.
6549.name: cutiefly

6550.text: An opponent’s aura can tell Cutiefly what that opponent’s next move will be. Then Cutiefly can glide around the attack and strike back.
6550.name: cutiefly

6551.text: It rolls up pollen into puffs. It makes many different varieties, some used as food and others used in battle.
6551.name: ribombee

6552.text: Some of Ribombee’s pollen puffs are highly nutritious. They are sometimes sold as supplements.
6552.name: ribombee

6553.text: Rain makes pollen damp, so Ribombee hates rain. When it sees ominous clouds, it finds a hollow in a tree, where it waits stock-still.
6553.name: ribombee

6554.text: It can predict the weather from moisture levels and wind direction. Ribombee only reveals itself when there are a few clear days in a row.
6554.name: ribombee

6555.text: It makes pollen puffs from pollen and nectar. The puffs’ effects depend on the type of ingredients and how much of each one is used.
6555.name: ribombee

6556.text: Ribombee absolutely hate getting wet or rained on. In the cloudy Galar region, they are very seldom seen.
6556.name: ribombee

6557.text: It’s considered to be a good Pokémon for beginners because of its friendliness, but its disposition grows rougher as it grows up.
6557.name: rockruff

6558.text: This Pokémon has lived with people since times long ago. It can sense when its Trainer is in the dumps and will stick close by its Trainer’s side.
6558.name: rockruff

6559.text: As they develop, their disposition grows more violent and aggressive. Many Trainers find them too much to handle and abandon them.
6559.name: rockruff

6560.text: When it rubs the rocks on its neck against you, that’s proof of its love for you. However, the rocks are sharp, so the gesture is quite painful!
6560.name: rockruff

6561.text: This Pokémon can bond very strongly with its Trainer, but it also has a habit of biting. Raising a Rockruff for a long time can be challenging.
6561.name: rockruff

6562.text: This Pokémon intimidates opponents by striking the ground with the rocks on its neck. The moment an opponent flinches, Rockruff attacks.
6562.name: rockruff

6563.text: Its quick movements confuse its enemies. Well equipped with claws and fangs, it also uses the sharp rocks in its mane as weapons.
6563.name: lycanroc

6564.text: When properly raised from a young age, it will become a trustworthy partner that will absolutely never betray its Trainer.
6564.name: lycanroc

6565.text: The sharp rocks in its mane can cut like knives. Lycanroc wears its prey down by degrees before finishing them off.
6565.name: lycanroc

6566.text: The rocks in its mane are sharper than a knife. Fragments that break off are treasured as good luck charms.
6566.name: lycanroc

6567.text: This Lycanroc is calm and cautious. The rocks jutting from its mane are razor sharp.
6567.name: lycanroc

6568.text: With swift movements, this Pokémon gradually backs its prey into a corner. Lycanroc’s fangs are always aimed toward opponents’ weak spots.
6568.name: lycanroc

6569.text: When it’s in trouble, its eyes moisten and begin to shine. The shining light attracts its comrades, and they stand together against their enemies.
6569.name: wishiwashi

6570.text: It’s awfully weak and notably tasty, so everyone is always out to get it. As it happens, anyone trying to bully it receives a painful lesson.
6570.name: wishiwashi

6571.text: They’re weak, so they move in schools. However, they can also often be seen all alone, having strayed from the school.
6571.name: wishiwashi

6572.text: When it’s in a jam, its shining eyes attract others of its kind. The light from its eyes is visible almost 25 miles away.
6572.name: wishiwashi

6573.text: Individually, they’re incredibly weak. It’s by gathering up into schools that they’re able to confront opponents.
6573.name: wishiwashi

6574.text: When it senses danger, its eyes tear up. The sparkle of its tears signals other Wishiwashi to gather.
6574.name: wishiwashi

6575.text: It plunges the poison spike on its head into its prey. When the prey has weakened, Mareanie deals the finishing blow with its 10 tentacles.
6575.name: mareanie

6576.text: It’s found crawling on beaches and seafloors. The coral that grows on Corsola’s head is as good as a five-star banquet to this Pokémon.
6576.name: mareanie

6577.text: They eat Corsola branches, so Mareanie are hated by craftsmen who work with Corsola branches that have naturally fallen off.
6577.name: mareanie

6578.text: Aside from its head, its body parts regenerate quickly if they’re cut off. After a good night’s sleep, Mareanie is back to normal.
6578.name: mareanie

6579.text: The first symptom of its sting is numbness. The next is an itching sensation so intense that it’s impossible to resist the urge to claw at your skin.
6579.name: mareanie

6580.text: Unlike their Alolan counterparts, the Mareanie of the Galar region have not yet figured out that the branches of Corsola are delicious.
6580.name: mareanie

6581.text: Toxapex crawls along the ocean floor on its 12 legs. It leaves a trail of Corsola bits scattered in its wake.
6581.name: toxapex

6582.text: Those attacked by Toxapex’s poison will suffer intense pain for three days and three nights. Post-recovery, there will be some aftereffects.
6582.name: toxapex

6583.text: To attack, this Pokémon sends toxic spikes flying at its enemies. Ones that come close get mown down by the claws on its feet.
6583.name: toxapex

6584.text: With its 12 legs, it creates a dome to shelter within. The flow of the tides doesn’t affect Toxapex in there, so it’s very comfortable.
6584.name: toxapex

6585.text: To survive in the cold waters of Galar, this Pokémon forms a dome with its legs, enclosing its body so it can capture its own body heat.
6585.name: toxapex

6586.text: Within the poison sac in its body is a poison so toxic that Pokémon as large as Wailord will still be suffering three days after it first takes effect.
6586.name: toxapex

6587.text: The mud stuck to Mudbray’s hooves enhances its grip and its powerful running gait.
6587.name: mudbray

6588.text: It has a stubborn, individualistic disposition. Eating dirt, making mud, and playing in the mire all form part of its daily routine.
6588.name: mudbray

6589.text: It loves playing in the mud. If it isn’t showered with mud on a daily basis, it gets stressed out and stops listening to its Trainer.
6589.name: mudbray

6590.text: Possessing mighty power, Mudbray can be loaded with 50 times its own body weight and will be totally fine.
6590.name: mudbray

6591.text: Loads weighing up to 50 times as much as its own body weight pose no issue for this Pokémon. It’s skilled at making use of mud.
6591.name: mudbray

6592.text: It eats dirt to create mud and smears this mud all over its feet, giving them the grip needed to walk on rough terrain without slipping.
6592.name: mudbray

6593.text: It spits a mud that provides resistance to both wind and rain, so the walls of old houses were often coated with it.
6593.name: mudsdale

6594.text: Its heavy, mud-covered kicks are its best means of attack, and it can reduce large trucks to scrap without breaking a sweat.
6594.name: mudsdale

6595.text: It remains calm and unmoving no matter the situation. It mixes dirt with the saliva in its mouth to make a special kind of mud.
6595.name: mudsdale

6596.text: It can trudge mountain roads without rest for three days and three nights, all the while dragging a 10-ton load.
6596.name: mudsdale

6597.text: Mud that hardens around a Mudsdale’s legs sets harder than stone. It’s so hard that it allows this Pokémon to scrap a truck with a single kick.
6597.name: mudsdale

6598.text: Mudsdale has so much stamina that it could carry over 10 tons across the Galar region without rest or sleep.
6598.name: mudsdale

6599.text: It crawls onto the land in search of food. Its water bubble allows it to breathe and protects its soft head.
6599.name: dewpider

6600.text: When it comes across enemies or potential prey, this Pokémon smashes its water-bubble-covered head into them.
6600.name: dewpider

6601.text: When two Dewpider meet, they display their water bubbles to each other. Then the one with the smaller bubble gets out of the other’s way.
6601.name: dewpider

6602.text: It can only breathe oxygen that has dissolved in water, so it wears a water bubble on its head when it walks around on land.
6602.name: dewpider

6603.text: It forms a water bubble at the rear of its body and then covers its head with it. Meeting another Dewpider means comparing water-bubble sizes.
6603.name: dewpider

6604.text: Dewpider normally lives underwater. When it comes onto land in search of food, it takes water with it in the form of a bubble on its head.
6604.name: dewpider

6605.text: It delivers headbutts with the water bubble on its head. Small Pokémon get sucked into the bubble, where they drown.
6605.name: araquanid

6606.text: Despite what its appearance suggests, it cares for others. If it finds vulnerable, weak Pokémon, it protectively brings them into its water bubble.
6606.name: araquanid

6607.text: It usually passes its time in the water. When its belly is full, it stores its subdued prey in the water bubble on its head.
6607.name: araquanid

6608.text: It has a habit of storing things it values in its water bubble. If its Trainer doesn’t watch out, Araquanid will try to put them in its bubble!
6608.name: araquanid

6609.text: It launches water bubbles with its legs, drowning prey within the bubbles. This Pokémon can then take its time to savor its meal.
6609.name: araquanid

6610.text: It acts as a caretaker for Dewpider, putting them inside its bubble and letting them eat any leftover food.
6610.name: araquanid

6611.text: During the day, it sleeps and soaks up light. When night falls, it walks around looking for a safer place to sleep.
6611.name: fomantis

6612.text: They give off a sweet and refreshing scent. Cutiefly often gather near the tall grass where Fomantis are hiding.
6612.name: fomantis

6613.text: When the sun rises, Fomantis spreads its four leaves and bathes in the sunlight. The tip of its head has a pleasant aroma.
6613.name: fomantis

6614.text: It loves the sunshine. When it basks in the sunlight regularly, it grows up with vivid coloration.
6614.name: fomantis

6615.text: When bathed in sunlight, this Pokémon emits a pleasantly sweet scent, which causes bug Pokémon to gather around it.
6615.name: fomantis

6616.text: During the day, Fomantis basks in sunlight and sleeps peacefully. It wakes and moves around at night.
6616.name: fomantis

6617.text: It requires a lot of effort to maintain Lurantis’s vivid coloring, but some collectors enjoy this work and treat it as their hobby.
6617.name: lurantis

6618.text: It fires beams from its sickle-shaped petals. These beams are powerful enough to cleave through thick metal plates.
6618.name: lurantis

6619.text: For self-protection, it pretends to be a bug Pokémon. Both of its arms bear keen-edged petals.
6619.name: lurantis

6620.text: As it slashes into its enemies, it looks like it’s dancing. Its elegant appearance has led some to call it the most glamorous Grass Pokémon.
6620.name: lurantis

6621.text: This Pokémon resembles a beautiful flower. A properly raised Lurantis will have gorgeous, brilliant colors.
6621.name: lurantis

6622.text: The petals on this Pokémon’s arms are thin and super sharp, and they can fire laser beams if Lurantis gathers light first.
6622.name: lurantis

6623.text: It scatters spores that flicker and glow. Anyone seeing these lights falls into a deep slumber.
6623.name: morelull

6624.text: As it drowses the day away, it nourishes itself by sucking from tree roots. It wakens at the fall of night, wandering off in search of a new tree.
6624.name: morelull

6625.text: It scatters its shining spores around itself. Even though they’re dangerous, nighttime tours of forests where Morelull live are popular.
6625.name: morelull

6626.text: It likes damp dark places. When night falls, the spores filling the caps of its mushrooms glow.
6626.name: morelull

6627.text: Pokémon living in the forest eat the delicious caps on Morelull’s head. The caps regrow overnight.
6627.name: morelull

6628.text: Morelull live in forests that stay dark even during the day. They scatter flickering spores that put enemies to sleep.
6628.name: morelull

6629.text: Forests where Shiinotic live are treacherous to enter at night. People confused by its strange lights can never find their way home again.
6629.name: shiinotic

6630.text: It emits flickering spores that cause drowsiness. When its prey succumb to sleep, this Pokémon feeds on them by sucking in their energy.
6630.name: shiinotic

6631.text: It puts its prey to sleep and siphons off their vitality through the tip of its arms. If one of its kind is weakened, it helps by sending it vitality.
6631.name: shiinotic

6632.text: When it starts fighting for territory with Parasect, the entire area gets completely coated in spores!
6632.name: shiinotic

6633.text: Its flickering spores lure in prey and put them to sleep. Once this Pokémon has its prey snoozing, it drains their vitality with its fingertips.
6633.name: shiinotic

6634.text: If you see a light deep in a forest at night, don’t go near. Shiinotic will make you fall fast asleep.
6634.name: shiinotic

6635.text: It burns its bodily fluids to create a poisonous gas. When its enemies become disoriented from inhaling the gas, it attacks them.
6635.name: salandit

6636.text: Volcanoes or dry, craggy places are its home. It emanates a sweet-smelling poisonous gas that attracts bug Pokémon, then attacks them.
6636.name: salandit

6637.text: The males will do whatever the females tell them. They give the females most of their food. Due to malnutrition, the males can’t evolve.
6637.name: salandit

6638.text: It weakens opponents and sends them reeling with its poisonous gas. Salandit doesn’t deal well with Spinda, since it’s always reeling.
6638.name: salandit

6639.text: Its venom sacs produce a fluid that this Pokémon then heats up with the flame in its tail. This process creates Salandit’s poisonous gas.
6639.name: salandit

6640.text: This sneaky Pokémon will slink behind its prey and immobilize it with poisonous gas before the prey even realizes Salandit is there.
6640.name: salandit

6641.text: For some reason, only females have been found. It creates a reverse harem of male Salandit that it lives with.
6641.name: salazzle

6642.text: Filled with pheromones, its poisonous gas can be diluted to use in the production of luscious perfumes.
6642.name: salazzle

6643.text: Salazzle lives deep in caves and forces the Salandit it has attracted with its pheromones to serve it.
6643.name: salazzle

6644.text: It punishes Salandit that couldn’t bring it food with a fierce slap of its flame-spewing palm.
6644.name: salazzle

6645.text: Only female Salazzle exist. They emit a gas laden with pheromones to captivate male Salandit.
6645.name: salazzle

6646.text: The winner of competitions between Salazzle is decided by which one has the most male Salandit with it.
6646.name: salazzle

6647.text: Despite its adorable appearance, when it gets angry and flails about, its arms and legs could knock a pro wrestler sprawling.
6647.name: stufful

6648.text: A touch from anyone except a known friend sends it into a surging frenzy. It’s an incredibly dangerous Pokémon.
6648.name: stufful

6649.text: It boasts power enough to split large trees in half. The organ on its rear releases an odor that it uses to communicate with others of its kind.
6649.name: stufful

6650.text: Stufful hates to be hugged or touched in any way. It will squirm, thrash, and resist with amazing power.
6650.name: stufful

6651.text: Its fluffy fur is a delight to pet, but carelessly reaching out to touch this Pokémon could result in painful retaliation.
6651.name: stufful

6652.text: The way it protects itself by flailing its arms may be an adorable sight, but stay well away. This is flailing that can snap thick tree trunks.
6652.name: stufful

6653.text: This immensely dangerous Pokémon possesses overwhelming physical strength. Its habitat is generally off-limits.
6653.name: bewear

6654.text: This Pokémon has the habit of hugging its companions. Many Trainers have left this world after their spines were squashed by its hug.
6654.name: bewear

6655.text: It waves its hands wildly in intimidation and warning. Life is over for anyone who doesn’t run away as fast as possible.
6655.name: bewear

6656.text: It boasts tremendous physical strength. Many people call it the most dangerous Pokémon in the Alola region.
6656.name: bewear

6657.text: Once it accepts you as a friend, it tries to show its affection with a hug. Letting it do that is dangerous—it could easily shatter your bones.
6657.name: bewear

6658.text: The moves it uses to take down its prey would make a martial artist jealous. It tucks subdued prey under its arms to carry them to its nest.
6658.name: bewear

6659.text: A delectable aroma pours from its body. They are often swallowed whole by Toucannon lured by that wafting deliciousness.
6659.name: bounsweet

6660.text: Although it’s too sugary for human consumption, Bounsweet’s sweat can be watered down into a juice with just the right amount of sweetness.
6660.name: bounsweet

6661.text: Because of its sweet, delicious aroma, bird Pokémon are always after it, but it’s not intelligent enough to care.
6661.name: bounsweet

6662.text: It tries to resist being swallowed by a bird Pokémon by spinning the sepals on its head. It’s usually a fruitless attempt.
6662.name: bounsweet

6663.text: Its body gives off a sweet, fruity scent that is extremely appetizing to bird Pokémon.
6663.name: bounsweet

6664.text: When under attack, it secretes a sweet and delicious sweat. The scent only calls more enemies to it.
6664.name: bounsweet

6665.text: The sepals on its head developed to protect its body. These are quite hard, so even if pecked by bird Pokémon, this Pokémon is totally fine.
6665.name: steenee

6666.text: This Pokémon is always bouncing around energetically. Other Pokémon are attracted by its lively appearance and pleasant aroma.
6666.name: steenee

6667.text: It’s protected by its hard sepals, so it plays with bird Pokémon without worry. They peck it relentlessly, but it doesn’t care.
6667.name: steenee

6668.text: It bounces around, swinging the sepals on its head with abandon. They’re quite painful when they smack you!
6668.name: steenee

6669.text: As it twirls like a dancer, a sweet smell spreads out around it. Anyone who inhales the scent will feel a surge of happiness.
6669.name: steenee

6670.text: Any Corvisquire that pecks at this Pokémon will be greeted with a smack from its sepals followed by a sharp kick.
6670.name: steenee

6671.text: Its long, striking legs aren’t just for show but to be used to kick with skill. In victory, it shows off by kicking the defeated, laughing boisterously.
6671.name: tsareena

6672.text: A Pokémon known for the beauty of its well-shaped legs, it sometimes appears as a mascot in advertisements for beauty salons.
6672.name: tsareena

6673.text: A master of grand and beautiful kicks, it can knock out even kickboxing champions with a single blow.
6673.name: tsareena

6674.text: A Pokémon with an aggressive personality and a mastery of kicking, it cackles every time it kicks an opponent.
6674.name: tsareena

6675.text: This feared Pokémon has long, slender legs and a cruel heart. It shows no mercy as it stomps on its opponents.
6675.name: tsareena

6676.text: A kick from the hardened tips of this Pokémon’s legs leaves a wound in the opponent’s body and soul that will never heal.
6676.name: tsareena

6677.text: It attaches flowers to its highly nutritious vine. This revitalizes the flowers, and they give off an aromatic scent.
6677.name: comfey

6678.text: Baths prepared with the flowers from its vine have a relaxing effect, so this Pokémon is a hit with many people.
6678.name: comfey

6679.text: It stretches sticky vines out from its head and picks flowers to adorn itself with. When it doesn’t have any flowers, it feels uneasy.
6679.name: comfey

6680.text: It picks flowers and sticks them to its body with fluids it produces. The aroma that wafts from its petals has a healing effect.
6680.name: comfey

6681.text: Comfey picks flowers with its vine and decorates itself with them. For some reason, flowers won’t wither once they’re attached to a Comfey.
6681.name: comfey

6682.text: These Pokémon smell very nice. All Comfey wear different flowers, so each of these Pokémon has its own individual scent.
6682.name: comfey

6683.text: Known for its extreme intelligence, this Pokémon will look down on inexperienced Trainers, so it’s best suited to veteran Trainers.
6683.name: oranguru

6684.text: Deep in the jungle, high in the lofty canopy, this Pokémon abides. On rare occasions, it shows up at the beach to match wits with Slowking.
6684.name: oranguru

6685.text: It normally spends its time meditating in the treetops. It throws Poké Balls and gives other Pokémon orders as it pleases.
6685.name: oranguru

6686.text: Oranguru don’t get along with each other, so they’re always engaging in battles of wits to decide which one is superior.
6686.name: oranguru

6687.text: With waves of its fan—made from leaves and its own fur—Oranguru skillfully gives instructions to other Pokémon.
6687.name: oranguru

6688.text: It knows the forest inside and out. If it comes across a wounded Pokémon, Oranguru will gather medicinal herbs to treat it.
6688.name: oranguru

6689.text: They form groups of roughly 20 individuals. Their mutual bond is remarkable—they will never let down a comrade.
6689.name: passimian

6690.text: They battle with hard berries for weapons. Their techniques are passed from the boss to the group, generation upon generation.
6690.name: passimian

6691.text: They use their saliva to stick leaves to their shoulders. You can tell what troop they belong to from the position of the leaves.
6691.name: passimian

6692.text: Berries are its weapons as well as the staple of its diet. The one that can throw a berry the farthest is the boss of the troop.
6692.name: passimian

6693.text: Displaying amazing teamwork, they follow the orders of their boss as they all help out in the search for their favorite berries.
6693.name: passimian

6694.text: Passimian live in groups of about 20, with each member performing an assigned role. Through cooperation, the group survives.
6694.name: passimian

6695.text: This Pokémon is a coward. As it desperately dashes off, the flailing of its many legs leaves a sparkling clean path in its wake.
6695.name: wimpod

6696.text: Its habitat varies from beaches to seabeds. A natural scavenger, it will gleefully chow down on anything edible, no matter how rotten.
6696.name: wimpod

6697.text: It will pick up anything it finds on the ground. Sometimes it finds coins, so Murkrow and Meowth will go after it.
6697.name: wimpod

6698.text: An astonishingly cowardly Pokémon, Wimpod will whir its legs at high speeds to run away if anything comes near it.
6698.name: wimpod

6699.text: It’s nature’s cleaner—it eats anything and everything, including garbage and rotten things. The ground near its nest is always clean.
6699.name: wimpod

6700.text: Wimpod gather in swarms, constantly on the lookout for danger. They scatter the moment they detect an enemy’s presence.
6700.name: wimpod

6701.text: With a flashing slash of its giant sharp claws, it cleaves seawater—or even air—right in two.
6701.name: golisopod

6702.text: It battles skillfully with its six arms, but spends most of its time peacefully meditating in caves deep beneath the sea.
6702.name: golisopod

6703.text: The shell covering its body is as hard as diamond. This Pokémon will do anything it takes to win.
6703.name: golisopod

6704.text: Its claws, which it can extend and retract at will, are its greatest weapons. Golisopod is sometimes accompanied by Wimpod.
6704.name: golisopod

6705.text: It will do anything to win, taking advantage of every opening and finishing opponents off with the small claws on its front legs.
6705.name: golisopod

6706.text: They live in sunken ships or in holes in the seabed. When Golisopod and Grapploct battle, the loser becomes the winner’s meal.
6706.name: golisopod

6707.text: Born from a sand mound playfully built by a child, this Pokémon embodies the grudges of the departed.
6707.name: sandygast

6708.text: It takes control of anyone who puts a hand in its mouth. And so it adds to the accumulation of its sand-mound body.
6708.name: sandygast

6709.text: It likes the shovel on its head, so Sandygast will get serious and fight any children who come to take it back.
6709.name: sandygast

6710.text: If you build sand mounds when you’re playing, destroy them before you go home, or they may get possessed and become Sandygast.
6710.name: sandygast

6711.text: Grudges of the dead have possessed a mound of sand and become a Pokémon. Sandygast is fond of the shovel on its head.
6711.name: sandygast

6712.text: Sandygast mainly inhabits beaches. It takes control of anyone who puts their hand into its mouth, forcing them to make its body bigger.
6712.name: sandygast

6713.text: Possessed people controlled by this Pokémon transformed its sand mound into a castle. As it evolved, its power to curse grew ever stronger.
6713.name: palossand

6714.text: Buried beneath the castle are masses of dried-up bones from those whose vitality it has drained.
6714.name: palossand

6715.text: Each of its grains of sand has its own will. Palossand eats small Pokémon and siphons away their vital essence while they’re still alive.
6715.name: palossand

6716.text: Once it has whipped up a sandstorm to halt its opponents in their tracks, this terrifying Pokémon snatches away their vitality.
6716.name: palossand

6717.text: Palossand is known as the Beach Nightmare. It pulls its prey down into the sand by controlling the sand itself, and then it sucks out their souls.
6717.name: palossand

6718.text: This Pokémon lives on beaches, but it hates water. Palossand can’t maintain its castle-like shape if it gets drenched by a heavy rain.
6718.name: palossand

6719.text: It’s covered in a slime that keeps its skin moist, allowing it to stay on land for days without drying up.
6719.name: pyukumuku

6720.text: It lives in shallow seas, such as areas near a beach. It can eject its internal organs, which it uses to engulf its prey or battle enemies.
6720.name: pyukumuku

6721.text: These Pokémon line the beaches. The sticky mucous that covers their bodies can be used to soothe sunburned skin. How convenient!
6721.name: pyukumuku

6722.text: The tradition known as Pyukumuku chucking started from the custom of throwing Pyukumuku back into the sea after they wash onshore.
6722.name: pyukumuku

6723.text: Its entire body is covered in its own slime. If you accidentally step on one, you’ll slip, and it will get mad and smack you!
6723.name: pyukumuku

6724.text: It lives in warm, shallow waters. If it encounters a foe, it will spit out its internal organs as a means to punch them.
6724.name: pyukumuku

6725.text: The heavy control mask it wears suppresses its intrinsic capabilities. This Pokémon has some hidden special power.
6725.name: type-null

6726.text: Due to the danger that this synthetic Pokémon may go on a rampage, it wears a control mask to restrain its power.
6726.name: type-null

6727.text: A Pokémon weapon developed for a specific mission, it went berserk during an experiment, so it was cryogenically frozen.
6727.name: type-null

6728.text: There’s danger of its going on a rampage, so its true power is sealed away beneath its control mask.
6728.name: type-null

6729.text: Rumor has it that the theft of top-secret research notes led to a new instance of this Pokémon being created in the Galar region.
6729.name: type-null

6730.text: It was modeled after a mighty Pokémon of myth. The mask placed upon it limits its power in order to keep it under control.
6730.name: type-null

6731.text: Its trust in its partner is what awakens it. This Pokémon is capable of changing its type, a flexibility that is well displayed in battle.
6731.name: silvally

6732.text: Although its name was Type: Null at first, the boy who evolved it into this form gave it the name by which it is now known.
6732.name: silvally

6733.text: This is its form once it has awakened and evolved. Freed from its heavy mask, its speed is greatly increased.
6733.name: silvally

6734.text: Through the bond it formed with its Trainer, its will was strengthened, and it was able to destroy its control mask.
6734.name: silvally

6735.text: A solid bond of trust between this Pokémon and its Trainer awakened the strength hidden within Silvally. It can change its type at will.
6735.name: silvally

6736.text: The final factor needed to release this Pokémon’s true power was a strong bond with a Trainer it trusts.
6736.name: silvally

6737.text: Originally making its home in the ozone layer, it hurtles to the ground when the shell enclosing its body grows too heavy.
6737.name: minior

6738.text: Strong impacts can knock it out of its shell. This Pokémon was born from mutated nanoparticles.
6738.name: minior

6739.text: It lives in the ozone layer, where it becomes food for stronger Pokémon. When it tries to run away, it falls to the ground.
6739.name: minior

6740.text: Although its outer shell is uncommonly durable, the shock of falling to the ground smashes the shell to smithereens.
6740.name: minior

6741.text: It is born asleep, and it dies asleep. All its movements are apparently no more than the results of it tossing and turning in its dreams.
6741.name: komala

6742.text: The log it holds was given to it by its parents at birth. It has also been known to cling to the arm of a friendly Trainer.
6742.name: komala

6743.text: It stays asleep from the moment it’s born. When it falls into a deep sleep, it stops moving altogether.
6743.name: komala

6744.text: It remains asleep from birth to death as a result of the sedative properties of the leaves that form its diet.
6744.name: komala

6745.text: The shell on its back is chemically unstable and explodes violently if struck. The hole in its stomach is its weak point.
6745.name: turtonator

6746.text: It gushes fire and poisonous gases from its nostrils. Its dung is an explosive substance and can be put to various uses.
6746.name: turtonator

6747.text: It lives in volcanoes and eats sulfur and other minerals. Materials from the food it eats form the basis of its explosive shell.
6747.name: turtonator

6748.text: Its exploding shell poses a real danger but is sensitive to moisture. On rainy days, Turtonator takes silent refuge in caves.
6748.name: turtonator

6749.text: Explosive substances coat the shell on its back. Enemies that dare attack it will be blown away by an immense detonation.
6749.name: turtonator

6750.text: Eating sulfur in its volcanic habitat is what causes explosive compounds to develop in its shell. Its droppings are also dangerously explosive.
6750.name: turtonator

6751.text: The spiny fur on its back is normally at rest. When this Pokémon becomes agitated, its fur stands on end and stabs into its attackers.
6751.name: togedemaru

6752.text: The long hairs on its back act as lightning rods. The bolts of lightning it attracts are stored as energy in its electric sac.
6752.name: togedemaru

6753.text: When it’s surprised or agitated, the 14 fur spikes on its back will stand up involuntarily.
6753.name: togedemaru

6754.text: Its capacity to produce electricity is somewhat limited, so it gets charged up by letting lightning strike it!
6754.name: togedemaru

6755.text: With the long hairs on its back, this Pokémon takes in electricity from other electric Pokémon. It stores what it absorbs in an electric sac.
6755.name: togedemaru

6756.text: When it’s in trouble, it curls up into a ball, makes its fur spikes stand on end, and then discharges electricity indiscriminately.
6756.name: togedemaru

6757.text: Its actual appearance is unknown. A scholar who saw what was under its rag was overwhelmed by terror and died from the shock.
6757.name: mimikyu

6758.text: A lonely Pokémon, it conceals its terrifying appearance beneath an old rag so it can get closer to people and other Pokémon.
6758.name: mimikyu

6759.text: Although it’s a quiet, lonely Pokémon, if you try to look at what’s under its rag, it will become agitated and resist violently.
6759.name: mimikyu

6760.text: A gust of wind revealed what hides under this Pokémon’s rag to a passing Trainer, who went home and died painfully that very night.
6760.name: mimikyu

6761.text: It wears a rag fashioned into a Pikachu costume in an effort to look less scary. Unfortunately, the costume only makes it creepier.
6761.name: mimikyu

6762.text: There was a scientist who peeked under Mimikyu’s old rag in the name of research. The scientist died of a mysterious disease.
6762.name: mimikyu

6763.text: When it unleashes its psychic power from the protuberance on its head, the grating sound of grinding teeth echoes through the area.
6763.name: bruxish

6764.text: It stuns its prey with psychokinesis and then grinds them to mush with its strong teeth. Even Shellder’s shell is no match for it.
6764.name: bruxish

6765.text: It burrows beneath the sand, radiating psychic power from the protuberance on its head. It waits for prey as it surveys the area.
6765.name: bruxish

6766.text: Its skin is thick enough to fend off Mareanie’s spikes. With its robust teeth, Bruxish crunches up the spikes and eats them.
6766.name: bruxish

6767.text: It has a compassionate personality, but if it is angered, it completely destroys its surroundings with its intense breath.
6767.name: drampa

6768.text: This Pokémon is friendly to people and loves children most of all. It comes from deep in the mountains to play with children it likes in town.
6768.name: drampa

6769.text: If a child it has made friends with is bullied, Drampa will find the bully’s house and burn it to the ground.
6769.name: drampa

6770.text: It appears in towns and plays with the children. Drampa will protect kids when they’re in danger, so their moms don’t have to worry.
6770.name: drampa

6771.text: The mountains it calls home are nearly two miles in height. On rare occasions, it descends to play with the children living in the towns below.
6771.name: drampa

6772.text: Drampa is a kind and friendly Pokémon—up until it’s angered. When that happens, it stirs up a gale and flattens everything around.
6772.name: drampa

6773.text: Swinging its massive anchor, it can KO Wailord in a single blow. What appears to be green seaweed is actually its body.
6773.name: dhelmise

6774.text: The soul of seaweed adrift in the waves became reborn as this Pokémon. It maintains itself with new infusions of seabed detritus and seaweed.
6774.name: dhelmise

6775.text: It wraps its prey in green seaweed and sucks away their vitality. It only likes to go after big prey like Wailord.
6775.name: dhelmise

6776.text: Its chain-like green seaweed can stretch outward for hundreds of yards. For some reason, it gets along well with Skrelp.
6776.name: dhelmise

6777.text: After a piece of seaweed merged with debris from a sunken ship, it was reborn as this ghost Pokémon.
6777.name: dhelmise

6778.text: After lowering its anchor, it waits for its prey. It catches large Wailord and drains their life-force.
6778.name: dhelmise

6779.text: It expresses its feelings by smacking its scales. Metallic sounds echo through the tall mountains where Jangmo-o lives.
6779.name: jangmo-o

6780.text: They live in mountains where no trace of humans can be detected. Jangmo-o grow little by little as they battle one another.
6780.name: jangmo-o

6781.text: It smacks the scales on its head against rocks or against the ground to frighten its opponents. It can also contact its friends with these noises.
6781.name: jangmo-o

6782.text: It will never show an enemy its back in battle. Ancient warriors liked Jangmo-o for its valiant disposition and made it one of their own.
6782.name: jangmo-o

6783.text: They learn to fight by smashing their head scales together. The dueling strengthens both their skills and their spirits.
6783.name: jangmo-o

6784.text: Jangmo-o strikes its scales to communicate with others of its kind. Its scales are actually fur that’s become as hard as metal.
6784.name: jangmo-o

6785.text: It leaps at its prey with a courageous shout. Its scaly punches tear its opponents to shreds.
6785.name: hakamo-o

6786.text: It sheds and regrows its scales on a continuous basis. The scales become harder and sharper each time they’re regrown.
6786.name: hakamo-o

6787.text: It makes noise by clanging its scales together. When the rhythm has reached its peak, Hakamo-o attacks.
6787.name: hakamo-o

6788.text: The scales it sheds can be molded and processed to make pots and pans. They conduct heat well, so they’re a popular item.
6788.name: hakamo-o

6789.text: The scaleless, scarred parts of its body are signs of its strength. It shows them off to defeated opponents.
6789.name: hakamo-o

6790.text: Before attacking its enemies, it clashes its scales together and roars. Its sharp claws shred the opposition.
6790.name: hakamo-o

6791.text: When it spots enemies, it threatens them by jingling the scales on its tail. Weak opponents will crack and flee in panic.
6791.name: kommo-o

6792.text: Its rigid scales function as offense and defense. In the past, its scales were processed and used to make weapons and other commodities.
6792.name: kommo-o

6793.text: When it howls after finishing off its prey, the metallic sounds of its celebrating comrades can be heard from all around.
6793.name: kommo-o

6794.text: It battles valiantly with its fists, which are armored in steel scales. Kommo-o specializes in uppercuts.
6794.name: kommo-o

6795.text: It clatters its tail scales to unnerve opponents. This Pokémon will battle only those who stand steadfast in the face of this display.
6795.name: kommo-o

6796.text: Certain ruins have paintings of ancient warriors wearing armor made of Kommo-o scales.
6796.name: kommo-o

6797.text: This guardian deity of Melemele is brimming with curiosity. It summons thunderclouds and stores their lightning inside its body.
6797.name: tapu-koko

6798.text: It confuses its enemies by flying too quickly for the eye to follow. It has a hair-trigger temper but forgets what made it angry an instant later.
6798.name: tapu-koko

6799.text: Although it’s called a guardian deity, if a person or Pokémon puts it in a bad mood, it will become a malevolent deity and attack.
6799.name: tapu-koko

6800.text: The lightning-wielding guardian deity of Melemele, Tapu Koko is brimming with curiosity and appears before people from time to time.
6800.name: tapu-koko

6801.text: This guardian deity of Akala is guilelessly cruel. The fragrant aroma of flowers is the source of its energy.
6801.name: tapu-lele

6802.text: As it flutters about, it scatters its strangely glowing scales. Touching them is said to restore good health on the spot.
6802.name: tapu-lele

6803.text: It heals the wounds of people and Pokémon by sprinkling them with its sparkling scales. This guardian deity is worshiped on Akala.
6803.name: tapu-lele

6804.text: Although called a guardian deity, Tapu Lele is devoid of guilt about its cruel disposition and can be described as nature incarnate.
6804.name: tapu-lele

6805.text: It pulls large trees up by the roots and swings them around. It causes vegetation to grow, and then it absorbs energy from the growth.
6805.name: tapu-bulu

6806.text: The guardian deity of Ula’ula is a lazy Pokémon. It commands plants to immobilize its foes and then deals them a savage blow with its horns.
6806.name: tapu-bulu

6807.text: Although it’s called a guardian deity, it’s violent enough to crush anyone it sees as an enemy.
6807.name: tapu-bulu

6808.text: It makes ringing sounds with its tail to let others know where it is, avoiding unneeded conflicts. This guardian deity of Ula’ula controls plants.
6808.name: tapu-bulu

6809.text: The dense fog it creates brings the downfall and destruction of its confused enemies. Ocean currents are the source of its energy.
6809.name: tapu-fini

6810.text: The guardian deity of Poni, it can control water. People say it can create pure water that will wash away any uncleanness.
6810.name: tapu-fini

6811.text: This guardian deity of Poni Island manipulates water. Because it lives deep within a thick fog, it came to be both feared and revered.
6811.name: tapu-fini

6812.text: Although it’s called a guardian deity, terrible calamities sometimes befall those who recklessly approach Tapu Fini.
6812.name: tapu-fini

6813.text: Its body is gaseous and frail. It slowly grows as it collects dust from the atmosphere.
6813.name: cosmog

6814.text: In ages past, it was called the child of the stars. It’s said to be a Pokémon from another world, but no specific details are known.
6814.name: cosmog

6815.text: Even though its helpless, gaseous body can be blown away by the slightest breeze, it doesn’t seem to care.
6815.name: cosmog

6816.text: Whether or not it’s a Pokémon from this world is a mystery. When it’s in a jam, it warps away to a safe place to hide.
6816.name: cosmog

6817.text: This Pokémon came from another universe. Its gaseous body is so light that even a gentle breeze can blow it away.
6817.name: cosmog

6818.text: Cosmog is very curious but not very cautious, often placing itself in danger. If things start to look dicey, it teleports away.
6818.name: cosmog

6819.text: Motionless as if dead, its body is faintly warm to the touch. In the distant past, it was called the cocoon of the stars.
6819.name: cosmoem

6820.text: There’s something accumulating around the black core within its hard shell. People think this Pokémon may come from another world.
6820.name: cosmoem

6821.text: The king who ruled Alola in times of antiquity called it the “cocoon of the stars” and built an altar to worship it.
6821.name: cosmoem

6822.text: As it absorbs light, Cosmoem continues to grow. Its golden shell is surprisingly solid.
6822.name: cosmoem

6823.text: The absorption of starlight fuels this Pokémon’s growth. The shell that encases it is harder than any known material.
6823.name: cosmoem

6824.text: It sucks in dust from the air at an astounding rate, frantically building up energy within its core as preparation for evolution.
6824.name: cosmoem

6825.text: It is said to live in another world. The intense light it radiates from the surface of its body can make the darkest of nights light up like midday.
6825.name: solgaleo

6826.text: This Pokémon is said to be a male evolution of Cosmog. At the activation of its third eye, it departs for another world.
6826.name: solgaleo

6827.text: Sometimes the result of its opening an Ultra Wormhole is that energy and life-forms from other worlds are called here to this world.
6827.name: solgaleo

6828.text: In writings from the distant past, it’s called by the name “the beast that devours the sun.”
6828.name: solgaleo
