6829.text: When light radiates from its body, this Pokémon could almost appear to be the sun. It will dispel any darkness and light up the world.
6829.name: solgaleo

6830.text: Solgaleo was once known as the Beast That Devours the Sun. Energy in the form of light radiates boundlessly from it.
6830.name: solgaleo

6831.text: It is said to be a female evolution of Cosmog. When its third eye activates, away it flies to another world.
6831.name: lunala

6832.text: Said to live in another world, this Pokémon devours light, drawing the moonless dark veil of night over the brightness of day.
6832.name: lunala

6833.text: Records of it exist in writings from long, long ago, where it was known by the name “the beast that calls the moon.”
6833.name: lunala

6834.text: It sometimes summons unknown powers and life-forms here to this world from holes that lead to other worlds.
6834.name: lunala

6835.text: Known as the Beast That Calls the Moon, this Pokémon lives by taking in any and all light and converting it into its own energy.
6835.name: lunala

6836.text: It steals the light from its surroundings and then becomes the full moon, showering its own light across the night sky.
6836.name: lunala

6837.text: One of several mysterious Ultra Beasts. People on the street report observing those infested by it suddenly becoming violent.
6837.name: nihilego

6838.text: One of the Ultra Beasts. It’s unclear whether or not this Pokémon is sentient, but sometimes it can be observed behaving like a young girl.
6838.name: nihilego

6839.text: A life-form from another world, it was dubbed a UB and is thought to produce a strong neurotoxin.
6839.name: nihilego

6840.text: It appeared in this world from an Ultra Wormhole. Nihilego appears to be a parasite that lives by feeding on people and Pokémon.
6840.name: nihilego

6841.text: This Ultra Beast appeared from another world. It shows off its body, but whether that display is a boast or a threat remains unclear.
6841.name: buzzwole

6842.text: A mysterious life-form called an Ultra Beast. Witnesses saw it pulverize a dump truck with a single punch.
6842.name: buzzwole

6843.text: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
6843.name: buzzwole

6844.text: Buzzwole goes around showing off its abnormally swollen muscles. It is one kind of Ultra Beast.
6844.name: buzzwole

6845.text: One of the dangerous Ultra Beasts, it has been spotted running across the land at terrific speeds.
6845.name: pheromosa

6846.text: One of the Ultra Beasts. It refuses to touch anything, perhaps because it senses some uncleanness in this world.
6846.name: pheromosa

6847.text: A life-form that lives in another world, its body is thin and supple, but it also possesses great power.
6847.name: pheromosa

6848.text: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
6848.name: pheromosa

6849.text: One of the mysterious life-forms known as Ultra Beasts. Astonishing electric shocks emanate from its entire body, according to witnesses.
6849.name: xurkitree

6850.text: It appeared from the Ultra Wormhole. It raided a power plant, so people think it energizes itself with electricity.
6850.name: xurkitree

6851.text: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
6851.name: xurkitree

6852.text: They’ve been dubbed Ultra Beasts. Some of them stand unmoving, like trees, with their arms and legs stuck into the ground.
6852.name: xurkitree

6853.text: It appeared from the Ultra Wormhole. Witnesses observed it flying across the sky at high speed.
6853.name: celesteela

6854.text: One kind of Ultra Beast. Witnesses have seen it burn down a forest by expelling gas from its two arms.
6854.name: celesteela

6855.text: One of the dangerous UBs, high energy readings can be detected coming from both of its huge arms.
6855.name: celesteela

6856.text: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
6856.name: celesteela

6857.text: This Ultra Beast came from the Ultra Wormhole. It seems not to attack enemies on its own, but its sharp body is a dangerous weapon in itself.
6857.name: kartana

6858.text: One of the Ultra Beast life-forms, it was observed cutting down a gigantic steel tower with one stroke of its blade.
6858.name: kartana

6859.text: This Ultra Beast’s body, which is as thin as paper, is like a sharpened sword.
6859.name: kartana

6860.text: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
6860.name: kartana

6861.text: It has gobbled mountains and swallowed whole buildings, according to reports. It’s one of the Ultra Beasts.
6861.name: guzzlord

6862.text: A dangerous Ultra Beast, it appears to be eating constantly, but for some reason its droppings have never been found.
6862.name: guzzlord

6863.text: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
6863.name: guzzlord

6864.text: An unknown life-form called a UB. It may be constantly hungry—it is certainly always devouring something.
6864.name: guzzlord

6865.text: Reminiscent of the Ultra Beasts, this life-form, apparently asleep underground, is thought to have come from another world in ancient times.
6865.name: necrozma

6866.text: Light is apparently the source of its energy. It has an extraordinarily vicious disposition and is constantly firing off laser beams.
6866.name: necrozma

6867.text: It looks somehow pained as it rages around in search of light, which serves as its energy. It’s apparently from another world.
6867.name: necrozma

6868.text: Light is the source of its energy. If it isn’t devouring light, impurities build up in it and on it, and Necrozma darkens and stops moving.
6868.name: necrozma

6869.text: It survives by absorbing light. After a long time spent slumbering underground, impurities accumulated within it, causing its body to darken.
6869.name: necrozma

6870.text: It needs light to survive, and it goes on a rampage seeking it out. Its laser beams will cut anything to pieces.
6870.name: necrozma

6871.text: This artificial Pokémon, constructed more than 500 years ago, can understand human speech but cannot itself speak.
6871.name: magearna

6872.text: Its mechanized body is merely a vessel. Its true self is its Soul-Heart, an artificial soul.
6872.name: magearna

6873.text: It synchronizes its consciousness with others to understand their feelings. This faculty makes it useful for taking care of people.
6873.name: magearna

6874.text: Built roughly 500 years ago by a scientist, the part called the Soul-Heart is the actual life-form.
6874.name: magearna

6875.text: Able to conceal itself in shadows, it never appears before humans, so its very existence was the stuff of myth.
6875.name: marshadow

6876.text: It lurks in the shadows of others, copying their movements and powers. This Pokémon is craven and cowering.
6876.name: marshadow

6877.text: It slips into the shadows of others and mimics their powers and movements. As it improves, it becomes stronger than those it’s imitating.
6877.name: marshadow

6878.text: It sinks into the shadows of people and Pokémon, where it can understand their feelings and copy their capabilities.
6878.name: marshadow

6879.text: By slipping into the shadow of a martial arts master and copying their movements, this Pokémon learned the ultimate techniques.
6879.name: marshadow

6880.text: This Pokémon can conceal itself in any shadow, so it went undiscovered for a long time.
6880.name: marshadow

6881.text: This Ultra Beast is well enough liked to be chosen as a first partner in its own world.
6881.name: poipole

6882.text: An Ultra Beast that lives in a different world, it cackles wildly as it sprays its opponents with poison from the needles on its head.
6882.name: poipole

6883.text: It stores hundreds of liters of poisonous liquid inside its body. It is one of the organisms known as UBs.
6883.name: naganadel

6884.text: One kind of Ultra Beast, it fires a glowing, venomous liquid from its needles. This liquid is also immensely adhesive.
6884.name: naganadel

6885.text: It appeared from an Ultra Wormhole. Each one appears to be made up of many life-forms stacked one on top of each other.
6885.name: stakataka

6886.text: When stone walls started moving and attacking, the brute’s true identity was this mysterious life-form, which brings to mind an Ultra Beast.
6886.name: stakataka

6887.text: It slithers toward people. Then, without warning, it triggers the explosion of its own head. It’s apparently one kind of Ultra Beast.
6887.name: blacephalon

6888.text: A UB that appeared from an Ultra Wormhole, it causes explosions, then takes advantage of opponents’ surprise to rob them of their vitality.
6888.name: blacephalon

6889.text: It electrifies its claws and tears its opponents apart with them. Even if they dodge its attack, they’ll be electrocuted by the flying sparks.
6889.name: zeraora

6890.text: It approaches its enemies at the speed of lightning, then tears them limb from limb with its sharp claws.
6890.name: zeraora

6891.text: It runs as fast as lightning strikes, shredding its opponents with its high-voltage claws.
6891.name: zeraora

6892.text: Electricity sparks from the pads on its limbs. Wherever Zeraora runs, lightning flashes and thunder echoes.
6892.name: zeraora

6893.text: It melts particles of iron and other metals found in the subsoil, so it can absorb them into its body of molten steel.
6893.name: meltan

6894.text: It dissolves and eats metal. Circulating liquid metal within its body is how it generates energy.
6894.name: meltan

6895.text: They live as a group, but when the time comes, one strong Meltan will absorb all the others and evolve.
6895.name: meltan

6896.text: Revered long ago for its capacity to create iron from nothing, for some reason it has come back to life after 3,000 years.
6896.name: melmetal

6897.text: At the end of its life-span, Melmetal will rust and fall apart. The small shards left behind will eventually be reborn as Meltan.
6897.name: melmetal

6898.text: Centrifugal force is behind the punches of Melmetal’s heavy hex-nut arms. Melmetal is said to deliver the strongest punches of all Pokémon.
6898.name: melmetal

6899.text: When it uses its special stick to strike up a beat, the sound waves produced carry revitalizing energy to the plants and flowers in the area.
6899.name: grookey

6900.text: It attacks with rapid beats of its stick. As it strikes with amazing speed, it gets more and more pumped.
6900.name: grookey

6901.text: The faster a Thwackey can beat out a rhythm with its two sticks, the more respect it wins from its peers.
6901.name: thwackey

6902.text: When it’s drumming out rapid beats in battle, it gets so caught up in the rhythm that it won’t even notice that it’s already knocked out its opponent.
6902.name: thwackey

6903.text: By drumming, it taps into the power of its special tree stump. The roots of the stump follow its direction in battle.
6903.name: rillaboom

6904.text: The one with the best drumming techniques becomes the boss of the troop. It has a gentle disposition and values harmony among its group.
6904.name: rillaboom

6905.text: A warm-up of running around gets fire energy coursing through this Pokémon’s body. Once that happens, it’s ready to fight at full power.
6905.name: scorbunny

6906.text: It has special pads on the backs of its feet, and one on its nose. Once it’s raring to fight, these pads radiate tremendous heat.
6906.name: scorbunny

6907.text: Its thick and fluffy fur protects it from the cold and enables it to use hotter fire moves.
6907.name: raboot

6908.text: It kicks berries right off the branches of trees and then juggles them with its feet, practicing its footwork.
6908.name: raboot

6909.text: It juggles a pebble with its feet, turning it into a burning soccer ball. Its shots strike opponents hard and leave them scorched.
6909.name: cinderace

6910.text: It’s skilled at both offense and defense, and it gets pumped up when cheered on. But if it starts showboating, it could put itself in a tough spot.
6910.name: cinderace

6911.text: When scared, this Pokémon cries. Its tears pack the chemical punch of 100 onions, and attackers won’t be able to resist weeping.
6911.name: sobble

6912.text: When it gets wet, its skin changes color, and this Pokémon becomes invisible as if it were camouflaged.
6912.name: sobble

6913.text: A clever combatant, this Pokémon battles using water balloons created with moisture secreted from its palms.
6913.name: drizzile

6914.text: Highly intelligent but also very lazy, it keeps enemies out of its territory by laying traps everywhere.
6914.name: drizzile

6915.text: It has many hidden capabilities, such as fingertips that can shoot water and a membrane on its back that it can use to glide through the air.
6915.name: inteleon

6916.text: Its nictitating membranes let it pick out foes’ weak points so it can precisely blast them with water that shoots from its fingertips at Mach 3.
6916.name: inteleon

6917.text: Found throughout the Galar region, this Pokémon becomes uneasy if its cheeks are ever completely empty of berries.
6917.name: skwovet

6918.text: It eats berries nonstop—a habit that has made it more resilient than it looks. It’ll show up on farms, searching for yet more berries.
6918.name: skwovet

6919.text: It stashes berries in its tail—so many berries that they fall out constantly. But this Pokémon is a bit slow-witted, so it doesn’t notice the loss.
6919.name: greedent

6920.text: Common throughout the Galar region, this Pokémon has strong teeth and can chew through the toughest of berry shells.
6920.name: greedent

6921.text: It will bravely challenge any opponent, no matter how powerful. This Pokémon benefits from every battle—even a defeat increases its strength a bit.
6921.name: rookidee

6922.text: Jumping nimbly about, this small-bodied Pokémon takes advantage of even the slightest opportunity to disorient larger opponents.
6922.name: rookidee

6923.text: Smart enough to use tools in battle, these Pokémon have been seen picking up rocks and flinging them or using ropes to wrap up enemies.
6923.name: corvisquire

6924.text: The lessons of many harsh battles have taught it how to accurately judge an opponent’s strength.
6924.name: corvisquire

6925.text: This Pokémon reigns supreme in the skies of the Galar region. The black luster of its steel body could drive terror into the heart of any foe.
6925.name: corviknight

6926.text: With their great intellect and flying skills, these Pokémon very successfully act as the Galar region’s airborne taxi service.
6926.name: corviknight

6927.text: A constant collector of information, this Pokémon is very smart. Very strong is what it isn’t.
6927.name: blipbug

6928.text: Often found in gardens, this Pokémon has hairs on its body that it uses to assess its surroundings.
6928.name: blipbug

6929.text: It barely moves, but it’s still alive. Hiding in its shell without food or water seems to have awakened its psychic powers.
6929.name: dottler

6930.text: As it grows inside its shell, it uses its psychic abilities to monitor the outside world and prepare for evolution.
6930.name: dottler

6931.text: It’s famous for its high level of intelligence, and the large size of its brain is proof that it also possesses immense psychic power.
6931.name: orbeetle

6932.text: It emits psychic energy to observe and study what’s around it—and what’s around it can include things over six miles away.
6932.name: orbeetle

6933.text: Aided by the soft pads on its feet, it silently raids the food stores of other Pokémon. It survives off its ill-gotten gains.
6933.name: nickit

6934.text: Cunning and cautious, this Pokémon survives by stealing food from others. It erases its tracks with swipes of its tail as it makes off with its plunder.
6934.name: nickit

6935.text: It secretly marks potential targets with a scent. By following the scent, it stalks its targets and steals from them when they least expect it.
6935.name: thievul

6936.text: With a lithe body and sharp claws, it goes around stealing food and eggs. Boltund is its natural enemy.
6936.name: thievul

6937.text: It anchors itself in the ground with its single leg, then basks in the sun. After absorbing enough sunlight, its petals spread as it blooms brilliantly.
6937.name: gossifleur

6938.text: It whirls around in the wind while singing a joyous song. This delightful display has charmed many into raising this Pokémon.
6938.name: gossifleur

6939.text: The seeds attached to its cotton fluff are full of nutrients. It spreads them on the wind so that plants and other Pokémon can benefit from them.
6939.name: eldegoss

6940.text: The cotton on the head of this Pokémon can be spun into a glossy, gorgeous yarn—a Galar regional specialty.
6940.name: eldegoss

6941.text: Its curly fleece is such an effective cushion that this Pokémon could fall off a cliff and stand right back up at the bottom, unharmed.
6941.name: wooloo

6942.text: If its fleece grows too long, Wooloo won’t be able to move. Cloth made with the wool of this Pokémon is surprisingly strong.
6942.name: wooloo

6943.text: Weave a carpet from its springy wool, and you end up with something closer to a trampoline. You’ll start to bounce the moment you set foot on it.
6943.name: dubwool

6944.text: Its majestic horns are meant only to impress the opposite gender. They never see use in battle.
6944.name: dubwool

6945.text: Apparently the itch of its teething impels it to snap its jaws at anything in front of it.
6945.name: chewtle

6946.text: It starts off battles by attacking with its rock-hard horn, but as soon as the opponent flinches, this Pokémon bites down and never lets go.
6946.name: chewtle

6947.text: With jaws that can shear through steel rods, this highly aggressive Pokémon chomps down on its unfortunate prey.
6947.name: drednaw

6948.text: This Pokémon rapidly extends its retractable neck to sink its sharp fangs into distant enemies and take them down.
6948.name: drednaw

6949.text: This Pokémon is very popular as a herding dog in the Galar region. As it runs, it generates electricity from the base of its tail.
6949.name: yamper

6950.text: This gluttonous Pokémon only assists people with their work because it wants treats. As it runs, it crackles with electricity.
6950.name: yamper

6951.text: This Pokémon generates electricity and channels it into its legs to keep them going strong. Boltund can run nonstop for three full days.
6951.name: boltund

6952.text: It sends electricity through its legs to boost their strength. Running at top speed, it easily breaks 50 mph.
6952.name: boltund

6953.text: Most of its body has the same composition as coal. Fittingly, this Pokémon was first discovered in coal mines about 400 years ago.
6953.name: rolycoly

6954.text: It can race around like a unicycle, even on rough, rocky terrain. Burning coal sustains it.
6954.name: rolycoly

6955.text: It forms coal inside its body. Coal dropped by this Pokémon once helped fuel the lives of people in the Galar region.
6955.name: carkol

6956.text: By rapidly rolling its legs, it can travel at over 18 mph. The temperature of the flames it breathes exceeds 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit.
6956.name: carkol

6957.text: It’s usually peaceful, but the vandalism of mines enrages it. Offenders will be incinerated with flames that reach 2,700 degrees Fahrenheit.
6957.name: coalossal

6958.text: While it’s engaged in battle, its mountain of coal will burn bright red, sending off sparks that scorch the surrounding area.
6958.name: coalossal

6959.text: It spends its entire life inside an apple. It hides from its natural enemies, bird Pokémon, by pretending it’s just an apple and nothing more.
6959.name: applin

6960.text: As soon as it’s born, it burrows into an apple. Not only does the apple serve as its food source, but the flavor of the fruit determines its evolution.
6960.name: applin

6961.text: It ate a sour apple, and that induced its evolution. In its cheeks, it stores an acid capable of causing chemical burns.
6961.name: flapple

6962.text: It flies on wings of apple skin and spits a powerful acid. It can also change its shape into that of an apple.
6962.name: flapple

6963.text: Eating a sweet apple caused its evolution. A nectarous scent wafts from its body, luring in the bug Pokémon it preys on.
6963.name: appletun

6964.text: Its body is covered in sweet nectar, and the skin on its back is especially yummy. Children used to have it as a snack.
6964.name: appletun

6965.text: As it digs, it swallows sand and stores it in its neck pouch. The pouch can hold more than 17 pounds of sand.
6965.name: silicobra

6966.text: It spews sand from its nostrils. While the enemy is blinded, it burrows into the ground to hide.
6966.name: silicobra

6967.text: When it contracts its body, over 220 pounds of sand sprays from its nose. If it ever runs out of sand, it becomes disheartened.
6967.name: sandaconda

6968.text: Its unique style of coiling allows it to blast sand out of its sand sac more efficiently.
6968.name: sandaconda

6969.text: It’s so strong that it can knock out some opponents in a single hit, but it also may forget what it’s battling midfight.
6969.name: cramorant

6970.text: This hungry Pokémon swallows Arrokuda whole. Occasionally, it makes a mistake and tries to swallow a Pokémon other than its preferred prey.
6970.name: cramorant

6971.text: If it sees any movement around it, this Pokémon charges for it straightaway, leading with its sharply pointed jaw. It’s very proud of that jaw.
6971.name: arrokuda

6972.text: After it’s eaten its fill, its movements become extremely sluggish. That’s when Cramorant swallows it up.
6972.name: arrokuda

6973.text: This Pokémon has a jaw that’s as sharp as a spear and as strong as steel. Apparently Barraskewda’s flesh is surprisingly tasty, too.
6973.name: barraskewda

6974.text: It spins its tail fins to propel itself, surging forward at speeds of over 100 knots before ramming prey and spearing into them.
6974.name: barraskewda

6975.text: It stores poison in an internal poison sac and secretes that poison through its skin. If you touch this Pokémon, a tingling sensation follows.
6975.name: toxel

6976.text: It manipulates the chemical makeup of its poison to produce electricity. The voltage is weak, but it can cause a tingling paralysis.
6976.name: toxel

6977.text: When this Pokémon sounds as if it’s strumming a guitar, it’s actually clawing at the protrusions on its chest to generate electricity.
6977.name: toxtricity

6978.text: This short-tempered and aggressive Pokémon chugs stagnant water to absorb any toxins it might contain.
6978.name: toxtricity

6979.text: It stores flammable gas in its body and uses it to generate heat. The yellow sections on its belly get particularly hot.
6979.name: sizzlipede

6980.text: It wraps prey up with its heated body, cooking them in its coils. Once they’re well-done, it will voraciously nibble them down to the last morsel.
6980.name: sizzlipede

6981.text: When it heats up, its body temperature reaches about 1,500 degrees Fahrenheit. It lashes its body like a whip and launches itself at enemies.
6981.name: centiskorch

6982.text: While its burning body is already dangerous on its own, this excessively hostile Pokémon also has large and very sharp fangs.
6982.name: centiskorch

6983.text: It’s very curious, but its means of investigating things is to try to punch them with its tentacles. The search for food is what brings it onto land.
6983.name: clobbopus

6984.text: Its tentacles tear off easily, but it isn’t alarmed when that happens—it knows they’ll grow back. It’s about as smart as a three-year-old.
6984.name: clobbopus

6985.text: A body made up of nothing but muscle makes the grappling moves this Pokémon performs with its tentacles tremendously powerful.
6985.name: grapploct

6986.text: Searching for an opponent to test its skills against, it emerges onto land. Once the battle is over, it returns to the sea.
6986.name: grapploct

6987.text: This Pokémon is said to have been born when a lonely spirit possessed a cold, leftover cup of tea.
6987.name: sinistea

6988.text: The teacup in which this Pokémon makes its home is a famous piece of antique tableware. Many forgeries are in circulation.
6988.name: sinistea

6989.text: This species lives in antique teapots. Most pots are forgeries, but on rare occasions, an authentic work is found.
6989.name: polteageist

6990.text: Leaving leftover black tea unattended is asking for this Pokémon to come along and pour itself into it, turning the tea into a new Polteageist.
6990.name: polteageist

6991.text: Via the protrusion on its head, it senses other creatures’ emotions. If you don’t have a calm disposition, it will never warm up to you.
6991.name: hatenna

6992.text: If this Pokémon senses a strong emotion, it will run away as fast as it can. It prefers areas without people.
6992.name: hatenna

6993.text: No matter who you are, if you bring strong emotions near this Pokémon, it will silence you violently.
6993.name: hattrem

6994.text: Using the braids on its head, it pummels foes to get them to quiet down. One blow from those braids would knock out a professional boxer.
6994.name: hattrem

6995.text: It emits psychic power strong enough to cause headaches as a deterrent to the approach of others.
6995.name: hatterene

6996.text: If you’re too loud around it, you risk being torn apart by the claws on its tentacle. This Pokémon is also known as the Forest Witch.
6996.name: hatterene

6997.text: Through its nose, it sucks in the emanations produced by people and Pokémon when they feel annoyed. It thrives off this negative energy.
6997.name: impidimp

6998.text: It sneaks into people’s homes, stealing things and feasting on the negative energy of the frustrated occupants.
6998.name: impidimp

6999.text: When it gets down on all fours as if to beg for forgiveness, it’s trying to lure opponents in so that it can stab them with its spear-like hair.
6999.name: morgrem

7000.text: With sly cunning, it tries to lure people into the woods. Some believe it to have the power to make crops grow.
7000.name: morgrem

7001.text: With the hair wrapped around its body helping to enhance its muscles, this Pokémon can overwhelm even Machamp.
7001.name: grimmsnarl

7002.text: Its hairs work like muscle fibers. When its hairs unfurl, they latch on to opponents, ensnaring them as tentacles would.
7002.name: grimmsnarl

7003.text: Its voice is staggering in volume. Obstagoon has a tendency to take on a threatening posture and shout—this move is known as Obstruct.
7003.name: obstagoon

7004.text: It evolved after experiencing numerous fights. While crossing its arms, it lets out a shout that would make any opponent flinch.
7004.name: obstagoon

7005.text: What appears to be an iron helmet is actually hardened hair. This Pokémon lives for the thrill of battle.
7005.name: perrserker

7006.text: After many battles, it evolved dangerous claws that come together to form daggers when extended.
7006.name: perrserker

7007.text: Its shell is overflowing with its heightened otherworldly energy. The ectoplasm serves as protection for this Pokémon’s core spirit.
7007.name: cursola

7008.text: Be cautious of the ectoplasmic body surrounding its soul. You’ll become stiff as stone if you touch it.
7008.name: cursola

7009.text: Only Farfetch’d that have survived many battles can attain this evolution. When this Pokémon’s leek withers, it will retire from combat.
7009.name: sirfetchd

7010.text: After deflecting attacks with its hard leaf shield, it strikes back with its sharp leek stalk. The leek stalk is both weapon and food.
7010.name: sirfetchd

7011.text: It’s highly skilled at tap-dancing. It waves its cane of ice in time with its graceful movements.
7011.name: mr-rime

7012.text: Its amusing movements make it very popular. It releases its psychic power from the pattern on its belly.
7012.name: mr-rime

7013.text: A powerful curse was woven into an ancient painting. After absorbing the spirit of a Yamask, the painting began to move.
7013.name: runerigus

7014.text: Never touch its shadowlike body, or you’ll be shown the horrific memories behind the picture carved into it.
7014.name: runerigus

7015.text: This Pokémon was born from sweet-smelling particles in the air. Its body is made of cream.
7015.name: milcery

7016.text: They say that any patisserie visited by Milcery is guaranteed success and good fortune.
7016.name: milcery

7017.text: When it trusts a Trainer, it will treat them to berries it’s decorated with cream.
7017.name: alcremie

7018.text: When Alcremie is content, the cream it secretes from its hands becomes sweeter and richer.
7018.name: alcremie

7019.text: Five of them are troopers, and one is the brass. The brass’s orders are absolute.
7019.name: falinks

7020.text: The six of them work together as one Pokémon. Teamwork is also their battle strategy, and they constantly change their formation as they fight.
7020.name: falinks

7021.text: It feeds on seaweed, using its teeth to scrape it off rocks. Electric current flows from the tips of its spines.
7021.name: pincurchin

7022.text: It stores electricity in each spine. Even if one gets broken off, it still continues to emit electricity for at least three hours.
7022.name: pincurchin

7023.text: It spits out thread imbued with a frigid sort of energy and uses it to tie its body to branches, disguising itself as an icicle while it sleeps.
7023.name: snom

7024.text: It eats snow that piles up on the ground. The more snow it eats, the bigger and more impressive the spikes on its back grow.
7024.name: snom

7025.text: Icy scales fall from its wings like snow as it flies over fields and mountains. The temperature of its wings is less than −290 degrees Fahrenheit.
7025.name: frosmoth

7026.text: It shows no mercy to any who desecrate fields and mountains. It will fly around on its icy wings, causing a blizzard to chase offenders away.
7026.name: frosmoth

7027.text: It stands in grasslands, watching the sun’s descent from zenith to horizon. This Pokémon has a talent for delivering dynamic kicks.
7027.name: stonjourner

7028.text: Once a year, on a specific date and at a specific time, they gather out of nowhere and form up in a circle.
7028.name: stonjourner

7029.text: It drifted in on the flow of ocean waters from a frigid place. It keeps its head iced constantly to make sure it stays nice and cold.
7029.name: eiscue

7030.text: This Pokémon keeps its heat-sensitive head cool with ice. It fishes for its food, dangling its single hair into the sea to lure in prey.
7030.name: eiscue

7031.text: It uses the horns on its head to sense the emotions of others. Males will act as valets for those they serve, looking after their every need.
7031.name: indeedee

7032.text: Through its horns, it can pick up on the emotions of creatures around it. Positive emotions are the source of its strength.
7032.name: indeedee

7033.text: As it eats the seeds stored up in its pocket-like pouches, this Pokémon is not just satisfying its constant hunger. It’s also generating electricity.
7033.name: morpeko

7034.text: It carries electrically roasted seeds with it as if they’re precious treasures. No matter how much it eats, it always gets hungry again in short order.
7034.name: morpeko

7035.text: It digs up the ground with its trunk. It’s also very strong, being able to carry loads of over five tons without any problem at all.
7035.name: cufant

7036.text: If a job requires serious strength, this Pokémon will excel at it. Its copper body tarnishes in the rain, turning a vibrant green color.
7036.name: cufant

7037.text: They came over from another region long ago and worked together with humans. Their green skin is resistant to water.
7037.name: copperajah

7038.text: These Pokémon live in herds. Their trunks have incredible grip strength, strong enough to crush giant rocks into powder.
7038.name: copperajah

7039.text: In ancient times, it was unbeatable thanks to its powerful lower body, but it went extinct anyway after it depleted all its plant-based food sources.
7039.name: dracozolt

7040.text: The powerful muscles in its tail generate its electricity. Compared to its lower body, its upper half is entirely too small.
7040.name: dracozolt

7041.text: The shaking of its freezing upper half is what generates its electricity. It has a hard time walking around.
7041.name: arctozolt

7042.text: This Pokémon lived on prehistoric seashores and was able to preserve food with the ice on its body. It went extinct because it moved so slowly.
7042.name: arctozolt

7043.text: Powerful legs and jaws made it the apex predator of its time. Its own overhunting of its prey was what drove it to extinction.
7043.name: dracovish

7044.text: Its mighty legs are capable of running at speeds exceeding 40 mph, but this Pokémon can’t breathe unless it’s underwater.
7044.name: dracovish

7045.text: Though it’s able to capture prey by freezing its surroundings, it has trouble eating the prey afterward because its mouth is on top of its head.
7045.name: arctovish

7046.text: The skin on its face is impervious to attack, but breathing difficulties made this Pokémon go extinct anyway.
7046.name: arctovish

7047.text: Its body resembles polished metal, and it’s both lightweight and strong. The only drawback is that it rusts easily.
7047.name: duraludon

7048.text: The special metal that composes its body is very light, so this Pokémon has considerable agility. It lives in caves because it dislikes the rain.
7048.name: duraludon

7049.text: After being reborn as a ghost Pokémon, Dreepy wanders the areas it used to inhabit back when it was alive in prehistoric seas.
7049.name: dreepy

7050.text: If this weak Pokémon is by itself, a mere child could defeat it. But if Dreepy has friends to help it train, it can evolve and become much stronger.
7050.name: dreepy

7051.text: It’s capable of flying faster than 120 mph. It battles alongside Dreepy and dotes on them until they successfully evolve.
7051.name: drakloak

7052.text: Without a Dreepy to place on its head and care for, it gets so uneasy it’ll try to substitute any Pokémon it finds for the missing Dreepy.
7052.name: drakloak

7053.text: When it isn’t battling, it keeps Dreepy in the holes on its horns. Once a fight starts, it launches the Dreepy like supersonic missiles.
7053.name: dragapult

7054.text: Apparently the Dreepy inside Dragapult’s horns eagerly look forward to being launched out at Mach speeds.
7054.name: dragapult

7055.text: Known as a legendary hero, this Pokémon absorbs metal particles, transforming them into a weapon it uses to battle.
7055.name: zacian

7056.text: This Pokémon has slumbered for many years. Some say it’s Zamazenta’s elder sister—others say the two Pokémon are rivals.
7056.name: zacian

7057.text: In times past, it worked together with a king of the people to save the Galar region. It absorbs metal that it then uses in battle.
7057.name: zamazenta

7058.text: This Pokémon slept for aeons while in the form of a statue. It was asleep for so long, people forgot that it ever existed.
7058.name: zamazenta

7059.text: The core on its chest absorbs energy emanating from the lands of the Galar region. This energy is what allows Eternatus to stay active.
7059.name: eternatus

7060.text: It was inside a meteorite that fell 20,000 years ago. There seems to be a connection between this Pokémon and the Dynamax phenomenon.
7060.name: eternatus

7061.text: Kubfu trains hard to perfect its moves. The moves it masters will determine which form it takes when it evolves.
7061.name: kubfu

7062.text: If Kubfu pulls the long white hair on its head, its fighting spirit heightens and power wells up from the depths of its belly.
7062.name: kubfu

7063.text: This form of Urshifu is a strong believer in the one-hit KO. Its strategy is to leap in close to foes and land a devastating blow with a hardened fist.
7063.name: urshifu

7064.text: Inhabiting the mountains of a distant region, this Pokémon races across sheer cliffs, training its legs and refining its moves.
7064.name: urshifu

7065.text: Within dense forests, this Pokémon lives in a pack with others of its kind. It’s incredibly aggressive, and the other Pokémon of the forest fear it.
7065.name: zarude

7066.text: Once the vines on Zarude’s body tear off, they become nutrients in the soil. This helps the plants of the forest grow.
7066.name: zarude

7067.text: This Pokémon is a cluster of electrical energy. It’s said that removing the rings on Regieleki’s body will unleash the Pokémon’s latent power.
7067.name: regieleki

7068.text: Its entire body is made up of a single organ that generates electrical energy. Regieleki is capable of creating all Galar’s electricity.
7068.name: regieleki

7069.text: An academic theory proposes that Regidrago’s arms were once the head of an ancient dragon Pokémon. The theory remains unproven.
7069.name: regidrago

7070.text: Its body is composed of crystallized dragon energy. Regidrago is said to have the powers of every dragon Pokémon.
7070.name: regidrago

7071.text: Glastrier emits intense cold from its hooves. It’s also a belligerent Pokémon—anything it wants, it takes by force.
7071.name: glastrier

7072.text: Glastrier has tremendous physical strength, and the mask of ice covering its face is 100 times harder than diamond.
7072.name: glastrier

7073.text: It probes its surroundings with all its senses save one—it doesn’t use its sense of sight. Spectrier’s kicks are said to separate soul from body.
7073.name: spectrier

7074.text: As it dashes through the night, Spectrier absorbs the life-force of sleeping creatures. It craves silence and solitude.
7074.name: spectrier

7075.text: Calyrex is a merciful Pokémon, capable of providing healing and blessings. It reigned over the Galar region in times of yore.
7075.name: calyrex

7076.text: Calyrex is known in legend as a king that ruled over Galar in ancient times. It has the power to cause hearts to mend and plants to spring forth.
7076.name: calyrex

7077.text: The black orbs shine with an uncanny light when the Pokémon is erecting invisible barriers. The fur shed from its beard retains heat well and is a highly useful material for winter clothing.
7077.name: wyrdeer

7078.text: A violent creature that fells towering trees with its crude axes and shields itself with hard stone. If one should chance upon this Pokémon in the wilds, one's only recourse is to flee.
7078.name: kleavor

7079.text: I believe it was Hisui's swampy terrain that gave Ursaluna its burly physique and newfound capacity to manipulate peat at will.
7079.name: ursaluna

7080.text: Clads itself in the souls of comrades that perished before fulfilling their goals of journeying upstream. No other species throughout all Hisui's rivers is Basculegion's equal.
7080.name: basculegion

7081.text: Because of Sneasler's virulent poison and daunting physical prowess, no other species could hope to best it on the frozen highlands. Preferring solitude, this species does not form packs.
7081.name: sneasler

7082.text: Its lancelike spikes and savage temperament have earned it the nickname ”sea fiend.” It slurps up poison to nourish itself.
7082.name: overqwil

7083.text: When it flies to this land from across the sea, the bitter winter comes to an end. According to legend, this Pokémon's love gives rise to the budding of fresh life across Hisui.
7083.name: enamorus

7084.text: Its fluffy fur is similar in composition to plants. This Pokémon frequently washes its face to keep it from drying out.
7084.name: sprigatito

7085.text: The sweet scent its body gives off mesmerizes those around it. The scent grows stronger when this Pokémon is in the sun.
7085.name: sprigatito

7086.text: Floragato deftly wields the vine hidden beneath its long fur, slamming the hard flower bud against its opponents.
7086.name: floragato

7087.text: The hardness of Floragato’s fur depends on the Pokémon’s mood. When Floragato is prepared to battle, its fur becomes pointed and needle sharp.
7087.name: floragato

7088.text: This Pokémon uses the reflective fur lining its cape to camouflage the stem of its flower, creating the illusion that the flower is floating.
7088.name: meowscarada

7089.text: With skillful misdirection, it rigs foes with pollen-packed flower bombs. Meowscarada sets off the bombs before its foes realize what’s going on.
7089.name: meowscarada

7090.text: It lies on warm rocks and uses the heat absorbed by its square-shaped scales to create fire energy.
7090.name: fuecoco

7091.text: Its flame sac is small, so energy is always leaking out. This energy is released from the dent atop Fuecoco’s head and flickers to and fro.
7091.name: fuecoco

7092.text: The combination of Crocalor’s fire energy and overflowing vitality has caused an egg-shaped fireball to appear on the Pokémon’s head.
7092.name: crocalor

7093.text: The valve in Crocalor’s flame sac is closely connected to its vocal cords. This Pokémon utters a guttural cry as it spews flames every which way.
7093.name: crocalor

7094.text: The fiery bird changes shape when Skeledirge sings. Rumor has it that the bird was born when the fireball on Skeledirge’s head gained a soul.
7094.name: skeledirge

7095.text: Skeledirge’s gentle singing soothes the souls of all that hear it. It burns its enemies to a crisp with flames of over 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit.
7095.name: skeledirge

7096.text: This Pokémon migrated to Paldea from distant lands long ago. The gel secreted by its feathers repels water and grime."
7096.name: quaxly

7097.text: Its strong legs let it easily swim around in even fast-flowing rivers. It likes to keep things tidy and is prone to overthinking things.
7097.name: quaxly

7098.text: These Pokémon constantly run through shallow waters to train their legs, then compete with each other to see which of them kicks most gracefully.
7098.name: quaxwell

7099.text: The hardworking Quaxwell observes people and Pokémon from various regions and incorporates their movements into its own dance routines.
7099.name: quaxwell

7100.text: A single kick from a Quaquaval can send a truck rolling. This Pokémon uses its powerful legs to perform striking dances from far-off lands.
7100.name: quaquaval

7101.text: Dancing in ways that evoke far-away places, this Pokémon mesmerizes all that see it. Flourishes of its decorative water feathers slice into its foes.
7101.name: quaquaval

7102.text: It searches for food all day. It possesses a keen sense of smell but doesn’t use it for anything other than foraging.
7102.name: lechonk

7103.text: This Pokémon spurns all but the finest of foods. Its body gives off an herblike scent that bug Pokémon detest.
7103.name: lechonk

7104.text: Oinkologne is proud of its fine, glossy skin. It emits a concentrated scent from the tip of its tail.
7104.name: oinkologne

7105.text: It entrances female Pokémon with the sweet, alluring scent that wafts from all over its body.
7105.name: oinkologne

7106.text: The ball of threads wrapped around its body is elastic enough to deflect the scythes of Scyther, this Pokémon’s natural enemy.
7106.name: tarountula

7107.text: The thread it secretes from its rear is as strong as wire. The secret behind the thread’s strength is the topic of ongoing research.
7107.name: tarountula

7108.text: It clings to branches and ceilings using its threads and moves without a sound. It takes out its prey before the prey even notices it.
7108.name: spidops

7109.text: Spidops covers its territory in tough, sticky threads to set up traps for intruders.
7109.name: spidops

7110.text: It has its third set of legs folded up. When it’s in a tough spot, this Pokémon jumps over 30 feet using the strength of its legs.
7110.name: nymble

7111.text: It’s highly skilled at a fighting style in which it uses its jumping capabilities to dodge incoming attacks while also dealing damage to opponents.
7111.name: nymble

7112.text: When it decides to fight all out, it stands on its previously folded legs to enter Showdown Mode. It neutralizes its enemies in short order.
7112.name: lokix

7113.text: It uses its normally folded third set of legs when in Showdown Mode. This places a huge burden on its body, so it can’t stay in this mode for long.
7113.name: lokix

7114.text: It has underdeveloped electric sacs on its cheeks. These sacs can produce electricity only if Pawmi rubs them furiously with the pads on its forepaws.
7114.name: pawmi

7115.text: The pads of its paws are electricity-discharging organs. Pawmi fires electricity from its forepaws while standing unsteadily on its hind legs.
7115.name: pawmi

7116.text: When its group is attacked, Pawmo is the first to leap into battle, defeating enemies with a fighting technique that utilizes electric shocks.
7116.name: pawmo

7117.text: Pawmo uses a unique fighting technique in which it uses its forepaws to strike foes and zap them with electricity from its paw pads simultaneously.
7117.name: pawmo

7118.text: This Pokémon normally is slow to react, but once it enters battle, it will strike down its enemies with lightning-fast movements.
7118.name: pawmot

7119.text: Pawmot’s fluffy fur acts as a battery. It can store the same amount of electricity as an electric car.
7119.name: pawmot

7120.text: Exhibiting great teamwork, they use their incisors to cut pieces out of any material that might be useful for a nest, then make off with them.
7120.name: tandemaus

7121.text: The pair sticks together no matter what. They split any food they find exactly in half and then eat it together.
7121.name: tandemaus

7122.text: The two little ones just appeared one day. The group might be a family of related Pokémon, but nobody knows for sure.
7122.name: maushold

7123.text: The larger pair protects the little ones during battles. When facing strong opponents, the whole group will join the fight.
7123.name: maushold

7124.text: This Pokémon is smooth and moist to the touch. Yeast in Fidough’s breath induces fermentation in the Pokémon’s vicinity.
7124.name: fidough

7125.text: The yeast in Fidough’s breath is useful for cooking, so this Pokémon has been protected by people since long ago.
7125.name: fidough

7126.text: The pleasant aroma that emanates from this Pokémon’s body helps wheat grow, so Dachsbun has been treasured by farming villages.
7126.name: dachsbun

7127.text: The surface of this Pokémon’s skin hardens when exposed to intense heat, and its body has an appetizing aroma.
7127.name: dachsbun

7128.text: It protects itself from enemies by emitting oil from the fruit on its head. This oil is bitter and astringent enough to make someone flinch.
7128.name: smoliv

7129.text: This Pokémon converts nutrients into oil, which it stores in the fruit on its head. It can easily go a whole week without eating or drinking.
7129.name: smoliv

7130.text: Dolliv shares its tasty, fresh-scented oil with others. This species has coexisted with humans since times long gone.
7130.name: dolliv

7131.text: It basks in the sun to its heart’s content until the fruits on its head ripen. After that, Dolliv departs from human settlements and goes on a journey.
7131.name: dolliv

7132.text: This calm Pokémon is very compassionate. It will share its delicious, nutrient-rich oil with weakened Pokémon.
7132.name: arboliva

7133.text: This Pokémon drives back enemies by launching its rich, aromatic oil at them with enough force to smash a boulder.
7133.name: arboliva

7134.text: These Pokémon prefer to live in cities. They form flocks based on the color of their feathers, and they fight over territory.
7134.name: squawkabilly

7135.text: Green-feathered flocks hold the most sway. When they’re out searching for food in the mornings and evenings, it gets very noisy.
7135.name: squawkabilly

7136.text: It was born in a layer of rock salt deep under the earth. This species was particularly treasured in the old days, as they would share precious salt.
7136.name: nacli

7137.text: The ground scrapes its body as it travels, causing it to leave salt behind. Salt is constantly being created and replenished inside Nacli’s body.
7137.name: nacli

7138.text: This Pokémon dry cures its prey by spraying salt over them. The curing process steals away the water in the prey’s body.
7138.name: naclstack

7139.text: It compresses rock salt inside its body and shoots out hardened salt pellets with enough force to perforate an iron sheet.
7139.name: naclstack

7140.text: Garganacl will rub its fingertips together and sprinkle injured Pokémon with salt. Even severe wounds will promptly heal afterward.
7140.name: garganacl

7141.text: Many Pokémon gather around Garganacl, hoping to lick at its mineral-rich salt.
7141.name: garganacl

7142.text: Burnt charcoal came to life and became a Pokémon. Possessing a fiery fighting spirit, Charcadet will battle even tough opponents.
7142.name: charcadet

7143.text: Its firepower increases when it fights, reaching over 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit. It likes berries that are rich in fat.
7143.name: charcadet

7144.text: Armarouge evolved through the use of a set of armor that belonged to a distinguished warrior. This Pokémon is incredibly loyal.
7144.name: armarouge

7145.text: This Pokémon clads itself in armor that has been fortified by psychic and fire energy, and it shoots blazing fireballs.
7145.name: armarouge

7146.text: The fiery blades on its arms burn fiercely with the lingering resentment of a sword wielder who fell before accomplishing their goal.
7146.name: ceruledge

7147.text: An old set of armor steeped in grudges caused this Pokémon’s evolution. Ceruledge cuts its enemies to pieces without mercy.
7147.name: ceruledge

7148.text: Tadbulb shakes its tail to generate electricity. If it senses danger, it will make its head blink on and off to alert its allies.
7148.name: tadbulb

7149.text: It floats using the electricity stored in its body. When thunderclouds are around, Tadbulb will float higher off the ground.
7149.name: tadbulb

7150.text: When this Pokémon expands and contracts its wobbly body, the belly-button dynamo in its stomach produces a huge amount of electricity.
7150.name: bellibolt

7151.text: What appear to be eyeballs are actually organs for discharging the electricity generated by Bellibolt’s belly-button dynamo.
7151.name: bellibolt

7152.text: When its wings catch the wind, the bones within produce electricity. This Pokémon dives into the ocean, catching prey by electrocuting them.
7152.name: wattrel

7153.text: These Pokémon make their nests on coastal cliffs. The nests have a strange, crackling texture, and they’re a popular delicacy.
7153.name: wattrel

7154.text: Kilowattrel inflates its throat sac to amplify its electricity. By riding the wind, this Pokémon can fly over 430 miles in a day.
7154.name: kilowattrel

7155.text: It uses its throat sac to store electricity generated by its wings. There’s hardly any oil in its feathers, so it is a poor swimmer.
7155.name: kilowattrel

7156.text: It always scowls in an attempt to make opponents take it seriously, but even crying children will burst into laughter when they see Maschiff’s face.
7156.name: maschiff

7157.text: Its well-developed jaw and fangs are strong enough to crunch through boulders, and its thick fat makes for an excellent defense.
7157.name: maschiff

7158.text: This Pokémon can store energy in its large dewlap. Mabosstiff unleashes this energy all at once to blow away enemies.
7158.name: mabosstiff

7159.text: Mabosstiff loves playing with children. Though usually gentle, it takes on an intimidating look when protecting its family.
7159.name: mabosstiff

7160.text: Though usually a mellow Pokémon, it will sink its sharp, poison-soaked front teeth into any that anger it, causing paralysis in the object of its ire.
7160.name: shroodle

7161.text: To keep enemies away from its territory, it paints markings around its nest using a poisonous liquid that has an acrid odor.
7161.name: shroodle

7162.text: The color of the poisonous saliva depends on what the Pokémon eats. Grafaiai covers its fingers in its saliva and draws patterns on trees in forests.
7162.name: grafaiai

7163.text: Each Grafaiai paints its own individual pattern, and it will paint that same pattern over and over again throughout its life.
7163.name: grafaiai

7164.text: A soul unable to move on to the afterlife was blown around by the wind until it got tangled up with dried grass and became a Pokémon.
7164.name: bramblin

7165.text: Not even Bramblin knows where it is headed as it tumbles across the wilderness, blown by the wind. It loathes getting wet.
7165.name: bramblin

7166.text: It will open the branches of its head to envelop its prey. Once it absorbs all the life energy it needs, it expels the prey and discards it.
7166.name: brambleghast

7167.text: Brambleghast wanders around arid regions. On rare occasions, mass outbreaks of these Pokémon will bury an entire town.
7167.name: brambleghast

7168.text: Toedscool lives in muggy forests. The flaps that fall from its body are chewy and very delicious.
7168.name: toedscool

7169.text: Though it looks like Tentacool, Toedscool is a completely different species. Its legs may be thin, but it can run at a speed of 30 mph.
7169.name: toedscool

7170.text: These Pokémon gather into groups and form colonies deep within forests. They absolutely hate it when strangers approach.
7170.name: toedscruel

7171.text: It coils its 10 tentacles around prey and sucks out their nutrients, causing the prey pain. The folds along the rim of its head are a popular delicacy.
7171.name: toedscruel

7172.text: Klawf hangs upside-down from cliffs, waiting for prey. But Klawf can’t remain in this position for long because its blood rushes to its head.
7172.name: klawf

7173.text: This Pokémon lives on sheer cliffs. It sidesteps opponents’ attacks, then lunges for their weak spots with its claws.
7173.name: klawf

7174.text: The more sunlight this Pokémon bathes in, the more spicy chemicals are produced by its body, and thus the spicier its moves become.
7174.name: capsakid

7175.text: Traditional Paldean dishes can be extremely spicy because they include the shed front teeth of Capsakid among their ingredients.
7175.name: capsakid

7176.text: The red head converts spicy chemicals into fire energy and blasts the surrounding area with a super spicy stream of flame.
7176.name: scovillain

7177.text: The green head has turned vicious due to the spicy chemicals stimulating its brain. Once it goes on a rampage, there is no stopping it.
7177.name: scovillain

7178.text: This Pokémon creates a mud ball by mixing sand and dirt with psychic energy. It treasures its mud ball more than its own life.
7178.name: rellor

7179.text: It rolls its mud ball around while the energy it needs for evolution matures. Eventually the time comes for it to evolve.
7179.name: rellor

7180.text: The body that supports the ball barely moves. Therefore, it is thought that the true body of this Pokémon is actually inside the ball.
7180.name: rabsca

7181.text: An infant sleeps inside the ball. Rabsca rolls the ball soothingly with its legs to ensure the infant sleeps comfortably.
7181.name: rabsca

7182.text: Flittle’s toes levitate about half an inch above the ground because of the psychic power emitted from the frills on the Pokémon’s belly.
7182.name: flittle

7183.text: It spends its time running around wastelands. If anyone steals its beloved berries, it will chase them down and exact its revenge.
7183.name: flittle

7184.text: It immobilizes opponents by bathing them in psychic power from its large eyes. Despite its appearance, it has a vicious temperament.
7184.name: espathra

7185.text: It emits psychic power from the gaps between its multicolored frills and sprints at speeds greater than 120 mph.
7185.name: espathra

7186.text: It swings its handmade hammer around to protect itself, but the hammer is often stolen by Pokémon that eat metal.
7186.name: tinkatink

7187.text: This Pokémon pounds iron scraps together to make a hammer. It will remake the hammer again and again until it’s satisfied with the result.
7187.name: tinkatink

7188.text: This Pokémon will attack groups of Pawniard and Bisharp, gathering metal from them in order to create a large and sturdy hammer.
7188.name: tinkatuff

7189.text: These Pokémon make their homes in piles of scrap metal. They test the strength of each other’s hammers by smashing them together.
7189.name: tinkatuff

7190.text: This intelligent Pokémon has a very daring disposition. It knocks rocks into the sky with its hammer, aiming for flying Corviknight.
7190.name: tinkaton

7191.text: The hammer tops 220 pounds, yet it gets swung around easily by Tinkaton as it steals whatever it pleases and carries its plunder back home.
7191.name: tinkaton

7192.text: This Pokémon can pick up the scent of a Veluza just over 65 feet away and will hide itself in the sand.
7192.name: wiglett

7193.text: Though it looks like Diglett, Wiglett is an entirely different species. The resemblance seems to be a coincidental result of environmental adaptation.
7193.name: wiglett

7194.text: It has a vicious temperament, contrary to what its appearance may suggest. It wraps its long bodies around prey, then drags the prey into its den.
7194.name: wugtrio

7195.text: A variety of fish Pokémon, Wugtrio was once considered to be a regional form of Dugtrio.
7195.name: wugtrio

7196.text: It gathers things up in an apron made from shed feathers added to the Pokémon’s chest feathers, then drops those things from high places for fun.
7196.name: bombirdier

7197.text: Bombirdier uses the apron on its chest to bundle up food, which it carries back to its nest. It enjoys dropping things that make loud noises.
7197.name: bombirdier

7198.text: It likes playing with others of its kind using the water ring on its tail. It uses ultrasonic waves to sense the emotions of other living creatures.
7198.name: finizen

7199.text: Its water ring is made from seawater mixed with a sticky fluid that Finizen secretes from its blowhole.
7199.name: finizen

7200.text: This Pokémon changes its appearance if it hears its allies calling for help. Palafin will never show anybody its moment of transformation.
7200.name: palafin

7201.text: Its physical capabilities are no different than a Finizen’s, but when its allies are in danger, it transforms and powers itself up.
7201.name: palafin

7202.text: It is said that this Pokémon was born when an unknown poison Pokémon entered and inspirited an engine left at a scrap-processing factory.
7202.name: varoom

7203.text: The steel section is Varoom’s actual body. This Pokémon clings to rocks and converts the minerals within into energy to fuel its activities.
7203.name: varoom

7204.text: It creates a gas out of poison and minerals from rocks. It then detonates the gas in its cylinders—now numbering eight—to generate energy.
7204.name: revavroom

7205.text: Revavroom viciously threatens others with the sound of its exhaust. It sticks its tongue out from its cylindrical mouth and sprays toxic fluids.
7205.name: revavroom

7206.text: Apparently Cyclizar has been allowing people to ride on its back since ancient times. Depictions of this have been found in 10,000-year-old murals.
7206.name: cyclizar

7207.text: It can sprint at over 70 mph while carrying a human. The rider’s body heat warms Cyclizar’s back and lifts the Pokémon’s spirit.
7207.name: cyclizar

7208.text: When attacked, this Pokémon will wield the tendrils on its body like fists and pelt the opponent with a storm of punches.
7208.name: orthworm

7209.text: This Pokémon lives in arid deserts. It maintains its metal body by consuming iron from the soil.
7209.name: orthworm

7210.text: It absorbs nutrients from cave walls. The petals it wears are made of crystallized poison.
7210.name: glimmet

7211.text: Glimmet’s toxic mineral crystals look just like flower petals. This Pokémon scatters poisonous powder like pollen to protect itself.
7211.name: glimmet

7212.text: When this Pokémon detects danger, it will open up its crystalline petals and fire beams from its conical body.
7212.name: glimmora

7213.text: Glimmora’s petals are made of crystallized poison energy. It has recently become evident that these petals resemble Tera Jewels.
7213.name: glimmora

7214.text: It is said that a dog Pokémon that died in the wild without ever interacting with a human was reborn as this Pokémon.
7214.name: greavard

7215.text: This friendly Pokémon doesn’t like being alone. Pay it even the slightest bit of attention, and it will follow you forever.
7215.name: greavard

7216.text: Houndstone spends most of its time sleeping in graveyards. Among all the dog Pokémon, this one is most loyal to its master.
7216.name: houndstone

7217.text: A lovingly mourned Pokémon was reborn as Houndstone. It doesn’t like anyone touching the protuberance atop its head.
7217.name: houndstone

7218.text: This Pokémon apparently ties the base of its neck into a knot so that energy stored in its belly does not escape from its beak.
7218.name: flamigo

7219.text: Thanks to a behavior of theirs known as “synchronizing,” an entire flock of these Pokémon can attack simultaneously in perfect harmony.
7219.name: flamigo

7220.text: This species left the ocean and began living on land a very long time ago. It seems to be closely related to Wailmer.
7220.name: cetoddle

7221.text: It lives in frigid regions in pods of five or so individuals. It loves the minerals found in snow and ice.
7221.name: cetoddle

7222.text: This Pokémon wanders around snowy, icy areas. It protects its body with powerful muscles and a thick layer of fat under its skin.
7222.name: cetitan

7223.text: Ice energy builds up in the horn on its upper jaw, causing the horn to reach cryogenic temperatures that freeze its surroundings.
7223.name: cetitan

7224.text: When Veluza discards unnecessary flesh, its mind becomes honed and its psychic power increases. The spare flesh has a mild but delicious flavor.
7224.name: veluza

7225.text: Veluza has excellent regenerative capabilities. It sheds spare flesh from its body to boost its agility, then charges at its prey.
7225.name: veluza

7226.text: This Pokémon is a glutton, but it’s bad at getting food. It teams up with a Tatsugiri to catch prey.
7226.name: dondozo

7227.text: It treats Tatsugiri like its boss and follows it loyally. Though powerful, Dondozo is apparently not very smart.
7227.name: dondozo

7228.text: This is a small dragon Pokémon. It lives inside the mouth of Dondozo to protect itself from enemies on the outside.
7228.name: tatsugiri

7229.text: Tatsugiri is an extremely cunning Pokémon. It feigns weakness to lure in prey, then orders its partner to attack.
7229.name: tatsugiri

7230.text: When its anger rose beyond a critical point, this Pokémon gained power that is unfettered by the limits of its physical body.
7230.name: annihilape

7231.text: It imbues its fists with the power of the rage that it kept hidden in its heart. Opponents struck by these imbued fists will be shattered to their core.
7231.name: annihilape

7232.text: When attacked, this Pokémon will retaliate by sticking thick spines out from its body. It’s a risky move that puts everything on the line.
7232.name: clodsire

7233.text: It lives at the bottom of ponds and swamps. It will carry Wooper on its back and ferry them across water from one shore to the other.
7233.name: clodsire

7234.text: Now that the brain waves from the head and tail are synced up, the psychic power of this Pokémon is 10 times stronger than Girafarig’s.
7234.name: farigiraf

7235.text: The hardened head from the tail protects the head of the main body as Farigiraf whips its long neck around to headbutt enemies.
7235.name: farigiraf

7236.text: This Pokémon uses its hard tail to make its nest by boring holes into bedrock deep underground. The nest can reach lengths of over six miles.
7236.name: dudunsparce

7237.text: It drives enemies out of its nest by sucking in enough air to fill its long, narrow lungs, then releasing the air in an intense blast.
7237.name: dudunsparce

7238.text: Only a Bisharp that stands above all others in its vast army can evolve into Kingambit.
7238.name: kingambit

7239.text: Though it commands a massive army in battle, it’s not skilled at devising complex strategies. It just uses brute strength to keep pushing.
7239.name: kingambit

7240.text: Sightings of this Pokémon have occurred in recent years. The name Great Tusk was taken from a creature listed in a certain book.
7240.name: great-tusk

7241.text: This creature resembles a mysterious Pokémon that, according to a paranormal magazine, has lived since ancient times.
7241.name: great-tusk

7242.text: There has been only one reported sighting of this Pokémon. It resembles a mysterious creature depicted in an old expedition journal.
7242.name: scream-tail

7243.text: It resembles a mysterious Pokémon described in a paranormal magazine as a Jigglypuff from one billion years ago.
7243.name: scream-tail

7244.text: It is possible that the creature listed as Brute Bonnet in a certain book could actually be this Pokémon.
7244.name: brute-bonnet

7245.text: It bears a slight resemblance to a Pokémon described in a dubious magazine as a cross between a dinosaur and a mushroom.
7245.name: brute-bonnet

7246.text: This Pokémon has characteristics similar to those of Flutter Mane, a creature mentioned in a certain book.
7246.name: flutter-mane

7247.text: It has similar features to a ghostly pterosaur that was covered in a paranormal magazine, but the two have little else in common.
7247.name: flutter-mane

7248.text: This mysterious Pokémon has some similarities to a creature that an old book introduced as Slither Wing.
7248.name: slither-wing

7249.text: This Pokémon somewhat resembles an ancient form of Volcarona that was introduced in a dubious magazine.
7249.name: slither-wing

7250.text: No records exist of this Pokémon being caught. Data is lacking, but the Pokémon’s traits match up with a creature shown in an expedition journal.
7250.name: sandy-shocks

7251.text: It slightly resembles a Magneton that lived for 10,000 years and was featured in an article in a paranormal magazine.
7251.name: sandy-shocks

7252.text: This Pokémon closely resembles a scientific weapon that a paranormal magazine claimed was sent to this planet by aliens.
7252.name: iron-treads

7253.text: Sightings of this Pokémon have occurred in recent years. It resembles a mysterious object described in an old expedition journal.
7253.name: iron-treads

7254.text: Its shape is similar to a robot featured in a paranormal magazine article. The robot was said to have been created by an ancient civilization.
7254.name: iron-bundle

7255.text: It resembles a mysterious object mentioned in an old book. There are only two reported sightings of this Pokémon.
7255.name: iron-bundle

7256.text: It is very similar to a cyborg covered exclusively by a paranormal magazine. The cyborg was said to be the modified form of a certain athlete.
7256.name: iron-hands

7257.text: This Pokémon shares many similarities with Iron Hands, an object mentioned in a certain expedition journal.
7257.name: iron-hands

7258.text: It resembles a certain Pokémon introduced in a paranormal magazine, described as the offspring of a Hydreigon that fell in love with a robot.
7258.name: iron-jugulis

7259.text: It’s possible that Iron Jugulis, an object described in an old book, may actually be this Pokémon.
7259.name: iron-jugulis

7260.text: This Pokémon resembles an unknown object described in a paranormal magazine as a UFO sent to observe humanity.
7260.name: iron-moth

7261.text: No records exist of this species being caught. Data is lacking, but the Pokémon’s traits match up with an object described in an old book.
7261.name: iron-moth

7262.text: It has some similarities to a Pokémon introduced in a dubious magazine as a Tyranitar from one billion years into the future.
7262.name: iron-thorns

7263.text: Some of its notable features match those of an object named within a certain expedition journal as Iron Thorns.
7263.name: iron-thorns

7264.text: Frigibax absorbs heat through its dorsal fin and converts the heat into ice energy. The higher the temperature, the more energy Frigibax stores.
7264.name: frigibax

7265.text: This Pokémon lives in forests and craggy areas. Using the power of its dorsal fin, it cools the inside of its nest like a refrigerator.
7265.name: frigibax

7266.text: Arctibax freezes the air around it, protecting its face with an ice mask and turning its dorsal fin into a blade of ice.
7266.name: arctibax

7267.text: It attacks with the blade of its frozen dorsal fin by doing a front flip in the air. Arctibax’s strong back and legs allow it to pull off this technique.
7267.name: arctibax

7268.text: This Pokémon blasts cryogenic air out from its mouth. This air can instantly freeze even liquid-hot lava.
7268.name: baxcalibur

7269.text: It launches itself into battle by flipping upside down and spewing frigid air from its mouth. It finishes opponents off with its dorsal blade.
7269.name: baxcalibur

7270.text: This Pokémon was born inside a treasure chest about 1,500 years ago. It sucks the life-force out of scoundrels who try to steal the treasure.
7270.name: gimmighoul

7271.text: It lives inside an old treasure chest. Sometimes it gets left in shop corners since no one realizes it’s actually a Pokémon.
7271.name: gimmighoul

7272.text: Its body seems to be made up of 1,000 coins. This Pokémon gets along well with others and is quick to make friends with anybody.
7272.name: gholdengo

7273.text: It has a sturdy body made up of stacked coins. Gholdengo overwhelms its enemies by firing coin after coin at them in quick succession.
7273.name: gholdengo

7274.text: The grudge of a person punished for writing the king’s evil deeds upon wooden tablets has clad itself in dead leaves to become a Pokémon.
7274.name: wo-chien

7275.text: It drains the life-force from vegetation, causing nearby forests to instantly wither and fields to turn barren.
7275.name: wo-chien

7276.text: This Pokémon can control 100 tons of fallen snow. It plays around innocently by leaping in and out of avalanches it has caused.
7276.name: chien-pao

7277.text: The hatred of those who perished by the sword long ago has clad itself in snow and become a Pokémon.
7277.name: chien-pao

7278.text: The fear poured into an ancient ritual vessel has clad itself in rocks and dirt to become a Pokémon.
7278.name: ting-lu

7279.text: It slowly brings its exceedingly heavy head down upon the ground, splitting the earth open with huge fissures that run over 160 feet deep.
7279.name: ting-lu

7280.text: It controls flames burning at over 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit. It casually swims through the sea of lava it creates by melting rock and sand.
7280.name: chi-yu

7281.text: The envy accumulated within curved beads that sparked multiple conflicts has clad itself in fire and become a Pokémon.
7281.name: chi-yu

7282.text: It is possible that this is the creature listed as Roaring Moon in an expedition journal that still holds many mysteries.
7282.name: roaring-moon

7283.text: According to an article in a dubious magazine, this Pokémon has some connection to a phenomenon that occurs in a certain region.
7283.name: roaring-moon

7284.text: It has some similarities to a mad scientist’s invention covered in a paranormal magazine.
7284.name: iron-valiant

7285.text: It’s possible that this is the object listed as Iron Valiant in a certain expedition journal.
7285.name: iron-valiant

7286.text: This seems to be the Winged King mentioned in an old expedition journal. It was said to have split the land with its bare fists.
7286.name: koraidon

7287.text: This Pokémon resembles Cyclizar, but it is far burlier and more ferocious. Nothing is known about its ecology or other features.
7287.name: koraidon

7288.text: Much remains unknown about this creature. It resembles Cyclizar, but it is far more ruthless and powerful.
7288.name: miraidon

7289.text: This seems to be the Iron Serpent mentioned in an old book. The Iron Serpent is said to have turned the land to ash with its lightning.
7289.name: miraidon

7290.text: This ferocious creature is shrouded in mystery. It's named after an aquatic monster mentioned in an old expedition journal.
7290.name: walking-wake

7291.text: It resembles an illustration published in a paranormal magazine, said to be a depiction of a super-ancient Suicune.
7291.name: walking-wake

7292.text: Many of its physical characteristics match those of a Virizion from the future that was covered in a paranormal magazine.
7292.name: iron-leaves

7293.text: According to the few eyewitness accounts that exist, it used its shining blades to julienne large trees and boulders.
7293.name: iron-leaves

7294.text: Dipplin is two creatures in one Pokémon. Its evolution was triggered by a special apple grown only in one place.
7294.name: dipplin

7295.text: The head sticking out belongs to the fore-wyrm, while the tail belongs to the core-wyrm. The two share one apple and help each other out.
7295.name: dipplin

7296.text: Supposedly, the regrets of a tea ceremony master who died before perfecting his craft lingered in some matcha and became a Pokémon.
7296.name: poltchageist

7297.text: Poltchageist looks like a regional form of Sinistea, but it was recently discovered that the two Pokémon are entirely unrelated.
7297.name: poltchageist

7298.text: It pretends to be tea, trying to fool people into drinking it so it can drain their life-force. Its ruse is generally unsuccessful.
7298.name: sinistcha

7299.text: It prefers cool, dark places, such as the back of a shelf or the space beneath a home's floorboards. It wanders in search of prey after sunset.
7299.name: sinistcha

7300.text: After all its muscles were stimulated by the toxic chain around its neck, Okidogi transformed and gained a powerful physique.
7300.name: okidogi

7301.text: Okidogi is a ruffian with a short temper. It can pulverize anything by swinging around the chain on its neck.
7301.name: okidogi

7302.text: The chain is made from toxins that enhance capabilities. It stimulated Munkidori's brain and caused the Pokémon's psychic powers to bloom.
7302.name: munkidori

7303.text: Munkidori keeps itself somewhere safe while it toys with its foes, using psychokinesis to induce intense dizziness.
7303.name: munkidori

7304.text: Fezandipiti owes its beautiful looks and lovely voice to the toxic stimulants emanating from the chain wrapped around its body.
7304.name: fezandipiti

7305.text: Fezandipiti beats its glossy wings to scatter pheromones that captivate people and Pokémon.
7305.name: fezandipiti

7306.text: This Pokémon's type changes based on which mask it's wearing. It confounds its enemies with nimble movements and kicks.
7306.name: ogerpon

7307.text: This mischief-loving Pokémon is full of curiosity. It battles by drawing out the type-based energy contained within its masks.
7307.name: ogerpon

7308.text: It gathers static electricity from its surroundings. The beams it launches when down on all fours are tremendously powerful.
7308.name: archaludon

7309.text: It digs holes on mountains, searching for food. It’s so durable that being caught in a cave-in won’t faze it.
7309.name: archaludon

7310.text: Seven syrpents live inside an apple made of syrup. The syrpent in the center is the commander.
7310.name: hydrapple

7311.text: These capricious syrpents have banded together. On the rare occasion that their moods align, their true power is unleashed.
7311.name: hydrapple

7312.text: There are scant few reports of this creature being sighted. One short video shows it rampaging and spouting pillars of flame.
7312.name: gouging-fire

7313.text: It resembles an eerie Pokémon once shown in a paranormal magazine. That Pokémon was said to be an Entei regenerated from a fossil.
7313.name: gouging-fire

7314.text: It's said to incinerate everything around it with lightning launched from its fur. Very little is known about this creature.
7314.name: raging-bolt

7315.text: It bears resemblance to a Pokémon that became a hot topic for a short while after a paranormal magazine touted it as Raikou's ancestor.
7315.name: raging-bolt

7316.text: It resembles a Pokémon described in a dubious magazine as a Terrakion that had been modified by an evil organization.
7316.name: iron-boulder

7317.text: It was named after a mysterious object recorded in an old book. Its body seems to be metallic.
7317.name: iron-boulder

7318.text: It resembles a mysterious object introduced in a paranormal magazine as a cutting-edge weapon shaped like a Cobalion.
7318.name: iron-crown

7319.text: There was supposedly an incident in which it launched shining blades to cut everything around it to pieces. Little else is known about it.
7319.name: iron-crown

7320.text: Terapagos protects itself using its power to transform energy into hard crystals. This Pokémon is the source of the Terastal phenomenon.
7320.name: terapagos

7321.text: It’s thought that this Pokémon lived in ancient Paldea until it got caught in seismic shifts and went extinct.
7321.name: terapagos

7322.text: It feeds others toxic mochi that draw out desires and capabilities. Those who eat the mochi fall under Pecharunt’s control, chained to its will.
7322.name: pecharunt

7323.text: Its peach-shaped shell serves as storage for a potent poison. It makes poisonous mochi and serves them to people and Pokémon.
7323.name: pecharunt
